story:
Short Summary

My name is Marion Arrou-Vignod and I am a third-year Writing & Producing for Television MFA candidate at Loyola Marymount University in Los Angeles, California. I will be shooting my thesis project titled “Checkmate” in January 2019. My preferred genres are science-fiction and supernatural dramas grounded in reality, which touch on contemporary societal issues and the human condition. Nothing and no one are black and white or single-layered: people are walking contradictions. “Checkmate” is the embodiment of that.

“Checkmate” is the story of two best friends, Nash and Logan, who struggle to make ends meet as a private corporation takes over the government’s role in Los Angeles, California. Most Angelenos believe Checkmate to be their savior and so does Nash, but Logan knows different. So, when Nash goes missing and they're running late on rent, Logan goes to find Nash, only to realize something terrible has happened and Checkmate is involved.

What We Need

All donations will directly offset the cost of production: food, props, production design, on-set safety, post-production (sound and video editing), original music etc. Any and all donations will be greatly appreciated and put to good use.

On top of production costs, we will submit the sizzle reel to festivals around the country and even the world, in the hopes of showcasing what the actual series can look like to potential producers/buyers. A successful crowdfunding campaign can make a big difference in the careers of my cast and crew.

Perks

We have some amazing perks for you!

A black king chess piece flash drive (16gb) which looks like the real thing!

An amazing poster! (Size TBD)

Other Ways You Can Help

Not everyone has the ability to donate money, and that’s okay! I wouldn’t be here asking for it if I could rely only on my bank account. If you like this project, please consider sharing this campaign on social media or talk to your friends and family about it. One simple share can reach hundreds of people, and you never know who might be able contribute.

Follow us on Facebook at https://www.facebook.com/checkmatethepilot/

The Crew

Writer/Producer: Marion Arrou-Vignod

Marion hailed all the way from Antibes, France, almost seven years ago. A third-year Writing and Producing for Television graduate student at LMU, she has worked as a script supervisor on several thesis films while working to build her own portfolio.

Director: Jeanette Romandetti

Jeanette directed a few short videos for her friend Myles Webb's YouTube page, before tackling on this project. She co-wrote a short film, "I Am June", which went to the Comic Con Festival in 2018.

Director of Photography: Griffin Voth

Griffin is currently an enrolled Senior in Loyola Marymount University's School of Film and Television program. He is passionate at crafting images to involve the audience with the film and create interesting and unique perspectives that spur creative and emotional thought.

1st Assistant Director: Ashley Beuhler

Ashley Beuhler is a Sophomore Film and Television Production, Finance Dual Degree at Loyola Marymount University. Ashley has worked on a number of sets as a script supervisor and assistant director. Her passion for telling captivating stories in a nontraditional manner drives her with each new film.

The Cast

We are currently in the process of casting, so be on the lookout for updates!

Nash Holloway: Vinu Ilangovan

A bubbly personality crushed by the need to survive.

Vinu came out to LA 2 years ago wanting to tell stories from new and unique perspectives. In that time, he has been training as an actor as well as taking film classes and has recently started auditioning and acting in short films. This will be his second LMU short in the past couple months and he is super excited as they have a wonderful program.

Logan Ward: Kolton Kolbaba

An artist who numbs the pain of his eidetic memory with pills.

Kolton Kolbaba, a recent Art of Acting Studio (a two year professional conservatory) graduate, is ecstatic to be a part of such an incredible team to see this film through. He makes it a point as an artist to be a helping hand in telling the worlds stories, putting a mirror up to humanity and showing its true nature. ‘Checkmate’ is no exception.

Blanka Greene: Kristin Horgen

A deadly woman who uses her sensuality to hide a troubled past.

Kristin is drawn to dark, emotionally complicated stories. When she is not working on her action hero training, she's pursuing her other passions - pool, billiards and photography.

Sade Malone: John Erickson

A self-made man who oozes charm to hide his complete lack of empathy.

John is excited to join the cast of Checkmate as Sade and looks forward to working with the highly talented team assembled to make the film possible. When John is not acting, he like to spend his time in nature or at a local Los Angeles watering hole, both places he calls his home away from home. To see what's he's up to in preparation for this role check him out @officialjohnerickson. 

Callie Sutherland: Laura Siskoff

A novice journalist whose integrity could mean the end of her short career.

Laura has successfully graduated from the Second City curriculum, has taken more than a year’s worth of Andrew Wood Acting Studio’s (Yale structure) essentials and advance classes and has even learned how to better her audition techinque through Annie Grindlay’s intensive program which has led her to where she is now.

story:
What is My d20 Stories?

First off, what the heck is a d20? Well, it's a twenty-sided die that has become synonymous with Dungeons & Dragons and other pen & paper role-playing games.

My d20 Stories is an idea I've been kicking around my cavernous noggin for the past few years, and I'm finally making myself make it happen.  What is it exactly, though? Well, imagine a thirty-something actor based in Los Angeles, who grew up in Long Beach, CA in the 1990s, and has been playing D&D since the tender age of 15. 

I'll be telling those stories to the camera, with each episode using one of the many d20s in my collection as a jumping-off point for the story. The first episode, for example, will be about the circumstances and happenings around the first d20 I ever acquired: a smoke-grey translucent Chessex d20 with white numbers - part of a 10-die set that I purchased from my local gaming shop.

I'm sure there's something interesting in there, right? My eventual goal is to get some of the other people I know that play tabletop dice-based rpgs to share their stories on the show in the same fashion. Guests abound.

What I Need & What You Get

I'm asking for $2500 - to cover equipment and production costs. I'm looking to get a portable recorder like a Zoom H4n, as well some lighting to help it all look snazzy. I also need to expand the storage capacity on my editing computer, so another couple of hard drives, one for backup.  Additionally, paying for stock footage/images, music, and sound will be an expense.  Finally, a portion of the budget will go to helping me out as I'll be carving out a good chunk of time to get this all written, shot, and edited.

There are a list of perks which I'm offering as a thank you, with more in the works if we get closer to (or even exceed, haha) the funding goal. 

In the long run, if My d20 Stories does well, I want to expand my breadth of content - and get back into producing video sketches and music.

If you can help at this stage, we're looking at a vast myriad of online content. VAST. J/k. It'll be a modest myriad.

Other Ways You Can Help

Of course, if you're not in a position to help with a few duckets, there are a couple ways you still help a brotha out:

  • SHARE (repost/share/retweet) THIS BAD BOY
  • DM me and let me know I'm not a lost, lost cause. Haha.

Hey, you're swell.

story:
GREAT NEWS!  We've reached our bare-bones production goal, and have greenlit Season 1!  Now we're reaching for our STRETCH GOAL of $45,000, which will enable us to have modern 4K cameras, quality sound, vivid production values, and location rentals.  But we need your help!  Here's what we need:

- If we reach $30,000, we'll give all contributors of $125 or more two free tickets to "EXTRA ROOM: THE MUSIC," a concert in NYC featuring the great up-and-coming bands and artists who are lending their voices to the show;

- If we reach $38,000, all contributors of $150 or more will receive a special USB thumb drive with loads of unseen content, including our behind-the-scenes "blooper reel" and the shooting scripts from the first season; 

- If we reach $45,000, we'll shoot an extra mini-episode, showing you the 'lost footage' from a hilariously disastrous cooking show made by two of our characters, Sava and Beau.  (Think Beavis and Butthead, if they were super-gay.  More than they already are.) 

Here's what the show's about:

 On Friends, the apartment was the size of Brazil.  Sex and the City lived in penthouses.  Will and Grace get hammered daily in their luxury condo.  And sure, Girls SAID they were broke, but the digs seemed pretty sweet to us.

The sitcom version of New York City is NOT the real New York...not the one we know, at least, where budding artists, immigrants, and dreamers band together in small apartments to split costs, share warmth, and get closer to the subway. 

Welcome to EXTRA ROOM, a web series about OUR New York City, right now, in 2019.  Living large in tiny spaces, rapidly accelerating, searching for answers.

Our production company, A Certain Something, brought together a creative team for EXTRA ROOM who have won Obie Awards, written New York Times bestsellers, screened at Cannes, and won both film festivals and national playwriting awards. 

We chose to make EXTRA ROOM from a desire to hear different voices, to realign perceptions of urban living, and bring an intersectional, diverse, pro-sex sensibility to characters like us, who aren't represented on television.  The scripts for Season One have already received praise from creative minds behind Pose, Grey's Anatomy, Bear City, and The Bourne Identity.

We hope you like New York the way we do...weird, spicy, sexy, and knee-slappingly hilarious!  We'll take you on an emotional ride through bad dates on the Lower East Side, concerts in SoHo, breakups in Bushwick, gay brunches in Harlem, booty calls in Washington Heights, and ambulances in Inwood.  You are the driving force behind EXTRA ROOM, and we want you to be a part of it!

What We Need & What You Get

We're trying to raise at least $25,000 here on Indiegogo, and hopefully more of our overall budget of $100,000 to shoot the six episodes of Season One.  It's real television -- each episode is a full 22-minutes!  There are over two dozen locations, 35 speaking roles, and a production crew of nearly 60.  This graph spells it out where the budget goes:

The great news: through private funding and this campaign, we've already covered much of our post-production budget!  We've made it to our minimum goal, but we're hoping to raise $45,000 here, which will allow us the resources to fully realize our dream show.  Any additional funds raised will greatly enhance our production and location options.  If we don't reach our entire goal, we will begin production while pursuing additional funding to complete the season.

We've got some VERY unique perks in store for you, to show our gratitude.  You can name a character in someone's honor (Aunt Phyllis? RuPaul? Queen Elizabeth?), or spend a day on the set with us.  We've got tickets to our World Premiere, and roles you can play onscreen!  My favorite idea came from the cast -- they want to do a total makeover of your dating app profile!  Personally, we hope you'll grab our power lunches, or truly magnificent swag items....check out the entire list of perks on the right, and be sure to read the benefits inside...we've hidden a few "Easter Eggs" there -- surprise benefits to make them extra special!

The Impact

Our writers were challenged to create characters they'd never seen on television before.  And wow, did they deliver -- non-binary farmhands, sexy gay bears, genderfluid chefs, post-Trump immigrants. We're disturbed by shows populated exclusively by white characters...or for that matter, exclusively black characters, or exclusively LatinX characters, etc.  Doesn't anyone have friends like us, of many races, heritages and backgrounds?  Can we all be on one show? 

We feel strongly about shattering traditional notions of beauty on  EXTRA ROOM -- tall and short, skinny and thick, dark and light, different sizes and shapes, and intergenerational relationships are all a part of our story.  This is the world as we know it, and the world we want to share.

Risks and Challenges

This kind of story isn't for everyone, of course...but we think we're on to something.  EXTRA ROOM builds and expands upon the worldview espoused by Pose, Insecure, This Is Us, Sense8, Orange is the New Black, Master of None and Atlanta...all of which successfully explore peculiar and specific lives, with authenticity, savvy humor, and freshness.

As a team, we've got over 75 combined years of experience telling stories like this, in a variety of mediums.  We just need a little help to make this peculiar, specific, beautiful, compelling, addictive story a reality!

Other Ways You Can Help

We really hope you'll contribute...even $15 would make a huge difference to this effort.  If you can't, however, there are other ways to help!

First, we hope you'll share this Indiegogo Campaign on your social media, and encourage people to participate...let 'em know how much you care about stories like this! 

And please, share us via email to anyone who might like EXTRA ROOM...we're building a community person by person, and your help would be invaluable!

http://www.extraroomtheshow.com

Warmly,

Catalin, Cherrye, Gabriel, Holly, JJ, Joe, Marc, Nathaniel, and Nilan

P.S. - There's more important info in our FAQ Section!

story:
Story

HighBread is a Serio-comedy about Jai who wants to open the first of its kind Pot bakery in Boston despite being an expelled international student from Boston University, having over-controlling, interfering and orthodox parents alongside an expired US visa.

The first episode is about Jai and how he overcomes the obstacle of always being controlled by his surroundings and finally makes a decision for himself which leads us to the franchise of the whole series.  

 

Meet the Creators

Jayesh Jaidka (the Producer, Director, Editor), Campaign Manager 

Jayesh is an Indian Director, Writer, and Actor. Originally from New Delhi, India, Jayesh worked at Shunya Theatre as Secretary and later Vice President. He later left to become Celebrity Manager at IMG Reliance Pvt. Ltd., India’s largest company that promotes and develop sports, entertainment and fashion in India. Jaidka studied economics at Delhi University with a Bachelors in Economics and is now residing in Boston, MA to attend Boston University for his Masters in Cinematography & Media Production.

  • IMDb: https://www.imdb.com/name/nm9497929/
  • LinkedIn: https://www.linkedin.com/in/jayesh-jaidka-275180a6
  • IG: @jaidkajayesh

 

John Varkados (the Unit Production Manager and Line Producer), Co-Campaign manager

John is an American film producer, singer-songwriter, and freelancer. Born in Seoul, South Korea, Varkados enlisted in the United States Marine Corps, but was released from active duty and moved to Boston in 2014. Varkados studied music theory at Berklee College of Music, specializing in music business management and artist development. Following the advice of a teacher, he later furthered his studies at Boston University, specializing in the production and visual storytelling.

  • IMDb: https://www.imdb.com/name/nm7970293
  • LinkedIn: https://www.linkedin.com/in/johnvarkados
  • IG: @johnvarkados

 

Sokhean (Johnny) Ouk (the Cinematographer)

After 10+ years as a professional sushi chef from Portland, Maine, Sokhean went to pursue a BA in Media Studies along with minors in Video Production & Information Communication Technology at the University of Southern Maine. During his undergraduate career he received the Maine Broadcasters Award and interned at Lone Wolf Media, a local production house that has produced many documentaries on various TV networks such as the Discovery Channel. Enjoying all aspects of the creative art of film and photography, he is now at Boston University for his MFA in Cinema and Video Production. Also a freelancer under his brand, Hi its Jonny, he has worked on TV/Web commercials, documentaries, weddings and various other projects.

  • IMDb: https://www.imdb.com/name/nm8633746
  • Reel: https://vimeo.com/312296661
  • IG: @hi.itsjonny

 

Meet the Bakery Owner

Dana Gallo Strayton (the Culinary Advisor/Catering Management Executive)

Dana began her culinary career in her grandfather’s pastry shop, later worked in her father’s restaurant, and while attending Boston University, managed G’Vanni’s.  After graduation Dana then went to Florida to open Galleria G’Vanni a 250-seat restaurant in Ft. Lauderdale, where she was responsible for hiring, menu development and once open, day-to-day management of the restaurant.

After two years in Florida, Dana returned to Boston again managing G’Vanni’s North End location while attending graduate school at Boston University, graduating with a Master’s Degree in Marketing.

Dana then joined a public relations firm in Boston where she managed the media services department, working closely with members of the press and facilitating corporate events for client companies.

For the past 8 years Dana has run a successful and acclaimed catering company that counts among its clients Kraft Foods, Microsoft, Fidelity Investments, Atlas Venture, Peabody Properties, McKinsey & Co., Progress Software, Mellic, Porter & Shea and a host of individuals and non-profit organizations.

Dana opened Prince Street Cafe & Bakery in 2011, a storefront retail bakery and café located in historic Bedford, MA., where she serves as Executive Pastry Chef making her grandfather’s North End recipes.

http://www.princestcafe.com/

 

The Impact

We may be serious filmmakers but we love to have fun. We really think HighBread will be an amazing collaborative that will remove stereotypes from Indian/Southwest Asian culture as well as address issues and spark conversations that surrounds the legalization of marijuana (a very recent event in Boston as well as other parts of the United States).

With you contributing:

  • We anticipate this pilot to picked up by a major television network and/or streaming service (ie- Hulu, Netflix, Amazon)
  • We already have been green-lit by Boston University for starting funds to support our project
  • We believe in this story and that's why we want nothing but the best to not only succeed, but become a hit both in the U.S. and India.

What We Need & What You Get

With budgeting and prepping for all the pre-production we are looking for $10,000 for this 30-min pilot alone (bare-bones minimum). We already have $3,000 from an angel investor. The remaining $7,000 will be for:

  • Transportation & Catering costs for Cast/Crew ($2500)
  • Additional equipment rental (lenses, etc.) not housed by Boston University ($1500)
  • Editing/Post-Production ($1500)
  • Music Score/Sound Design ($1000)
  • Production Design & Wardrobe ($1500)

Here are some mood board samples already created by the Production Design Team:

Risks & Challenges

While this pilot is fairly contained in terms of production, it has its own challenges that come with shooting an episodic pilot inside a bakery as a masters student.

The first challenge is one we have already conquered: getting permission from Boston University to produce this story. We have been in touch with New York scriptwriter Daniel Blanda through pre-production and have been editing and table reading the tar out of this story. We also have been working closely with film director Paul Schneider (Baywatch, JAG) for production advice and mentorship.

The second challenge is applying for insurance and permits to film in locations that are not covered by the university. Again, our team is currently working through that, and we seem to be on the right track to get all the permits and insurances necessary.

Once we are fully funded, that should be the extent of our challenges, past the obvious ones of actually shooting the film.

Other Ways You Can Help

We are glad you asked!!! In today's day and age, word of mouth is everything.  We think we got a pretty cool idea on our hands, and we believe the video speaks for itself.  Sharing our campaign would be extremely beneficial, or informing people of who we are, and how we are different would help spread the message of unique independent filmmaking.

Donate

Share our campaign on your socials (FB, IG, Twitter)

LIKE and follow us on our Instagram page for the updates :)

https://www.instagram.com/highbread13/
story_txt:
Story
HighBread is a Serio-comedy about Jai who wants to open the first of its kind Pot bakery in Boston despite being an expelled international student from Boston University, having over-controlling, interfering and orthodox parents alongside an expired US visa.
The first episode is about Jai and how he overcomes the obstacle of always being controlled by his surroundings and finally makes a decision for himself which leads us to the franchise of the whole series.  
 
Meet the Creators
Jayesh Jaidka (the Producer, Director, Editor), Campaign Manager 

Jayesh is an Indian Director, Writer, and Actor. Originally from New Delhi, India, Jayesh worked at Shunya Theatre as Secretary and later Vice President. He later left to become Celebrity Manager at IMG Reliance Pvt. Ltd., India’s largest company that promotes and develop sports, entertainment and fashion in India. Jaidka studied economics at Delhi University with a Bachelors in Economics and is now residing in Boston, MA to attend Boston University for his Masters in Cinematography & Media Production.

IMDb: https://www.imdb.com/name/nm9497929/

LinkedIn: https://www.linkedin.com/in/jayesh-jaidka-275180a6

IG: @jaidkajayesh

 
John Varkados (the Unit Production Manager and Line Producer), Co-Campaign manager

John is an American film producer, singer-songwriter, and freelancer. Born in Seoul, South Korea, Varkados enlisted in the United States Marine Corps, but was released from active duty and moved to Boston in 2014. Varkados studied music theory at Berklee College of Music, specializing in music business management and artist development. Following the advice of a teacher, he later furthered his studies at Boston University, specializing in the production and visual storytelling.

IMDb: https://www.imdb.com/name/nm7970293

LinkedIn: https://www.linkedin.com/in/johnvarkados

IG: @johnvarkados

 
Sokhean (Johnny) Ouk (the Cinematographer)

After 10+ years as a professional sushi chef from Portland, Maine, Sokhean went to pursue a BA in Media Studies along with minors in Video Production & Information Communication Technology at the University of Southern Maine. During his undergraduate career he received the Maine Broadcasters Award and interned at Lone Wolf Media, a local production house that has produced many documentaries on various TV networks such as the Discovery Channel. Enjoying all aspects of the creative art of film and photography, he is now at Boston University for his MFA in Cinema and Video Production. Also a freelancer under his brand, Hi its Jonny, he has worked on TV/Web commercials, documentaries, weddings and various other projects.

IMDb: https://www.imdb.com/name/nm8633746

Reel: https://vimeo.com/312296661

IG: @hi.itsjonny

 
Meet the Bakery Owner
Dana Gallo Strayton (the Culinary Advisor/Catering Management Executive)

Dana began her culinary career in her grandfather’s pastry shop, later worked in her father’s restaurant, and while attending Boston University, managed G’Vanni’s.  After graduation Dana then went to Florida to open Galleria G’Vanni a 250-seat restaurant in Ft. Lauderdale, where she was responsible for hiring, menu development and once open, day-to-day management of the restaurant.After two years in Florida, Dana returned to Boston again managing G’Vanni’s North End location while attending graduate school at Boston University, graduating with a Master’s Degree in Marketing.Dana then joined a public relations firm in Boston where she managed the media services department, working closely with members of the press and facilitating corporate events for client companies.
For the past 8 years Dana has run a successful and acclaimed catering company that counts among its clients Kraft Foods, Microsoft, Fidelity Investments, Atlas Venture, Peabody Properties, McKinsey & Co., Progress Software, Mellic, Porter & Shea and a host of individuals and non-profit organizations.Dana opened Prince Street Cafe & Bakery in 2011, a storefront retail bakery and café located in historic Bedford, MA., where she serves as Executive Pastry Chef making her grandfather’s North End recipes.
http://www.princestcafe.com/
 
The Impact
We may be serious filmmakers but we love to have fun. We really think HighBread will be an amazing collaborative that will remove stereotypes from Indian/Southwest Asian culture as well as address issues and spark conversations that surrounds the legalization of marijuana (a very recent event in Boston as well as other parts of the United States).

story:
So here we are...

Stephen Colletti and James Lafferty. Friends, colleagues and now collaborators. Some of you may know us from our time on "One Tree Hill", some of you may know us personally, and many of you probably don't know us at all. Regardless, we're here to introduce you to a project near and dear to our hearts.

"Everyone is Doing Great" is an episodic comedy project we’ve lived and breathed for the last year of our lives. It’s a story formed partly from circumstances we’re familiar with, but primarily a fiction following friends dealing with life’s unexpected challenges. 

 If you think it’s worth your contribution, small or large, you’ll be satisfying the budget for 5 more 30-40 minute episodes of “Everyone is Doing Great.” That’ll make our first season 6 total episodes. The first season scripts are all written and we’re ready to pounce into production as soon as we have the funds. Over the next 45 days, you have the ability to bring this pilot several steps closer to becoming a full season of comedy television. 

What's in it for you?

Now for the fun part. We’ve put a lot of thought into what we can offer our backers a.k.a., our Heroes. We think many of the campaigns that forged a path before us had some great ideas, so you’ll see a few familiar incentives. We also sprinkled in a few things we think are fun and original, but we’ll let you be the judge of that. 

We’re grateful for every cent put forward and are looking forward to expressing that gratitude through these incentives and more!

Shooting the pilot episode of 'Everyone is Doing Great'. Stephen Colletti (Writer/Actor) touching the monitor after Johnny Derango (D.P./E.P.) told him to keep his greasy-ass fingers off it -- for the millionth time. Ian and Eshom Nelms (E.P.s) look on in bewilderment.

Why are we crowdfunding?

In an ever-changing landscape of Film and TV, more and more people are taking matters into their own hands and seeing incredible results. We're constantly inspired by filmmakers who fiercely protect their creative integrity. Crowdfunding our budget allows us to do exactly that. We want to remind creatives and audiences alike that there's always interest — and room — for great content. Here you will not only support “Everyone is Doing Great,”  you will also be showing your belief in independent television.

We’re grateful to take this route because it gives us more creative freedom and the ability to take you on the journey with us — every step of the way. Our incentives will provide you with updates and opportunities to put your own stamp on the series! 

Where does the money go?

We have a small, but incredibly talented and proficient team of independent filmmakers — a team that’s worked together on multiple projects over the years — actors, producers, cinematographers, sound mixers and set designers who have spent a decade carving out an efficient and effective system to create peak production value on a modest budget.

If you care to see for yourself, check out LOST ON PURPOSE on iTunes; WAFFLE STREET on Netflix; or perhaps SMALL TOWN CRIME, also on Netflix now, which just enjoyed a theatrical run. All of them are brought to you by our creative team, including Writer/Producer/Director duo Ian and Eshom Nelms, Cinematographer/Producer Johnny Derango and Actress/Producer Michelle Lang — all of whom serve as Executive Producers on “EDG.” Any one of these projects should assure you that the season of “EDG" we create will be completely consistent in quality. You can count on that. 

Since we already completed the pilot on our own, these funds will pay for the production of 5 additional episodes to make a total of one complete 6 episode season. Our efforts to help minimize production costs will include using several locations we personally own, shooting all episodes on one schedule to save time, and taking nominal pay rates relative to industry standards. 

Johnny Derango and Eshom Nelms wonder how they got here as James Lafferty (Actor/Director) encourages them to violate safety regulations by illegally crossing the street. Again.

But no matter how cost-effective we are, there will be expenses. Our shoot will last around two months and with a cast and crew of around 15-25 people, it will take significant funds to compensate these warriors fairly. There will also be insurance to buy, food for the crew, cameras to rent, lenses to rent, lights to rent, music licensing and all post-production costs (editing, sound mixing, color grading) amongst a truckload of other line items. Oh and that reminds us, we'll need to rent a truck as well.

All things considered, the number we’ve set for this campaign allows us to make a season of "Everyone is Doing Great" for the very least amount of money possible. Down to the last woman and man, we are a filmmaking team dedicated to the passion and love for storytelling first. 

Want to see the pilot?

As we mentioned in our video, the "Everyone is Doing Great" pilot is screening at film and television festivals around the world this year. Check out "Everyone is Doing Great" on the EDG social media accounts - Facebook, Instagram and Twitter - for updates on our festival tour. Come check out the show, mingle with our creative team, and let us know what you think.

Shooting the pilot's opening sequence. James Lafferty does his best impression of a featherless chicken moments before Director of Photography Johnny Derango insists he's not getting paid enough to tolerate this behavior.

The 'EDG' Creative Team

James Lafferty (Role of Jeremy Davis) – Producer, Director, Writer, Actor

James Lafferty most recently starred opposite Octavia Spencer and John Hawkes in the film Small Town Crime. In conjunction with starring in the CW series One Tree Hill for nine seasons, Lafferty also directed several episodes of the show. Since then, he’s recurred on NBC’s Crisis alongside Dermot Mulroney and WGN’s Underground starring Jurnee Smollett-Bell and Christopher Meloni. His recent film credits also include the hit Blumhouse horror Oculus and the comedy Waffle Street alongside Danny Glover. Last fall, he returned as a director to the E! Network’s The Royals. Lafferty continues to develop projects as both writer and director. 

 Stephen Colletti (Role of Seth Stewart) – Producer, Writer, Actor

Stephen Colletti made his film debut in Normal Adolescent Behavior, starring Amber Tamblyn, Ashton Holmes, and Kelli Garner. That same year, Colletti began recurring on the CW’s One Tree Hill where he appeared for six seasons and became a series regular. From 2014-'16, Colletti recurred on VH1's, Hit The Floor. Most recently, Colletti can be seen in the film comedy, Frat Pack, from Lionsgate. Colletti has also been drawn to the other side of the camera, developing projects as a writer and producer in both film and television. This year, Colletti sold a feature he wrote and produced with Jonathan Dillon (director/writer/producer) and Brian Kong (producer) to NBC Universal where they are further developing the film together. 

The Nelms Brothers, Executive Producers

Eshom Nelms and Ian Nelms are award-winning filmmakers who previously directed James Lafferty in three feature films including Lost on Purpose (2013), Waffle Street (2015), and the critically-acclaimed Small Town Crime (2018) all of which they also wrote. The Nelms Brothers executive produced “Everyone is Doing Great” under their Folly Films production banner. 

Michelle Lang, Executive Producer 

Founder of RBL (Relaxation Based Lifestyle), Michelle Lang is a world class swim instructor, certified Reiki practitioner, black belt martial artist and filmmaker. Her upcoming book, “A Mermaid’s Guide,” is a detail oriented visual guide for parents to empower their children in and out of the water. Michelle previously produced and starred in Lafferty’s film, Lost on Purpose (2013), and she serves as an executive producer on “EDG” in which she also has a cameo. 

Johnny Derango, Executive Producer + Director of Photography

In 2018, Johnny was featured by the entertainment industry’s prestigious American Cinematographer Magazine on their coveted annual list of The Top 12 Cinematographers from across the globe to watch out for. Johnny, who previously produced Lafferty’s film, Lost on Purpose (2013), is an executive producer on “EDG.” He also served as Director of Photography on both films. 

FREQUENTLY ASKED QUESTIONS...

How are you?

We're doing great, thanks. How are you?

When will I get my perk?

All perks, whether they require mail delivery or not, will be fulfilled by December, 2018, unless otherwise specified in the perk details. 

What if my address changes?

Please notify us via Indiegogo if there are any changes to your shipping information and we’ll do our best to get your delivery to your new address.

How do I choose my shirt size?

We will contact you post-campaign to collect your sizing information.

How do I change or upgrade my perk?

Indiegogo does not offer options to change or upgrade your perk through the site, but if you contact us directly, we’ll do our best to accommodate your request.

A moment from the pilot episode of 'Everyone is Doing Great'. Seth Stewart (Left) and Jeremy Davis (Right).

Can I claim more than one perk?

Absolutely. Each Indiegogo contribution is recorded individually, as a separate transaction. If you feel like showing your support multiple times, fire away!

What if the perk I want is sold out?

Although it may be possible that we add more stock of a sold-out perk, we’ll be doing so at our discretion. If the perk you want is sold-out, keep checking back to see what new perks we’ll be rolling out as the campaign progresses, there just might be something else that catches your eye!

Why was my contribution unsuccessful?

See Indiegogo’s list of  common contribution errors.... https://support.indiegogo.com/hc/en-us/articles/526846-Common-Contribution-Errors to troubleshoot the problem. If you’re still having trouble, get in touch with our campaign directly and we’ll see if we can help.

In what currency is the campaign raising money?

Bitcoin. 

Just kidding. We’ll be raising funds is USD.

What if I see an error on the page?

Get in touch and let us know! Feedback from our backers is as important to us as feedback from an audience. We want our campaign to run as smoothly as possible and your help in that regard is valued.

How will my contact information be used?

Your contact information will ONLY be used to communicate with you regarding your perk options and delivery, keep you informed of our show's progress and answer any questions you may have.

How long will it take for the campaign to answer my question?

If you’ve submitted a question, rest assured we’re working hard to get you an answer as soon as possible. We do ask for your patience on the matter, as we’re likely to be receiving hundreds of emails throughout the duration of the campaign, but rest assured, you will be heard!

 

Seth Stewart, Jeremy Davis and Andrea Cooper-Davis's smash vampire drama 'Eternal'. While some consider season two to be "the best season", that distinction continues to be widely and fervently debated.

story:
Once Upon a (Very Weird) Time...

For those who don’t know me, I’m a writer and entertainer based in Nottingham UK. I also work as an event producer, storyteller, workshop facilitator, and dabble in music, makeup, podcasting - all sorts of fun stuff!

I’ve been very fortunate in that I'd been working full time in the arts until self-isolating began. The downside is my income relied on curating and performing at events which are now all cancelled or postponed until further notice. 

People I’ve performed to or worked with have been wonderfully generous by continuing to support my work from afar, but I really miss being out in the community, entertaining people and just… all of it really. So, what I want to do while waiting to get back to work is create an online show that's fun and ridiculous and suitable for all!

"Stories from the Back of the Cupboard" (a mini-series of 5 episodes) is 'Mr Ben' when he can’t leave the house to pop to the costume shop. Virtual storytelling for the self-isolating where "Jackanory" meets "The Mighty Boosh."

Influenced by our current situation, each day you’ll find me as the narrator stuck at home, running out of things to do,  clearing out another area of the house. It's during these deep cleans that I’ll lean in too close, fall “through the back of the cupboard” and discover the story of a character that’s been long forgotten, or previously undiscovered. Think an alien in the attic, a yeti in the freezer, or a hermit hidden amongst the Tupperware...

Every scene will be filmed in and around my house and home studio space (i.e. the spare room with a green screen pinned to the wall) in order to create the fantastical scenes! 

The series will be posted online one episode each evening starting Monday June 1st 2020 until Friday 5th, on both Facebook and YouTube. 

 

The Funding Bit

If for some reason the campaign goes bananas, I’ll donate 50% of any funds received over target to Mermaids charity  The rest will help support my future creative endeavours i.e. keeping a roof over mine and my cat’s heads.

There's a lot which will go into this mini-series, and I'm doing it all single-handed. This includes developing the characters, writing their stories, filming the show, editing and producing the final episodes, along with making the music, props, sets, costumes, doing the makeup, and a little set aside for some paid advertising to reach as many homes as possible!

Supporting this project will help me keep going as an artist for the foreseeable and uncertain future but I don't want summat for nowt! There are some amazing perks to supporting this project, including event tickets, one of a kind creations, limited edition t-shirts, online private tutorials with yours truly, and more!

 

Ambitions beyond the cupboard...

The series will be for everyone; those living in isolation and those crammed together as ad hoc family units. It'll be colourful and eye-catching and psychedelic, with characters that captivate younger audiences, but appeal to all through the very relatable setting; you're stuck at home, rediscovering stuff you forgot you had but maybe find out a bit more about yourself, others, and the world immediately around you.

The episode themes will be universal, light-hearted, for anyone watching it to be entertained without feeling pandered to! Mostly I just wanted to get people talking with each other while self-isolating, or if they’re more isolated than most, to feel a little less alone.

 

Sounds like a lot, right? 

Yes, it's a massive project for one person but with all this free time when better to undertake such a challenge! Nevertheless, I'll be updating this page and my social medias with progress posts and sneak peeks as I go along. That way supporters can see some behind the scenes shenanigans of what they're helping create! 

 

All help gratefully received!

If you don’t see anything that takes your fancy then please, please contact me or alternatively drop whatever you can into the campaign or as a tip to my PayPal - make sure to add a note so I can still “Thank you” in the credits!

And just know even if you can't contribute at the moment a little can go a long way at a time like this. If you have a spare moment share this page with anyone you think might be interested, and help me spread the word! Thank you!
story_txt:
Once Upon a (Very Weird) Time...
For those who don’t know me, I’m a writer and entertainer based in Nottingham UK. I also work as an event producer, storyteller, workshop facilitator, and dabble in music, makeup, podcasting - all sorts of fun stuff!
I’ve been very fortunate in that I'd been working full time in the arts until self-isolating began. The downside is my income relied on curating and performing at events which are now all cancelled or postponed until further notice. 
People I’ve performed to or worked with have been wonderfully generous by continuing to support my work from afar, but I really miss being out in the community, entertaining people and just… all of it really. So, what I want to do while waiting to get back to work is create an online show that's fun and ridiculous and suitable for all!
"Stories from the Back of the Cupboard" (a mini-series of 5 episodes) is 'Mr Ben' when he can’t leave the house to pop to the costume shop. Virtual storytelling for the self-isolating where "Jackanory" meets "The Mighty Boosh."
Influenced by our current situation, each day you’ll find me as the narrator stuck at home, running out of things to do,  clearing out another area of the house. All help gratefully received!
If you don’t see anything that takes your fancy then please, please contact me or alternatively drop whatever you can into the campaign or as a tip to my PayPal - make sure to add a note so I can still “Thank you” in the credits!

story:
COVID Ditty is keeping New York Actors Creative and Working Through Tough Times

A Bronx-bred, film-TV-theater actor, Steve is a character actor who typically plays working-class people. Sometimes, he plays complementary roles such as an attorney opposite a headliner, like multiple Grammy- and Tony-Award winner Patti LaPone in FX’s hit show POSE. 

But the COVID-19 pandemic has changed things, including Steve. After months of isolation and continuous death-toll updates, he subconsciously decided to squint so he could see the humor amid the wreckage.

“There is a place for the human expression of some sort of  joy—or we would have all gone crazy,” says Steve, who shook the room with his booming voice as the miserable Ghost of Jacob Marley in A Christmas Carol in Harlem at the Classic Theater of Harlem—before the pandemic shut down everything.

Suddenly, Steve saw juxtapositions and inequities everywhere. Schools and houses of worship closed down, but liquor stores, fast-food joints and the state lottery were open for business. Teachers expressed concern about going back to work, while minimum-wage workers at McDonald’s dished “essential” burgers seemingly around the clock.

With Broadway locked down, Steve has started a new NYC production during the pandemic—about the pandemic—with his own cobbled-together life savings. He recently began writing an eight-part “dramedy”—COVID Ditty—a series of short vignettes that captures glimpses of oddities and ironies that we have all been too numb to fully digest. Steve is the writer, the director and the lead as “Phil”, who is a simple, lumbering, lunch-pail guy trying to make sense of the new world order.

Steve’s other new role is one of job creator. So far, he has hired SAG-AFTRA actors, like himself, for Episode 1, as well as an editor, a Go Pro cameraman, someone in charge of music, a production team and a digital marketing firm with a publicist to get the word out. 

According to Steve, New York City is the tale of two cities: the posh “Goldman Sachs New York” who have the resources to cut and run to the Hamptons, Miami or points beyond when the going gets tough and the blue-collar families who grind and endure, making the city’s gears turn every day—even when the New York Post’s headline screams, “New York City is Dead Forever.”

“COVID Ditty is a New Yorker’s love letter to his neighborhood,” Steve says. “It’s a love letter for the people who went through 9/11 and the people who are going through this pandemic—and they are still HERE. They love the city. They see the good in people. They are rising above the news, all the partisan anger and rancor. They are regular joes, trying to get by. There are plenty of those people out there.” Now COVID Ditty hopes to keep production of the additional episodes  moving forward with help from the greater community. 

 

Help Keep COVID Ditty Progressing....

Steve, in his own words:

I always bet on a sure thing. The COVID Ditty web series is a testament to the hard-working NYC families who have chosen to stay and fight. I have reached into my SAG-AFTRA retirement savings to produce the first scripts for Season One, but I need your help to finish the eight-part series. We have actors, an editor and a production team counting on us. We are an economic engine that is putting money into the local Bronx economy. Every time a coffee is bought over a script meeting, a lunch is served on set or an interior location is used, a local Kingsbridge business benefits. The arts are job creators! If you believe New Yorkers don’t quit, please make a contribution today to keep this work alive. For donations more than $60, I’ll throw in a t-shirt that captures this memorable work during an unforgettable time.

The Impact

ALL donations will keep the show in production and contribute to keeping NY artists and crew working through this difficult time that has especially impacted artists and creatives across this city, the country and the world.

  • Support NYC actors and neighborhoods
  • Contribute to a heartfelt, relevant series that can share light to many during a difficult time.

Other Ways You Can Help

Please go to https://stevegreensteinactor.com/covid-ditty/ to check out the first episodes  and @covidditty for Social Media, and share COVID Ditty, to spread the word about this project. Every little bit helps!

story:
Meet the Co-Creators of Apartment 101

 

Heather Abbott graduated from Stephen F. Austin State University with a Bachelor of Fine Arts in Theatre Performance. Before her college experience, she studied film all four years of high school. She is a Kamp Hollywood alum and is excited to work on a film set once more. 

Breanna Benedict graduated from Columbia College Chicago with a Bachelor of Arts in Acting. Growing up, she was always performing on the stage. Then in college, she caught the screen acting bug and is ready to get back in front of the camera.  

 

Apartment 101 started out as an inside joke. Then, after hours of banter, Heather and Breanna finally sat down and started writing. Three months later, ten episodes had been written, re-written, and re-re-written. It was time to assemble the troops. As of today, the first two episodes have been completely filmed; however, as production continues, expenses will begin to pile up. Donation to our campaign will help us to make this project a reality, while still being able to pay rent. 

 

Our goal is to raise $1000. This will allow us to pay for venue rentals, costumes, props, and food for our actors. 

 

If you donate, here are the special perks:

  • $10- You get a handwritten thank you note from the creators of the show. Oh my! Do people even hand write letters anymore?
  • $25- You get that handwritten thank you and a commemorative show poster signed by the whole cast. Who knows? One of them could get real famous. 
  • $50- You get the ever-so-sought-after handwritten thank you, commemorative, signed show poster, and a Blu-ray copy of the first season. Or a DVD. You know, if you're into that. 
  • $100- You know the drill. Handwritten thank you, commemorative poster, Blu-Ray copy of the first season, AND an official Apartment 101 t-shirt. Oh, also, a special thanks in the credits of every episode. 
  • $200- I see you, big spender. You're going to get all the cool stuff listed above (handwritten thank you, show poster, Blu-Ray, t-shirt, special thanks in the credits) BUT ALSO an Associate Producer credit. That's right. You'll get to say you are in show business. The family will be so proud. 

 

After you donate, tag us on social media to spread the word! We want to hear from you!

Give us a follow to stay up to date with behind the scenes extras and links to the show when it airs. 

Instagram: @apartment101show    Twitter: @apt101show

Check out the official Apartment 101 website at www.apartment101show.com

story:
NEW WEB SERIES, WHO DIS?

We're Aaron J. Shelton and Polina Feldbein. We're two New York comedians, filmmakers and besties.

Aaron is a director, writer, editor who has been working in television and film production since 2010.  Polina is a producer, writer, actor who has been working in television development since 2014. Don't believe us? IMDB son. 

We've been doing improv together all around NYC for the past 3 years on our team Daddy's Ghost. 

We also produce sketches. Still don't believe us? Man, you got trust issues.

 

BIG DEAL, SO WHAT?

POSSESSED is the next step in our creative comedy dream board. We’re passionate about this silly sad comedy because it showcases the female experience through an unconventional lens. Plus we think Satan's pretty funny. I mean look at him, all red, tiny horns, lil' pointy tail. What a dummy.

Every video we’ve created so far has been self-financed. We've kept projects small, called in favors from our talented friends, and used every resource available to us in order to keep costs low. With POSSESSED, we’re still doing all of those things, but it's just not enough to create the series we want.

And that’s where you come in.  

WHAT MONEY DO?

We need $5,000 to create SIX five-minute episodes.

Here’s the breakdown of where that money is going:

Our generous cast and crew have agreed to work below industry standards, and any additional funds raised will go to giving them the pay they deserve.

And just so you know, Aaron and Polina are making negative dollars for their time and efforts as the writers/producers/director/editor/actors/sound designer/chefs/marketing firm of POSSESSED.

THOSE BENNIES

Here are some of the great rewards you can earn:

  • Thank-You emails
  • Digital Downloads
  • Original Music
  • Behind The Scenes Podcast
  • VIP Screening
  • Producer Credits
  • Commercial for your Product or Service
  • Baked Goods!

 

RISKS & CHALLENGES

Though this is our first web series as a creative team, we have created several video projects both together and separately. Aaron has produced independent feature films. Polina has developed docu-series. Though we’ll have to work around our day jobs, we’re confident that we can deliver the first season of POSSESSED in early 2018.

THANK YOU!

Thank you so much for visiting our campaign. Any donation in any amount helps. Also, please share our campaign on social media, e-mail or through notes to your crush in class. We won't tell.

story:
We have already created a high-end television quality pilot episode of The Vancouver Actor's Guild to market our concept. The feedback to date has been exceptional! We have the first 3 episodes ready to shoot and 9 more written on the back-end to complete the first full season. The money we raise will be used to shoot these first 3 episodes and bring them to market, at which time we hope to be picked up for distribution. 

We have evaluated the project from the beginning for longevity and consumer demand. We self-funded our own proof of concept before asking anyone else for money. What we have produced has been widely accepted and praised. Not just by close friends, but by industry professionals, second and third generation referrals, and also from a wide demographic range. Our characters and their stories are very widely accepted and relate to everyone. We have included a diverse array of characters from all walks, and we feel that this further demonstrates the broad market appeal for a our project.

Did we mention it's hilarious?! There have been spit takes, double takes, and confessions of some piddling of pants..:)

We know that not everyone can contribute financially. And that is absolutely fine. We do not want to ask someone to assist with funds they cannot spare. However, the push to create the biggest awareness campaign possible in the time we have is on. We ask that everyone who likes our show to PLEASE forward links and information throughout your entire networks as quickly and passionately as possible. Building our audience is vital to our success. Especially since we are hoping to draw the attention  of major networks. Our reach at this moment is near 5000. With your help, we are hoping to expand that reach globally.

All supporters will be recognized online and at our September 25, 2019 director's cut Pilot episode screening event launch party at the renowned Columbia Theatre in New Westminster.

All donations/contributions over $100 will be entered into lottery draws for some special opportunities such as additional walk-on roles,  private events with the cast, back stage access during the shoots, and some fun times out and about in our beautiful City. You are welcome to purchase these perks to gift friends, family and the creative in your world.

Private investment opportunities/ producer credits, and  joining our 'Executive Producer' team are available at www.babycrowpictures.com

story:
Our Story

Trillo & Suede is a multi-award-winning film noir parody web series, featuring a ventriloquist detective and his wooden partner. It is the Winner for Best Web Series, Best Comedy, Best Noir, Best Music and other Top Awards in 27 international film contests. 

Episode 1 of ten weekly episodes comprising Season 1 was released on Jan. 1, 2020.  Season 2 began on Nov. 1, 2020 with the first of ten weekly episodes. Seasons 1 and 2 can be seen on our YouTube channel: https://www.youtube.com/c/TrilloSuede - and on our Vimeo channel: https://vimeo.com/trilloandsuede

I (Jonathan Geffner) am the writer/creator/executive producer/lead actor.  A real-life professional ventriloquist, I play the roles of both Trillo and Suede.

Having self-funded both Seasons 1 and 2 I am no longer able to self-fund this project. Producing another 10-episode season would require at least $35,000 on a very tight budget. I felt it would be very difficult to crowd fund $35,000, so I decided to set a more achievable goal of $18,000 in order to produce an abbreviated Season 3 of only five episodes.  

If we exceed our $18,000 goal I will use the money as far as it will go to produce additional Season 3 episodes. If we fall short of our goal I will shoot fewer episodes. If we fall far short of our goal my fallback plan is to use whatever money I have to produce just one short film. 

What We Need & What You Get

Every dollar of your contribution will go toward the production of Trillo & Suede Season 3. Our $18,000 goal will barely cover the cost of shooting and editing an abbreviated, five-episode Season 3 on a very tight budget. If we are fortunate enough to surpass our goal, every dollar of it will go toward expanding the number of episodes and/or adding production value to the episodes.

All of our talented cast and crew will be working for very modest fees because of their enthusiasm for and belief in the Trillo & Suede project. But even modest fees will add up quickly. Plus there will be equipment rental fees, location fees, transportation fees, cost of insurance, props and wardrobe, and lots of nutritious food to keep our cast and crew well-fed and energetic throughout the grueling-yet-exciting shoot. 

Your support will enable the unique, exciting, hilarious Trillo & Suede web series to continue, while allowing yourself to become part of its history. Plus, you'll get some cool perks in appreciation for your support.

Other Ways You Can Help

• Share this campaign with friends, family, coworkers, and on social media.

• If you know someone who writes for a journal or a blog, or has a podcast, tell them about us so they can spread the word about our campaign.

Your help of any kind will be greatly appreciated. 

We'd love to hear your comments and feedback. Welcome to the Trillo & Suede team!

Meet Members of Our Team

Jonathan Geffner - aka Trillo & Suede - is the writer, creator, executive producer and lead actor.  One of the world's most highly skilled and versatile ventriloquists, he is also a pianist with an M.A. in Piano from Manhattan School of Music, a novelist, a Yiddish teacher/translator, and has 3rd degree black belts in Ki Chuan Do (Guided Chaos) and Close Combat Karate. 

 

Sabrina Geffner appears as Zoe in the Trillo & Suede web series - in addition to working as 2nd Assistant Director and helping her dad, Jonathan (aka Trillo), in countless other ways. A talented filmmaker, she is a film major at School of Visual Arts in New York City. 

 

Katharina Schmidt (Helga/Heather) plays recurring guest star roles in Seasons 1 & 2 of Trillo & Suede. A versatile actress, she enjoys flipping through random accents (including a native Aussie accent that likes to invade randomly in conversations). She is also fluent in German, as well as being able to speak basic French and Korean and the occasional Yiddish. You can catch two of her aliases - Helga (a German femme fatale with a wooden sense of humor) and Helene (a French femme fatale with a pastry fetish) - in Season 1, as well as her new identity as Heather (a Chicagoan damsel in distress) in Season 2. Theatre BA, Bucknell University. Her recent projects are playing at: Garden State Film Festival.

 

Leah Haley plays femme fatale Jessica Rabbi in the Trillo & Suede web series. Actor, model and singer, Leah is a versatile performing artist. Whether improvising on stage, preparing a monologue, or surfing in El Porto, she is always known to be dedicated, and is looking forward to returning to Trillo & Suede in Season 3.  

 

Tarnisha Garvin is a Brooklyn, NY native and is an animal rescuer and entrepreneur. She is the eldest daughter of 10 kids and graduated from Midwood HS. Tarnisha always wanted to become a doctor but ended up in a career in Healthcare reporting. Her friend starred in one episode of Trillo and Suede as a villain and Tarnisha absolutely loved it. Since then she has decided to support this web series by becoming a team member.

 

Gregory Levine (Big Boychik) was bred in the Bronx, where he fought his cruel beautiful sisters for every crumb. Jump Cut: He writes and acts, playing maniacs ranging from Napoleon to mad scientists to Satan, Berlinner artistes and Runyonesque gangsters - and yes, Big Boychik in "Trillo & Suede" - in feature films, TV, Web series, on stage and via live Zoom-casts. Gregory is thrilled to be working with Jonathan and his inspired T&S team!

 

Chris Torem: Plays the role of Goose in the Trillo & Suede Web Series. In addition to acting, Chris is a Psychologist, PE Teacher, Football Coach & Powerlifter. His Acting Resume (Films, TV, Infomercials & Music Videos...) can be found on both Actors Access & Boston Casting, as well as the Christorem.com website.  

 

Marc Lubbers (Rabbi Shmutsik Pupik) grew up in the Hamptons suburb of Sag Harbor on Long Island, NY. He studied music and acting at Susquehanna and Northwestern Universities, focusing mainly on music during his 20s and 30s. Returning to stage and screen acting in 2017, he has portrayed a wide variety of lead and supporting roles in both musical and non-musical theater productions, and has filmed a diverse array of work in short films, web series and commercial/industrial projects.

 

Ed Bungert has appeared in only one film, playing a purse snatcher in 1977’s Blackout. A mere dabbler himself, Ed had been a lifelong fan of Ventriloquism and is happy to be part of the team promoting this amazing series of shorts. Ed is also a published author of four, FBI procedural novels, and a renter of office and meeting spaces by day. Let’s go Team Trillo and Suede!

 

Shooting Season 2 in August, 2020. Clockwise, top left: Sabrina Geffner (Zoe), Jonathan Geffner (Trillo), Suede (himself), Hassan Farrow (Rabbi Lustig), Marc Lubbers (Rabbi Shmutsik Pupik)
story_txt:
Our Story
Trillo & Suede is a multi-award-winning film noir parody web series, featuring a ventriloquist detective and his wooden partner. It is the Winner for Best Web Series, Best Comedy, Best Noir, Best Music and other Top Awards in 27 international film contests. 
Episode 1 of ten weekly episodes comprising Season 1 was released on Jan. 1, 2020.  Season 2 began on Nov. 1, 2020 with the first of ten weekly episodes. Seasons 1 and 2 can be seen on our YouTube channel: https://www.youtube.com/c/TrilloSuede - and on our Vimeo channel: https://vimeo.com/trilloandsuede
I (Jonathan Geffner) am the writer/creator/executive producer/lead actor.  A real-life professional ventriloquist, I play the roles of both Trillo and Suede.
Having self-funded both Seasons 1 and 2 I am no longer able to self-fund this project. Producing another 10-episode season would require at least $35,000 on a very tight budget. I felt it would be very difficult to crowd fund $35,000, so I decided to set a more achievable goal of $18,000 in order to produce an abbreviated Season 3 of only five episodes.  
If we exceed our $18,000 goal I will use the money as far as it will go to produce additional Season 3 episodes. If we fall short of our goal I will shoot fewer episodes. If we fall far short of our goal my fallback plan is to use whatever money I have to produce just one short film. 

What We Need & What You Get
Every dollar of your contribution will go toward the production of Trillo & Suede Season 3. Our $18,000 goal will barely cover the cost of shooting and editing an abbreviated, five-episode Season 3 on a very tight budget. If we are fortunate enough to surpass our goal, every dollar of it will go toward expanding the number of episodes and/or adding production value to the episodes.
All of our talented cast and crew will be working for very modest fees because of their enthusiasm for and belief in the Trillo & Suede project. But even modest fees will add up quickly. Plus there will be equipment rental fees, location fees, transportation fees, cost of insurance, props and wardrobe, and lots of nutritious food to keep our cast and crew well-fed and energetic throughout the grueling-yet-exciting shoot. 
Your support will enable the unique, exciting, hilarious Trillo & Suede web series to continue, while allowing yourself to become part of its history. Plus, you'll get some cool perks in appreciation for your support.

Other Ways You Can Help
• Share this campaign with friends, family, coworkers, and on social media.
• If you know someone who writes for a journal or a blog, or has a podcast, tell them about us so they can spread the word about our campaign.
Your help of any kind will be greatly appreciated. 
We'd love to hear your comments and feedback. Welcome to the Trillo & Suede team!

story:
What is Babyborough, MA?

Babyborough, Massachusetts is a small town comedy-mystery webseries, based on the real town of Boxborough, Massachusetts, and we can’t wait to film! Our team has already poured our hearts into writing the show and planning for the shoot and we are itching to bring it life. Help us make it a reality!

 

What's our goal?

Our fundraising goal is $1500. The money will cover props, costumes, gear rental, food, housing, transportation, and festival submissions for the finished pilot. Every cent we make will go towards making this pilot the best it can be.


Who's the team?

This show is our baby and we want to share it with the world— especially you! Here is some of our team’s previous work to check out if you want a sense of what to expect with this pilot:

 

(Aaron Razi Baseman, co-director)

(Ralston Finney, director of photography)

(Aleiagh Hynds, lighting designer)

(Carl Coetzee, composer)

(Siena Brolin & M Fleming, co-writers)

 

A Note About COVID

There is a possibility that filming will be delayed due to COVID-19, and in the unfortunate event that we can not film at all, we will refund all donors. However, it is probable that vaccines will be available to our cast and crew by the time of filming, and some of our team members are already vaccinated!

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Donating isn’t all you can do! Whether or not you are able to contribute money, sharing our campaign is another great way to help us out and increase the likelihood of reaching our goal. Thank you so much for your help!

story:
Help Big Man Dan Finish!

Big Man Dan is a short-form animated web series (2-3 minutes per episode) about a Caribbean husband with a "too good for him" wife who spends all his time trying (and failing) to prove that he's a real macho man -- the kind of man he thinks his wife deserves.

Based in Trinidad & Tobago, the team behind Big Man Dan brings experience from top entertainment companies and has been recognized by international film festivals.

We're sure you still have tons of questions. Read on for some answers...

 

We're a small team of 5, and just like that famous Jamaican bobsled team, we're defying the odds through hard work and perseverance to enter a field typically dominated by North American and European teams. But before we can take over the industry we need to complete the pilot episode of our first production, Big Man Dan.  

We started producing the first Big Man Dan episode (the pilot) this May with a 3-month timeline and a tight budget. Then tragedy struck.

Our Storyboard Artist's mother passed away. Our artist was willing to come back to work almost immediately, but we didn't let her. The team wanted to give her a generous grieving period (a decision we don't regret). As a result, we lost time and money.

Then, the technology gods frowned upon us and our Animation Director's computer died! The repair process took nearly three weeks. Again, time and money down the drain. The team put in overtime to make up for the unexpected delays. 

Still, despite our best efforts to catch up for lost time, we're left with a budget deficit. 

 

We need $6000 to fund the following production activities:

  • Final Animation & Compositing - Your contribution will help put a little money in the pockets of our full-time animators/compositors so they can buy food to fuel their brains and hands.  We don't want them starving to death before they finish the episode!

 

  • Sound Design - If you've ever seen a cartoon, you know how important sound is to telling an animated story. A portion of your contribution will go towards this. 

 

  • Music - It's illegal to use copyrighted music without purchasing permission. Your contribution will help us purchase music licenses for the episode. 

 

  • Pitching & Marketing - Before and after the episode is released online we'll have to promote it to make sure audiences around the world can find it in addition to pitching the show to potential funders so that we can make more episodes.

But enough about us. Let's talk about what YOU get out of all of this...

 

As a Big Man Dan supporter you get to say that you played a part in bringing to life one of the best Caribbean animation series ever made (we're so humble, right?). And if that's not enough, we have great perks lined up for our Big Man Dan family. 

 

 

Heartfelt Thanks

$10 - We'll send you a thank you email dripping with compliments and gratitude because you deserve it!

Early Access

$25 - See the pilot episode before anyone else with an exclusive online pass. Plus our sincerest thanks. 

Coffee Mug

$40 - Been itching for a new coffee mug? We got you covered. Get a special-edition Big Man Dan coffee mug plus a thank you email, plus early access to the episode. 

T-Shirt

$75 - No need to walk around bareback, showing off all your goods. We're offering you the very shirts off our back (not really, they're brand-new Story Play tees). Plus our sincerest thanks and early episode access.

BTS Digital Book

$100 - What's it take to put an animation pilot together? Get an inside look at the process with a "Behind the Scenes of Big Man Dan" digital book.  Not only that,  get a t-shirt , early access plus our sincerest thanks.

Executive Producer Credit

$600 - You'll receive Executive Producer screen credit plus a "Behind the Scenes of Big Man Dan" digital book, a t-shirt, mug and thanks. 
 

  • Follow Big Man Dan on Facebook and Instagram!
  • Share this campaign with someone, anyone, everyone!

 

Thanks for supporting Big Man Dan and Story Play!

campaign_city: Port of Spain, Trinidad and Tobago

story:
The Creative Team

 

The filmmakers behind "The Coroner's Assistant" have each been part of their own completed projects, and brought their unique skills to the table to create the pilot for the series.

Angeline Walsh (Writer/Director), has made two feature films as an independent filmmaker in Cleveland, Ohio. Her first feature, 21st Century Spectacle, a 1920s-style silent film, won Best First Feature at the L-Dub Film Festival in 2016, as well as being featured in the Broken Knuckle Film Festival that same year. Her 2016 film, A Murder Party, won best Indie Feature (December 2017) at the Festigious Los Angeles Monthly Film Competition and 4th place in the Short Drama-Comedy competition at the 2017 Indie Gathering Film Festival. Her self-published poetry collection, “Bad Psychiatry,” was released in 2018, and she is currently in the process of recording an accompanying audiobook. She blames her thanatological fixations on having visited too many catacombs as a child.

Giorgiana Lascu (Producer), started her career as a producer in high school where she took a friend’s address book and bullied half a dozen friends into coming over to make a film called Psychotown. Since then she has produced several independent web series, sketches, and short films. Her production work includes production coordinating and assistant producing the documentary mini-series Plate Up, and includes freelance work as a second assistant director and music supervisor. A recent theatre graduate from Cleveland State University, she was the first recipient of the Tony Weinert Theatre Scholarship, the departmental academic scholarship, and a leadership scholarship for her work as a reporter and business manager of the college newspaper “The Cauldron.” She also served on the General Fee Committee championing vibrant creative endeavors, and is an adamant supporter and believer in independent film.

Dagna Griffin (Director of Photography), is a classically trained filmmaker and perfectionist. She was a Video Production Specialist for IBM for 5 years, where she created an abundance of creative marketing videos as a “one person video crew.” Presently, as the owner of Dagna Griffin Creative, she produces a variety of unique and intimate films for weddings, real estate, birth, and more. Her dedication to visual detail and capturing perfect moments makes her cinematography captivating and engaging.

 

Perks

We are offering a variety of perks for donating (see the bar on the side)! Everyone who donates will receive their name at the end credits of the remaining four episodes as a "Thank You", as well as a PDF of the Promo Deck for the show to read and share.

 

Where Your Donation Money Will Go

Here's a little breakdown of our budget for the next four episodes:

  • Payment for our cinematographer ($1,800)
  • Location Fees ($300)
  • Props/Wardrobe ($300)
  • Travel Expenses ($300)
  • Food and Drink for Cast/Crew ($300)

 

The Talent

"The Coroner's Assistant" boasts a diverse, professional, and talented cast.

Cedric Gegel (James Rigby), is a stage and film actor from Columbus, Ohio. Film/TV credits include A Murder Party (where he debuted the role of James Rigby, “The Coroner’s Assistant”), Programmed Series: Aznek (Draven), Knight’s End (Prince Cnut), and Close-Up Shot (Protagonist/Antagonist). Stage credits include Beauty and the Beast(The Beast), Hamlet (Claudius), and Peter and the Starcatcher (Black Stache). A filmmaker in his own right, he wrote and directed the fantasy feature film, Cadia: The World Within, starring two-time Emmy nominee Corbin Bernsen and Harry Potter star James Phelps. Cedric is married to his beautiful wife Sarah, and is a huge football and Star Wars fan.

Robert Branch (Oliver Cross), has recently been seen at The Karamu House where he played George Bernard Shaw in The Adventures of the Colored Girl and her Search for God. After that, he donned several wigs and threw on a smattering of dresses to portray Diana Ross, Latoya Jackson, Liza Minnelli, Oprah Winfrey, and Michael Jackson’s mom Catherine, so assaying the role of Oliver Cross, with no wigs, and no dresses, was a welcome relief.

Jeremy Gladen (Thomas), while at Marie Et Cie in North Hollywood, once overheard an actor say to their manager over coffee, in public, “vulnerability is a weakness.” It’s relieving that his sense of morality was working that day, otherwise he would have ripped their heart right out of their chest and laid it on the table in front of them. Then, THE CORONER’S ASSISTANT came along and now he can do that, but without all the mess and the repercussions...maybe.

Giorgiana Lascu (Mary Cross), ran away from home to join a traveling caravan when she was three. She was discovered hours later, returned home, and subsequently received only a mildly beating...if that doesn’t qualify her to play Mary Cross, she doesn’t know what does.

Meg Martinez (Roberta Paine/Beggar Woman/Mrs. Pine), is dying of excitement to be part of THE CORONER’S ASSISTANT. She has been seen on stages around Cleveland as Mary Poppins in Mary Poppins, Marian Paroo in The Music Man, Janet Weiss in The Rocky Horror Show, Johanna in Sweeney Todd, Petra in A Little Night Music, and Polly Pry in Cannibal! The Musical, among others. When not onstage, she can often be found cooking up deviously delicious recipes in her kitchen, but don’t worry...she’s vegan.

Jim Curtis (The Fisherman), a Hilliard, Ohio, native, is currently studying Special Education at Columbus University. He plans to pursue acting full-time after graduation. There’s no way to describe him personally, so it’s best not to describe him at all.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you can't personally donate to this campaign, we'd appreciate it if you share the link to this page -- we want as wide of an audience as we can get!

Cedric is married to his beautiful wife Sarah, and is a huge football and Star Wars fan.
Robert Branch (Oliver Cross), has recently been seen at The Karamu House where he played George Bernard Shaw in The Adventures of the Colored Girl and her Search for God. After that, he donned several wigs and threw on a smattering of dresses to portray Diana Ross, Latoya Jackson, Liza Minnelli, Oprah Winfrey, and Michael Jackson’s mom Catherine, so assaying the role of Oliver Cross, with no wigs, and no dresses, was a welcome relief.
Jeremy Gladen (Thomas), while at Marie Et Cie in North Hollywood, once overheard an actor say to their manager over coffee, in public, “vulnerability is a weakness.” It’s relieving that his sense of morality was working that day, otherwise he would have ripped their heart right out of their chest and laid it on the table in front of them. Then, THE CORONER’S ASSISTANT came along and now he can do that, but without all the mess and the repercussions...maybe.
Giorgiana Lascu (Mary Cross), ran away from home to join a traveling caravan when she was three. She was discovered hours later, returned home, and subsequently received only a mildly beating...if that doesn’t qualify her to play Mary Cross, she doesn’t know what does.
Meg Martinez (Roberta Paine/Beggar Woman/Mrs. Pine), is dying of excitement to be part of THE CORONER’S ASSISTANT. She has been seen on stages around Cleveland as Mary Poppins in Mary Poppins, Marian Paroo in The Music Man, Janet Weiss in The Rocky Horror Show, Johanna in Sweeney Todd, Petra in A Little Night Music, and Polly Pry in Cannibal! The Musical, among others. When not onstage, she can often be found cooking up deviously delicious recipes in her kitchen, but don’t worry...she’s vegan.
Jim Curtis (The Fisherman), a Hilliard, Ohio, native, is currently studying Special Education at Columbus University. He plans to pursue acting full-time after graduation. There’s no way to describe him personally, so it’s best not to describe him at all.
 

Other Ways You Can Help
Even if you can't personally donate to this campaign, we'd appreciate it if you share the link to this page -- we want as wide of an audience as we can get!

story:
Summary

Mo is a normal 10 year old kid living in a parallel time to our own. The 1993 Mo lives in is not like the 1993 we know. In America, Hip-Hop is the culture that decides your value. Whether you be a Master of Ceremonies with the power to force an opponent to tears or a Graffiti artist with the power to bring your creations to life; you have the power to use creativity and style to master your own power.

After the destruction of his village and the loss of his teacher Iceberg, Mo swears revenge on those responsible; The 9 Legendary Samurai of the Shaolin.

 

 

 

My Background

 

I grew up in New Hampshire.

I went to college in Philly for Film.

Worked in New York for a little bit and moved to Los Angeles after graduating.

During this time the one thing keeping me company was music and my drive to keep writing and keep creating. Ultimately that culminated in this series coming so far along that I'm at the point of fundraising.

 

Contribution Reminders

Any contribution will be properly tracked and used for milestones along the way.

Contributors will know EXACTLY what their money is being used on.

If the goal is not met; I will keep everyone updated through alternative channels with where contributions are going. 

 

 

Video Schedule

I'll release videos bi-weekly to let people know how everything is coming.

 

Monday, January 25th = Animated Trailer

Monday February 8th = Budgeting Video (Where's it all Going?)

Monday February 22nd = What's Next?
