story:
Short Summary

I have 35 years in business start ups - some good and some bad. The bad ones you really learn from. In 2011, I was one of the first investors in the new Equity Crowdfunding (ECF) scene. Since then I have been battling to increase knowledge levels for investors; to help them make better decisions and give them a degree of information symmetry. My views are often quoted in national papers like The Times, The Sunday Times, The Herald and The Financial Times and online sources like CityAM, Bloomberg, The Memo and Altfi News, as well as specialist sector publications like The Caterer and BikeBiz.com. Here are some examples -

https://www.thememo.com/2017/08/21/crowdfunding-has-become-a-monster-argues-its-greatest-critic/

https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2016-11-07/you-too-can-invest-in-a-startup-likely-to-go-bust

https://www.thetimes.co.uk/article/lone-researcher-spells-out-the-dangers-of-following-the-crowd-jw990k2b5

I have been described in The Times as the guy "who arguably has spent more time than anybody tracking crowdfunding". 

Now the time is right to launch our new site ECF.Buzz. Offering data on 8 years of ECF investing, including records on over 500 real companies. The member's site will have

  • A forum for investors, companies and shareholders to chat  
  • Resources to help with..........
  • Due Diligence 
  • Understanding and analysing Companies House Filings 
  • Financial analysis
  • Market analysis
  • IP, Patents and how they work
  • Share classes and your rights
  • Trends in the various sectors and from ECF overseas
  • In depth analysis of successful and failed businesses,
  • Data on company directors
  • Advice on SEIS and EIS
  • Advice on loss relief  
  • Data on the investing platforms; independently analysed
  • Guest experts
  • Bespoke DD service
  • Similar P2P Lending section in development  
  • Lots more.

ECF investing has often been described as the Wild West; for good reason. Imagine ECFBuzz as your friendly Sheriff. It is time investors took back control!

 

What We Need & What You Get

We need to raise £6,500 to help build the site. All the ideas are there and we are ready to go. 

Your £24 will give you 12 months full Founders'Membership, discounted from the full annual rate of £48. The 5 year full Founders' Membership costing just £115 (RRP £240) means you don't have to worry about remembering to renew - 5 times! We are also exploring a London Event for the launch, which would give you all a fantastic networking evening. This will be priced and sold separately. Details to follow.

You will be the Founding Members and as such you will have the chance to join a virtual Advisory Board to help fashion this site - to help to improve it, so that it, in turn, helps you. 

The Impact

We think ECF is a fantastic way for ordinary people to get involved in start up businesses. We love start ups and at a time when banks have all but given up funding them, this is an essential resource for UKplc. But to make the most of it, people need to be able to see the potholes and avoid the more obvious pitfalls. The ECF investment platforms do not offer this service. At ECF Solutions Ltd, we are totally independent and our main goal is to help you.

 

 

There is currently no independent place for investors to go to discuss their experiences, learn about the sector and download information on investing in this scene. Our Guide to Due Diligence, now in its second year with Syndicate Room, has had over 5000 downloads and some great feedback. We have also, for the last 2 years, been writing a blog for a major UK ECF platform, covering ECF developments from around the world. We intend to make this research available to members. ECF Solutions also operates as a consultancy for companies to use, to help them create and run ECF campaigns. ECF.Buzz will be a one stop shop for everything you need to know about Equity Crowdfunding.  

Our blog fantasyequitycrowdfunding now has over 28k readers annually and this is growing organically at around 5% per month. Both the FCA and HMRC are readers. We intend to improve your chances and also increase your enjoyment in this investing. No one is going to get it right all of the time but a little knowledge can hugely improve your chances. We have that knowledge. We want to share it with you. 

This is what readers of our blog have to say - 

''Great idea , looking forward to the discussions already''..........''I’m in! I think it’s a splendid idea''............''Had I known about this blog 3 years ago I'd have saved circa £ 3k''..........''This blog is how I've found out about some of my investments not quite being what I was sold by XXXXXXX''..........''For those who have not been following you for some years the article archive provides a lot of credibility''...........''As an avid reader of your blog, I am forwarding a Drag Along Notice from XXXXX. From what I understand this is a forced sale where shareholders will lose 83% of their equity''...........''FantasyEquityCrowdfunding is required reading for anyone interested in ECF''

 

 

 

Risks & Challenges

We will not take any of your money unless the full £6,500 is funded. We aim to deliver the site up and running for members by June 2019 and your membership will only commence once it is live. Of course the site may cost considerably more than £6,500 and we have a contingency to allow for this. Once funded to £6,500, you are guaranteed a site. If we manage to fund more than the minimum then the plan is to improve the site pro rata.  

We would appreciate your help in spreading the word for this campaign - without members it will not happen. Our readers will form the backbone of our membership but the more members we have the more information we can all share. Who knows where it might lead?
 
We will be promoting it to our readers at FantasyEquityCrowdfunding. 
 
Thank you all for your support. Happy investing.

story:
Short Summary

See above. Going Dark: life backstage onscreen.

  • I started this as a bulleted list and it got too late to stop, so just go with it.
  • Jaime: writer, creator, carpenter extraordinaire 
  • Going Dark began when I realized there was a definite need for something catered to theatre tech-folk. There's a market for it, and Going Dark is going to fill that void.
  • We need help off-setting the cost of props, costumes, space rental?, coffee and snacks for the actors, equipment, etc. We're trying to do it on the cheap, but that means we end up paying out of pocket for all that stuff, you feel? All funds raised will go to off-set production costs. And hey, maybe we could even pay our actors--how novel. 
  • Tech crews in general are some sort of anomaly. There are shows about actors, singers, and dancers, but what about the people who turn the lights on in the morning and sweep up at night? This show is for them, and about them.
  • Not that it actually matters, because I'm a dope ass writer, but it's loosely based on my own experiences.
  • You want to know what's expensive? Trying to produce a web series. Even when everyone knows they're doing it for free because they're bomb ass friends; there are still a lot of costs to cover (see above)
  • Even if you can't contribute financially, you can help spread the word! Subscribe to our Youtube Channel and share it with your friends.
story_txt:
Short Summary
See above. Going Dark: life backstage onscreen.

I started this as a bulleted list and it got too late to stop, so just go with it.
Jaime: writer, creator, carpenter extraordinaire 
Going Dark began when I realized there was a definite need for something catered to theatre tech-folk. There's a market for it, and Going Dark is going to fill that void.
We need help off-setting the cost of props, costumes, space rental?, coffee and snacks for the actors, equipment, etc. We're trying to do it on the cheap, but that means we end up paying out of pocket for all that stuff, you feel? All funds raised will go to off-set production costs. And hey, maybe we could even pay our actors--how novel. 
Tech crews in general are some sort of anomaly. There are shows about actors, singers, and dancers, but what about the people who turn the lights on in the morning and sweep up at night? This show is for them, and about them.
Not that it actually matters, because I'm a dope ass writer, but it's loosely based on my own experiences.



You want to know what's expensive? Trying to produce a web series. Even when everyone knows they're doing it for free because they're bomb ass friends; there are still a lot of costs to cover (see above)
Even if you can't contribute financially, you can help spread the word! Subscribe to our Youtube Channel and share it with your friends.

story:
The Next James Bawnd. 

The Next James Bawnd is an exciting action/comedy webseries from creators Christopher John Blue & Steve Madden. The Next James Bawnd is James Bond meets Milos Forman's classic award winning film One Flew Over The Cuckoo's Nest and has everything you've ever wanted from a fan based webseries, action, comedy, drama and is uniquely filmed from two perspectives, that being one of Bawnd's and the other what everyone else sees. The 007 program has ended, James Bawnd has unknowingly failed  the psych test and is being given a send off. Unbeknownst to Bawnd, and disguised as a mission James Bawnd is sent by Em to a psychiatric facility in the Canadian countryside under the guise of a mission to track down a French Canadian terrorist named Monet posing as a street mime in Montreal. Bawnd, living the life of R.P McMurphy while staying at Kennedy Lodge begins to find that his stay is anything but voluntary. Upon his arrival at Kennedy Lodge he is greeted by Orderly's, Dr.’s, employees and a slew of familiar friends and foes including the evil admin of the institution Nurse Ratched, a heavy Asian chef who resembles Oddjob, an African American psychiatric Dr. who resembles Baron Samedi and a tall orderly resembling Jaws among a few other surprises. During his stay at Kennedy Lodge Bawnd befriends Chief Boom and begins to have intermittent flashbacks and delusions through-out his stay at the lodge he begins to see himself (back in action) as his younger self, however in reality he's an aging man (looks and acts like Connery) clinging to memories of his glory years with the MI6.

story:
Who Am I?

My name is Mitchel Holson, a student filmmaker studying cinematography at Hofstra University in New York. 

From co-directing a feature length documentary concerning autism awareness, to co-founding a ten day film camp for local teens, I have always been adamant about utilizing film as a tool to give back to the community.

With the help of your contribution, I intend to do just the same with this endeavor. 

What We Need 

Our goal is $1,005. This money will be used to kick off our campaign with the production of our first video. To ensure complete transparency, I have broken down the allocation of funds below:

Budget Breakdown

  • Camera Package: FREE
  • Advertisement: $30
  • Talent: $470
  • Wardrobe: $220
  • Post-Production Color Correction: $250
  • Music Licensing: $35

   Total: $1,005

The Impact

The first video will cover a clothing line called Maverick. Maverick encourages others, especially young kids, to remain persistent when it comes to pursuing their dreams.  The messages this brand projects have been adopted by thousands who sport the attire and have become a pivotal part of my personal ideology. 

Other Ways You Can Help

In the event that you are not able to contribute to this project financially, I would greatly appreciate a share on social media (which can be accomplished by hitting the Facebook icon at the top of this page). 

Thank you so much for your time!

Mitchel Holson

story:
When a scrappy young girl's first time is documented on social media, she has to decide if the truth is more important than the likes.

 

The Impact

SLAG is a controversial, slap in the face short film set in today’s post hopscotch world, where teens are digital natives and a young girl’s first time is documented on social media. Geared towards a youthful and tech-savvy audience, it presents a universal insight into how we can use social media platforms today and how toxic masculinity and infect the lives of young people. We believe this important message would be perfect for film festivals that invite innovative and thought provoking ideas such as SXSW, Filckerfest, MIFF and Byron Bay International Film Festival among others. After it’s festival circuit we intend to release the film across all social media platforms in the hopes of  bringing awareness and inspire debates on the topics of social media use, consent and how sex is perceived in today's culture of oversharing. We would really appreciate your support in telling this unique and important story.

 

What We Need & What You Get

So, heres the pitch:

50%  to Post-Production: Sound Design, Mixing and Grading most importantly, to give us a polished look and experience for our audience, you! 

50% to Marketing and Festival distribution: We would love to see this film go all around the world to reach as many audiences as possible and with your help we can make that dream a reality!

We have some very exciting perks including signed polaroids taken on set, and opportunities to meet the cast and crew at our cast and crew screening of the film.

 

Risks & Challenges

If we don't reach our goal, we are still 200% committed to finishing this film, however if we don't get all our funding, certain post-production facilities and distribution ideas/plans may need to be changed in order to keep in budget.  

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Please help spread the word by sharing our campaign on your social media! 

 

Meet the Team

Writer/Directors: Hannah-Rae Meegan and Monique Terry

'SLAG' is written and directed by Monique Terry and Hannah-Rae Megan, who have recently graduated from AFTRS. Their partnership has birthed a number of raw, gritty and gutsy shorts with a female gaze that is open and inclusive. Their films have screened at Cannes Antipodes, Berlin Now, Tropfest and in Sydney buses on Snackable to name a few.  'SLAG' is their most ambitious project to date.

Actress: Darcey Wilson

Darcey Wilson is an actress known for 'The Dressmaker (2015)', 'Home and Away (2016)' and 'Swinging Safari (2018)'. She has featured in multiple short films such as 'Over The Hills and Far Away (2014)' and 'Dream Baby (2015)'. She has worked previously with the directors, Monique and Hannah-Rae, on their 2018 short, 'Bring Me Back, Ma'. 

Actor: Wilson Moore

Wilson Moore graduated from Screenwise in 2017 with a Diploma in Film and Television. He has appeared in a number of commercials, television productions and short films including John Hillcoat’s feature films 'The Road (2009)' and 'Lawless (2012)'. Wilson played Adam in Simon Stone’s feature film 'The Daughter (2015)' and Warrick Trent in Rachel Perkin’s 2016 film 'Jasper Jones'. 

Producer: Hannah-Florence Macgregor 

Hannah-Florence Macgregor is a producer and director who graduated from AFTRS and International Film School Sydney with advanced diplomas in producing and directing respectively. She has directed and produced several short films and music videos. She recently produced the short film 'Asian Girls (2017)' as part of the Create NSW Generator Emerging Filmmakers Fund with executive producers Aquarius Films, which had it’s World Premier at 2018 SXSW, and has gone on to screen at MIFF, SFF, Palm Springs among others. Committed to making films with unique and lasting impact, Hannah-Florence is currently producing Hannah-Rae Meegan’s and Monique Terry’s 'SLAG'.

Director of Photography/Executive Producer: Lucca Barone-Peters

Lucca Barone-Peters is a cinematographer based in Sydney, Australia. He has worked extensively across short films, music videos and commercials, and his first feature Suburban Wildlife is currently in distribution. Lucca’s work has been recognised locally and internationally, with his short Gem winning the 2018 European Union Film Award, and screening at the 45th Gent Film Fest and the Asia Independent Film Festival. His unique eye, and commitment to story and character, has picked up multiple awards including Best Music Video at the International Women’s Film Festival and the Moondance International Film Festival. Lucca is also co-founder and creative director of Fat Salmon, an award winning youth-focused production company, and a founding member of Sydney’s Blueface Creative Space. Lucca is also a VR specialist, and has been involved with Australia’s biggest and most innovative VR projects, including Wentworth VR (Fremantle, StartVR), Prehistoric VR (ACMI, Screen Australia), and VRNoir (StartVR, AFTRS).

Production Design & Costume/Associate Producer/Executive Producer: China White

China White  is a Sydney based producer, writer and production designer whose award-winning work has featured in several festivals on an international stage. China is a recent graduate of AFTRS Bachelor in Arts (Screen) and prior to her work in film was an award-winning painter whose work has been exhibited in some of Australia’s most prestigious galleries. China is a progressive and expressive artist with a particular passion for animal welfare, women’s rights and mental health. China’s career in film has spanned from independent film projects like the multi-award-winning music video 'Savannah' to major productions such as 'Hacksaw Ridge (2016)' and 'Top of the Lake (2017)'. China has also spent time working with highly respected Australian production companies such as  Porchlight, See Saw and Tracy Mair Publicity. Recently, with her production company Fat Salmon China has Executive produced her first feature film Suburban Wildlife which has garnered the attention of such publications as IFMagazine, Filmink and Indiewire.

Executive Producer: Davis Jensen​

Davis is a writer, director based in Sydney Australia who makes theatrical comedies that harness the absurd and embrace the Australian voice.  Davis started making comedy shorts in high-school before getting accepted into the Australia Film Television and Radio School. At AFTRS Davis focused on his writing and directing leading him to create 'Tunnel Ball' in his final year. Upon graduation, Davis co-founded the production company Fat Salmon with two other AFTRS alumni, as well as working on the ABC TV show 'The Checkout' as an assistant producer.

Fat Salmon:

Fat Salmon is a dynamic creative agency making waves with fresh, forward-thinking & evocative content. We collect the best of Sydney’s young creative talent and channel it into a range of projects across short and feature films, VR, animation, visual effects and experimental art. In the last year, Fat Salmon has led the creation and production of major marketing campaigns for top Australian firms, as well as releasing their debut feature film 'Suburban Wildlife' that has garnered critical acclaim and press coverage in FilmInk and IF, as well as FBI Radio exclusives and a large online following. Fat Salmon has also delivered an award-winning experimental music video Savannah for Sydney independent artist Ivy Jane-Browne, as well as developing and funding multiple short films. Fat Salmon continues to expand its repertoire of work and a network of young creatives tied together by a belief in diverse local and emerging talent who create beautiful work across all mediums. At the forefront of Sydney’s burgeoning youth culture, Fat Salmon continues to surprise and impress into the start of 2019.

Take Two Productions:

With the emergence of online video platforms, digital TV, and mobile & social apps the creative landscape is wide open for story tellers to create and distribute new innovative content in exciting ways. Take Two Production was created to source and produce original digital content with global appeal with a focus on digital, online and mobile distribution. In doing so we aim to find talented voices who wish to take their vision to emerging digital platforms, and to develop the next generation of Australian screen professionals.
story_txt:
When a scrappy young girl's first time is documented on social media, she has to decide if the truth is more important than the likes.

 
The Impact
SLAG is a controversial, slap in the face short film set in today’s post hopscotch world, where teens are digital natives and a young girl’s first time is documented on social media. Geared towards a youthful and tech-savvy audience, it presents a universal insight into how we can use social media platforms today and how toxic masculinity and infect the lives of young people. We believe this important message would be perfect for film festivals that invite innovative and thought provoking ideas such as SXSW, Filckerfest, MIFF and Byron Bay International Film Festival among others. After it’s festival circuit we intend to release the film across all social media platforms in the hopes of  bringing awareness and inspire debates on the topics of social media use, consent and how sex is perceived in today's culture of oversharing. We would really appreciate your support in telling this unique and important story.
 

What We Need & What You Get
So, heres the pitch:
50%  to Post-Production: Sound Design, Mixing and Grading most importantly, to give us a polished look and experience for our audience, you! 
50% to Marketing and Festival distribution: We would love to see this film go all around the world to reach as many audiences as possible and with your help we can make that dream a reality!
We have some very exciting perks including signed polaroids taken on set, and opportunities to meet the cast and crew at our cast and crew screening of the film.
 

Risks & Challenges
If we don't reach our goal, we are still 200% committed to finishing this film, however if we don't get all our funding, certain post-production facilities and distribution ideas/plans may need to be changed in order to keep in budget.  
 

Other Ways You Can Help
Please help spread the word by sharing our campaign on your social media! 
 
Meet the Team
Writer/Directors: Hannah-Rae Meegan and Monique Terry
'SLAG' is written and directed by Monique Terry and Hannah-Rae Megan, who have recently graduated from AFTRS. Their partnership has birthed a number of raw, gritty and gutsy shorts with a female gaze that is open and inclusive. Their films have screened at Cannes Antipodes, Berlin Now, Tropfest and in Sydney buses on Snackable to name a few.  'SLAG' is their most ambitious project to date.
Actress: Darcey Wilson
Darcey Wilson is an actress known for 'The Dressmaker (2015)', 'Home and Away (2016)' and 'Swinging Safari (2018)'. She has featured in multiple short films such as 'Over The Hills and Far Away (2014)' and 'Dream Baby (2015)'. She has worked previously with the directors, Monique and Hannah-Rae, on their 2018 short, 'Bring Me Back, Ma'. 
Actor: Wilson Moore
Wilson Moore graduated from Screenwise in 2017 with a Diploma in Film and Television. He has appeared in a number of commercials, television productions and short films including John Hillcoat’s feature films 'The Road (2009)' and 'Lawless (2012)'. Wilson played Adam in Simon Stone’s feature film 'The Daughter (2015)' and Warrick Trent in Rachel Perkin’s 2016 film 'Jasper Jones'. 
Producer: Hannah-Florence Macgregor 
Hannah-Florence Macgregor is a producer and director who graduated from AFTRS and International Film School Sydney with advanced diplomas in producing and directing respectively. She has directed and produced several short films and music videos. She recently produced the short film 'Asian Girls (2017)' as part of the Create NSW Generator Emerging Filmmakers Fund with executive producers Aquarius Films, which had it’s World Premier at 2018 SXSW, and has gone on to screen at MIFF, SFF, Palm Springs among others. Committed to making films with unique and lasting impact, Hannah-Florence is currently producing Hannah-Rae Meegan’s and Monique Terry’s 'SLAG'.
Director of Photography/Executive Producer: Lucca Barone-Peters
Lucca Barone-Peters is a cinematographer based in Sydney, Australia. He has worked extensively across short films, music videos and commercials, and his first feature Suburban Wildlife is currently in distribution. Lucca’s work has been recognised locally and internationally, with his short Gem winning the 2018 European Union Film Award, and screening at the 45th Gent Film Fest and the Asia Independent Film Festival. His unique eye, and commitment to story and character, has picked up multiple awards including Best Music Video at the International Women’s Film Festival and the Moondance International Film Festival. Lucca is also co-founder and creative director of Fat Salmon, an award winning youth-focused production company, and a founding member of Sydney’s Blueface Creative Space. Lucca is also a VR specialist, and has been involved with Australia’s biggest and most innovative VR projects, including Wentworth VR (Fremantle, StartVR), Prehistoric VR (ACMI, Screen Australia), and VRNoir (StartVR, AFTRS).
Production Design & Costume/Associate Producer/Executive Producer: China White
China White  is a Sydney based producer, writer and production designer whose award-winning work has featured in several festivals on an international stage. China is a recent graduate of AFTRS Bachelor in Arts (Screen) and prior to her work in film was an award-winning painter whose work has been exhibited in some of Australia’s most prestigious galleries. China is a progressive and expressive artist with a particular passion for animal welfare, women’s rights and mental health. China’s career in film has spanned from independent film projects like the multi-award-winning music video 'Savannah' to major productions such as 'Hacksaw Ridge (2016)' and 'Top of the Lake (2017)'. China has also spent time working with highly respected Australian production companies such as  Porchlight, See Saw and Tracy Mair Publicity. Recently, with her production company Fat Salmon China has Executive produced her first feature film Suburban Wildlife which has garnered the attention of such publications as IFMagazine, Filmink and Indiewire.
Executive Producer: Davis Jensen​
Davis is a writer, director based in Sydney Australia who makes theatrical comedies that harness the absurd and embrace the Australian voice.  Davis started making comedy shorts in high-school before getting accepted into the Australia Film Television and Radio School. At AFTRS Davis focused on his writing and directing leading him to create 'Tunnel Ball' in his final year. Upon graduation, Davis co-founded the production company Fat Salmon with two other AFTRS alumni, as well as working on the ABC TV show 'The Checkout' as an assistant producer.

Fat Salmon continues to expand its repertoire of work and a network of young creatives tied together by a belief in diverse local and emerging talent who create beautiful work across all mediums. At the forefront of Sydney’s burgeoning youth culture, Fat Salmon continues to surprise and impress into the start of 2019.

story:
PREMIERE DATE

SEEDS is set to premiere this March with OpenTV in Chicago. OpenTV is a web platform that hosts original, diverse content by equally diverse filmmakers. It has featured acclaimed series such as Brown Girls, which recently got picked up by HBO. 

 

WHERE WE ARE NOW

We have since moved into post-production since filming began, and are currently in the process of adding the finishing touches to complete post-production. We are looking to raise a few thousand to cover costs towards sound mixing and color correction. Check out the teaser* above to get a preview of the series overall!

*Do note that the teaser is unfinished and does not have professional sound-mixing or color correction done.

 

HOW YOU CAN HELP

Consider donating to our campaign, any amount helps! Whether it's $5 or $20, every dollar raised goes towards the funding of and completion of this amazing project, including any contingencies or fees towards entering the series into film festivals & more!

Read on for behind-the-scenes photos & meet the SEEDS team!

 

THE FILMING OF SEEDS

SEEDS began pre-production in April 2017 with the casting of local Chicago talent. As scripts underwent rewrites, the locking-in of key crew began. From navigating logistics in securing equipment for lighting, camera, and sound to locking-in locations both in and around Chicago, by early Summer the team was able to secure the connections and resources needed to begin filming.  

Here are a few behind-the-scenes photos showcasing our 3-day adventure (I hadn't slept much that first day of filming...too many problems to solve!).

Photo credits to Michael Chungbin.

2nd A.C. Michael Chungbin adjusts the slate while C.J. reviews the monitor.

Setting the scene for Episode 2.

C.J. chats briefly with boom operator Tomoko Fukuda.

Our Director of Photography, Kyle Fisher, sets the camera.

A view of the monitor.

 

THE TEAM

Our core team comprises of a group of talented filmmakers actively working in the industry, in association with production company, Shatterglass Films. Members of the Shatterglass team is known for having worked on productions such as Revival (2019), Slice (2018), The Pooka (2017), and Consumed (2015), working with the likes of Chance the Rapper, Joe Keery, Tika Sumpter, Chris Sullivan & Zoe Lister-Jones.

Writer - Deja Harrell

Director - C.J. Thomas

Executive Producer - Iman Sharabash

Producers - Luke Boyce, Brett Hays

Co-Producers - Ashleigh Coartney, Jason Knade & Anthony Cabral

Associate Producers - Tyler Myles, Jeremy Marder

& More!

 

...& OUR CAST!

From left to right, our talented lovely ladies from Chicago, Kyra Jones (MAYA), Deja Harrell (JADE), Adia Alli (DANIELLE), Dionne Addai (BETH).

The amazingly talented SEEDS cast with our director, C.J. Thomas!

story:
Short Summary

Fran just got a new job. She's the newest hire at Friend inDeed, and she has no idea what she's about to get into. Each episode of Rent a Friend will follow Fran's adventures with a new client, like a newly-certified yoga instructor whose friends refuse to come to her first class, a lonely boi trying to adjust to a new city, and a team of LARPers who need a mercenary.

She'll be fine, as long as she avoids the three Fs of Friendship: No Flaking, No Fucking, No Freud.

 

The Team

Sophie's background is in graphics & editing. She studied animation at California College of the Arts and has since worked for some of New York's top post-production houses. When she's not cutting spots for web & TV, you can probably find her creating breathtaking illustrations. 

Emily's background is in performance and comedic writing. After attending a performing arts high school, she went on to study French literature because reading in English was too easy. She studied at UCB and has performed stand up, improv & sketch comedy all over New York City. In 2014 she wrote her own show, Slam Up, which had over 100 performances across the US & Canada. 

Our first collaboration together was a music video for Emily's performance project. We bonded over how much we each enjoy storytelling in our respective mediums. Since then, business and pleasure have merged and we are so excited to make the most out of a concept that can truly go anywhere.

 

What We Need & What You Get

Aside from the pilot episode attached to this campaign, we have written scripts for 3 episodes. The first two will be between 5 and 10 minutes. The third episode will likely be between 10 and 15 minutes long. Your donations will help us fund the filming and postproduction of our 3 episodes, and put us in a competitive place to find a distributor down the line.

  • Our goal of $30K will go towards paying for:
    • Actors & production crew 
    • Transportation costs, equipment, & costume rentals
    • Music production, mixing, & licensing
    • Potential luxuries like a producer and making sure everyone starts the day off with a bagel n schmea r
  • Contributions of all sizes will be recognized with perks! Perks include Rent a Friend stickers, beanies, signed storyboards, having a character named after you, tickets to the premiere, and producer credits!

Our first two episodes can be produced at a low cost, but the third will be a showstopper! (Think medieval costumes, battle scenes, & a large cast!)

 

Keep in mind: when we reach our goal of $30K, it will be reduced after taxes and fees​.

 

The Impact

I'm sure we've all been pleased by increased diversity in entertainment, but the voices of women, lqbtq, and POC are still underrepresented. We intend to create opportunities for people to share their voices and talents in a space that welcomes all folks and experiences.

We are firm believers in paying the people we work with, and your help will allow us to compensate our team with more than free drinks and the promise of brunch.

 

Risks & Challenges

There's always risk involved in film production. Sophie's experience in commercial postproduction and Emily's experience in DIY tour management and video production have made us all too aware that in any given project, things can go majorly wrong.

However, what we've both learned is that with meticulous planning in the preproduction phase, these surprises and accidents are less likely to occur.

Your donations will allow us to hire good, capable people for all production phases, have equipment that works, & deliver our show in a timely manner.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

We know that not everyone is able to donate $, but you can still contribute by helping us spread the word and by signing up for project updates!

  • Get the word out and make some noise about our campaign!
  • Sign up for emails, so you can see how we're doing down the line!

story:
Introduction

Unhinged is a five-episode web series being developed and filmed by students at Western Carolina University as apart of our Senior Thesis Showcase. The series follows a reporter and her camera man as she goes into the field to uncover the secrets behind a local cult. We are beyond excited to get this project off the ground, and our wonderful crew has been hard at work refining the scripts and preparing for production with an ambitious attitude. One of our most ambitious goals is to create this web series with the environmental impact in mind, something we are calling the Green Initiative. Along with these things comes the financial cost that will be required to bring this show to life the way we believe it should be. That’s where you come in! We are asking for donations to help us achieve our goals and create the best web series we possibly can.

The Crew

Logan Pitaccio – Showrunner

Logan Pitaccio is a senior at Western Carolina University. He’s an active writer, director, and editor in the Stage & Screen Program. He’s found mild success in all categories, having written five completed short films with two more in pre-production. He was awarded the Best Screenwriter award at the 2019 Controlled Chaos Film Festival for his short screenplay “The House That Clowns Built.” He is beyond excited for the opportunity to show-run and is confident that the audience will love what we have in store for them. He’s from Fayetteville, North Carolina.

Hailey Suzanne Smith – Producer/Production Designer

My name is Hailey Suzanne Smith and I am a third year filmmaking student at Western Carolina University. My concentrations as a filmmaker are in producing and production designing, both of which I am putting into practice with Unhinged. I am also passionate about environmentally-conscious producing and Unhinged will be my first green film project. I am unbelievably excited to be working on this show with such as amazing cast and crew!

Zach Field – Lead Director

Hello, my name is Zachary Field and I’m a student filmmaker here at Western Carolina University in his Senior year. I am the series director which means I’m in charge of keeping the episodes consistent in both look and feel by working hand in hand with the show runner, producers, and episode directors. I’m more than excited to have the opportunity to make this web series and to be able to work with such a strong team.

Ben Koziel – Director

Hi, my name is Ben Koziel and I am a Junior in Western Carolina University’s Film and Television Production program. I am an episode director for Unhinged as well as a member of the writer’s room. I am thrilled to be on a team with such talented members to create a series that I think is a real winner. If you like cults and comedy as much as me, this is the show for you. 

Isaac Dye – Director of Photography

Hi! My name is Isaac Dye and I am a third year film student here at WCU. As the Director of Photography, I will be working closely with the Showrunner, Director, and Production Designer to determine the specific visual style and overall look of the series. It will be my job to ensure that all artistic and technical decisions related to the image are executed successfully. I can't wait to begin production on this series and am more than excited to work with such a strong team!

The Story

Living with a cult for a week might not be everyone’s idea of a perfect vacation, but for Jennifer Wallace, it’s just another normal day on the job. Welcome to Unhinged, the Web Series where we follow investigative reporter Jennifer and her trusty camera-man, Steve Cobble, as they dive into the lives of a local cult and their beloved leader, Julian Caesar. Julian leads the Family Of Cardea, a small convent that dedicates their lives to the worship of Cardea, the Roman (and real) Goddess of door hinges. Jennifer and Steve document the cult on what they believe is their last week before The Unhinging, an apocalyptic event where Cardea will “unhinge” the door of reality and destroy all of creation. But is everything truly what it seems? Is Jennifer in over her head? That might just be for us to know and you to find out.

What We Need

We are asking for 2,000 dollars to help create this world. This will not cover everything, but it will help us get our most essential needs. We will use these funds to create costumes and props, feed our cast and crew, commit to our Green Initiative, build/decorate our sets, and pay our actors. All of these categories will greatly affect the quality of our final products, and as such, every single dollar counts.

The Green Initiative

The Green Initiative is an eco-friendly filmmaking initiative never before seen at Western Carolina University. In light of the more recent updates with climate change, the crew feels that it is imperative that we understand the environmental impacts of our industry and combat them as best we can as student filmmakers. With this initiative, several departments of the production team (writers and directors, camera team, sound team, and craft services) will be responsible for a different set of sustainable incentives that will carry throughout the preproduction and production processes.

Directors, writers, and producers of “Unhinged” are responsible for reducing as much paper as possible from the preproduction and production phases of the project. documents such as cast and crew contracts, location agreements, tech scouting checklists, script drafts, script breakdowns, and call sheets will be virtualized. Documents requiring signatures will be signed via an iPad and documents that need to be shared with multiple crew members or professors will be distributed electronically. The Director of Photography will be responsible for holding the camera and lighting teams accountable for drawing as little power from our shooting locations as possible through the use of LED lights and reusable batteries.

The sound department will be responsible for using reusable batteries to power the sound mixer and wireless microphones. They will also fill out sound reports virtually on a simultaneously editable document that will also be accessed by the 2nd AC to input camera notes, streamlining the editor’s creation of the assembly cut.

Lastly, the craft services department will be responsible for eliminating plastic water bottle use on set, providing biodegradable plates and cutlery for shooting days, setting up recycling stations on set, providing vegetarian and vegan snack selections for the cast and crew, and collecting trash that will be composted for the local community gardens. If possible, we would love to have a completely waste-free craft services.

Currently, we are a paperless production and are optimistically preparing for other initiatives that will be put into effect later. We are all happily working hard to find the coexistence between resourceful filmmaking and effective storytelling and with luck, moving forward.

Welcome to Unhinged, the Web Series where we follow investigative reporter Jennifer and her trusty camera-man, Steve Cobble, as they dive into the lives of a local cult and their beloved leader, Julian Caesar. Julian leads the Family Of Cardea, a small convent that dedicates their lives to the worship of Cardea, the Roman (and real) Goddess of door hinges. Jennifer and Steve document the cult on what they believe is their last week before The Unhinging, an apocalyptic event where Cardea will “unhinge” the door of reality and destroy all of creation. But is everything truly what it seems? Is Jennifer in over her head? That might just be for us to know and you to find out.
What We Need
We are asking for 2,000 dollars to help create this world. This will not cover everything, but it will help us get our most essential needs. We will use these funds to create costumes and props, feed our cast and crew, commit to our Green Initiative, build/decorate our sets, and pay our actors. All of these categories will greatly affect the quality of our final products, and as such, every single dollar counts.
The Green Initiative
The Green Initiative is an eco-friendly filmmaking initiative never before seen at Western Carolina University. In light of the more recent updates with climate change, the crew feels that it is imperative that we understand the environmental impacts of our industry and combat them as best we can as student filmmakers. With this initiative, several departments of the production team (writers and directors, camera team, sound team, and craft services) will be responsible for a different set of sustainable incentives that will carry throughout the preproduction and production processes.
Directors, writers, and producers of “Unhinged” are responsible for reducing as much paper as possible from the preproduction and production phases of the project. documents such as cast and crew contracts, location agreements, tech scouting checklists, script drafts, script breakdowns, and call sheets will be virtualized. Documents requiring signatures will be signed via an iPad and documents that need to be shared with multiple crew members or professors will be distributed electronically. The Director of Photography will be responsible for holding the camera and lighting teams accountable for drawing as little power from our shooting locations as possible through the use of LED lights and reusable batteries.
The sound department will be responsible for using reusable batteries to power the sound mixer and wireless microphones. They will also fill out sound reports virtually on a simultaneously editable document that will also be accessed by the 2nd AC to input camera notes, streamlining the editor’s creation of the assembly cut.
Lastly, the craft services department will be responsible for eliminating plastic water bottle use on set, providing biodegradable plates and cutlery for shooting days, setting up recycling stations on set, providing vegetarian and vegan snack selections for the cast and crew, and collecting trash that will be composted for the local community gardens. If possible, we would love to have a completely waste-free craft services.
Currently, we are a paperless production and are optimistically preparing for other initiatives that will be put into effect later. We are all happily working hard to find the coexistence between resourceful filmmaking and effective storytelling and with luck, moving forward.

story:
Hey Pals!
We're the team behind the awesome web series Pal Points and we're so excited to tell you all about our vision and hope for Season 2!

 

What is "Pal Points"?

This wonderful world centers around Jake Bo, a goofy, immature high school dropout and Spencer Jones, a determined, level-headed aspiring city mayor. The two estranged friends reunite due to friendship coupons from their childhood called "Pal Points". These "Pal Points" grant Jake three favors from Spencer, no questions asked. Jake recruits Spencer's help to get his life back on track, one "Pal Point" at a time.

In the summer of 2017 we personally funded, wrote, and filmed Season 1.  We had an amazing ride and decided to showcase the series premiere at a local cinema in our community. Not only did we receive amazing feedback from our viewers on YouTube, but our community was absolutely thrilled and anxious for season 2.

Why we need more Pals:

So...we chatted and decided why not do a season 2? We loved creating season 1, but this year we have a bigger vision, a bigger cast, and a bigger following... which requires a bigger budget.

Our cast and team consist of artists and creatives in high school, college or recently graduated-and...our parents-low budget actors with quality talent you know? ;)

That being said we only had so much to work with, in regards to funding our first season...but with creativity comes risk and that's why we've decided to come to you with our question...would you be a pal and help us make our vision come alive?

What We Need & What You Get

Our goal is to raise $3,000 for the Season 2 production costs.

Production Costs:

  • Premiere at Picture Show Cinema
  • Care of our crew and actors ( food, water etc. )
  • Advertising
  • Prize Expenses
  • Location Fees, Set Fees, Camera Fees

Of course we wanna be a pal to you and make sure we repay you somehow- there will be perks and prizes for your contributions.

Why Pal Points?

We strongly believe in this series and the joy it spreads to families, pals, and strangers! We created this show with the intent to just bring the simplicity of laughter to our viewer. All in all, we love creating, we love to laugh and we love our friends; our goal is to bring all those parts of our lives to a screen, with excellence. So, if you're looking to invest in good friendships, laughter and a show that could frankly be something amazing....you've come to the right place.

Other Ways You Can Help

Now we know that not all can give financially but there's always some way to be a pal:

Watch Season 1 and let us know what you think! We love to hear from you.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=C_38xSuHfFY&list=PL53g4cUmbfrkOwI17x7uiNv3MPczSeuGT

Share our vision with your Pals- use the Indiegogo share tools and look forward to season 2!

story:
Short Summary

Hello everyone, and thank you for checking out this Indiegogo campaign. 

We're now raising money for the second episode of our web-series "Spad's Hollow" 

What We Need & What You Get

The money we raise on indiegogo will be used to help pay our cast and crew aswell as rent equipment for our shoot. 

We worked hard to assemble a rock-solid cast of actors that will help bring to life these characters that we took so much time devoloping. We need your help to make sure these talented men and women are appropriately compensated for thier hard work on set.   

 

Cast

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

Share our indiegogo campaign on social media.

Purchase our comics on Amazon or our T-Shirts on our Teespring store.                            Comic: https://www.amazon.com/Spads-Hollow-Cataclysmic...           Teespring:  https://teespring.com/stores/spads-hollow

Donate monthly to our patreon: https://www.patreon.com/SpadsHollow

story:
Hello! We are Kaitlyn Krieg and Nicole Lee, creators and writers of a web series about two LGBTQIA women - Kait and Nic. One of the things that frustrates us as consumers of contemporary film and television is a persistent lack of diversity, an absence of people who look and feel like us. While diversity and positive representation of LGBTQIA have improved on screen, there is still progress to be made. 

 

The creation of Kait & Nic is our contribution to improving diversity and positive representation. Kait and Nic are three dimensional characters. Kait battles depression and anxiety while Nic faces racial prejudice. While Kait is introverted, Nic is extroverted. They struggle, dream, and persevere. They are people like you. 

 

We are both trained in improv comedy, but we are not professional comedians, writers, or actors. This is our first project together and we are looking for your help to finance and bring it to fruition. All funds raised will be used to pay for the work of our crew (our DOP (director of photography), sound, lighting, editing, makeup), principal cast, and catering. Filming is scheduled for March, 2018 and we are excited to offer some fun perks to help thank you for your support. 

 

We are committed to diversity, and casting it in all of its facets. Our cast will be predominantly female, LGBTQIA, and people of color. We will also cast for diversity of age and body type. In supporting Kait & Nic, you will be supporting diversity and its representation in media.

 

Thank for your consideration.

story:
Con Man - Teaser. Enjoy!
















Wray Nerely (Alan Tudyk-Me!) was a co-star on Spectrum, a sci-fi series which was canceled -Too Soon- yet became a cult classic. Wray’s good friend, Jack Moore (Nathan Fillion) starred in the series and has gone on to become a major movie star. While Jack enjoys the life of an A-lister, Wray tours the sci-fi circuit as a guest of conventions, comic book stores, and lots of pop culture events.  The show will feature all the weird and crazy things that happen to Wray along the way to these events.

The series is a light-hearted take on the personalities, luminaries, and characters in the sci­fi community we are privileged to call ourselves members. Con Man is a way to share some of the surreal occurrences we have had, while telling the story of a guy learning to love and embrace his fans.

I wanted to make a show that featured all of my favorite convention artists and friends together. Not only that, I wanted to celebrate the world where heroes, villains, zombie hunters, and space pirates all overlap. I especially wanted to work with my friend Nathan Fillion again.

We are seeking funding for the first three episodes of the series. So why are we here on Indiegogo and not debuting this on a more traditional network or outlet? 

The convention world is unique and not easily understood from the outside. To tell this story right, you need to have first hand experience. Although, to tell this story for more than cable access production values you need a partner. In show business, a network/studio could add plenty to the business of Con Man, but at the expense of the show. Complications such as dictating what guests we may have, changing the tone of the show, going into production freezes, having a delayed release, or forcing the show to only be described by a tagline like “Extras meets Galaxy Quest,” ­ though we will admit that is sort of an on the nose description.

The most important reason to use Indiegogo is that we have genuinely passionate, stalwart and powerful fans. We’ve even seen fans get movies made. We realized pretty quickly we ought to cut out the middle management and just get you involved as soon as possible. We’ll have more fun having you on board this early in the process, and we know you’d love to see what we’re up to along the way. Not to mention, sci-fi conventions wouldn’t exist without you. You built this world but you’ve only seen one half of it. You know the carnival, let us introduce you to the carnies.

I would like to direct your attention to the giant wall of rewards to the right with dollar amounts attached. The rewards are great, but more than that, every dollar you spend goes to creating the world of Con Man.

Want examples? $5? You just bought some sharpies for signing. $10? You bought fruit for the fruit basket that gets stolen from Wray in episode 2. $100? You just bought the furry costume head of a Vardak Warrior worn by  Nigel Thrice, the "second best motion capture artist." $1000? You just rented Nathan’s character some skis and bought the fake snow that will stick to his wavy locks.

If you can’t support us with dollars then your enthusiasm and support is equally valuable - tweet, Facebook, tumblr, Linkedin, Mypace, Friendster, and ICQ the project as much as you can. Don’t be afraid to use morse code or smoke signals. Talk about it with friends and associates at work, comic shops, dog parks, and all secret or not-so-secret gatherings. Spreading the word about the campaign is just as important! We’re so thankful for any support you can offer during our campaign.

The number may seem like a lot for initial three episodes, but the production costs are high and the series is demanding. This isn’t a living room sitcom; we need to put on a fake convention. Or two. We also need to build a spaceship. It’s a big cast and our friends from the sci-fi community will be joining us. That means at LEAST paying SAG minimums or they wouldn’t be allowed to show.


Rewards! Loot! Plunder! Booty! Treasure! I should probably tell you about them as we’ve teamed up with some amazing people who also love the idea of Con Man. In their amazingness they are helping bring Con Man and exclusive offers to you our amazing fans who are likely to be amazed.

Instead of just a standard backer blog where we post updates and a few still photos, we’ve teamed up with HANG W/ to provide live (and archived) on-set and behind the scenes content to applicable backers. Some contributors will even get to sit in on exclusive or private Hang W/ times with myself or Nathan.

Hang w/ allows myself and Nathan, producer PJ Haarsma, and the cast and crew of Con Man to share exclusive behind the scenes experiences - LIVE from our phones to yours! You even get to chat LIVE with us right through the app. We'll also archive these so you can catch up an anything you missed! 

While doing blog posts are great, we really love the idea of being able to share stuff on a schedule or off the cuff with fans, rather than waiting till something has happened and typing up a post and editing photos. 

You can get started now - download the app to your iPhone, iPad or Android Device and follow AlanTudyk, NathanFillion, PJHaarsma and ConMan.

Secondly - Thanks to Indiegogo's partnership with Vimeo, we're able to offer the episodes in hi-def streaming to funders who pledge $25+! Not only will you get early access to the episodes before the public, you'll also get to stream them as much as you want for 90 Days. The series will feature English Closed Captioning and subtitles in additional languages as voted on by you, the funders!That's all the episodes, whether we produce 3 episodes or 3,000*!

*=Or Twelve.

As for the physical rewards, we’ve got a mix of Con Man and SPECTRUM rewards. Spectrum is the space show within-the-show. We have some one time posters and  memorabilia that won’t be available outside the campaign. Some of them are even signed by Jack Moore and Wray Nerely, whose signatures look surprisingly similar to Nathan’s and mine.






We’re excited to make this series, and have a lot planned. But, ultimately Nathan and I just wanted to say thank you. Your support is the inspiration behind this story we want to tell.  Like most things in the convention world, it wouldn’t exist without you. Thank you.

Frequently Asked Questions!

Q:  When do I get my Perk?

A:  Each Perk has an Estimated Delivery month listed in description. You will be notified of any delays.

Q: Can I upgrade to another Perk?

A: Unfortunately, Indiegogo does not have a built in function for this. However, if you do want to upgrade to a higher perk level, we recommend that you simply donate the difference between your original payment and your desired new Perk level. Be sure to contact George Rohac via the contact user button on his profile -https://www.indiegogo.com/individuals/10023076 so we can update your record.

Q: What if I forgot to add shipping for my Canadian or International order?

A: Similar to the procedure for Perk upgrades, we recommend that you make a separate payment to account for the missing shipping charges. Be sure to contact George Rohac via the contact user button on his profile so we can update your record. For US Funders no additional amount is needed, we factored that into the base perk amount. 

Q: I don’t see the update on my Indiegogo contribution profile after you confirmed my upgrade?

A: Unfortunately Indiegogo doesn’t allow us to update information for you or us, we’re tracking this separately and will make sure you get your proper perks and items, thanks!

Q:  Will any Perks go out before the Campaign is completed?

A:  Only the Hang W/ Con Man Private access codes.

Q:  Speaking of Hang W/ Con Man Private access codes I haven’t gotten mine yet!

A:  Hang W/ has had such an overwhelming response with the Con Man Fans that they are feverishly working to get them all emailed out.  Do check your Spam, and if not there then email Hang W/ and request your access code at:  Feedback@hangwith.com

Q:  Who gets Hang W/ access codes?

A:  Any Funder @ $15 and up get private Con Man Hang W/ access & $250 and up for private Hang W/ Alan and/or Nathan.

Q:  How do I tell you what T-Shirt size I need?

A:  When the campaign comes to an end we will send you an email inquiring of the cut & size you want that you can reply to.

Q:  What are you guys going to do with all this money?

A:  There is a pie chart on the main page that illustrates where the dollars are divided into. And, each Stretch Goal past the original goal ($425,000 = 3 Episodes) adds another Episode.

Q: When is the series taping, I want to know if I can be a headliner?

The series is taping over the majority of this June in the Los Angeles, CA area. We want to make clear to everyone contributing to be a background character that you will be required to sign a waiver to be a background character in the series. That sounds weird, but we have to follow the law and do it for insurance purposes and to even be legally allowed to show it anywhere. We couldn't put you in it if you don't sign off! You'll get these forms the day you visit the set.

Q: Are there any considerations I need to know about for the Mogul tier?

Yes, for that perk in particular you must agree to the following terms:

It is valid for YOU + 1. 

It will be somewhere in Los Angeles, CA. 

The event will be in a public group setting.

To be scheduled at a mutually agreed upon date.

A meal is part of the event.

The meal cost is included.

Alcoholic beverages are included.

Gratuity is included.

You may take photos.

You can bring something small to be signed.

The signed item should not be resold or re-auctioned.

Travel and accommodations are included.

We expect all winning bidders and their guests to conduct themselves appropriately when attending an experience. Polite manners and respect for the generous donor and adherence to any rules or parameters are a must. Any behavior deemed inappropriate by celebrity, or representative, warrants immediate dismissal from said event.

DVD/Blu-ray Specific FAQs

Q: Will the discs be region locked?

A: No! We're going to make them region free so you can play them no matter where you are. 

Q: I got the Volunteer level, can I switch to the AV-Tech? 

A: The AV-TECH perk does NOT include streaming, so if you really want to swap your contribution you can, but it means you will not receive codes to stream the series when it is released online. You will have to wait till you the discs are sent out at the end of the year. If you still want to change contact George Rohac via the "Contact User" button and tell him you want to swap your perk over.

Q: I'm at Super Fan/Talent Wrangler/or Higher how do I get a disc copy?

A: When the campaign closes we'll send out surveys to get information about your perk choices including whether you want a Blu-ray or DVD. At the end of the year we'll send the disc versions out. 

Q: I got a Volunteer perk but I also want a disc what do I do?

A: Just select the AV-TECH perk and contribute OR you can contribute the difference to upgrade to a SUPER FAN perk level and contact George Rohac via the "Contact User" button and tell him you want to upgrade. 

Q: I backed at Bodyguard/Cosplayer but I want to get AV-Tech and I live in Canada/Outside the US, do I have to pay the extra shipping?

A: Yes. Since we're shipping the discs at the end of the year we'll be sending out two shipments, so we need to make sure we can cover shipping costs to get everyone their perks and as much goes into the production of the show as possible. No additional shipping is due at the Super Fan or above perk levels as a thanks for contributing so much to the campaign.

However, if you do want to upgrade to a higher perk level, we recommend that you simply donate the difference between your original payment and your desired new Perk level. Be sure to contact George Rohac via the contact user button on his profile -https://www.indiegogo.com/individuals/10023076 so we can update your record.
Q: What if I forgot to add shipping for my Canadian or International order?
A: Similar to the procedure for Perk upgrades, we recommend that you make a separate payment to account for the missing shipping charges. Be sure to contact George Rohac via the contact user button on his profile so we can update your record. For US Funders no additional amount is needed, we factored that into the base perk amount. 
Q: I don’t see the update on my Indiegogo contribution profile after you confirmed my upgrade?
A: Unfortunately Indiegogo doesn’t allow us to update information for you or us, we’re tracking this separately and will make sure you get your proper perks and items, thanks!
Q:  Will any Perks go out before the Campaign is completed?
A:  Only the Hang W/ Con Man Private access codes.
Q:  Speaking of Hang W/ Con Man Private access codes I haven’t gotten mine yet!
A:  Hang W/ has had such an overwhelming response with the Con Man Fans that they are feverishly working to get them all emailed out.  Do check your Spam, and if not there then email Hang W/ and request your access code at:  Feedback@hangwith.com
Q:  Who gets Hang W/ access codes?
A:  Any Funder @ $15 and up get private Con Man Hang W/ access & $250 and up for private Hang W/ Alan and/or Nathan.
Q:  How do I tell you what T-Shirt size I need?
A:  When the campaign comes to an end we will send you an email inquiring of the cut & size you want that you can reply to.
Q:  What are you guys going to do with all this money?A:  There is a pie chart on the main page that illustrates where the dollars are divided into. And, each Stretch Goal past the original goal ($425,000 = 3 Episodes) adds another Episode.

Q: When is the series taping, I want to know if I can be a headliner?
The series is taping over the majority of this June in the Los Angeles, CA area. We want to make clear to everyone contributing to be a background character that you will be required to sign a waiver to be a background character in the series. That sounds weird, but we have to follow the law and do it for insurance purposes and to even be legally allowed to show it anywhere. We couldn't put you in it if you don't sign off! You'll get these forms the day you visit the set.
Q: Are there any considerations I need to know about for the Mogul tier?
Yes, for that perk in particular you must agree to the following terms:
It is valid for YOU + 1. 
It will be somewhere in Los Angeles, CA. 
The event will be in a public group setting.
To be scheduled at a mutually agreed upon date.
A meal is part of the event.
The meal cost is included.
Alcoholic beverages are included.
Gratuity is included.
You may take photos.
You can bring something small to be signed.
The signed item should not be resold or re-auctioned.
Travel and accommodations are included.
We expect all winning bidders and their guests to conduct themselves appropriately when attending an experience. Polite manners and respect for the generous donor and adherence to any rules or parameters are a must. Any behavior deemed inappropriate by celebrity, or representative, warrants immediate dismissal from said event.
DVD/Blu-ray Specific FAQs

Q: Will the discs be region locked?
A: No! We're going to make them region free so you can play them no matter where you are. 
Q: I got the Volunteer level, can I switch to the AV-Tech? 
A: The AV-TECH perk does NOT include streaming, so if you really want to swap your contribution you can, but it means you will not receive codes to stream the series when it is released online. You will have to wait till you the discs are sent out at the end of the year. If you still want to change contact George Rohac via the "Contact User" button and tell him you want to swap your perk over.
Q: I'm at Super Fan/Talent Wrangler/or Higher how do I get a disc copy?
A: When the campaign closes we'll send out surveys to get information about your perk choices including whether you want a Blu-ray or DVD. At the end of the year we'll send the disc versions out. 
Q: I got a Volunteer perk but I also want a disc what do I do?
A: Just select the AV-TECH perk and contribute OR you can contribute the difference to upgrade to a SUPER FAN perk level and contact George Rohac via the "Contact User" button and tell him you want to upgrade. 
Q: I backed at Bodyguard/Cosplayer but I want to get AV-Tech and I live in Canada/Outside the US, do I have to pay the extra shipping?
A: Yes. Since we're shipping the discs at the end of the year we'll be sending out two shipments, so we need to make sure we can cover shipping costs to get everyone their perks and as much goes into the production of the show as possible. No additional shipping is due at the Super Fan or above perk levels as a thanks for contributing so much to the campaign.

story:
Overview

In a world of political tension, social distortion and cultural clashing, we tend to ignore the hard-learned lessons of our past. Unfortunately, this means we are doomed to repeat the same awful mistakes again and again like a skipping record. Unless we do something--fast.

Politically Motivated is a free to view web series with a satirical look at American history through sketch comedy scenes.

We look at history and the unknown parts as well as the more well-known historical events. Our goal is to explain and educate without alienating political preferences and at the same time shattering the notions that we have a perfect and spotless history. Simultaneously encouraging self-sufficient research on important subjects.

 

Our Campaign

We are Glass Iris Studios, an Indie Production company that was founded in 2016. Our studio has worked alongside doughnut shops, neighborhood sports teams, local non-profits and we have marched for Science and equality. We have created several short films using local actors and crew from the Pacific Northwest. This project will be our first complete web series. 

 

  • Your contribution keeps this series alive and well. Because of you, the world will learn legal definitions and social impacts in a comedic way without political lampooning and debasing the "other party"
  • Your contribution will ensure that our talent and production receive the compensation they deserve and that our wardrobe and props keep the production value at its highest. 

 

A little bit goes a long way. Even if we are unable to reach our goal of $15,000, your contribution will go towards making our series the best it can be!

 

Crowd-source incentives

The success of this series wouldn’t be possible without you. Here is a breakdown of what we will give back

  • For the People! - $5 - Good Karma
  • Live free or die! $50 - A personal thank you email & credit
  • Honorable Mention package $250 – credited at the end of the episode, swag bag & a digital copy of the series. 
  • Guest Star package $500 –  Credit, Swag bag, a signed poster & signed box set of season 1 on DVD.
  • Producer Credit Package $1,000 – Swag bag, Special Credit as Producer, Signed DVD set, 11x17 movie poster, Personalized production book with the pilot script.
  • Founding Member Package $5,000 – Wow! To thank you for going above and beyond to help us out you will receive all of the aforementioned prizes alongside a hand-made metal coin with Your Name, a specific serial number, and our logo. smelted from Tin and molded by hand in our own backyard!

Meet the Cast and Crew

 

Lauren Scoville - Producer & Financial Manager 

(Photo credit: Sid Santiano)

Lauren is the Glass Iris Financial Manager and executive producer. She is trained in classical music, stage theater, acting, and has many other extraordinary talents. She is currently leading the team to success! 

"There’s a drive within that I draw from in all I do for, self-expression & the creative process, that I can not let be" 

 

Janejira Damron - Art Director 

(Headshot by Katanya Warwick) 

My name is Janejira Damron. I am an artist, author, and a cosplayer. I recently graduated from the Seattle Film Institute and joined Team Glass Iris as their social media manager. My true passion is costuming. I was blessed with the opportunity to work on some of the costumes in this series. Being required to sew something beautiful is a dream come true for me.

 

Matthew P. Johnson - Writer, Director

 

(Photocredit: Sid Santiano) 

Matthew is a writer and director who is overly passionate about politics, history and their effects on our world. His sketches are heavily researched, translated and constructed into relatable situations that encourage the viewer to open a book or watch a video to learn more.

 

All About That Deficit

 

Production Needs 40%

  • Printing- 
  • Props-
  • Historically accurate costumes-
  • Research-
  • Location & legal fees- 
  • Craft Services for the hardworking Cast and Crew! 

Staff Needs 60% 

  • Talent costs
  • Crew Payment
  • Editor salary

What Are We Contributing?

  • All Needed Filming equipment
  • Time
  • Expertise
  • Passion for historical accuracy

The Reason YOU SHOULD DONATE is so we Americans don't get stuck in the same god awful situation we are trapped in today.

 

Follow us on social media and share this campaign! You might not be able to donate but perhaps someone else is.

Twitter: @GlassIrisFilms

Facebook: @PoliticallyMotivatedShow

Instagram: @GlassIrisStudio

story:
There is a lot here, so be sure to read til the end!

Overview

The Blu ray is a TWO DISC, 50 gig each, set inside Digi-pack packaging to match our previous DVD release packaging. The Blu-ray is packed to the brim with as much content as our previous DVDs,  and will play on any and all blu-ray players, and is region free!

What is in this set:

  • An all new 1080 high Definition transfer of Each Episode and mini-chode of season 4
  • New extended edits of each episode with added footage not seen on youtube.
  • Audio commentary from the crew and special guests on each episode.
  • An exclusive documentary on the events of season 4.
  • Exclusive: QUEST FOR THE CHEST
  • Exclusive: Over an hour of never before seen outtakes edited together like one long episode.
  • Exclusive:  A choose your own adventure, virtual game chasing game. Even bigger than before!
  • Exclusive:  Dodongo tries to beat Mega Bug for the first time since a kid. His long awaited chance at redemption has arrived. 
  • Exclusive: The return of Dodongo's Den. 
  • Exclusive: A look back at our favorite finds of the season
  • And of course, interactive menus and animations!
  • Exclusive: never before seen animations from the canceled 5th cartoon 

 

 

What is the Limited DIGI-BOOK?

Well...it's a cross between our Standard Blu-Ray set and...a BOOK. The disc content is the exact same, but the packaging is what sets this set apart. It has within the set a 20 page book attached to the packaging. The pages within the book will contain:

    • YOUR NAMES! Anyone who pre-orders this Digi-book will have their name printed within the pages in the list of contributors! 
    • A handwritten personalized "thank you" and note from one of the member of the crew. Might be Jay, Melvor, Billy, or even Dodongo..(there is no telling what we will say ). Each note will be specifically written for YOU in your specific copy of the Digi-book. So each Digi-Book will be unique. 
    • Art work from the episodes of season 4
    • Stories and quotes from the crew
    • special, exclusive, secret pics....just for you
    • A old style hand drawn map of our season 4 travels (if space is available) 

     

    This digi-book is ONLY available here and will NEVER be printed again. Ever!

    Why does the Digi-Book cost $75 dollars?

    Yes the digi-book is quite a bit more than the standard packaging. Is this what we would want to sell it for if we had a choice? NO, but our hands are tied do to the extreme costs of manufacturing these in such small numbers. For those who don't know, when you get something manufactured (in this case a Digi-book) the more you order the lower the cost will be per unit. In other words, if we had 2,000 of these made the costs to get them made would be way cheaper, and we could charge 30-40 instead. But unfortunately we are not Sony or a big company that can just go get thousands made and sell them much cheaper, we are just a couple of chodes. Therefore these will cost us about 50-60 bucks each to get made since we are only going to get 100-200 made. (maybe even less). If we make more than 200 our costs will go down some and we do something special for everyone who purchased one as a thank you. Our profit margin will be about the same on this as the regular set, we just wanted to give some of our fans an option for something special. 

    UPDATE

    We hit the 200+ sold threshold on the digi-books, making the manufacturing costs a little cheaper,  which means the books will now increase from 12 pages to 20!

     

     

    Now for the fun part

    Introducing 

    WATCH the video in this link below!

     

     

    The Epic Game Chaser Blu-Ray, Quest

    for the Chest! 

    What is this???? Inspired by Swordquest on the Atari 2600, we have decided to take physical media to the next level. By getting a Blu-ray (any version), you will have a chance to win real life prizes! Each Blu-ray will have clues hidden throughout the menu systems. These clues will lead you to a puzzle on the Blu-ray. Be one of the finalists to solve the puzzle and you win! The Grand Prize going to the first to solve it will be the Epic Game Chasers Chest of Destiny. You will also be featured in a video on the youtube channel. The contest will start about a month after the release of the Blu-ray in order to make sure everyone gets their copy and can start solving it! It wont be easy!

    The First place winner will get:

    • The Game Chasers Chest of Destiny, full of Epic prizes that will aid you not only in your game chasing adventures, but life as well. We can't spill the beans about what's in it, we want to see your surprise! 
    • One item in the chest will be the Game Chasers SWORD of Destiny.. A powerful jewel encrusted sword you can mount on your wall, or slay evil resellers with. The choice is yours.
    • Record yourself opening your prize and we will feature you in a video on the Game Chasers Youtube channel!
    • A small poster sized version of the season 4 Blu Ray cover signed by the crew.

    The 2nd through 5th place winners will get:

    • Not the CHEST, however you will get a smaller and slightly less epic care package!
    • A small poster sized version of the season 4 Blu Ray cover signed by the crew.

    The 5th through 10th place winners will get:

    • A small poster sized version of the season 4 Blu Ray cover signed by the crew.

    ANYONE EVERYWHERE can enter! Details on how and when to submit your answers will be mailed with your Blu-ray order. 

     

    Well this is the story so far. More things will be added in the coming weeks I'm sure.

    We just want to thhank you for taking the time to look at this page, and your continuted support. Even if you cant get a set  you can still help us by getting this out and sharing the heck out of it. 

     

    Thank you, and may the force be with you.

The 2nd through 5th place winners will get:
Not the CHEST, however you will get a smaller and slightly less epic care package!
A small poster sized version of the season 4 Blu Ray cover signed by the crew.
