story:
Summary

My name is John "Oz" Layne. 

I'm no Chef but I am known for Educating people about Health through Food and so much more.  I LOVE seeing people get healthy while enjoying the Foods they love. 

This Show is important to me because I know that you can be healed through food and that there are a very large number of Urban Chefs, Restaurants, and Farms that help people to do that.   The Chefs and Owners of these establishments usually do not receive the attention and recognition of the Food Community as a whole.

Your Contribution will help those who LOVE to watch Food Shows but don't receive the knowledge they need to become healthy beings, get, through entertainment, the education so badly needed.

 

What We Need & What You Get

To shoot this show, we need $6,400.  The funds are to pay for a Video Transmitter which is used for the Director to see the shots as they occur.  That costs approximately $1200.00.  We also need to cover the cost of travel (Local) for the crew.  This is for Fuel.  We also have to feed the Crew.  Everyone has Volunteered for this project due to its' impact potential and I personally cannot allow them to put in so much work without pay AND Food. 

We Appreciate your support immensely!  We want to Thank You by offering the following:

  • Support of $50 - $100 will receive their name in the credits of the show and a Listing on our Website as a Supporter.
  • Support of $101 - $500 will receive the above PLUS the opportunity to be on an Episode as a Featured Patron (restaurant or farm of their choosing from our list of Featured Guests).
  • Support of $501 - $1000 will get both of the above but with the choice of 2 Episodes AND  a Great Urban Eats™ T-Shirt.
  • Support of $1000+ will receive all of the above PLUS a Guest  Co-Host Spot on an Episode.  If we do not reach our goal, the received funds will be distributed as such; 1st - Towards the Transmitter we need to shoot the show.  2nd - Towards Feeding the Crew. And 3rd - Towards travel expenses for the Crew.

The Impact

As we've stated previously, this show is a Game Changer!  So many people will finally have an outlet that not only Entertains them but also Educates them on the importance and relativity of Food in their lives.  From this, they will be able to make healthy decisions on Food choices while celebrating the Amazing People who bring it to them.

I'm sure you, somewhere along your life's journey, have watched the various Food Shows and said something like "that's a heart attack on a bun" or "Looks good!  I want that!!".  this show will serve to satisfy those needs while saying, "Here is an alternative to what you just saw if you have, for example, Diabetes, High Blood Pressure, Food Allergies, etc.".

Risks & Challenges

The only potential hurdles that we foresee with this project is getting a major distributor to buy in.  However, due to our Team of Producers and Executive Producers, we actually have the contacts within who are connected to these Majors and therefore, have a much higher rate of success potential than the average Producer of a Television Project.  

We will utilize these connections (some of who have already been securely briefed) to our advantage.  In fact, all that we need to do is shoot it and present it.  We strongly believe we have a greater than 80% chance of being green lighted. 

Other Ways You Can Help

So Friends, we know that Everyone cannot help Financially.  We get it.  

Therefore, we humbly ask, if you cannot make a financial contribution, do us a HUGE Favor, share this with someone.  Heck, share it with EVERYONE!  Your Friends, Family, Social Media, etc.  IndieGoGo has SHARE Tools that you can use.  You will find them on this page.

We Thank You for considering us.  We look forward to possibly meeting and Featuring You!

Thank you,

The Great Urban Eats™ Team

I'm sure you, somewhere along your life's journey, have watched the various Food Shows and said something like "that's a heart attack on a bun" or "Looks good!  I want that!!".  this show will serve to satisfy those needs while saying, "Here is an alternative to what you just saw if you have, for example, Diabetes, High Blood Pressure, Food Allergies, etc.".

Risks & Challenges
The only potential hurdles that we foresee with this project is getting a major distributor to buy in.  However, due to our Team of Producers and Executive Producers, we actually have the contacts within who are connected to these Majors and therefore, have a much higher rate of success potential than the average Producer of a Television Project.  
We will utilize these connections (some of who have already been securely briefed) to our advantage.  In fact, all that we need to do is shoot it and present it.  We strongly believe we have a greater than 80% chance of being green lighted. 

Other Ways You Can Help
So Friends, we know that Everyone cannot help Financially.  We get it.  
Therefore, we humbly ask, if you cannot make a financial contribution, do us a HUGE Favor, share this with someone.  Heck, share it with EVERYONE!  Your Friends, Family, Social Media, etc.  IndieGoGo has SHARE Tools that you can use.  You will find them on this page.
We Thank You for considering us.  We look forward to possibly meeting and Featuring You!
Thank you,
The Great Urban Eats™ Team

story:
The 'boonies' Mission

We need to help our community grow with intention by inspiring people to start their own cool business and help the economy thrive. By spotlighting some of the many individuals who have put down roots here and started the kinds of businesses that make our town the thriving community it is today, we hope to be part of the effort to attract more unique, sustainably-minded, and forward-thinking entrepreneurs to the area. The ‘boonies’ series will illuminate the very best of our town and region, and we believe it can play a role in helping the area chart a positive and enduring course for the future.

 

About the Project

The purpose of this campaign is to raise enough money to produce a five minute episode of 'boonies.' Each episode will focus on a business owner or entrepreneur in the area while also featuring other businesses and landmarks around the High Country.

We hope to produce six episodes for the first season. So far we only have the funding to produce three. That's why we NEED your help!! Each episode costs at least $12k to produce, but if we reach our goal please don't stop donating! The more money we raise the more episodes of 'boonies' we can produce.

If the campaign is successful and we're able to complete the first season of 'boonies,' we'll put it online for viewers to stream for free. We've also had interest from UNC-TV (North Carolina's Public Television station), so television broadcast is a possibility for the future. But we can't make that happen without your continued support!

 

The Trailer

 

 

Meet the Team

Selena Lauterer, Executive Producer

Selena has worked in public media for 20 years and is the founder and president of Artemis Independent, a media promotions company located in Boone, North Carolina. Her public television credits include Co-Producer of the Emmy and Peabody Award-winning PBS series A Chef’s Life, and Executive Producer of A Craftsman’s Legacy. Her company manages promotion efforts for over a dozen public television favorites each year, including Roadtrip Nation, Reel South, Pearl Jam 20, Tony Bennett Duets II, and more. She’s also a true boonie and an 8th generation Appalachian!

 

Kelly Davis, Director

Kelly teaches video production at Appalachian State University and has worked in public television production for 15 years. He earned his Master’s Degree in documentary film from UC Berkeley, a PhD in Mass Communication from UNC Chapel Hill, and has recently acquired tenure at ASU.  His major credits include such series as History Detectives, The New Heroes, Bridging World History, and A Craftsman’s Legacy.

 

What We Need & What You Get

It takes $12k to produce each episode of ‘boonies.’ To produce all six episodes for the first season we'll need $72k. So far we've raised $25k (The Watauga Economic Development Commission has contributed $20k and First Security Insurance has contributed $5k) but the rest is coming straight from our pocket, which is why we need this campaign to be successful!

Our budget goes toward costs for crew, video equipment, travel, food, supplies, post production and promotion. Our budget is based on public television day rates for the crew & expenses which means we are economical and fair — and about half of what commercial outfits charge. 

The Impact

We need to help our community grow with intention by inspiring similar people to start their own cool business and help the economy thrive. *The Appalachian region has some of the most poverty stricken counties in the country. 40% of Watauga County school children receive free/reduced lunches. We can help fix this with robust and mindful industry!

 

Perks!

Now to tell you about some of our very special perks. Several businesses around town have been generous enough to donate perks to our campaign. We want to thank them all again for their continued support and for demonstrating what 'boonies' is all about!

For a donation of $500 our friends from Startup High Country will give you business advice based on your specific needs! They'll have two one-hour meetings with you, the first an initial discovery session and the second with an expert to go over your specific needs. The mission of Startup High Country is to create more high-tech & high-paying jobs in the High Country. 

For $1,000 you'll receive a night at the new Horton Hotel located in historic downtown Boone. The Horton is currently under construction but projected to open in Fall 2018. It'll be Boone’s first boutique hotel, complete with a rooftop lounge with breathtaking views of downtown, Appalachian State University’s campus, and surrounding mountains. You’ll also get two tickets for a Pubcycle tour (we've done it and trust us, you'll have a great time!) and dinner on us.

Check out our other great perks to the right!   :)

 

Other Ways You Can Help

We understand that not everyone can make a donation, but there are other ways you can show your support!

  • Like our Facebook page
  • Follow us on Instagram 
  • Talk about us! The more people hear about us, the better chance we have of making this project happen.

story:
Welcome to the fundraising campaign for Plot Device, a TV pilot produced by Perfectly Adequate Films.

Plot Device Synopsis 

Andy is down in the dumps. He’s unemployed, recovering from a family tragedy, and struggling to save his marriage. His life is turned upside-down when a mysterious button with the power to bend reality unexpectedly arrives at his doorstep.

With every press of the button, Andy finds zany characters, classic story tropes, and wild adventure thrust into his formerly underwhelming life. Helped by his excitable friend Preston, and estranged wife Charlotte, he soon discovers bigger things are afoot, and the three must work to uncover the button’s many secrets.

 

 

About Us

Perfectly Adequate Films is a media production company founded by Erinn Nelson and William Douglas Turner. Both aspiring actors and writers, the two met working the same job in NYC, and quickly developed a habit of pitching each other silly story premises and movie concepts.

Since then, Will and Erinn have written, directed, produced and starred in nearly a dozen sketches and short films, and have been featured in such festivals as The NYC Short Film Comedy Film Festival and The NYC Independent Film Festival. The duo also capitalized on their comedy chemistry by becoming co-hosts for various live events, including a stint as the game show hosts for the app Hangtime from  2017-2019.

Plot Device, an original TV series pitch, was conceived out of a mutual love for genre-style storytelling, however, it did not truly come together until Will and Erinn received a call from award-winning filmmaker Beecher Reuning, who was interested in a collaboration. He loved the idea of Plot Device, so the three wrote a treatment for the pilot script.

Since then, so much has changed. Plot Device has survived a pandemic, two table reads and countless editing sessions. What remains is a tight script, with an insanely talented cast and creative team, chomping at the bit to start filming. 

That's where you come in. 

It’s time for you to join our team

That’s right - YOU!

What We Need 

Independent filmmaking requires creativity, hard work, perseverance, and no small amount of generosity. Perfectly Adequate Films is hoping to raise at least $5,000 to help aid in the creation of this television pilot.  Production is set to begin July of 2021, and these funds will help pay for a secure (and ideal) location to film, allow PAF to engage, feed, and pay a top-notch crew, and keep all on-set personnel safe with strict Covid protocols and personal protective equipment. 

No donation is too small! Wonder how your $15 could possibly help ? Here is a breakdown of what your contribution could cover:

  • $15 - covers one day's worth of on-set coffee (very important)
  • $25 - supplies 1 box of KN95 masks
  • $50 - funds a day of filming with one of our talented Actors
  • $75 - pays for the official Plot Device prop button
  • $100 - allows us to house a crew/cast member for one night

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Perfectly Adequate Films understands that some people won’t be able to contribute financially, but that doesn't mean they can't help. While we are grateful for every cent raised, there are absolutely other ways to support this project:

  • Subscribe and follow us on YouTube, Instagram and Twitter
  • Share our campaign and posts with your social circle - every  like, retweet and shared post counts!
  • Have a friend or family member with a house in the NYC/NJ area who would be willing to let us film for a week this Summer? Reach out to us! We are on the hunt for the perfect location

More Info

For more information on Plot Device, including a full list of our cast and creative team, please visit: www.plot-device.com

story:
Short Summary

The Say is satirical take on daytime talk shows, in which four different women offer four different opinions but no apologies (even when, objectively, they should). No topic is too hot, ranging from mastectomies, to gun control, to the untold truth of the Lolita Express. Join the ladies as they go there and maybe a little further. When debate gets heated, these women aren’t afraid to walk out the door -- but if they do, who knows where they’ll end up! Through this heightened reality, ‘The Say’ reflects the absurdity of our modern moment.

In between segments on the Say there are commercials from Chiz & Lo, advertising’s most dynamic duo. In these commercials, Chiz & Lo sell very special products made just for women!

  • $1000 - $1200: editing, special effects, sound mixing, color grading,  getting custom studio audience audio
  • $600-$1000 for custom graphics and original music 

  • If we exceed our goal extra money will go towards professional sound mixing, better stock footage, better studio audience audio,  and submission expenses for festivals!

We are members of the Austin comedy group, Say Uncle. ‘The Say’ began as a live, late-night hour-long show in a grungy basement theater in Austin, Texas. It ran for a year before we decided to expand our favorite parts of the live show into a narrative digital series. The show was built over a shared bond of playing vulgar, chaotic, and over-the-top female characters. Working on the show has strengthened the creative trust we have in each other and encouraged us to keep on bitchin’.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Spread the word through social!

story:
My Name is Faye Alamango the creator and producer of a startup web Movie series called Gypsy & The Devil. The web series has been widely viewed online via Youtube and Facebook. This series that I have dedicated myself too, has so far, two first episodes. second one having a more solid and serious approach in establishing what is hopefully to become a long running program. We are looking to raise money in order to continue with the series.

From the beginning it all started when I had asked a friend of mine to do a documentary about my tarot reading business ''Fire & Moon Dust Mystical Emporium''. I am a professional tarot reader, who works in similar manner to a psychologist / therapist, only I use tarot cards to assist my clients in therapy and guidance. 

My cards are tools to help understand and find solutions for my clients, when one is stuck at a fork in the road or needs personal advice on their love life, career or even financial issues.

This is my business page: https://www.facebook.com/firemoon111/?ref=bookm...

While we were brainstorming on how to do my tarot documentary the idea began to grow into starting  something of a series. The documentary then quickly turned into a fictional mini movie and we launched it on Youtube and Facebook. After such amazing positive responses I decided to pursue further and develop what is becoming, already, a quite popular idea. 

My Youtube Channel: 

https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCmlqS6RkUmXe06...

Facebook Fan Page: 

https://www.facebook.com/Gypsythedevil-23431240...

I need your help so that it will be possible to start filming again mid December 2018. The third episode will, with the funds committed, bring a higher level of professionalism to the series and set the standard of production for the series as a whole. 

What is unique and genuine about this series is that part of our intent is to promote Maltese creativity, talent and entrepreneurial spirit by showcasing and featuring some of the Islands best artists, designers, local actors, local people and businesses that make my home such a wonderful eclectic mix of interesting world spanning individuals.

Overview of the episodes so far:

Episode 1 starts off as the pilot where we see a documentary about a Tarot reader in Malta, then switches into a movie where Mr. Lu the Devil from the tarot deck shows up in her life yet she has no idea what she has done wrong to make him so angry to the point he is now after her.

-link to episode two https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Dk3QbiXUdjQ&amp...

Episode 2 goes forward in time where we see another character who represents Major arcana card ‘’Death’’ from the tarot deck  and has been asked to meet with the devil to discuss plans on executing the tarot reader, however episode 2 reveals that Mr. Lu’s missing son Damien has something to do with why he’s pissed off at the tarot reader.

——What is episode three about——

Continuing the movie series episode 3 introduces new characters to the scene and finally explains why the devil wants the tarot reader dead and why his son has gone missing.

The money raised will go towards payment for renting out film equipment, film crew, actors, venue location, costumes and various costs pertaining to the flow and function of each of these.

story:
WHAT IS "VOLUNTEERS" ABOUT?

Vince hasn’t had an audition in 13 months but, with the help of his wife, has decided to look at his situation in a new way. It’s not that he can’t find work… it’s that he’s been retired for a year and just didn’t know it.  With this new found realization, he needs a purpose, so he decides to search for meaning by visiting his old friend Matt in Rwanda where he runs a charity for orphans.

Video of Erik punching a Trump supporter at a protest march ends up on FOX News with the host noting “For those of you wondering where that guy from ER has been these past years… we found him.” And after experiencing a bit of a “Hatfields and McCoys” situation with his neighbor that tests his anger issues, he could probably use a time-out of his own. When he hears of Vince’s plan to “do good” with “the black kids” in Rwanda, Erik quickly turns it into a “guys trip” and invites himself along... much to the consternation of Vince.

In the vein of HBO’s Curb Your Enthusiasm and FX’s Louie, Volunteers takes it a step further by putting  Vince and Erik in darkly-comedic situations that unflinchingly expose them to the horrors of genocide, the scourge of the AIDS epidemic, the vicious cycle of poverty in developing nations, and the self-aggrandizing of many in the world of International NGOs and Charities.

WHY IS "VOLUNTEERS" DIFFERENT?

Beyond making a funny, fish-out -of-water comedy, the idea is to show a side of Africa, and Rwanda in particular, that has rarely been seen by a western audience. A vibrant, bustling, and yes, funny place filled with unique characters. After completion of the pilot the production team and its representatives will take the show around Hollywood and pitch it as a series.

HOW DOES "VOLUNTEERS" GIVES BACK?

With the exception of Erik and Vincent (and Matt, sort of), the cast will be entirely Rwandan, as will the crew. The money raised from this campaign will go towards a five day shoot that will employ local Rwandans in all departments including camera, wardrobe, hair & makeup, sound, lighting, grip, locations, transportation, catering, and support staff.

We are excited to be able to expose American audiences to some of these incredibly talented actors and artists.

Additionally, 10% of the the money raised here will be donated to the Rwandan charity We Are Limitless and their efforts to place orphans in boarding schools and provide them with quality healthcare. The production team has also agreed to donate 10% of any profits made from the potential Volunteers series to the charity.

WHAT'S SO COOL ABOUT THESE PERKS?

 EVERY contribution above $25 will receive a password to stream the 30 minute pilot.

We are also offering a bunch of other cool perks for your contributions.  From personalized tweets from the actors, to Skype sessions on set with the cast and crew in Rwanda.

How about joining the cast and playing the role of a lifetime? -- "The Guy That Got Punched By Erik." For a couple of bucks more, he'll let you punch him back.

Come hang out with the filmmakers and cast at the Los Angeles premiere.

Ever want to be an Executive Producer? Get the full "Hollywood treatment" and come to Rwanda while we are filming. Visit the set and even have Matt take you up to see the mountain gorillas or personally drive you on a tour in Akagera National Park where you can see zebras, giraffes, hippos... and if you're lucky you might get chased by an elephant like the last time he took people there.

WHO ARE THE CREATORS?

Erik Palladino has been acting for over 35 years with somewhat mediocre results. But every few years, something pretty good happens, which then fills his tank of hope and keeps him going. 

Surprisingly, Erik has starred in some hit shows and movies over the years. Some that people have actually seen, such as ER (Dr. Dave Malluci), U-571 (Mazzola) and Can't Hardly Wait (Cousin Ron). He has also had large recurring roles on SUITS (Kevin Miller) and NCIS:LA (Sabatino). People definitely watch those shows, and as result when Erik is out in the street, some people will think that he went to high school with them.  Erik has had multiple failed shows, some that he was pretty good in too, like, FX's OVER THERE and ABC's 666 PARK AVENUE, along with six failed pilots (he may have been just okay in 2 of the 6) but he is proud to have been in all of them and looks forward to being in more failed things in the future. To his credit, in the face of all this constant failure, he somehow hangs in there by a thread. Erik is very persistent. And like many artists, he decided to try to fail with another art form. For Erik, it's been writing. He has been writing for over ten years with very little to show for it. But in all fairness, this current writing team, came really close to getting a pilot picked up to series a few years back. Real close. They have not collaborated since. It was so close that it in the words of Taylor Swift, it took them ten years to, "Shake it off." Now, here we are again. 

Erik is hoping that this current project and idea will be "the one." Although, most would think, based on his past, that this pilot was just another tap on that illusive glass ceiling for Erik. Some might think it will be another big waste of time, effort and money. Maybe. Most likely. Probably. You'd think, based on the history alone. But if you believe in dreams, like Erik obviously does, come along with him on this journey.  He's taking the bull by the horns, by being the master of his own destiny, he will do everything he can to make this dream of being the creator and star of his own series almost pretty good.  

Vincent Ventresca is best known for playing the title role in the SY-FI original series, THE INVISIBLE MAN and also "Fun Bobby" on FRIENDS. He recently completed an arc on ABC's WICKED CITY. Other notable television credits include: PSYCH, WITHOUT A TRACE, NIKITA, DOLLHOUSE, and NASHVILLE.  His most recent feature, BREAKPOINT, had its world premiere at SXSW last year. He is currently filming the independent feature THE TAO OF SURFING.  Other credits include ROMY AND MICHELLE'S HIGH SCHOOL REUNION, MADISON, with Jim Caviezel, and DEAD & BREAKFAST opposite Jeremy Sisto. Vincent will next be seen in LIFELINE, YouTube Red’s eight-episode sci-fi action thriller starring Zach Gilford and Sydney Park, produced by Dwayne Johnson. Vincent was born in Indiana and graduated from Indiana University with a degree in Theatre and Psychology.  He currently lives in Los Angeles with his wife and children.

Matthew Leutwyler  wrote and directed the cult-comedy/horror/musical DEAD & BREAKFAST, starring Jeremy Sisto, Jeffrey Dean Morgan, Erik Palladino & Vincent Ventresca. The film won over a dozen audience and best film awards around the world and was nominated for a Saturn Award.  Since then he has produced or exec produced THE OH IN OHIO starring Parker Posey & Paul Rudd; LOWER LEARNING with Eva Longoria, Jason Biggs, & Rob Corddry; AGAINST THE CURRENT with Joseph Fiennes and Justin Kirk; the Matthew Broderick, Sanaa Lathan drama WONDERFUL WORLD; and EVERY DAY, starring Helen Hunt, and Liev Schreiber.
In the past few years, Leutwyler directed the adaptation of the acclaimed novel THE RIVER WHY starring William Hurt, Zach Gilford, and Amber Heard. He also exec produced James Gunn’s SUPER starring Rainn Wilson and Ellen Page; and the comedy-drama THE GIRL MOST LIKELY, starring Kristen Wiig and Annette Benning.  Additionally, he wrote & directed the ensemble drama ANSWERS TO NOTHING starring Dane Cook, Barbara Hershey, and Julie Benz.

Leutwyler co-founded the theatrical distributor The Film Arcade in 2012. For two years, he worked on a dozen films including Sundance winner and Indie Spirit Award nominee AFTERNOON DELIGHT starring Kathryn Hahn and Jane Lynch, as well as THE OTHER DREAM TEAM, and A.C.O.D. with Amy Poehler, and Adam Scott. Matthew departed the company in 2014 to concentrate his efforts back on production.

In 2014 Leutwyler produced the food documentary SPINNING PLATES. November 2015 saw the release of Leutwyler’s most recent directorial effort, the sci-fi drama UNCANNY, with Mark Webber, Lucy Griffiths, and Rainn Wilson. The award winning film has been critically praised with Sight & Sound Magazine calling the film “confident, meticulously crafted, written with sharp brilliance and performed with perfect nuance.” And Ain’t-It-Cool-News described it as “the kind of movie you want to talk about afterward. A rare breed of thoughtful, independent science fiction.” Currently, he is developing DARK WATERS, a thriller set against the world of Nigerian oil piracy.  He is also producing, alongside Morgan Spurlock’s company Warrior Poets, the coming-of-age film GOOD AFTER BAD starring Billy Burke, Maddie Hasson, and Melora Walters. The film is currently in post production.

Outside of his career as a filmmaker Leutwyler is the founder of We Are Limitless, which provides orphans in Rwanda and the Congo with boarding school education and healthcare.

PILOT CAST:

  • Erik Palladino
  • Vincent Ventresca
  • Matthew Leutwyler
  • Simon Rwema
  • Solange Uwamahoro
  • Mark Kelly

 

SPECIAL THANKS for helping put this campaign together...

Adrian Colbert, Ruth Du, Bryan Kuroda, Andy Rath.
story_txt:
WHAT IS "VOLUNTEERS" ABOUT?
Vince hasn’t had an audition in 13 months but, with the help of his wife, has decided to look at his situation in a new way. It’s not that he can’t find work… it’s that he’s been retired for a year and just didn’t know it.  With this new found realization, he needs a purpose, so he decides to search for meaning by visiting his old friend Matt in Rwanda where he runs a charity for orphans.
Video of Erik punching a Trump supporter at a protest march ends up on FOX News with the host noting “For those of you wondering where that guy from ER has been these past years… we found him.” And after experiencing a bit of a “Hatfields and McCoys” situation with his neighbor that tests his anger issues, he could probably use a time-out of his own. When he hears of Vince’s plan to “do good” with “the black kids” in Rwanda, Erik quickly turns it into a “guys trip” and invites himself along... much to the consternation of Vince.
In the vein of HBO’s Curb Your Enthusiasm and FX’s Louie, Volunteers takes it a step further by putting  Vince and Erik in darkly-comedic situations that unflinchingly expose them to the horrors of genocide, the scourge of the AIDS epidemic, the vicious cycle of poverty in developing nations, and the self-aggrandizing of many in the world of International NGOs and Charities.
WHY IS "VOLUNTEERS" DIFFERENT?
Beyond making a funny, fish-out -of-water comedy, the idea is to show a side of Africa, and Rwanda in particular, that has rarely been seen by a western audience. A vibrant, bustling, and yes, funny place filled with unique characters. After completion of the pilot the production team and its representatives will take the show around Hollywood and pitch it as a series.

HOW DOES "VOLUNTEERS" GIVES BACK?
With the exception of Erik and Vincent (and Matt, sort of), the cast will be entirely Rwandan, as will the crew. The money raised from this campaign will go towards a five day shoot that will employ local Rwandans in all departments including camera, wardrobe, hair & makeup, sound, lighting, grip, locations, transportation, catering, and support staff.
We are excited to be able to expose American audiences to some of these incredibly talented actors and artists.
Additionally, 10% of the the money raised here will be donated to the Rwandan charity We Are Limitless and their efforts to place orphans in boarding schools and provide them with quality healthcare. The production team has also agreed to donate 10% of any profits made from the potential Volunteers series to the charity.
WHAT'S SO COOL ABOUT THESE PERKS?
 EVERY contribution above $25 will receive a password to stream the 30 minute pilot.
We are also offering a bunch of other cool perks for your contributions.  From personalized tweets from the actors, to Skype sessions on set with the cast and crew in Rwanda.
How about joining the cast and playing the role of a lifetime? -- "The Guy That Got Punched By Erik." For a couple of bucks more, he'll let you punch him back.
Come hang out with the filmmakers and cast at the Los Angeles premiere.
Ever want to be an Executive Producer? Get the full "Hollywood treatment" and come to Rwanda while we are filming. Visit the set and even have Matt take you up to see the mountain gorillas or personally drive you on a tour in Akagera National Park where you can see zebras, giraffes, hippos... and if you're lucky you might get chased by an elephant like the last time he took people there.
WHO ARE THE CREATORS?
Erik Palladino has been acting for over 35 years with somewhat mediocre results. But every few years, something pretty good happens, which then fills his tank of hope and keeps him going. 
Surprisingly, Erik has starred in some hit shows and movies over the years. Some that people have actually seen, such as ER (Dr. Dave Malluci), U-571 (Mazzola) and Can't Hardly Wait (Cousin Ron). He has also had large recurring roles on SUITS (Kevin Miller) and NCIS:LA (Sabatino). People definitely watch those shows, and as result when Erik is out in the street, some people will think that he went to high school with them.  Erik has had multiple failed shows, some that he was pretty good in too, like, FX's OVER THERE and ABC's 666 PARK AVENUE, along with six failed pilots (he may have been just okay in 2 of the 6) but he is proud to have been in all of them and looks forward to being in more failed things in the future. To his credit, in the face of all this constant failure, he somehow hangs in there by a thread. Erik is very persistent. And like many artists, he decided to try to fail with another art form. For Erik, it's been writing. He has been writing for over ten years with very little to show for it. But in all fairness, this current writing team, came really close to getting a pilot picked up to series a few years back. Real close. They have not collaborated since. It was so close that it in the words of Taylor Swift, it took them ten years to, "Shake it off." Now, here we are again. 
Erik is hoping that this current project and idea will be "the one." Although, most would think, based on his past, that this pilot was just another tap on that illusive glass ceiling for Erik. Some might think it will be another big waste of time, effort and money. Maybe. Most likely. Probably. You'd think, based on the history alone. But if you believe in dreams, like Erik obviously does, come along with him on this journey.  He's taking the bull by the horns, by being the master of his own destiny, he will do everything he can to make this dream of being the creator and star of his own series almost pretty good.  
Vincent Ventresca is best known for playing the title role in the SY-FI original series, THE INVISIBLE MAN and also "Fun Bobby" on FRIENDS. He recently completed an arc on ABC's WICKED CITY. Other notable television credits include: PSYCH, WITHOUT A TRACE, NIKITA, DOLLHOUSE, and NASHVILLE.  His most recent feature, BREAKPOINT, had its world premiere at SXSW last year. He is currently filming the independent feature THE TAO OF SURFING.  Other credits include ROMY AND MICHELLE'S HIGH SCHOOL REUNION, MADISON, with Jim Caviezel, and DEAD & BREAKFAST opposite Jeremy Sisto. Vincent will next be seen in LIFELINE, YouTube Red’s eight-episode sci-fi action thriller starring Zach Gilford and Sydney Park, produced by Dwayne Johnson. Vincent was born in Indiana and graduated from Indiana University with a degree in Theatre and Psychology.  He currently lives in Los Angeles with his wife and children.

story:
This campaign is to fund the production of a Pilot episode of Mommy Mafia. I started writing it when my daughter was a baby. I was amazed at the way people trusted me in public places with their laptops and children just because I was a Mom. And it got me thinking about the perception of moms as being these super responsible trustworthy people and what if moms were to leverage their trustworthiness for their own gain? Wouldn’t that shake things up? The other thing that struck me as a new mom was how quickly I bonded with other moms, We were fast close friends. We waged tight friendships even though we all had very little in common beyond motherhood. Sort of like in war, we needed each other so we became close quickly and those bonds have stayed strong ever since.

I’m Laura Sweeney, Screenwriter, Director and Actress. My scripts have been semi finalist with Screencraft Script Fund and Nantucket Film Festival. Currently, I have a feature film in development with Aloris Entertainment and previously have had television projects optioned by North South Productions. I've directed a short experimental film called THE NECK and created two webseries: The Mothership and Theater Bitches. I performed most recently in the NYC Fringe Festival award winning play Random Us. Member of SAG-AFTRA, The Georgetown Entertainment Media Alliance, and New York Women In Film and Television. I teach screenwriting for Writers Boot Camp and am a graduate of Georgetown University. I studied acting with the Moscow Art Theatre www.laurasweeney.com

Mommy Mafia is a story about a new type of family. Groups of moms thrust together out of necessity. Today’s world is so competitive and expensive that moms bond together most their waking hours, to raise the kids and make ends meet. It also is a story about the haves and have-nots. The main character’s arch nemesis, a woman they nickname Yoga Bitch is a different type of mom with a nasty attitude and a designer stroller in tow.

It’s a really fun project with lots of inherent comedy that takes place in Park Slope, Brooklyn. My vision for the project is a very real grassroots but polished Brooklyn look. I’d like to shoot in all in NY, on the charming stoops, coffee shops and boutiques in Brooklyn. It’d be fun to pay homage to the mafia films by showing the new mafia of Brooklyn: the moms. I’m excited especially by these characters. From Ruth, a born leader who forgot to comb her hair to Kira the drummer in a band who is now the mom of twin boys. They are all very brave and adventurous people who dive in head first. These moms are smart edgy and funny.  These moms are real people whole dynamic people who carry great responsibility to hand off their values to their kids. I also always love a story that is the plight of the underdog, the middle class mom who puts her kids first and her ingenuity and smarts beat out the super entitled snobby mommies.

THE IMPACT OF YOUR CONTRIBUTIONS:

Your contributions will help us to achieve a professional level pilot and realize this project's full creative potential. We’ll then be able to bring this piece and the rest of the 9 scripted episode, currently being written to Netflix, Hulu, amazon prime and other new media outlets. This piece will act as a blue print for the entire series and open doors for this project.

HOW MUCH MOOLAH? and FOR WHAT EXACTLY?

How much are we raising? $10,000

Where is it going: A 3-4 Day shoot in Brooklyn, NY.

  • Professional crew: including Director of Photography, Editor, Production Designer, Sound, Lights, Makeup, Editor.
  • Actor stipends
  • Insurance
  • Locations: Gowanus Canal, Coffee shop, Brooklyn Apartment
  • Equipment rental
  • Props and Costumes
  • Catering

The Payoff?  Join the Mafia for our fun perks! Passes to the screening, t-shirts, and more. Check out the perks section for more info on this.

If we don't reach our entire goal, the funds you give will still go to the creation of this project. We will do further fundraising to make this project happen This is the one! I’m happy to die trying on this one.

The Big Picture Impact

Its exciting to launch a project with so many dynamic roles for women! Also, like so many other shows that have been hugely successful this is at its core a show about an American family doing its best to get by. And just like the original mafia, these moms organize and stick together in order to overcome obstacles. 

Since I started this project, it has brought people together in such a positive way, there’s a powerful energy behind it! We have successfully funded and produced projects before: Mommy Mafia's shorter version, The Neck [short film] and The Mothership.

Risks & Challenges

My vision is to be the show runner and also play Ruth in the series. I realize this is incredibly ambitious. To overcome any potential nervous breakdown, I plan on having a very experienced first AD friend on set, calling my mom and friends for support and making sure I eat my breakfast. But honestly, I survived childbirth so I think I'll be OK.

Incredible Team

For me it’s all about the people. We are so psyched to have such a talented and diverse cast and crew!

Laura Sweeney, Screenwriter, Director, and Actor

Cynthia Barrera, Producer - Cynthia has more than a decade of experience as a field producer and executive producer of television, film and commercial content. She also has extensive experience in radio as the host of her own Spanish-Language radio show Transicion. Most recently, she was the executive producer/senior content developer and writer at HITN-TV overseeing all production elements of live and pre-produced on-air and online content for such shows popular bilingual shows as Dialogo de Costa a Costa.

Teresa Bolz, Associate Producer - Teresa is a school librarian, actress and a member of the Prop Department in IATSE Local 52.  She was the lead in the 2003 Fringe NYC play Who's Not Ready Holler I!.  In 2015, she returned to the Fringe NYC stages in the awarding winning production of Random Us portraying three characters.  She has performed around Long Island with the following companies: YCP presents The Company, Huntington Village Theater Company, BareBones Theater Company and Township Theater Group. In the fall of 2015, Teresa along with Laura Sweeney created the web series, Theater Bitches. Teresa just recently filmed an episode for The Mothership.

Cybel Martin, Director of Photography -  Cybel is an award winning Director of Photography for feature films, commercials, documentaries and television programs. She's a Native New Yorker with a voracious appetite for travel. Recent projects have brought her to Tanzania, Ethiopia, Turkey and Brazil. 

Her films have premiered at Sundance, TriBeCa, Toronto and Berlin Film Festivals. She's shot commercials for Timberland Apparel, Reebok, Sony and L'Oreal; tv programs for ESPN, Netflix, NatGeo and Centric/BET. She's been featured in Fader Magazine, American Cinematographer Magazine and most recently in Fast Company for her work shooting Virtual Reality. Cybel received her MFA from NYU's Tisch School of the Arts and is a proud member of the International Cinematographers Guild. 

Carlos Abi Torres, Editor  - Carlos is a two-time NY Emmy Award-winning Senior Video Editor who specializes in short form promo, factual and branded content work. He started his career in media production in 1992 as a master control operator at his alma mater radio station while completing his BA in Theater at the University of Puerto Rico.

After graduation, he arrived in New York City to attend a filmmaking workshop at New York University’s SCPS. He quickly started working at different capacities in film, theater and TV, including projects for prominent international television companies Nippas TV (Japan) and TVE (Spain). But it wasn’t until completing his Master’s Degree in Media Arts Production at the City College of New York, CUNY, that he discovered his passion for film and video editing. Since then, he’s worked on numerous projects for commercial and non-profit organizations such as Procter & Gamble, Anthropologie, Maybelline, Verizon, Coors, Major League Soccer, Cornell University, Columbia University, New York City DOE, and the Florida Coalition Against Human Trafficking. 

Carlos served as Post-Production Manager and Senior Video Editor for the Hispanic Information and Telecommunications Network, and currently works as contractor and as a freelance video editor for Nickelodeon and Univision. His work has earned him many industry accolades, including various NY Emmy, Telly, Communicator and New York State Broadcasters Association awards. 

Other Ways You Can Help

"Leave the gun, take the cannoli"

Even if you can’t give the money, we value your contribution:

Help us get the word out and make some noise about our campaign by emailing it, harass your family members, talking to your friends about it, sharing on social media.

Encourages us along the way, we love talking to you.

Donate your stuff! We need strollers, coffee cups all kinds of other stuff, if you’re interested in this project, drop us a line and we can see how you might be of service.

Indiegogo makes it easy to share this link!! 

More about our cast and crew in our Facebook page.

story:
Whats it about?

Day One is a 10 part fantasy horror series that is set in two distinct time-zones, modern day and 10 years later, it revolves around Carolin Casey, an 11 year old girl from a NORMAL family in manchester.  On Day One Carolins world collapses around her as a mysterious affliction destroys the world as she knows it, losing her brother, sister, mother and father in the process.  We follow Carolin as she tries to survive in a post apocalyptic Manchester, always striving to find out what has happened to her family.  An elusive man always at periphery of vision, stalks her, and where he walks necromancy is never far behind

Whats it really about?

Family!  The lengths we would all go to make sure our family are safe and well, the mistakes parents sometimes make and how the decisions those parents make can have long lasting effects on their children for many years to come, all told from the perspective of a lonely 11 year old girl. We explore all this and more but from a child's perspective and try to give our viewers an insight into the secret world our children live in.

Think the Walking Dead mixed with fantasy elements, this is not your run of the mill zombie(but they are not zombies) series, you won't find any chemical/nuclear fallout or pandemic viruses in Day One, apart from the occasional cold perhaps. In fact its not about the zombies(but they are not zombies) at all, the core concept is about family and losing someone you love, and the things kids do when faced with an extreme situation.

What We Need

We have already shot 2/3rd's of the pilot and we have a few more scenes left to shoot, the tough part is, these are either post apocalyptic or have large numbers of people in them. These scenes are scheduled to take a further 4-5 days

Stills from what we have already shot

What we need is enough money to make these last few scenes to get the pilot completed.  To date we have spent around £4500, some of that came from a previous Indiegogo campaign a total of £1503, the rest has been raised by the producers or come from our own pockets.

To really do it justice we need another £3500

Concept CGI post apocalyptic scene created by our very own David Turner

Who Are Clouded Sight Pictures?

Started in 2014 by Actor's David Christopher Turner and Alex De Luca, Clouded Sight Pictures was launched as a platform to work on the projects we want to make.

David Turner has been a performer for many years starting as a singer and guitarist at the age of 15 and gigging across the country in various bands, then 6 years ago, he found his true calling, acting and film making.  Starting in the acting industry later in life than some, David enjoyed some small success and can be seen in several worldwide or national commercials, including the "Dads Voice" commercial and the Loctite glue worldwide campaign. He also features in Perfect Skin starring Richard Brake(Game of Thrones, Doom) as well as playing lead roles in multiple short and feature length independent films.  As a film maker David is capable of doing everything, but he gravitates towards writing, producing, directing, editing and VFX and has been teaching the kids of Pauline Quirke Academy Bury how to make their own films for the past 18 months as the Film and TV teacher.

David and Alex have worked on several projects either together or separately but they all stay true to the Clouded Sight ethos.  If you want to get to know who Clouded Sight Pictures are and where we came from be sure to check out Independent Dreams, a documentary that delves into both mine and Alex's private life as we start to try and make our first films.

Independent dreams on amazon

When its finished what will happen?

Originally this was intended as a free web series, but since we started shooting in June 2018, we have been approached by representatives from CBS, Channel 4 and Sky, all of whom want to see what we can do with the pilot.  To say I'm excited is an understatement as there is a very real possibility of Day One Series 1 being commissioned.

However if none of that pans out we will continue the series as a web series as long as the fans still want to see more.

The perks

We have just added an exclusive to Indiegogo, signed character A3 character poster, this wont be available anywhere else, so get in quick before time runs out. Choose from Carolin Casey, Paul Morel, The Man or Zephaniah.

Where will the money go?

The original budget was £6,000, unfortunately due to locations cancelling last minute and various other issues, the budget has had to be increased to £8,000.  Of that £8,000, £4500 has already been raised and spent on, costume, makeup, locations, expenses, props and a myriad of other things.  £1557 was raised by the previous Indiegogo campaign and our producers David and Alex have provided the deficit of £2,943.  Now we need a further £3,500 to get it completed and that is broken down as follows.

Locations : £1500

Cast and Crew Expenses : £1000

SFX makeup and costume : £580

Crowdfund fees : £420

The Cast

We are honoured to welcome both experienced and young talented actors to the production.

Other Ways You Can Help

Spread the word, please share our campaign with your friends and family. and don't forget to use Indiegogo's sharing tools at the top of the page,  you also don't need to pledge to get rewards, simply create an account on Indiegogo and share the campaign with your friends and family using the Indiegogo share tools,  every person will accrue referral rewards for every successful pledge resulting from them sharing the campaign!  Referral awards will be published 7 days from the campaign start.

 

With a little help from you, Day One has the potential to not only prove that to be successful you don't need to be famous but also gives the kids a chance they seem to have been lacking in modern day television programming. An actual voice front and centre that no one can ignore!

story:
What is Going Both Ways?

It's the story of identical twins who look and sound alike, and even think alike. But they've started moving along different paths. Adam and his wife just moved to the suburbs with an infant and a newborn, and Todd just started dating men.

Both twins are newbies and they're anxious - whether it be about a first diaper change or a first hand job. But they remain deeply committed to each other and their comedy career, and are willing to do whatever it takes to get each other through this new chapter in their lives. 

 

Why this series? Why Now?

We're creating "Going Both Ways" because these are our lives now. In five years, Todd may fall in love with an elderly Japanese heiress, Baiya Toyota. And Adam may change his gender to compete with his wife for the affections of their son's studly math teacher, Mr. Jason. But for now, this is who we are.

We're also excited about the fact that some of today's biggest comedy shows started as web series, including shows such as "Broad City," "Insecure," and "Workaholics."

 

Where your money will go

In order to make this, we're going to need money for production costs. (Please look over to the right where you'll see the perks that come with different donation amounts!)

Fortunately, we have an incredibly talented and professional team of people who are excited to make this series with us. BUT there are still many costs associated with filming a series, including:
  • Securing locations
  • Equipment rentals
  • Additional crew
  • Feeding the cast and crew
  • Marketing / Distribution
  • Wardrobe / Makeup
  • Festival submissions
And your contribution will allow us to pay for these expenses.

 

About Us

For those of you who don't know us, we are the Stones (“Stone and Stone”), and we have been featured in the semi-final round of NBC’s "Last Comic Standing," in a series of national Verizon FiOS commercials and in videos on Comedy Central. We hosted a web series on truTV, performed on AXS TV's Gotham Comedy Live, and roasted people including Dennis Rodman, Padma Lakshmi and George Takei at the New York Friars Club.

We perform at clubs and theaters throughout New York, and our “Stone and Stone Show” is the longest-running stand-up show at The PIT. We have been featured in the New York Comedy Festival and the Edinburgh Fringe Festival and have also appeared in films including The Mend, and most recently, John Wick: Chapter 2.

 

About the Team

Steve Morey is on board to Produce the series. He has worked in TV for 5+ years for companies like Spike, TV Land, truTV and NBC/Universal. One day he realized that he'd love to start making things on his own, a couple short films later here he is working with the Stones on their latest venture.

 

Kyle Moriwaki is a music composer, illustrator, graphic/web designer, photographer and videographer for the series.

 

This is Ryan Krumm. He edits.

 

Steven Mosley is an award winning Producer, Director and Artist living in Jersey City, NJ. With over 10 years of television experience, Steven has worked as a producer for several high profile brands (VH1, Lifetime, truTV and HBO). He has directed commercials featuring a range of celebrities from the Impractical Jokers to Heidi Klum.

Steven is currently producing a Web Series with his wife Jenna Bosco called "New Heights." New Heights is a comedy that tackles the inequities of the entertainment world through the lens of a mixed race actress. To watch episodes, search "NewHeightsWebSeries" on Facebook.

Steven is a friend and a huge fan of the talented comedy duo. He cant wait to work with/ yell at the Stones.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you don't have the means to contribute anything, we know a career coach. Just kidding! Seriously, if you can't make a donation, but you're excited about the series, we need you! We want "Going Both Ways" to reach as large an audience as possible, so every "like" and "share" on social media really helps! If you can share this campaign with friends, that would be great! And when the series actually gets made, sharing and liking those videos will help tremendously. Thank you so much for joining the "Going Both Ways" series in whatever way you can!!

story:
Short Summary

Chronofilm is the first web series project from ThreeDadsProductions. We're a small group that loves telling great stories and thanks to the web we now have the opportunity to spread those stories to a much larger audience. We also love the small communities that we come from and we want to highlight the gems of talent that have been hidden beneath the surface here in California's Central Valley.  

What We Need & What You Get

  • As a homegrown operation we still need the funds to produce  this ambitious web series.  Your contributions will go to pay actors, crew, and help us AFFORD costumes and props.  As a time travel show we desperately need a budget for these items to create a sense of immersion for our viewers. Help us prove that home grown film works!
  • We want you to be part of the team and help us unlock the mysteries of time travel.  Your contributions will allow you to work your way up through the ranks of the fabled Chronofilm Institute and can make you feel like a Time Traveler yourself. 
  • With so much local support this project will happen even if we don't achieve our funding goal. But we don't want to skimp on costumes, props, locations or being able to hire the best crew and actors. Only you and your contribution can help us make Chronofilm The Web Series the high quality product that we have envisioned and designed.

The Impact

  • Living in the middle of CA, we want to create our OWN film projects.  We've all been  professionals in the entertainment field at some point in our lives, and while we ended up for various reasons moving away from the studios and the mainstream, the passion and the filmmaking fire has never been extinguished for any of us. 
  • We're working with people who have created content like this successfully in their careers, who are eager to  join us in our journey to create sci fi magic in the Central Valley. 
  • Independent film making starts with the audience, NOT the studios.  We can make this happen and create quality entertainment without the bureaucracy or red tape of the Hollywood scene to  the best project to our audience. The story we want to tell is amazing, and IF we get to do the multiple seasons we have planned you'll be blown away.  From beginning to end we know the shape of the story and we're excited to bring you along for the ride.

Risks & Challenges

  • The truth: Without studio backing, or LA producers raising money is hard.  Joseph Hypes, one of the Executive Producers and actors in Chronofilm the Web Series has worked in fundraising and development for 8 years and he knows that  raising funds for the ARTS in the Central Valley can be competitive and difficult.  But a project on the scale of Chronofilm the Web Series doesn't happen in the Central Valley all the time, and we expect that the community will light up with support when it sees what we have planned.
  • We've got the best cast, the best crew, great scripts and an awesome story to tell. All we need is your help to get the story told.

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Wanna help us out? $10 goes a long way.  That same $10 you spend for popcorn at the movies, or a weeks worth of coffee at Starbucks.  $10 buys you in and shows support.  
  • Whether you can help financially or not, please remember to share this campaign with anyone who you know would be interested in local, quality, exciting science fiction storytelling.

story:
When reality gets grim, make up a better version of it. Or a grimmer one. Or funnier. Something to remind you that things can always be different.

What's it all about?

We are asking for your help to finish the first season of our web-comedy KANAL 82 – and thus show your support for liberal voices under threat in Turkey today.

KANAL 82 tells the behind-the-scenes-story of a local TV station in a fictional small town in Turkey, mainly broadcasting light entertainment. Having no experience in “serious journalism”, one day the channel‘s exclusively female crew is caught up by a horrific event - too horrible to be mentioned here - which all the big media organs corporations self-censor immediately. Only Kanal 82 broadcasts live and uncut.

The web-series is a running comedic commentary on the distressing and often chaotic twists and turns of recent politics in Turkey, with it's crackdown on free media, leftist political opposition and liberal freedoms. It tackles issues like the aftermath of the failed coup from 07-15-2016, the militarization of Turkey's society and the effect the economical crisis has on the average people.

KANAL 82 is witty, it's critical and it doesn't shy away from talking truth to power. And it is a decidedly feminist series, casting seven strong female leads against the seemingly all-powerful alliance of state authorities, corrupt businessman and a censored press.

The first five episodes of the series have been written, developed & produced over the course of the last 13 months. Spoken language is mostly Turkish, with English and German subtitles.

To finish the first season, we have to shoot two more episodes – and for this we are calling for YOUR support. After a short festival run, the series will be made available online & free around mid 2019.

Who we are

KANAL 82 is the outgrow of a long history of migration and cultural entanglement. The series is produced in Berlin, Germany - from the midst of the biggest community of Türkiyeli (people from Turkey) outside of Turkey.

Our creative team comprises individuals from all walks of lives, Turkish-Germans born and raised in Berlin, Türkiyeli  who recently arrived for political reasons and Germans.

We - Zeynep Tuna and Nino Klingler - are the series' writers and directors. Zeynep (born in Eskisehir, Turkey) is a specialist in Turkish popular culture and a digger for the weirdest Found Footage around. Nino (from a small town in Southern Germany) is both a film director and a prolific reviewer, with more than 300 published texts to date (albeit mostly in German).

We met in Istanbul over ten years ago and have since been working on many different projects in many different media together, including experimental found footage on Turkish sexploitation films, a short fiction on gay romance and many more.

Currently, we are fellows at the Graduate School of Berlin's University of the Arts - a wonderful program allowing artists to work on a project for two years. With KANAL 82, we got accepted as a team to realize our vision of a fictional TV station somewhere between Turkey and Germany...

What happened so far...

Over the last 18 months, we have built a working TV studio in our atelier in the University of Arts - check out this very short introduction to the heart of KANAL 82.

We have gathered a wonderful group of people to help us in front & behind the camera - including our marvellously charismatic and talented main actresses.

Over the last year, we grew together as a team, sharing a vision and a political conviction.  We also had to overcome some hardships - especially the unexpected and painful loss of Zeynep Delibalta, a wonderful person and gifted artist who was acting as one of the leading characters in the first two episodes. She is sorely missed. It is in her memory that we continue to work double as hard to finish KANAL 82's first season.

Just one step away...

Together with our amazing team & crew we poured all our love, energy and commitment into building our set and shooting five episodes of 10-15 min each. We are one week of shooting  away from finishing the first season of KANAL 82. The crew is ready, the set is ready, the equipment is available - but the money has run out. The limited resources provided by our university have all gone into getting as far as we are now.

So we need your help to shoot two more episodes. The largest chunk of the money will go to our amazing team. We do not only love the people we are working with, we respect them. They believe in our project so much that they accept possible risks for themselves and their loved ones. Most of us have family in Turkey, and everybody knows stories about persecuted artists, journalists, activist. But still they work for KANAL 82, in front of and behind the camera.

In our opinion, this kind of commitment deserves recognition. No one can live from passion alone. We live in a capitalist world. People who make art have to be able to support their lives from it, to whatever meager degree. This crowdfunding campaign is for them.

So we call upon you to support KANAL 82, support alternative voices in Turkey, support political diversity - and become a part of a community. If you look at our perks you will see: Your contribution is much more than a financial backing. It's becoming part of KANAL 82's team. It's showing a flag.

See the diagram below for a detailed breakdown of how we want to spend the money. If we do not meet our goal entirely, we will distribute what we have among everybody.

Some words on politics...

You've probably heard about it: Turkey is sliding down a vicious spiral of economic, political and social crisis at the moment. There is a war being waged against the Kurdish minority in the country's southeast (and Syria's North), critical voices in the media have in large part been silenced through police persecution and political influence, and the authoritarian prime-minister-turned-president on top (whose name we will never mention) has just fulfilled his masterplan to turn Turkey from a emerging democracy into a one-party, one-person quasi-dictatorship. 

The reality looks grim. The lira, the Turkish currency, is rapidly losing value as social unrest is growing between the majority and the many minorities in the country (Kurdish, Alevis, Syrian refugees). But the state-controlled mainstream media have so far succeed in shifting the blame for the country's malaise from its corrupt elites to diverse "foreign powers" (Israel, the US, Europe....). Turkey is more and more living in an alternative reality of ever-evolving conspiracy theories, with new villains popping up constantly and ever stranger plot twists happening on a daily basis. One would be tempted to call it the world's most ridiculous soap-opera – if it wasn't so dead serious...

Why TV?

Television has a large part in establishing this thwarted worldview since it is undeniably the dominant medium in Turkey. The average Türkyeli (Person from Turkey) watches six hours per day (according to the Statistical Institute of Turkey, TÜIK). The result is that “the overwhelming majority of the population in Turkey gets their news not from newspapers, but from television”. (The quote was taken from a - highly recommended - report by Human Rights Watch entitled "Silencing Turkey's Media").

And what a kind of news that is: A recent media monitoring showed that self censorship and sponsored content abound in an environment where media houses are part of diversified conglomerates also dealing in construction, manufacturing and real estate. And one of the biggest investors is the Turkish state. So obviously, bosses who are eying for government contracts have a strong interest in having their news teams show the country's leadership in a positive light.

KANAL 82 boils these issues down to a local level to make them both understandable and funny. It's about series about small channel, owned by a crook who is dealing in newsmaking the way he is dealing in everything else: Only to further his interest. But he hadn't reckoned with the women working for his channel...

The Trojan Horse of Comedy

You know the one about jokes and frogs? Here goes: Explaining jokes is like dissecting a frog. It's ugly and the frog dies. So better don't do it.

Nevertheless, we think some explanations are in order as to why we chose to treat grim "-isms" like sexism, authoritarianism or nationalism in a comedic fashion. One could say: Looking at 100.000+ political prisoners, an economy on the verge of collapse and toxic social hatred, there isn't a lot to laugh about in Turkey today. The country is, like many societies at the moment, politically deeply divided.

So we were asking ourselves the question: How do you address polarizing issues – like what the role of women should be in a predominantly Muslim society, or how journalistic media should cover political issues – without polarizing the already polarized society even further?

And this is where comedy comes in. We love the slapstick of Charlie Chaplin, Buster Keaton, the Marx Brothers and also Samuel Beckett. Because everybody can laugh about their jokes. And because the issues at the heart of the jokes are sometimes surprisingly grave: Poverty, loneliness, exploitation.

So we see comedy as something like a Trojan horse: KANAL 82 is deceptively lighthearted in tone, but with serious issues in mind.

Why Berlin?

For the last decades, Berlin has often been a safe heaven for Turkey's opposition. Groups of politically persecuted people moved here during the political turbulence of the 1970s, after the 1980's coup, during the Kurdish uprising in the 1990s and again now in the wake of the recent anti-democratic transformation of Turkey, especially following the crackdown after the failed coup attempt of 15th July 2016. The exodus of critical journalists, academics and artists, many of whom come to Germany with its big Turkish-speaking diaspora, has been called a “brain drain” or „New Wave“ by the German media. In Berlin, one can find cutting edge thinking about and artistic engagement with contemporary issues of Turkey.

But this is only one side of the coin: In Germany one also encounters strong factions of supporters of the prime-president and his party AKP (in the presidential election of June 2018, 66% of Turkish-German citizens voted for Erdoğan, compared to only 53% in total). These people often rightfully criticize what they perceive as a condescending approach of the West towards their home country.

Berlin, sometimes dubbed „Little Istanbul“ among the Turkish-speaking community, often appears like an unofficial province of Turkey, encapsulating the whole social, cultural and political spectrum of Turkey.

    Other Ways You Can Help

    We know the world of culture, we know Turkey, and we know the combination of both. In other words: We know money can be tight, especially if a project is asking for a contribution in Euro when your local currency is losing value on a two-digit level every day. 

    So if you can't or won't contribute to our project financially, we understand 100 %. But if you like what we are doing, please know that there are other ways to support us.

    It all boils down to this: Spread the word! Let your community know, share our campaign with your friends on- and offline, use the tools of indiegogo. We are thankful for every post, every like and every word-of-mouth-moment.
story_txt:
When reality gets grim, make up a better version of it. Or a grimmer one. Or funnier. Something to remind you that things can always be different.
What's it all about?

We are asking for your help to finish the first season of our web-comedy KANAL 82 – and thus show your support for liberal voices under threat in Turkey today.
KANAL 82 tells the behind-the-scenes-story of a local TV station in a fictional small town in Turkey, mainly broadcasting light entertainment. Having no experience in “serious journalism”, one day the channel‘s exclusively female crew is caught up by a horrific event - too horrible to be mentioned here - which all the big media organs corporations self-censor immediately. Only Kanal 82 broadcasts live and uncut.
The web-series is a running comedic commentary on the distressing and often chaotic twists and turns of recent politics in Turkey, with it's crackdown on free media, leftist political opposition and liberal freedoms. It tackles issues like the aftermath of the failed coup from 07-15-2016, the militarization of Turkey's society and the effect the economical crisis has on the average people.
KANAL 82 is witty, it's critical and it doesn't shy away from talking truth to power. And it is a decidedly feminist series, casting seven strong female leads against the seemingly all-powerful alliance of state authorities, corrupt businessman and a censored press.
The first five episodes of the series have been written, developed & produced over the course of the last 13 months. Spoken language is mostly Turkish, with English and German subtitles.
To finish the first season, we have to shoot two more episodes – and for this we are calling for YOUR support. After a short festival run, the series will be made available online & free around mid 2019.
Who we are

KANAL 82 is the outgrow of a long history of migration and cultural entanglement. The series is produced in Berlin, Germany - from the midst of the biggest community of Türkiyeli (people from Turkey) outside of Turkey.
Our creative team comprises individuals from all walks of lives, Turkish-Germans born and raised in Berlin, Türkiyeli  who recently arrived for political reasons and Germans.

We - Zeynep Tuna and Nino Klingler - are the series' writers and directors. Zeynep (born in Eskisehir, Turkey) is a specialist in Turkish popular culture and a digger for the weirdest Found Footage around. Nino (from a small town in Southern Germany) is both a film director and a prolific reviewer, with more than 300 published texts to date (albeit mostly in German).
We met in Istanbul over ten years ago and have since been working on many different projects in many different media together, including experimental found footage on Turkish sexploitation films, a short fiction on gay romance and many more.
Currently, we are fellows at the Graduate School of Berlin's University of the Arts - a wonderful program allowing artists to work on a project for two years. With KANAL 82, we got accepted as a team to realize our vision of a fictional TV station somewhere between Turkey and Germany...
What happened so far...

Over the last 18 months, we have built a working TV studio in our atelier in the University of Arts - check out this very short introduction to the heart of KANAL 82.
We have gathered a wonderful group of people to help us in front & behind the camera - including our marvellously charismatic and talented main actresses.
Over the last year, we grew together as a team, sharing a vision and a political conviction.  We also had to overcome some hardships - especially the unexpected and painful loss of Zeynep Delibalta, a wonderful person and gifted artist who was acting as one of the leading characters in the first two episodes. She is sorely missed. It is in her memory that we continue to work double as hard to finish KANAL 82's first season.
Just one step away...

Together with our amazing team & crew we poured all our love, energy and commitment into building our set and shooting five episodes of 10-15 min each. We are one week of shooting  away from finishing the first season of KANAL 82. The crew is ready, the set is ready, the equipment is available - but the money has run out. The limited resources provided by our university have all gone into getting as far as we are now.
So we need your help to shoot two more episodes. The largest chunk of the money will go to our amazing team. We do not only love the people we are working with, we respect them. They believe in our project so much that they accept possible risks for themselves and their loved ones. Most of us have family in Turkey, and everybody knows stories about persecuted artists, journalists, activist. But still they work for KANAL 82, in front of and behind the camera.
In our opinion, this kind of commitment deserves recognition. No one can live from passion alone. We live in a capitalist world. People who make art have to be able to support their lives from it, to whatever meager degree. This crowdfunding campaign is for them.
So we call upon you to support KANAL 82, support alternative voices in Turkey, support political diversity - and become a part of a community. If you look at our perks you will see: Your contribution is much more than a financial backing. It's becoming part of KANAL 82's team. It's showing a flag.
See the diagram below for a detailed breakdown of how we want to spend the money. If we do not meet our goal entirely, we will distribute what we have among everybody.

Some words on politics...

You've probably heard about it: Turkey is sliding down a vicious spiral of economic, political and social crisis at the moment. There is a war being waged against the Kurdish minority in the country's southeast (and Syria's North), critical voices in the media have in large part been silenced through police persecution and political influence, and the authoritarian prime-minister-turned-president on top (whose name we will never mention) has just fulfilled his masterplan to turn Turkey from a emerging democracy into a one-party, one-person quasi-dictatorship. 
The reality looks grim. The lira, the Turkish currency, is rapidly losing value as social unrest is growing between the majority and the many minorities in the country (Kurdish, Alevis, Syrian refugees). But the state-controlled mainstream media have so far succeed in shifting the blame for the country's malaise from its corrupt elites to diverse "foreign powers" (Israel, the US, Europe....). Turkey is more and more living in an alternative reality of ever-evolving conspiracy theories, with new villains popping up constantly and ever stranger plot twists happening on a daily basis. One would be tempted to call it the world's most ridiculous soap-opera – if it wasn't so dead serious...
Why TV?

Television has a large part in establishing this thwarted worldview since it is undeniably the dominant medium in Turkey. The average Türkyeli (Person from Turkey) watches six hours per day (according to the Statistical Institute of Turkey, TÜIK). The result is that “the overwhelming majority of the population in Turkey gets their news not from newspapers, but from television”. (The quote was taken from a - highly recommended - report by Human Rights Watch entitled "Silencing Turkey's Media").
And what a kind of news that is: A recent media monitoring showed that self censorship and sponsored content abound in an environment where media houses are part of diversified conglomerates also dealing in construction, manufacturing and real estate. And one of the biggest investors is the Turkish state. So obviously, bosses who are eying for government contracts have a strong interest in having their news teams show the country's leadership in a positive light.
KANAL 82 boils these issues down to a local level to make them both understandable and funny. It's about series about small channel, owned by a crook who is dealing in newsmaking the way he is dealing in everything else: Only to further his interest. But he hadn't reckoned with the women working for his channel...
The Trojan Horse of Comedy

You know the one about jokes and frogs? Here goes: Explaining jokes is like dissecting a frog. It's ugly and the frog dies. So better don't do it.

One could say: Looking at 100.000+ political prisoners, an economy on the verge of collapse and toxic social hatred, there isn't a lot to laugh about in Turkey today. The country is, like many societies at the moment, politically deeply divided.
So we were asking ourselves the question: How do you address polarizing issues – like what the role of women should be in a predominantly Muslim society, or how journalistic media should cover political issues – without polarizing the already polarized society even further?
And this is where comedy comes in. We love the slapstick of Charlie Chaplin, Buster Keaton, the Marx Brothers and also Samuel Beckett. Because everybody can laugh about their jokes. And because the issues at the heart of the jokes are sometimes surprisingly grave: Poverty, loneliness, exploitation.
So we see comedy as something like a Trojan horse: KANAL 82 is deceptively lighthearted in tone, but with serious issues in mind.
