Groups of politically persecuted people moved here during the political turbulence of the 1970s, after the 1980's coup, during the Kurdish uprising in the 1990s and again now in the wake of the recent anti-democratic transformation of Turkey, especially following the crackdown after the failed coup attempt of 15th July 2016. The exodus of critical journalists, academics and artists, many of whom come to Germany with its big Turkish-speaking diaspora, has been called a “brain drain” or „New Wave“ by the German media. In Berlin, one can find cutting edge thinking about and artistic engagement with contemporary issues of Turkey.
But this is only one side of the coin: In Germany one also encounters strong factions of supporters of the prime-president and his party AKP (in the presidential election of June 2018, 66% of Turkish-German citizens voted for Erdoğan, compared to only 53% in total). These people often rightfully criticize what they perceive as a condescending approach of the West towards their home country.
Berlin, sometimes dubbed „Little Istanbul“ among the Turkish-speaking community, often appears like an unofficial province of Turkey, encapsulating the whole social, cultural and political spectrum of Turkey.

Other Ways You Can Help

We know the world of culture, we know Turkey, and we know the combination of both. In other words: We know money can be tight, especially if a project is asking for a contribution in Euro when your local currency is losing value on a two-digit level every day. 
So if you can't or won't contribute to our project financially, we understand 100 %. But if you like what we are doing, please know that there are other ways to support us.
It all boils down to this: Spread the word! Let your community know, share our campaign with your friends on- and offline, use the tools of indiegogo. We are thankful for every post, every like and every word-of-mouth-moment.

story:
Everything Hawaii with Kawika Singson

Kawika Singson has a passion for Hawaii's Big Island, one that he cultivated through adventure and photography.  A few years ago he began sharing his photos on Facebook. They were an instant hit.  Shooting and editing all of his own videos, the response from the internet was clear, with his videos getting millions of hits.

As fans of Kawika's work, we've set out to produce a television series.  Leveraging Farish Media's knowledge of broadcast television production, we aim to share these visual stories with the world. Farish Media is a Hawaii based video production company with 30 years of experience producing content for television series, commercials, websites and social media platforms.

Mission Statement

• Inspire Hawaii and the world with Kawika's story and his adventures around the Big Island

• Air 52 weekly episodes of Everything Hawaii on Spectrum OC16 starting in April 2018

• Provide free online access to all episodes

• Credit all contributors in every episode of Season 1 and on IMDb

Funding

As a small team, community support is vital to ensure that stories like Kawikas are told.

Your valued contributions will help ensure that this series is the best it can be.

Operational costs to produce a television series like this include equipment, studio time, local talent and all things production.

Other Ways You Can Help

Getting the word out is just as important as your contribution.  Please take a moment to share our @EverythingHawaiiTV page on Facebook, Instagram or any social media platform.  To make it easy, there are share buttons located near the top right of the campaign page.

story:
A Blank Canvas

Welcome to Becoming Bob!  My name is Alex and I am seeking your support to create the ultimate Bob Ross tribute channel on Youtube. This will not just be a handful of paint along shorts, but rather, a journey to understand what it means to “Become Bob.”

Painting along with Bob will form the core of the project because like many of you, I have long felt the urge to take Bob up on his challenge that anyone can learn to paint. Beginning with series 1, the first 13 episodes, I seek to paint along with all 403 episodes of The Joy of Painting. (31 series, 13 episodes each). I have no formal training and practically no experience with oil painting. In addition to the painting, I want to experience other aspects of what made Bob who he was. This includes going out into nature, spending time with animals, and of course talking to trees!

My history with Bob goes back to my childhood, when WIPB (Muncie’s local PBS station) was my primary source of televised entertainment. Because The Joy of Painting was filmed in Muncie, I have always felt a strong connection with Bob. In fact, it wasn’t until I was in college that I really learned of his influence across the globe. As an adult, I have found the show to be a haven, a place where all the troubles of the outside world fade away.

I know I am not alone in my desire to become more like Bob and I hope that you are one of those who feel compelled to join me in this journey.

It Starts With You

This campaign will raise support for Series 1 of Becoming Bob. Financially speaking, I will need $1,700 to cover all of my needs. Two-thirds of this money will go to cover the cost of paints and other supplies to create the paintings. The other third will go towards equipment to improve the quality of the show. This includes a set to match Bob’s, a couple of nicer cameras, and incidental items like tripods and wiring.

This campaign is about more than just raising funds. It is also about knowing that this is a project people want. For me, this is a passion project. I am not seeking to make any money by doing this. The time and effort of taping, formatting, editing and uploading the videos is all being done by me for free. Sure, I could just paint along with Bob in the privacy of my own home, but I believe that there are many people out there who aren’t ready to take that step. People who want to see someone else make a fool of themselves at first, but then to learn and grow and begin to create beautiful things. I hope that you are one of those people.

Supporting Becoming Bob isn’t without its benefits though. Backers can expect to receive some nice tokens of my appreciation, from social media shout outs, all the way up to actual paintings from Series 1. Perks will begin as early as December 2018 for shout outs and most perks will be available sometime in February 2019. Paintings will be available once filming for Series 1 is complete.

If I should not achieve this goal, I will use the funds I have acquired to produce as many episodes as possible and no one will be left without their perks being fulfilled. If I should exceed my goal, I will use the additional funds to further improve the show quality. I will also begin doing Bob type activities outside of painting, with the first activity being long walks through nature with a camera so that you can join me.

The Big Picture

I don’t think too many people can watch Bob paint and not feel the urge to try it themselves. After all, Bob invites you to join in every episode and continually promises that anyone can paint beautiful pictures. I think many people choose not to join in because painting isn’t the cheapest of hobbies and because they are unsure of their outcomes, especially starting out. I want to give people the opportunity to see someone give it a shot and see where it takes me. I believe that everything Bob has been telling us has been true this whole time, it’s all just a bravery test.

For this project to be authentic, it has to start from the very beginning. If I began Becoming Bob with years of painting experience it wouldn’t be the raw experience that it needs to be. At the same time, I know that no one would want to back this project if I hadn’t shown that I was ready to take that first step. And so I have created the pilot episode of Becoming Bob to prove that I am excited and eager to begin on my journey.

With your support I can take the next steps and complete Series 1. And, once that is under my belt, I can continue on to tackle the remaining 30 series of the Joy of Painting. This is an undertaking which is no small feat and will take years to accomplish, but with the right support I am up for the challenge!

No Mistakes, Only Happy Accidents

If you have watched the pilot episode then you know there are some challenges to this undertaking. Namely, I am doing this almost entirely on my own. I am the painter, designer, writer, film crew, and editing team. With most of these things I have only a little bit more experience than I do with oil painting and it shows.

However, I will grow in these areas as I grow in my painting. I am confident that with the correct equipment and a more permanent studio setup the production quality will greatly improve. This is especially true because the filming and editing of the show is fairly simple and every episode is the same to produce. The technical hurdles of the first episode have taught me a lot already and I have plans for improving many aspects of how the show is made.

Anyone Can Be a Friend

I understand that not everyone can help support Becoming Bob financially. But there are some other ways that you can help make Becoming Bob into a reality. Like, subscribe and, most importantly, share my Facebook and YouTube channel with everyone you know. Send me feedback and encouragement in emails and messages to let me know that you want to see me do this. And if you have experience with video production, I welcome your suggestions.

Whether you are one of my largest supporters or just someone who spreads the word, I can’t thank you enough. This project means a lot to me and it has taken me nearly two years to get the courage to make these initial steps. With your help I know we can do great things. So let’s Become Bob together!

story:
Who We Are & What This Is

Duplexity Productions is a two women team with lofty goals and a driving passion for film. We are a newly established company and our debut project will be a love letter to the industry that gives us our sense of purpose. Our series entitled “Breaking The Fourth Wall” is that love letter.

 

We want to focus on the talented people of this business and give them their opportunity to talk directly to you, to impart their unique journeys, successes, failures, hopes, and dreams on to you. We are excited to bring insight and awareness to the diversity of people and of the paths that this field is endowed with.

 

With your contributions, we can magnify the importance of each position in front of and behind the camera lens. We will explore the universal and unique experiences that are under the umbrella of film. Empathy and curiosity is a gift that film lovers and filmmakers share, and we would love to share that gift with you.

 

What We Need & What You Get

Our goal for this project is $2000; this money will be going directly to secure a great location in Downtown LA, hiring a great team: of lighting designers, sound technicians, cinematographers, and to make sure it’s edited and distributed skillfully.  This series will be budgeted precisely and without a penny to spare.

 

We appreciate any donation -- small and big! --  alike. We understand that not everyone has the means to donate financially. That’s okay! Here’s how you can help out in a big way:

Share:  Facebook/ Instagram/ Twitter / Snapchat you have it! Share with your friends online, in person, over the phone! Snail mail! We appreciate it all.

Connect:

Instagram — @duplexityprod 

Facebook—Duplexity Productions 

Website — duplexityproductions.com 

Vimeo—Vimeo.com/Duplexityproductions

story:
Who Are We?

In May 2016 we left Perth, Western Australia, to drive the entire world aboard our 1994 Delica! So far we've made our way around Australia, South East Asia and North America.

During this entire time we've been sharing our journey on Facebook, Instagram and Youtube, hoping both to encourage others to pursue their dreams as well as help the Delica Community with the knowledge the road has given us.

What Do We Want to Do?

With your help we will not only be able to tackle the next leg of our journey - South America here we come! - with much more confidence, but produce more content for you guys! Our plan is to install the locker on our own, following the instructions the product comes with, while recording the entire process and creating two videos you guys can learn from to help you make the diff decision yourselves. 

What Exactly We Need?

We need AU$ 575 - the exact amount 4WD Systems quoted us for a Lokka front locker for the Delica delivered to Perth! Not one cent more!

We'll do all the hard work of installing, filming and editing the videos ourselves!

What Do You Get?

  • A step-by-step tutorial on how to install a front diff locker to your Delica;
  • An unbiased and comprehensive review of the Lokka diff locker;
  • 20% discount off any of the products available at Overland Way's  Shop!
  • We are currently in negotiations with Lokka to provide a discount for buying your own lockers directly from 4WD Systems.

What Do We Get?

The opportunity to drive the rest of the world with front lockers in place!

Those who have been following us would have noticed our recent efforts trying to prepare the Delica for some rough tracks throughout South America. That's why we've just installed a Warn Winch, Airbag Man air suspensions and redone a lot of the bushings and the steering rack! So having front diff lockers would be an incredible help for us to get further off-road and share the adventures with you.

What if we don't reach the goal?

Unfortunately, if we don't reach the goal we won't be able to purchase the lockers and go ahead with the project. So if that's the case all money pledged will be refunded to those who have contributed!

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't pledge anything, you can still support us by liking our Facebook page, following us on Instagram and subscribing to our Youtube Channel! 

Facebook: www.facebook.com/OverlandWay
Instagram: www.instagram.com/OverlandWay
Youtube: www.youtube.com/OverlandWa

Thank you so much for supporting us! We couldn't have come this far without you guys!

Alex and Michaela.
story_txt:
Who Are We?
In May 2016 we left Perth, Western Australia, to drive the entire world aboard our 1994 Delica! So far we've made our way around Australia, South East Asia and North America.

During this entire time we've been sharing our journey on Facebook, Instagram and Youtube, hoping both to encourage others to pursue their dreams as well as help the Delica Community with the knowledge the road has given us.
What Do We Want to Do?
With your help we will not only be able to tackle the next leg of our journey - South America here we come! - with much more confidence, but produce more content for you guys! Our plan is to install the locker on our own, following the instructions the product comes with, while recording the entire process and creating two videos you guys can learn from to help you make the diff decision yourselves.

story:
What is TV Bootcamp?

TV Bootcamp is the intermediate TV production class at NYU's Tisch School of the Arts. Every fall, students form crews behind 2-4 projects to create a five part webseries. 

About Somnus

Having trouble falling or staying asleep? If counting sheep or drinking warm milk doesn't help, call Somnus Sleep Disorder Hotline! Somnus Sleep, Inc. follows Neil, an almost-college graduate, as he navigates adult life, the immediate aftermath of trauma, and finding a purpose in life, all to a backdrop of a slowly unfolding mystery and sleep issues stronger than all the melatonin in the world. 

The Crew

Like all film and television productions, creating Somnus is a collaborative process, and each crew member plays a vital role in working towards a final product. Students work together throughout the semester to create a series we're all proud of. The Somnus team is made up of multitalented individuals, from a team of writers, directors, producers and more. 

  • Divya Subbiah — Creator & Showrunner
  • Kennedy Shine — Executive Producer
  • Katerina Taetle & Blu Cervantes — Producers
  • Dani Bernal — Assistant Director
  • Jada Bethea, August George, Kennedy Shine, Divya Subbiah,  & Katerina Taetle — Writers
  • Jada Bethea, Blu Cervantes, Valentina Gonzalez, & August George — Directors

With Art Direction by Katerina Taetle, Script Supervision by Louisa McGrath, and Cinematography by Roomaline Chemaly.

Supervision and guidance from our incredible professor, Janet Tamaro, who is supporting and facilitating the production of this series. 

Why a Webseries?

Creating a webseries allows us to explore the episodic form in a way that is accessible and feasible for full-time college students. From our writers' room to the post production process, through TV Bootcamp we get to experience the full extent of a TV show production but in a scale that is fitting to our situation. 

Series often allow for the exploration of character in a way that single-standing works don't, and we hope to utilize the form to its fullest potential to tell Neil and Somnus' stories. 

How You Can Help

Every contribution counts! We're very grateful for any and all support, and any money donated will go towards securing locations, creating sets and props, transportation, and feeding our cast and crew on set. Making films in New York City is no small feat, and we appreciate your support — whether that be through this campaign, words of encouragement, or help with production. 

No amount is too small; every donation counts and goes a long way to help us make this series happen. Thank you for your time, and to keep up with the production of Somnus Sleep, Inc., follow us on Instagram, @somnussleepinc.

story:
X Loves Y

 

In our first year of BA Television Production at the University of Westminster, we will be producing a four part TV drama called 'X Loves Y'. We explore love in all forms and peoples real-life experiences from different perspectives.   

 

So a bit about us....... We have worked together to write four scripts which we now, as a year group, will use to produce a broadcast standard TV/Web series. During our academic year, we have had workshops in Camera, Editing, Lighting, Production Management, Screen Graphics and Sound to ensure we are all well prepared for our upcoming shoot.

 

 What We Need & What You Get

 

Here's where you come in! This is our first opportunity to really prove ourselves and make our first steps towards being ready for the tough industry we're all excited to break into. This means that want our production to be as good as it can possibly be and to do that we need some help to raise funds.

Your money will go towards all kinds of things we might need while producing X Loves Y, potentially including:

Feeding our talented cast

Equipment hire/purchase

Transportation of equipment

Hiring locations

Costumes, props and make-up 

Special FX

Copyrighted music

 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

 

We understand that not everyone can contribute to our fund, however you can help us spread the word about X Loves Y!

You can visit our website:  xlovesywestminster.wix.site.com/mysite

You can also follow us on the following social media sites. Please Like, Share and RT to help us out.

Twitter - https://twitter.com/xlovesyTV?lang=en

Facebook - https://www.facebook.com/xlovesy/

Instagram - @xlovesytv

Please use the handy IndieGoGo share tool and don't forget to tell a friend to tell a friend and family too about our campaign! 

 

Thank You!

story:
Short Summary

 

 

Who are we? 

Alain Terzoli and Adiza Shardow are the writers and lead actors of Adulting. They have been working on the show for two years with most of the story based on real life events. Adulting is their debut writing project. Follow the shows twitter @AdultingUk and instagram @adultinguktv for daily updates on the show #adulting

 

ALAIN TERZOLI 


Alain trained at Arts Educational Schools, London. He made his West End debut in Michael Grandages Production of ‘Guys and Dolls’ at the Piccadilly Theatre. His first feature film was ‘Crux’ shot at Pinewood, where he played Cameron. He has recently completed filming ‘Night Bus’ at the Three Mills Studios playing the role of Leo. Alain also performed in the UK Premiere of 'Farragut North' written by Beau Willimon (House of Cards) at the Southwark Playhouse and has most recently shot the guest role of Marco Fiorelli in 'Doctors' for the BBC.

Spotlight alainactor

Instagram alainterzoli

Twitter @alainterzoli

 

Adiza Shardow

 

Adiza Shardow trained at The Royal Conservatoire of Scotland. Her best known roles on TV are Liberty Gordon in the BBC drama Waterloo Road, and currently in BBC Scotland’s drama River City as new regular Shelley Belmont. Adiza joined the award winning Sketch Pack, a comedy webseries on YouTube from Wolfpack Productions in 2016. She has apperead in a number of sketches and pencilled her first one called 'Toodle Loo' which has been shown at many festivals.

 

Spotlight  adizaactor

Instagram adizashardow

Twitter  @adizadiva7

 

What we need and what you get?

 

Our goal is to shoot a pilot episode in four days in July/August.

In order to do this we need to raise £3000

The funding will be going towards:

  • Directing
  • Director of Photography
  • Camera Op
  • Sound
  • Script Supervisor
  • Runner
  • Set dresser
  • Costume
  • Make up
  • Catering 
  • Kit Hire
  • Insurance 
  • Contingency 
  • Editing

So overall the budget will get you a finished episode ready for viewing in October/November time to a high standard. 

 

As a reward we will do daily shout outs on our social media and give invites out to the ADULTING screening we will be hosting in London.

If we don't reach our goal we will still put what we have raised to the project and try our best to still produce a decent episode for viewing ,even if it means cutting back on things. 

The Impact

ADULTING is a story that's based on true events of both Alain and Adiza. They wanted to tell a story of the outsiders who never feel accepted in life. The goal is to have a narrative thats relatable and inspiring to anyone who has ever felt rejected by society.

 

The Team

 

We are working with the award winning Wolfpack Productions who have filmed multiple webseries and sketches on YouTube up to a high standard. One including Adiza Shardows writing debut on a sketch called "Toodle Loo" which she also starred in. Toodle Loo has been shown at various comedy festivals. You can check the guys website and view Toodle Loo by clicking below 

Website

wolfpackproductionsweb

Twitter

wolfpackproductions

Toddle Loo Sketch by Adiza Shardow 

toddle loo

 

THE CAST

We have selected a very talented and diverse cast who will all be appearing as supporting characters. We are lucky to be working with the finest and freshest talent the industry has to offer. For more info on each cast members  check out our social media 

Instagram @adultinguktv

Twitter @AdultingUk

 

 

 

 

THE MUSIC

Soundtrack to our trailer and pilot is from the amazing artist Danny Wright check out his stuff by clicking the link below 

Danny Wright

 

 

R

 

 

 

 

 

 

Risks & Challenges

 

We plan to film in July but there is a possibility it could be pushed back to August. If this happens for whatever reason we will reschedule and make sure that we will have a finished product by October/November 2018.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

 

If you can't contribute on the money side of things, there are other ways you can help us achieve our goal. Spreading the word to your friends and contacts would be a massive help to us. This can be done by using the Indiegogo share option below :)

story:
Project Summary

Frequency: Delirium is an exciting new project for a webisode series. The series is intense, dark and mysterious. 

Background

My name is Luke Russell and I am currently studying film production as a degree. I have worked on lots of student short films and I am now looking to step up the scale of my productions. By creating this series, I aim to gain more production skills and experience in Directing/Producing/Writing. I am passionate about creating vivid and compelling worlds that really get people hooked, so I look forward to creating this episodic story!

By donating to this project, it will massively help create a strong believable world. There are some incredibly talented people working on this project, from Producers and Production Designers to Cinematographers and Sound Designers. I strongly believe together we can create a great piece of drama. However, having a more substantial budget will help us purchase the locations/props/set design to create a stunning and immersive world. 

As a production team, we believe in our world and we are determined to realise it. If you help donate we can use our passion to deliver you with great drama that will have you on the edge of your seat.  

What We Need...

  • Money.

 What For?

  • We need roughly £500 to help fund our film.
  • The money will go towards several different things, but primarily:
  1. Hiring a room in London to hold cast auditions.
  2. Paying travel expenses of the actors involved. 
  3. Purchasing props, costume and dressing the set.

If you feel you can donate any amount, great or small, you will be rewarded with one of our perks. From the donation of £1 to the full £500 we will reward you with our unique gifts. These gifts range from a credit in the series, to a poster print and even a copy of the script, (once the show has aired)!

Our Goals

We want to create great drama. We all watch shows like Game of Thrones and Breaking Bad, it is our ambition to create this quality of entertainment. 

Previously I have produced a 16mm film project, directed two micro shorts and I'm currently directing another micro short called Dark Fortune. By working on these projects I have learnt a great deal and now I'm ready for the next, bigger project...Frequency: Delirium.

Production on this project has already started, so even if we receive no funding at all, the series will be created. With your financial help we can add so much more production value to this project and in return we can give our audience a great story.

Other Ways You Can Help

Please share this project so we can hopefully achieve our goal. Our production team are really excited by this project and we want Frequency: Delirium to be a show that leaves people wanting more. So please, spread the word!

story:
Short Summary

  • "True Friends" is a web series written and created by John-Michael Jalonen and Madison Landis, co-founders of HimHer Productions. Together, they have made the short films "The Fittest" and "Movie Night". They have also written, produced, directed, and starred in 3 Off-Off Broadway shows in NYC since December 2016.
  • We are independent filmmakers with a network of talented up-and-coming actors, directors, writers, cinematographers, gaffers, and more embarking to make an incredibly ambitious project together.

What We Need

"$1500 for what?!"

  • Cast and crew travel expenses
  • Feeding and housing 15 people stuck in a house with each other for 4 days 
  • Lights, camera, and sound equipment rentals
  • Insurance and location permits
  • Post-production costs (editing, color correcting, etc)

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Spread the word! Let people know about the "True Friends" Indiegogo campaign!
  • Watch our series trailer and share it!
  • Follow us on social media for updates! We're @himherprods on Instagram, Twitter, and Vimeo!

story:
What Is Mars About?

Mars: Interstellar Adventures is a journey of self-discovery, understanding one's place in the universe, and lots and lots of drinking kale smoothies through sepia filters on the totally-not-the-same instafame app. 

Mars is a self-absorbed avatar who lives on earth and has found a new passion for being internet famous. What she wants, she gets, and she lives in a bubble without any consequences to her actions...or so she thinks. Unfortunately, the Planetary Society has a certain disdain for Mars, and her public identity makes her vulnerable to attack. However, Mars is by no means helpless. As an avatar, she possesses superhuman strength and various martial combat skills necessary to defend herself. However, she'd just rather go for a cappuccino run and gossip with her friends. In time, Mars will understand her place in the universe and will have to choose her own destiny.

We really wanted to create an epic adventure with some slices of life that holds a mirror to life. So many messages and lessons can be had from Mars and her ways, and we hope our audience can relate to Mars and the supporting cast as we take you across the galaxy in a story too big to tell in just a one-off episode. Coming of age, overcoming fear, and being split between two worlds are just a fraction of the themes we wish to explore with this story. There is a lot of heart in Mars and company, and her story starts here: with you!

Here is a sample of our style thus far. Check it out!

 

One of the ventures that Chad took up when he was a teenager was music. He was in and out of multiple garage bands, playing guitar in all of them and writing music. Now, he wants to take his style and bring it to life in Mars. Music has always been a gigantic part of any show, and Chad wishes to make the very best he can provide given his materials for the show. Mars is a journey unlike any other, and thus the music must represent the various emotions that our hero and supporting casts feels depending on the situation. Anger, fear, joy, determination, these emotions are amplified with the right soundtrack, thus creating an out of this world experience. He plans to use a DAW (digital audio workstation), but still wants to find a way to implement some hard rock guitar into the soundtrack.  

The current music that is playing in the teaser promotional video is not music created by the studio :) With your help, we want to fix that!

Here's a video of him rocking out with a raw guitar sample:

 

MARS - ANGELA HANSEN

The leading lady herself, Angela Hansen delivers the style, grace, and sass that brings Mars to life. Personal trainer (and happy vegan!) by day, voice actress by night! 

You can find Angela online here:

Twitter

MCLOKEN - PLUTO

McLoken is an up and coming voice actor/partnered twitch streamer. Loken plays Pluto, the Avatar for furthest planet from the sun who is hell bent on destroying Mars. His icy presence and deceivingly friendly demeanor warrants nothing but caution from the frozen spectre. You can hear his voiceover work here:

You can also find him online here:

Twitter

Twitch

Our startup studio consists of two people working out of a super small office room. Cozy, isn't it? However, big things come in small packages. Both of us have a wide variety of skills with an absolute passion for storytelling by any medium. 

 

Chad Garza (commonly known as Smoofheigen on Twitch) Creator/Animator/Writer/Voice Actor/Artist/Music Composer

Chad has been practicing storytelling since he was a child. One of his first instances of narrative was doing voice acting for his parents and friends. Not soon after, small short stories were being created with his toys in his bedroom and with his friends at school. Growing up watching highly successful cartoons (and still to this day) such as Dragon Ball Z, Batman: The Animated Series and many, many more, Chad soon formed dreams of telling epic stories in his own way. In college, he studied film, and how methodology is such an incredible factor when it comes to telling a story that you and your audience can enjoy and understand. Storytelling is his utmost passion, and something he lives and breathes every day. Now, he is more than excited to bring Mars to audiences and tell an original story of his own, just like the shows he still looks up to to this day. 

Follow him on Twitter: https://twitter.com/Therealsmoof

Haley Crandell  (commonly known as ChickNuggs on Twitch...funny I know) Illustration/Story/Background Design

Haley has known her whole life that she wanted to entertain people. From being a little kid practicing stand-up comedy with her mom, to performing/directing/writing small little plays that she would perform for the neighborhood kids, to even creating and filming elaborate soap operas with her dolls. Creating things has always been something she loves doing. Throughout the years she's pursued several different art mediums, from wanting to be a dancer, director, comedian, voice actor, writer, even a magician at one point…crazy I know. But throughout all the different things she’s tried, one thing remains the same: she loves entertaining others with stories. Some of her favorite animated shows that helped influence some ideas for Mars would be Avatar: The Last Airbender, Death Note, The Powerpuff Girls, Samurai Jack, and many, many more. 

Follow her on Twitter: https://twitter.com/ChickNuggs_

Haley and Chad started dating after they discovered they shared the same vision in careers. Living the dream, they work out of a small office room via parent's house that was graciously given to them. After being together for 2 years, both of them decided it's time to start a studio from the ground up to bring their dreams into reality. Since they are an incredibly small studio of just two people, they utilize one of their greatest superpowers gained via radioactive cosmic rays: resourcefulness. Both people understand their limitations in production, and bring a storytelling medium that is unique and effective as you have seen above. We wish to grow and bring in more people in time, but for now the project suits both of them and their capabilities! 

Also our studio has Jaina Proudmoore (Blizzard fans here), our precious baby(not) cat who demands your constant attention and love, even when you're knee deep in work. We also affectionately call her "poopy". She really is a big ol' attention hog. 

In order for something to be polished the best it can within the studio's capacity, a full time endeavor is the only option. Given our current situation of pursuing freelance work and juggling part time jobs, its almost impossible to give Mars the attention it deserves to become something truly great. This is why we have turned to you and are asking for your help!

The risks are also incredibly important to consider too! Financially, we live paycheck to paycheck at the moment with very little to spare each month. We've devoted our lives to creating art, and our financials show for it unfortunately. However, in order to make the first five episodes as great as it can be, we need your help to buy us some time to ensure that Mars is truly something amazing. We estimate 150+ hours of work to make sure that this gets made right (this isn't just including animation, but also song writing/composing, voice over work and workflow management). The odds are stacked against us, but we know that we can persevere and make the show that you deserve! 

Here is what our budget will be divided up into so you know what exactly your funding is going towards:

Once we receive our funding (after September 18th) we are planning the next 6 months to create the first five episodes for you guys. We predict that Mid March (hey, close to Chad's birthday, March 14th!) will be our estimated completion date for the first half of the season. If we can finish sooner, then great! Hopefully, we can produce an episode once a month at the duration of 5 mins per episode. This includes animation, voice acting, storyboarding, music production, art design and project management. We plan to stick to the schedule we set out, but are also aware of one of our greatest adversaries: life. It gets in the way when it wants to without rhyme or reason. If anything were to happen, we'll keep you updated on social media that we provide in the campaign. Regardless, we plan to conquer life with an iron fist and indomitable will!

*Merch above are just examples, not final product. Final product will be perfected over time*

 

Other Ways You Can Help

- SPREAD THE WORD! Just because you can't donate doesn't mean you don't know anyone who can. Use the Indiegogo tools and share our campaign!

- Give us a like, follow, retweet, share on ALL of the social media!

- ALSO, make sure to watch out for our show on our YouTube channel! Subscribe and turn on the bell notifications to get an alert when we launch the series!
story_txt:
What Is Mars About?
Mars: Interstellar Adventures is a journey of self-discovery, understanding one's place in the universe, and lots and lots of drinking kale smoothies through sepia filters on the totally-not-the-same instafame app. 
Mars is a self-absorbed avatar who lives on earth and has found a new passion for being internet famous. What she wants, she gets, and she lives in a bubble without any consequences to her actions...or so she thinks. Unfortunately, the Planetary Society has a certain disdain for Mars, and her public identity makes her vulnerable to attack. However, Mars is by no means helpless. As an avatar, she possesses superhuman strength and various martial combat skills necessary to defend herself. However, she'd just rather go for a cappuccino run and gossip with her friends. In time, Mars will understand her place in the universe and will have to choose her own destiny.
We really wanted to create an epic adventure with some slices of life that holds a mirror to life. So many messages and lessons can be had from Mars and her ways, and we hope our audience can relate to Mars and the supporting cast as we take you across the galaxy in a story too big to tell in just a one-off episode. Coming of age, overcoming fear, and being split between two worlds are just a fraction of the themes we wish to explore with this story. There is a lot of heart in Mars and company, and her story starts here: with you!
Here is a sample of our style thus far. Check it out!

 

One of the ventures that Chad took up when he was a teenager was music. He was in and out of multiple garage bands, playing guitar in all of them and writing music. Now, he wants to take his style and bring it to life in Mars. Music has always been a gigantic part of any show, and Chad wishes to make the very best he can provide given his materials for the show. Mars is a journey unlike any other, and thus the music must represent the various emotions that our hero and supporting casts feels depending on the situation. Anger, fear, joy, determination, these emotions are amplified with the right soundtrack, thus creating an out of this world experience. He plans to use a DAW (digital audio workstation), but still wants to find a way to implement some hard rock guitar into the soundtrack.  
The current music that is playing in the teaser promotional video is not music created by the studio :) With your help, we want to fix that!
Here's a video of him rocking out with a raw guitar sample:

story:
The food scene in Kitchener-Waterloo is underrated. 

This year, Nick Benninger (Harmony Lunch, Marbles, Uptown 21, Tacofarm) and Taylor Jackson (local filmmaker) will be eating and drinking across our region, visiting our most celebrated spots and hidden treasures.

This campaign is to fund Season 1 of the show, which will be 7 episodes total.

We are an independent show that will be released online starting April 5th, 2018.

Us on 570 News! (We start at 24:30)
http://www.570news.com/2018/01/29/monday-january-29th-2018-9am/


Online Record Article: https://www.therecord.com/news-story/8107898-waterloo-region-restaurateur-and-filmmaker-launch-food-show/

Things that are important to you:

1. You can be in the Season 1 finale! Monday April 16th at 7pm we will be filming the finale episode at Taco Farm in Waterloo. You can join us for the episode, and also for the dinner we create. There are only 30 seats available, so get your seat quickly if you'd like to join us. (It's available in the perks, and seats are only available on this Indiegogo campaign!)

2. You can be a producer of the show! Associate and Executive producer roles are available in the perks. You'll get your name on every episode of the show. Surprise your friends and family with the news that you're famous.

3. Learn to cook with Nick! There are 3 cooking classes available with Nick at Uptown 21.

4. You can be a guest on the show! Join us for a 5 minute segment in Season 2. We'll figure out together which culinary experience we all want to do together.

5. You can learn video production! Taylor is hosting a single day class that will teach you how to make videos either for your business or for YouTube. This is the first and only time this in person class will ever happen, and you can only get it through this Indiegogo campaign.

6. Kitchener-Waterloo Food Tour in a Limo Bus! Join Nick, Taylor and Brentwood Livery for a culinary tour around KW. We will visit stops on Season 1 of the show, as well as a few other hidden gems of the region. Meeting the chefs, and eating their food.
The Brentwood Livery Limbusine is the nicest vehicle in all of Kitchener-Waterloo, and will be your home for this tour. Less than 20 spots available total, so get your ticket soon!

GET YOUR COMPANY OR ORGANIZATION INVOLVED!

Sponsorship Packages:

HELP US MAKE THIS SHOW FOR THE COMMUNITY!

story:
WELCOME TO THE LAND!

When you think of the continent called Africa, what comes to mind? Is it Lions and Elephants, Tarzan and Jane, Bushmen and mud huts? Please, we don't mean to offend you, but...

...well what if we told you that there are many worlds completely unknown to most people on the planet that exist all throughout the unbelievable continent of Africa??

Would you like to see it in a way that you have never seen before???

We want to show it to you!

 
 

 

THE STORY

Jared Henderson, AKA Jah Kobi, is a born and raised African-American who has successfully expatriated (or repatriated) to Ghana, West Africa. It was never his true plan to return to The Land of his ancestors, but his experiences allowed the idea for The Land  to begin and grow in the mind of it's creator, producer and host.

Jah first visited and fell in love with Ghana in 2012 through a work study opportunity while completing a bachelor's degree in International Studies at North Carolina  A&T SU. In 2014, after graduating university, Jah returned to Ghana to work with an International church organization who were building a TV station where he was brought on board to assist in content creation. When approached to help create original programming, Jah knew already what he wanted to produce.

He created a show called "Go Ghana" (links below) with the purpose of sharing with the viewers an experience of Ghana similar to his own. Go Ghana gained much success locally and in neighboring African countries, but Jah's vision extended much further then what he was being allowed to do at the time. The pieces seemed to begin to fall perfectly in place for what was to come.

 

   

 

After finding his now beautiful Ghanaian wife and birthing a wonderful African-born son, all in Ghana, and about 6 beautiful years later, the idea for The Land was finally born. From his dream of sharing his amazing experience of what Africa truly had to offer the world, Jah and his team of amazing artists and technicians, began to create what they believe will shape history and change the world one viewer at a time.

 

THE MISSION

It is the year 2020 and globalization, technology and the sheer will of mankind have made the world "smaller" in the sense that people can share their cultures and connect in ways that had never been possible in the history of mankind. However, for whatever reason, Africa is still a mystery for most people in the world. Many people may think Africa is one big country, or that most people still live in the bush with gorillas, lions,  tigers and... water buffalo. While others are even surprised that there are cars, highways, millionaires and even billionaires in most African countries. The Land wants to blow the minds of people all over the world. 

The Land aims to do what no one has truly been able to achieve before, bring the wonderment of Africa's past and present into the homes of the world abroad and show how its future may be even brighter. By showing the colorful and rich cultures, complicated and fascinating history and an immeasurable and vast potential, The Land will reshape the image of Africa in the minds of people all over the world.

In every episode of The Land, Jah Kobi will embark on an adventure in a different city or region of Africa (spending most of the first season in Ghana).  Each episode will be themed by a different aspect of African society and culture (History, food, tradition, etc) and Jah will feature the people, places and things associated with those themes (divided by segments). One important segment consistent throughout every episode will be the highlight of an entity (person, business, etc) by which The Land will support directly or act as a liaison to obtain support for. Every episode will tell a story that will be thoughtfully written, planned and produced with sufficient research, care and an unbiased rawness that you can only otherwise get by a visit to The Land yourself. 

 

HOW WE CAN DO IT!

We not only want to broadcast to the world what much of Africa can feel, smell, sound and even taste like, but WE NEED YOU to be a part of making it happen. Though, for a production of this quality and magnitude, our ultimate goal is to raise $1.3 million. We have calculated our immediate financial needs at an approximated $444,000 (budget available upon request).  Our hope is that all our contributors not only help us create the production and accomplish our goals, but more so help us achieve the vision of a world that realizes and appreciates the great continent of Africa. The following are some of the deliverables to help us get there:

  • We want to use this fundraiser to jump start the production of the series and produce the first 2 Seasons as soon as possible for international syndication. 
  • We want to complete the first season of 13 episodes within 9 months of reaching or goal. WE CAN DO IT!
  • We want to make EVERY contributor an ambassador for The Land and all its associations through the perks we offer.
  • Perks include:The Land clothing and accessories, name mentioning in credits, guided trips, access to exclusive content, partnership opportunities and much more!
  • We will support the communities we feature through the funds raised and deals made throughout the production (more info below in "Growing The Land")

 

THE VISION

As stated before, we envision a world that appreciates the great continent of Africa for what it truly is and realizes the potential of what it can become. We also realize that cannot be done solely through a few seasons of a travel and culture TV production. Nonetheless, we intend it to start with The Land.

We want The Land to ultimately become a platform that helps to launch various businesses, projects and other entities with the purposes of uplifting the many countries of Africa and most of all its people. The show will not only bring to light the sights and sounds of the countries we feature, but more so the heart and soul of the continent. This brings us to one of the most important aspects of our project. 

 

GROWING THE LAND

Please don't get confused. This whole fundraiser is about growing The Land... the TV show. However, as a part of our ultimate vision, we want The Land to contribute to the overall growth of Africa, the Motherland, and its people. The following are ways we will support the communities we feature on the show:

  • Every episode will feature and an entity (person, business, etc) who contributes to the overall growth of the content and is in need of support to grow further, by which we will help them obtain. 
  • We will donate a percentage of The Land's earnings to schools, orphanages, rehabilitation centers and more, with the help of its contributors and viewers alike. 
  • All of the employed production team will be persons of the African Diaspora. 
  • We will bring the wonderment of Africa that has been hidden from the world so the future is full of those that look to this great land with hope 

 

CHALLENGES

Of course there are challenges! To bring darkness to the light is not meant to be easy, but where there's a will there is always a way. We, Jah Kobi and the rest of The Land team, are dedicated to achieving the mission and vision no matter what obstacles stand in our way.

Even if we don't raise a single $1 in this campaign, we will begin shooting as early as April to begin obtaining footage for future episodes. Of course, to achieve the goal of 13 episodes in 9 months (26 in 18 months) we will definitely need to raise more funds to expand the team and its resources, but we will continue to work diligently to achieve our vision.

Nonetheless... we have already gotten started:

  • We have already personally acquired basic equipment to begin acquiring content. 
  • We shot and started post-production for the pilot episode (which will be available for all contributors to view) 
  • We have created a rough production schedule for Q2 2020 which includes concepts, locations, events and people to feature. 

After we spend much of the first season in Ghana, we plan to begin traveling to various other African countries (like Nigeria, South Africa, Rwanda and many more) that we will continue on in the 2nd season and even further seasons thereafter. Many of these international locations require work visas and permits to shoot there. The time to acquire these documents may prohibit us from being able to shoot there on schedule, but these are issues that the team is experienced and well prepared to handle. 

If you have locations suggestions, connections or advice for any international locations, please email the team at thelandtvshow@gmail.com.

 

NOT ABLE TO CONTRIBUTE $$$?

No problem! Even if you can't donate money WE STILL NEED YOU!

Though we have writers and producers that will provide their ideas and visions for the show, we want all of our contributors to be able to positively be a part of the origin and building of The Land and its goals. 

We welcome all ideas in regards to WHAT YOU WANT to see:

  • style of the show and its segments
  • events that you might want us to attend and feature
  • people you would like to get to know
  • places / locations you want us to visit

And if none of the above you can always SPREAD THE WORD!

 

THE CREW

Jared "Jah Kobi" Henderson @jahkobi_official  (https://www.instagram.com/jahkobi_official/)

Creator / Writer / Producer / Host

Links to associated works:

  • https://youtu.be/sH8jN2SS2IM
  • https://youtu.be/XLW64nkEUEo

 

Henry Hayford  @takyinative  https://www.instagram.com/takyi_natives/

 

Producer / Director / Head of Production 

Links to associated works:

  • https://www.ghvibes.net/meet-takyi-native-the-m...
  • [https://www.google.com/amp/s/www.newsghana.com....
  • https://youtu.be/RH_aNTLlipY

 

Emmanuel Hayford  

Associate Producer / Production Coordinator

Links to associated works

  • https://youtu.be/RH_aNTLlipY

 

OTHER CREW:

Joel Essiaw - Editor

Peter Cheko - Camera, light & sound

Joojo Daniels - Camera, light & sound

Many people may think Africa is one big country, or that most people still live in the bush with gorillas, lions,  tigers and... water buffalo. While others are even surprised that there are cars, highways, millionaires and even billionaires in most African countries. The Land wants to blow the minds of people all over the world. 
The Land aims to do what no one has truly been able to achieve before, bring the wonderment of Africa's past and present into the homes of the world abroad and show how its future may be even brighter. By showing the colorful and rich cultures, complicated and fascinating history and an immeasurable and vast potential, The Land will reshape the image of Africa in the minds of people all over the world.
In every episode of The Land, Jah Kobi will embark on an adventure in a different city or region of Africa (spending most of the first season in Ghana).  Each episode will be themed by a different aspect of African society and culture (History, food, tradition, etc) and Jah will feature the people, places and things associated with those themes (divided by segments). One important segment consistent throughout every episode will be the highlight of an entity (person, business, etc) by which The Land will support directly or act as a liaison to obtain support for. Every episode will tell a story that will be thoughtfully written, planned and produced with sufficient research, care and an unbiased rawness that you can only otherwise get by a visit to The Land yourself. 
 
HOW WE CAN DO IT!

We not only want to broadcast to the world what much of Africa can feel, smell, sound and even taste like, but WE NEED YOU to be a part of making it happen. Though, for a production of this quality and magnitude, our ultimate goal is to raise $1.3 million. We have calculated our immediate financial needs at an approximated $444,000 (budget available upon request).  Our hope is that all our contributors not only help us create the production and accomplish our goals, but more so help us achieve the vision of a world that realizes and appreciates the great continent of Africa. The following are some of the deliverables to help us get there:

We want to use this fundraiser to jump start the production of the series and produce the first 2 Seasons as soon as possible for international syndication. 
We want to complete the first season of 13 episodes within 9 months of reaching or goal. WE CAN DO IT!

We want to make EVERY contributor an ambassador for The Land and all its associations through the perks we offer.


Perks include:The Land clothing and accessories, name mentioning in credits, guided trips, access to exclusive content, partnership opportunities and much more!
We will support the communities we feature through the funds raised and deals made throughout the production (more info below in "Growing The Land")

 
THE VISION


As stated before, we envision a world that appreciates the great continent of Africa for what it truly is and realizes the potential of what it can become. We also realize that cannot be done solely through a few seasons of a travel and culture TV production. Nonetheless, we intend it to start with The Land.
We want The Land to ultimately become a platform that helps to launch various businesses, projects and other entities with the purposes of uplifting the many countries of Africa and most of all its people. The show will not only bring to light the sights and sounds of the countries we feature, but more so the heart and soul of the continent. This brings us to one of the most important aspects of our project. 
 
GROWING THE LAND
Please don't get confused. This whole fundraiser is about growing The Land... the TV show. However, as a part of our ultimate vision, we want The Land to contribute to the overall growth of Africa, the Motherland, and its people. The following are ways we will support the communities we feature on the show:

Every episode will feature and an entity (person, business, etc) who contributes to the overall growth of the content and is in need of support to grow further, by which we will help them obtain. 
We will donate a percentage of The Land's earnings to schools, orphanages, rehabilitation centers and more, with the help of its contributors and viewers alike. 
All of the employed production team will be persons of the African Diaspora. 
We will bring the wonderment of Africa that has been hidden from the world so the future is full of those that look to this great land with hope 

 

CHALLENGES
Of course there are challenges! To bring darkness to the light is not meant to be easy, but where there's a will there is always a way. We, Jah Kobi and the rest of The Land team, are dedicated to achieving the mission and vision no matter what obstacles stand in our way.
Even if we don't raise a single $1 in this campaign, we will begin shooting as early as April to begin obtaining footage for future episodes. Of course, to achieve the goal of 13 episodes in 9 months (26 in 18 months) we will definitely need to raise more funds to expand the team and its resources, but we will continue to work diligently to achieve our vision.
Nonetheless... we have already gotten started:

We have already personally acquired basic equipment to begin acquiring content. 
We shot and started post-production for the pilot episode (which will be available for all contributors to view) 
We have created a rough production schedule for Q2 2020 which includes concepts, locations, events and people to feature. 

After we spend much of the first season in Ghana, we plan to begin traveling to various other African countries (like Nigeria, South Africa, Rwanda and many more) that we will continue on in the 2nd season and even further seasons thereafter. Many of these international locations require work visas and permits to shoot there. The time to acquire these documents may prohibit us from being able to shoot there on schedule, but these are issues that the team is experienced and well prepared to handle. 
If you have locations suggestions, connections or advice for any international locations, please email the team at thelandtvshow@gmail.com.
 

NOT ABLE TO CONTRIBUTE $$$?
No problem! Even if you can't donate money WE STILL NEED YOU!
Though we have writers and producers that will provide their ideas and visions for the show, we want all of our contributors to be able to positively be a part of the origin and building of The Land and its goals. 
We welcome all ideas in regards to WHAT YOU WANT to see:

style of the show and its segments
events that you might want us to attend and feature
people you would like to get to know
places / locations you want us to visit

And if none of the above you can always SPREAD THE WORD!
 
THE CREW
Jared "Jah Kobi" Henderson @jahkobi_official  (https://www.instagram.com/jahkobi_official/)

Creator / Writer / Producer / Host
Links to associated works:

https://youtu.be/sH8jN2SS2IM
https://youtu.be/XLW64nkEUEo

 
Henry Hayford  @takyinative  https://www.instagram.com/takyi_natives/
 
Producer / Director / Head of Production 
Links to associated works:

https://www.ghvibes.net/meet-takyi-native-the-m...
[https://www.google.com/amp/s/www.newsghana.com....

https://youtu.be/RH_aNTLlipY

 
Emmanuel Hayford  

Associate Producer / Production Coordinator
Links to associated works
https://youtu.be/RH_aNTLlipY
 
OTHER CREW:
Joel Essiaw - Editor
Peter Cheko - Camera, light & sound
Joojo Daniels - Camera, light & sound

story:
As recent graduates of Northwestern University, where we spent four years learning how the arts of theatre, radio, television, and film can help make sense of the world, we begin our adult lives facing the most senseless time in living memory. Art has simultaneously become both more essential than ever and dramatically harder to make. Viral is our way to contribute to the conversation in spite of the obstacles. 

VIRAL

Viral is a web series positioned in the very recent past to explore the extended now. It’s a nonlinear comedy about memory, identity, and the insidious effects of the algorithm.

Quick gloss on TikTok from Wikipedia: TikTok is a viral video-sharing social networking service. It is used to create short music, lip-sync, dance, comedy and talent videos of 3 to 60 seconds.

THE RECENT PAST  [the story]

A naive, metropolitan duo (her bob is asymmetrical, and yes, he’s gay) has escaped to the dunes, but why? The concatenation of events is revealed in fragments as the past returns to them along with the very TikToks that led them to online popularity and real world insanity and criminality. It’s hard to piece it all together—the con artist ex-roommate, the dreaded side jobs, and the absent or non-existent boyfriends—because there’s no escape from the surreality of memory when you’re dealing with brains addled by drugs, the scroll of the feed, the distortion of truth in a curated social media presence, a general numbness to extremity, a thirst for individuation, and a sustained, hypochondriatic anxiety (we were scared enough of vaping let alone coronavirus... Obviously, not scared enough to quit vaping, but we considered it!). Susan Sontag warned us about employing illness as metaphor, but it now seems impossible to do anything else. Capturing the texture of contemporary life, Viral follows its two directionless artists-turned-would-be-influencers on an exploration of what’s happening in the vanguard of popular entertainment and how it affects the psyche. What is making yourself into your art but self-cannibalism? 

If this all sounds a bit heady, it's just because we're trying to impress you. For instance the line “is it possible to burn water?” might be described on here as a Zen kōan, but in episode 4, it's Chloe's plea for help while making Kraft mac and cheese for the first time. And yes, that really happened.

THE NOW [the impact]

As José Esteban Muñoz writes in Cruising Utopia, there exists an “anticipatory illumination of art, which can be characterized as the process of identifying certain properties that can be detected in representational practices helping us to see the not-yet-conscious.” That is, the artist is the canary in the mineshaft. With Viral, we are exploring the ways in which the success of TikTok reveals to us the state of our collective subconscious. TikTok is perfectly designed to divert us from the ongoing crisis of the 21st century by flooding our senses to the point of displacing any engagement with the material reality while enacting our greater societal fantasy of upward mobility without material consequences. 

We are eager to create art that is attentive to the present moment and in conversation with many other works exploring other facets of this incredibly complicated time. We believe art is worth supporting, but we also believe that it is imperative to support and uplift BIPOC and their communities. In mind of that, we are taking part in the Change the Lens Pledge which aims to ensure the representation of black filmmakers by calling for an at least 15% black crew on film sets.

We know that it is possible to support art and social justice simultaneously, and we hope our audience feels the same way.  So, please consider donating to the following organizations:

Black Trans Advocacy Coalition (https://blacktrans.org)

The Okra Project (https://www.theokraproject.com)

Black Visions Collective (https://www.blackvisionsmn.org/)

WHAT WE NEED

While our actors are volunteering their time, and our shooting locations are free, we are hoping to use your help to cover these costs:
Equipment Rental & Insurance-We want our crew behind the lens to have access to the highest quality of equipment (cameras, lighting, sound, etc.)  to make the most sophisticated product possible.
Crew-Our talented crew members are professionals with many years of industry experience, and we will be compensating them for their hard work.
Production Design-Props, costumes, and set design will allow us to create the world of the series.
Transportation-We need to rent vehicles to transport the cast, crew, and equipment.
Food-Meals will be provided on set for all cast and crew.
Submission Fees-We plan to submit Viral to film festivals around the country to reach as large of an audience as possible.
Contingency-A small portion of our budget is set aside to cover any unforeseen costs, as well as to ensure a safe and sanitary set amidst the Covid-19 Pandemic.

WHO WE ARE

Miles Blim (co-writer, co-star, co-director) is a Chicago-born, New York-based artist. He recently graduated from Northwestern where he studied theatre. He’s performed in several professional productions and is eager to explore the full range of his artistic interests.

Chloe Howard (co-writer, co-star) is a New York-based actor originally from the California Bay Area. She is a graduate of Northwestern University where she studied theatre, performed as a member of Northwestern Sketch Television, and acted in many short films and theatrical productions. Since moving to New York, Chloe has performed professionally around the city, primarily working on developmental processes for new musicals.

Camille Casmier (co-director) is a director who lives in Brooklyn, NY. Since graduating from Northwestern University's directing program, she has directed theatre, music videos, promo videos, and shorts. She also works in development at Tiny Reparations.

Leo Gallagher (director of photography) is a freelance cinematographer based in Brooklyn, NY. Experienced with documentary, narrative, and corporate. He received his B.A. from Northwestern University, double majoring in Radio/Television/Film and History of the Americas. Leo is mentored by Luke Geissbühler. He’s shot for Old Navy, RadicalMedia, Participant Media, and director Andrew Rossi.

Jessica Levin (artistic producer) is a New York-based director and producer. She attended Northwestern University where she earned her B.A. in theatre with a minor in psychology. Jess has worked with many New York arts organizations, including The Drama League, Atlantic Theater Company, A3 Artists Agency, Jax Media, and The Tank.

Hatuey Rodriguez (producer) is an award-winning New York and Los Angeles-based filmmaker. He has worked on numerous projects including 'Triggering Wounds' (Winner: 2013 Tribeca Film Festival - Our City, My Story, Best Documentary Award) and 'Homemade Friend' (Official Selection: 2018 Woods Hole Film Festival, 2018 Commonwealth Film Festival, 2018 Redstones Film Festival; Winner: 2018 Commonwealth Film Festival, Best Cinematography Award,), 'TAPS' (Official Selection: 2020 Independent Short Awards, 2020 Global Film Festival, 2020 LA Independent Film Festival) and most recently 'The Collector', a USC thesis film set to go on the festival circuit early next year.

story:
Short Summary

  • Hi! my name is Christina Boyd, and I have been acting for about 10 years. I am a first time writer and producer for this web series I created, "Roommates." This is a series I've been thinking about for a long time now and I am craving to bring it to life. And I started to do just that with my own money, but this thing costs a pretty penny, and I'll need just a little bit of help.
  • This story takes you on a journey with a group of friends, navigating their everyday lives that involve dating, social issues and awkward experiences, while attending college. Its a fun time with a very talented cast and crew and we are all passionate to put "roommates" on the map! But, we're also broke creatives so...there's that. Either way, we're having fun doing it! You can check out what we've done so far at https://www.obsidiantv.com/
  • Much love from all of us and thank you for your support!

What We Need & What You Get

  • We will need $15,000.00 to finish our web series. We already started filming and completed a few episodes, but the funds will go toward completing season 1 and creating longer episodes. It will also go toward our studio set rentals, Post Production, Marketing, Promotional Merch, Hot meals, Crafty and other miscellaneous expenses that arise during Production and Post-Production.
  • This is a fundraising effort first and foremost, but we have some unique perks only found during this campaign as a thank you from the bottom of our hearts for getting in on the ground floor of our first Season!
  • Our goal is to complete production by February 2020. So we will be using funds immediately so as to make "Roommates" a reality as soon as possible!

The Impact

Donating to our campaign is the only way we finish our project and you will make all the difference with your contribution:

  • At the end of the day, we are just a group of struggling actors yearning to tell a story. A funny one at that. And it fulfills us to no end to garner laughs in the room. You will find yourself relating to a number of characters,  rooting for them and wanting to see them grow and fail and learn. We just want the opportunity to see it through.
  • This project is valuable in that it is an original story derived from personal experiences, with a comedic take. We really put our all into it, from writing, to cast to crew.  I am independently funding this series, but, I can't do it alone. This is a community project and every donation does takes us a step closer to finishing our project. And we are thankful for any form of support we can get. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Please remember EVERY DOLLAR COUNTS!  And even if you can't lend financial support, you can still help by getting the word out and make some noise about our campaign. 

Share our campaign link and direct people on social media and word of mouth!

Remember to use the Indiegogo share tools! It makes it really simple. You can also check out the episodes we have so far on our network, https://www.obsidiantv.com/

And that's all there is to it.

I want to say Thank you!  I hope you can help me reach our goal. Much love always!

story:
Short Summary

Every child of immigrants will tell you of this weight. The weight of responsibility they hold in their hearts every single day. The responsibility of privilege.

"Generations" is a thank you letter to our immigrant mothers. For their love, wisdom and sacrifices.

"Generations" premiered at the 2021 Montreal St-Ambroise Fringe Festival with a full sold out run at La Balustrade Monument National venue. As featured in CBC News, The Montreal Gazette, The Montreal Theatre Hub, CKUT 90.3FM and CJLO 1690AM.

 

What We Need & What You Get

Our fundraising goal: $2,000.00

  • $1,000.00 will be going to development of the TV Pilot of "Generations"
    • Researching, reading, writing and editing scripts
    • Writing and applying for federal and provincial grants 
  • $1,000.00 will be going to the four individuals involved in the "Generations" play; Rana Liu, Uzoma Onyechekwa, Andrea Pavlovic and Emily Sheeran
    • Over 50 hours of rehearsal
    • 7 show dates at the Montreal St-Ambroise Fringe Festival
    • 3 hour filming day 

 

The Impact

By giving to our fundraiser, you will be:

  • Supporting the development of "Generations," a show about family, highlighting the immigrant parent-child relationship. 
  • Championing a creative team composed of BIPOC, queer and 1st generation immigrant artists.
  • Promoting representation, visibility and opportunity to BIPOC voices in media.

 

Blowfish Theatre Company

Some say that Blowfish Theatre Company was born on a warm Summer’s day in Jeanne Mance Park. Others say it was born in the cab ride home from a prog-rock concert. Whichever version you choose to believe, the things that matter stay the same. 

Blowfish Theatre Company was founded out of a passion for theatre and a need to present stories. Our principle goal is to (re)vitalize diversity and cultural understanding through shared perspectives. Through our company, we are not just telling these stories, but also celebrating them.

From their first production in September 2016 to their current project at the 2021 Montreal Fringe Festival, not much has changed. “Generations” marks Blowfish Theatre Company’s third show at the Montreal Fringe Festival. They’re still just a bunch of theatre nerds looking to do their little part by creating something meaningful.

 

Read more about Blowfish Theatre Company here.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Any contribution helps! You can do so by:

  • Following Blowfish Theatre Company on Instagram and Facebook!
  • Reading and listening to our press coverage: CBC News, The Montreal Gazette, The Montreal Theatre Hub, CKUT 90.3FM and CJLO 1690AM
  • Sharing this campaign!

 

Thank you for listening to our stories. We are so excited to share it with you and the world.

story:
Watch Our Short Film Prequel! ▽▽▽


◭◊◬◊◮ Above is an introductory chapter into our psychedelic world, lending insight into Russell Louise Uddin's storytelling style! This dream-like tale takes place moments before the events of The Birds of Paradise... ◭◊◬◊◮



The pilot episode begins with the arrival of our protagonist, Casey (Sara Cicilian), 23, as she navigates through her ancient stomping grounds in the concrete jungle. Reluctantly, she ends up being invited to parties with old friends from high-school she hasn’t seen in years. Casey quickly realizes New York City is not really the same anymore…

Every day since her return, Casey has prophetic dreams that begin to tell of future events in cyptic, eerie imagery. She ponders, however, is this really the future she & her peers envisioned? Is there any way to collectively alter the fate of the future of humanity? Casey asks, "Or am I losing my mind?"

At the end of the pilot episode, Casey finally gathers enough strength to leave her room & join the peaceful activists protesting on Wall Street. As she arrives, it becomes very clear that the police department has something else in store for her but by that point, it's too late...

◭◊◬◊◮◭◊◬◊◮◭◊◬◊◮

CLICK HERE! for our Instagram ~ even more style, imagery & positive vibes to experience!!! ◬△▲◇◆◉ ◉ ◉◒◓◚◛◚◛

((( here we are on imdb! )))

◹◹◹◥◥◥◥

What You're Donating Toward:

  • Camera & Audio Department Payroll
  • Sony FS7 Camera Rentals
  • Lens Rentals
  • Lighting Kit Rentals
  • Audio Equipment Rentals
  • New York City Permits
  • On Set Meals & Snacks
  • Cast & Crew Accommodations
  • Film & TV Festival Submissions
  • *we already have free post-production donated from master editors!*


We Need Your Help!

With your gracious contributions, we plan to film the pilot, then submit it to every TV festival (and eligible film festival) we can! The hope is to find passionate investors who see the potential of our series and are willing to assist us in bringing it to the next level of development!

All of the talented, professional actors & actresses involved with The Birds of Paradise TV Series have donated their special performances to the pilot for free in hopes of being paid for their hard work once the entire series has been funded. Why? They all wholeheartedly believe in the TV series’ idealistic messages, which are rooted in civil rights & overcoming adversity. These actors feel such concepts are very important to explore in a healthy manner via cinema amid such a harsh geo-political climate.

Starring:
Sara Cicilian as Casey
Michael Jefferson as Rocco
Russell Louise Uddin as Raph
Sanam Erfani as Faye
Joshua Dye as Jasper
Edwin Arzon as Eddie

◆◊◆◊◆◊◆◊◆◊◆◊◆

story: Last year, I made a web series called HOOKED and it went on to appear in many film festivals including Garden state and HollyWeb and has won numerous awards including Best Web Series. Since then, we are trying to develop the show even more so that it grabs the attention of networks and we will try to hire known actors for the new characters that have been created. The journey has been amazing so far and I hope that you will want to help the ride continue.

story:
Short Summary

The year is 2008 and sketch comedy is at its absolute peak--do you want to watch an intern help his boss dodge sniper rounds from a rival businessman? Watch Whitest Kids U Know. Do you want to watch Will Ferrell mangle his hand in a bunk bed accident? Lucky for you Step Brothers has just hit theaters. On top of all that, there's a new entertainment platform called YouTube housing a bunch of new channels dabbling in in sketch comedy, such as  CollegeHumor or Funny Or Die. 

Fast forward to today and that original idea and pursuit of sketch comedy has evolved, or devolved, to new mediums like Tiktok to match the attention span of our current generation.

Odd Campus is the natural evolution of random and chaotic comedy that takes from the ancient channels of YouTube now buried under vloggers and "influencers", and from the more recent channels that are heavily stylized and reaching for the next peak of awkward, and combines the two. It’s something that can reflect how our generation views content and still fits within a college-aged sense of humor.

A channel that also utilizes the power of community and inside jokes, the goal of Odd Campus is to create an environment that establishes a world that makes you, once you've experienced it, feel like you’re one of the gang.

(Full treatment attached at the bottom)

The Team

Creator: Jake Hektoen 

Producers: Jenna Cusack and Johnny Deffinbaugh

Marketing Producer: Zach Chaloux

Cinematographers: Ben Trevey and Ariano Treviño Angelone

Production Designers: Kat Garrido, Sanya Salehi, and Thomas Day

Editor: Kendall Best

What We Need & What You Get

With your donation(s), you allow us the opportunity to level up the production quality and chaos of the show. Our humble YouTube channel can become more and more extreme while maintaining it's grassroots style.

Risks & Challenges

We will be running a COVID safe set for each episode. We will be testing everyone on set, crew members will be masked, and we will do our best to ensure everyone’s safety while in production.

We plan to release during Summer 2021, all the while practicing safe production standards. This, of course, heavily influences our schedule, as we are all in school and working around projects, but nevertheless we have a plan to work within our limitations and create content that connects.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't donate today but want to help out the campaign anyways, you can:

  • Spread this on your Facebook or other social media!

And that's all there is to it.

For a dive into the crazy world that is Odd Campus, take a look at our treatment to get some more information on the project as a whole.

https://drive.google.com/file/d/1OuGnLo1ZZlFMBQrLLf8rqvRCD_bWMc7Z/view?usp=sharing

Linked Socials

Thank you so much for checking us out, and if you have any questions at all you can reach us at oddcampusmedia@gmail.com

Twitter: twitter.com/oddcampus

Facebook: facebook.com/oddcampus

Instagram; odd.campus
