story:
After our summer season finale you may be wondering: Will Delilah recover from wingman-mania and find her way to Columbia University? Does Harry have a shot at representing an illustrious literary-marvel? Will Jules ever find love, or a job, or maybe even just a friend? Did TJ break his back after being thrown up a stairwell oh-so-sexually by Nomi? 

All this, and so much more, will be revealed in the new season of Everyone Else Has! 

Over the past year, we have been hustling to create the first four episodes of EEH for you and the feedback from our audience has been excellent! We celebrated the summer with a screening of episode four: "As Seen in TimeOut" at the Threes Brewing bar in Brooklyn. Not to toot our own horns, but it was a wonderful evening full of laughter, new friends, and excitement for the future. 

We are asking for $3,500 to shoot our final six episodes. This money will primarily go towards paying our dedicated camera and sound crew, feeding our brilliant cast, fees for film and web series festivals, and marketing the show so that people can actually see what we've done! 

Moving forward we want to directly involve our fans much more than we have in the past. Some of our characters are even now online and in your social media worlds. You can follow TJ on Twitter (@TheTeej3) and Jules on Instagram (@its_jules_richards). You'll notice that our perks for donors are also on the interactive side, so be sure to select the perk you'd like! 

If you can't donate today, please consider watching the show and sharing it with your friends! Word of mouth is a great way to build our audience and a share is truly invaluable!

story:
About Kyloki

Kyloki is the first comedic web series venture from Leisure Elk Productions. It imagines a world in which a guy named Matt lives in an apartment with Loki from the Marvel universe and Kylo Ren from the Star Wars universe. Also along for their misadventures are Loki's friend Wanda (Scarlet Witch) and Kylo's younger brother Kyle Solo.

We premiered Season 1 at the end of 2016 and were so thrilled with the response! If you haven’t seen it yet, you can check out all six episodes here:

We love these characters and this world, and by contributing to our campaign, you'll help us tell more of their stories in the four new episodes. We'll be updating you throughout the production process about what's going on with Season 2, but we can tell you right now that we'll be leaving the apartment for a few of the episodes, as well as introducing a couple new characters!
 

What We Need & What You Get

Season 1 was self-funded, meaning we were limited on what we could do production-wise. For example, most of our crew worked for free, and we spent all 8 days of production shooting in our producer's apartment.

This time around, we're looking to expand our universe. The contributions you make will go toward things like:

  • Bringing back our AMAZING cast and crew
  • Camera, lighting, and sound equipment
  • Costumes
  • Hair and makeup
  • New locations
  • Set decoration
  • Props
  • Feeding the cast and crew
  • Post production

We've got some awesome perks for you to check out over on the right. From engaging with us on social media to attending a screening of the new episodes, we want you here with us every step of the way as we continue this journey!

Meet the Creative Team

Here's a little about just a few of our key players:

Leisure Elk Productions 

Born out of the crazed fangirl minds of Jordan Henry and Arielle Waldman, Leisure Elk is a production company dedicated to creating character driven comedy aimed at fellow pop culture addicts and comedy fans at large.

Arielle Waldman - Creator/Writer/Executive Producer

Originally from the Midwest, Arielle Waldman has been writing since she was ten years old (most of her early work is illegible but will hopefully someday be worth millions). She has been working in the entertainment industry since 2011 and has experience in production, talent management, and television development. She studied creative writing at Emerson College, but her passion for writing comedy started at a young age by watching shows like The Nanny and Will & Grace. Despite her parents' concerns, watching all that television has paid off, and she is fulfilling her dream of creating her own comedy series filled with the kind of complex and unique characters that first inspired her to write. When not writing, Arielle likes hunting for the best tacos in LA, creating gourmet popcorn, and dog sitting.

Jordan Henry - Creator/Writer/Executive Producer

Jordan Henry grew up in southern West Virginia, where she spent much of her childhood watching Wishbone on PBS and reading Harry Potter as many times as possible. Her passion for storytelling propelled her to pursue a bachelor’s degree in radio & television at the University of Central Florida and a master’s degree in television at Boston University. Since moving to LA in 2013, she has primarily worked in production on several primetime television series. In her free time, Jordan can often be found producing a comedy podcast, baking delicious desserts, and obsessing over ice hockey.

Morten Forland - Director/Executive Producer

Morten Forland, a native of the wild western coast of Norway, is an award-winning, Los Angeles based writer, director and editor. With an early start making a Star Wars fanfilm at the age of 12, Morten has steadily been honing his filmmaking skills and earned a BA (University of Bergen) and an MFA (Loyola Marymount University) in Film and TV Production. His short film, Total Awesome Viking Power, has won him over twenty awards and more than eighty official festival selections world wide and has confirmed his strength in handling the nerdy, funny and action filled.

Morten is steadily directing and putting out original content. In addition to directing all six episodes in Season 1 of Kyloki, this past year he directed an action packed branded short for CollegeHumor and Ubisoft, Fatigued (a digital comedy pilot about an all female army bootcamp), five short-form digital concepts for TBS’s, The Heckler, a commercial for a new casting app, Upcast, as well as a proof-of-concept for a TV show and a series of promos for USA/Fandango and Red Lobster.

Jennevie Olivieri - Executive Producer

Born and raised in Puerto Rico, Jennevie learned English watching as many episodes of The Power Rangers as she could before bedtime. But it was grandmother’s fondness for telenovelas and her family’s dramatic tendencies that ignited her obsession with storytelling. Jennevie has been with Kyloki since the very beginning, and produced the first season of the show. She also produced the award winning short film TOTAL AWESOME VIKING POWER.

Vincent Valentin - Director of Photography

Originally from Northern California, Vincent is an LMU alum (’14), pursuing a career as a cinematographer. He’s a long-time collaborator of Morten Forland’s, and an incredibly talented cinematographer, with an eye for great frames as well as a massive well of technical know-how.

Taylor Sandling - Costume Designer

Taylor Sandling is a Fashion Institute of Design and Merchandising graduate. She is an award winning costume designer with work in many independent films, local film festivals, theatre productions, tv commercials and digital series. She has close ties with local film schools and has worked on over 35 student thesis projects. Taylor doesn't confine herself to any one particular part of design or fashion. She prides herself on her ability to take on any challenge ranging from period pieces to contemporary engineering. Her work can be found on Facebook and Instagram.

Meet the Cast

Max Cutler - Kylo Ren

Max Cutler is a Los Angeles based actor, born and raised, a rare breed. He has a rich history with Improv, founding a troupe in College (HoosOnFirst) plus studying at Groundlings and UCB. So, you can always find him making too many jokes and making people cringe with joy at his unstoppable river of situational puns.

Kaelan Strouse - Loki

Kaelan is the creator of the blog OnTheRoadToBliss.com - about his journey learning to be happy.  He wrote and directed the award-winning film, Legend of Amba; and has acted on tv shows, films, commercials, and stages across the country.  He is a Wildcat (grad of Northwestern), as well as a grad of the Conservatory at The Second City.

Vince Major - Matt

Vince Major is a level 97 night elf mage in real life. Born in Colorado, he made his way to Los Angeles to pursue acting and to escape snow. Vince has been seen all over the world on the festival circuit in Total Awesome Viking Power. A huge fan of all things geeky, he is thrilled that being a nerd and gamer is finally cool. It is also rumored that Vince once fought a bear with his bare hands.

Claudine Quadrat - Wanda

After graduating from Princeton with a degree in Politics and minors in French & Italian, Claudine took the next logical step and became an actor. Her work includes indie films Wild Men and Adele and Everything After (both released this year), as well as commercials for Intel, Macy's, and Cricket Wireless. She is also a dancer, improviser, and avid traveler.

Sam Tank - Kyle Solo

Sam is originally from Minneapolis, Minnesota.  He graduated from The Theatre School at DePaul University.  Recent credits include Young Hillary, Take Back and People Magazine Investigates.

Risks & Challenges

Production is always a challenge, and this is no different. This is the first time we'll be shooting a great deal of the series in different locations outside the apartment, so we'll literally be out of our comfort zone. However, we're bringing back most of our team from Season 1, as well as adding some new key players, and we're confident that this awesome group can do anything!

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you can't contribute financially, we'd still love your support! Follow us on social media for updates about Season 2 and help share our campaign across the galaxy!

You can find us on Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, YouTube, and Tumblr.

Any Questions?

You can reach us directly at leisureelk@gmail.com

Even if you can't contribute financially, we'd still love your support! Follow us on social media for updates about Season 2 and help share our campaign across the galaxy!
You can find us on Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, YouTube, and Tumblr.
Any Questions?
You can reach us directly at leisureelk@gmail.com

story:
Make sure to check out the video above

A NOTE: This has been in the works for months and obviously I had no anticipation of the strange times we'd be living come mid-March. I decided to move forward with the project for my own sanity, to provide a welcome distraction for others, and to stay true to the ideals of the project and make art even in the face of uncertainty. There is no pressure at all for anyone to give to this project, but that goes double for anyone (like myself) whose income has shifted due to the current situation. Take care of your family and your neighbors first, and if you have some leftovers after that then consider helping launch this thing and getting some fun rewards in return.

*

Now, on with the scheduled programming...

*

The Backstory

Moana stuck on an island. Harry Potter living under the stairs.

At the start of most great stories the central character is living their everyday lives with a gnawing sense they are destined for something more.

Sound familiar?

We love these stories because they are our stories; or at least they could be.

We want to be the one breaking into song and sailing the open seas, yet most of the time we're the ones staying behind stacking coconuts.

If the things that make a great story make a great life, it stands to reason we can find ways to better our lives by stealing from the stories we love.

That's the big idea behind this whole project.

So What Is This, Exactly?

Ben and the Family Quest is a few things.

First, it's a way to sum up a commitment I am making to spend the 1,000 days leading up to my 30th birthday on an epic quest towards the life that up to now has been relegated to "maybe someday."

My wife Erin and 2-year old son Forest are ready for the journey, too!

Our quest won't involve long lost treasure or vanquishing evil, but it will involve...

*New Music!

and

*A YouTube Show!

+ some other ideas currently up our sleeves.

(hear more about these in the video above)

The 1,000 Day commitment starts on June 21, 2020 and runs through March 18, 2023 -- that's 3 years from the launch of this crowdfunding campaign, and my 30th birthday.

If we get to that day and everything has been a historic disaster we'll reevaluate.

Until that day, we are all in.

The Vision

(by March 18, 2023)

For What I'll Have Made

  • 15 New Songs (at least)
  • 150 YouTube Episodes (at least)
  • A tour of live shows (at least 1)
  • A concrete step-by-step process to help people craft their own plan for their quests
  • A thriving online community, not only connected to me but also to each other

For Our Family

We will have made progress towards what we sum up as "a lifestyle rich in fulfillment, freedom, community, and memories."

Since that's sweet but a little abstract we do also have concrete goals for our finances, calendars, and most aspects of our lifestyle. Those goals aren't necessarily for everyone to know, but they do exist and serve as tangible goals to work towards.

For The Greater Impact

I have big dreams for this being about so much more than me, my music, and my family.

If people can be inspired by our family (for lack of a less trite and cheesy word) giving them permission to pursue their own things then I will consider this whole thing a big success!​ And my hope is to connect people to each other through online community tools, so we can learn from and encourage each other along the way.

The Part Where You Come In!

I've put countless hours into dreaming and scheming over the last year and made it this far.

But now I need your help!

Tool Chest for The Quest

Every hero needs their tools. Mine are admittedly less awesome than intergalactic spaceships or magic wands. Luckily, they're also cheaper and actually exist.

Every penny raised through INDIEGOGO will go towards equipment needed to pull all of this off.

Here's a tasty pie chart:

Everything here is gear that's needed to make a fully produced song or YouTube episode. Note the absence of backyard jacuzzi or exotic vacation here.

All the gear has been thoroughly researched to make sure I'll be getting the most bang for the buck. In some cases I'll be buying things lightly used to save some money.

(for more about why I haven't bought these things myself see FAQ)

Finally

If you are still reading, thank you!

If you are considering giving anything at all, thank you!!

Whether $10 or $100, simply sharing this campaign on social media, or keeping your hate mail to yourself if you really hate me and this whole idea, any help at all is seen and very much appreciated.

Now, let's make something great together!

Here's to the quest,

Ben

--

(if you have questions, check out the FAQ and feel free to reach out to me directly)

Want to force me to cover a Disney song?

Click here to see a list of song options!

Note the absence of backyard jacuzzi or exotic vacation here.All the gear has been thoroughly researched to make sure I'll be getting the most bang for the buck. In some cases I'll be buying things lightly used to save some money.(for more about why I haven't bought these things myself see FAQ)FinallyIf you are still reading, thank you!If you are considering giving anything at all, thank you!!Whether $10 or $100, simply sharing this campaign on social media, or keeping your hate mail to yourself if you really hate me and this whole idea, any help at all is seen and very much appreciated.Now, let's make something great together!Here's to the quest,Ben--(if you have questions, check out the FAQ and feel free to reach out to me directly)Want to force me to cover a Disney song?Click here to see a list of song options!

story:
WHO am I and WHY this project

My name is Ina and I am the writer/director of "Homies," a web series project. I've been a filmmaker and a TV production professional for about 4 years.

Last year, I began to visualize a web series. One that would explore different experiences of relationships that my friends and I have come to experience - with people who looked like us.

As a Filipino immigrant and a queer woman, I wanted to create stories that feature Filipino queer women - ones that I rarely see in media. I also wanted to give a stage to others who are people of color and in the lgbtq+ spectrum. Many times these groups are portrayed by their struggles: their coming out stories and their stories of oppression. While these are important experiences, the media ignores other aspects of their lives - ones that end up being told by people who look and act nothing like them.

The Homies web series aims to normalize our stories within society.

WHAT is Homies

"Homies" will be a collection of four short films. (Maybe more if things go well) Each episode has different characters and has a different theme, all featuring queer-identifying people and people of color. For ROUND 1, we are raising money for Episode 2!!

Brief Description of eps:

1st EP: Two best friends navigate their friends-with-benefits relationship

2nd EP: A couple enjoys their last day before a long-distance relationship

3rd EP: A homeless couple tries to get clean and get off the streets together

4th EP: A middle-aged couple look back on the start of their relationship

WHEN do you see the product

The FIRST EPISODE has already been produced and is being submitted to film festivals this year. It has already been included in a few film festivals!

Our aim is to produce the second episode late fall and then the others early next year. We are going to fundraise until we reach our goal. 

WHERE does the money go towards

The Cast and Crew! Everything is about them!! We want to pay everyone for their hard work and we want to make sure they have enough to eat. Equipment rentals and location fees are the least of our worries. 

(For the 1st episode, the cast and crew worked pro bono and that production still cost me $2,000! )

Other Ways You Can Help 

Share, share, share!!! In addition to trying to get funds, we are also trying to build an audience so getting the word out is very important.

Please follow us 

ig: @homiesdc

FB: https://www.facebook.com/homiesDC

story:
Nuerona Ecologica is an environmental education and ecofriendly lifestyle educational channel in Spanish. We will create educational, very entertaining and super interesting videos about:

- Environmental conservation
- Wildlife and ecology
- Animal rights
- Plant based eating.

[Scroll down for English]

Los videos se graban en pantalla verde en un estudio de producción, con equipo profesional. Hacemos este proyecto porque es mínima la información basada en investigación científica sobre estos temas, disponible en español.

 

 

Compartiremos este conocimiento con todas las personas que solo hablan español en toda América. Y seremos tu guía práctica que te facilitará el hacer cambios en tus hábitos para que lleves un estilo de vida más amigable al medio ambiente. Juntos ayudaremos a conservar miles de especies que están en peligro de extinción y a tener una comunidad más limpia y más sana. Mientras a más personas llegue este conocimiento, más gente hará el cambio necesario en su estilo de vida, dejará de ser parte del problema y será parte de la solución. Es por esto que es sumamente importante y urgente este proyecto. Y también, es por esto que es tan importante que participes y nos ayudes a llevarlo a cabo.

¡Esto lo tenemos que hacer juntos!

 

  • Producir y publicar 12 videos de 7 a 10 minutos cada uno, grabados en pantalla verde, con  textos y gráficos animados, clips de videos, animaciones e imágenes de apoyo, en un periodo de 9 meses (1 cada 3 semanas)
  • Crear y manejar una página web del proyecto, canal de YouTube y páginas de Instagram y Facebook, donde compartiremos los videos y contenido que te inspirará y ayudará a hacer el cambio
  • Adquirir 100,000 suscriptores de YouTube, 50,000 de Facebook y 20,000 de Instagram
  • Crear una comunidad internacional de personas interesadas en cuidar el medio ambiente y en tener un mejor futuro para esta y para las próximas generaciones.

Somos un equipo de expertos de diferentes áreas de producción multimedia, redes sociales y conservación ambiental…

  • Arturo Ángeles, productor, guionista y conductor. Tiene licenciatura en biología y maestría en desarrollo comunitario sustentable. Es director de una organización especializada en la educación ambiental multimedia, con una base de más de 93,000 seguidores en redes sociales, y fue la persona que inició el movimiento contra las bolsas de plástico, que ayudó a llevar a la prohibición de bolsas en Tijuana, México.
  • Mónica Hernández, editora y diseñadora gráfica digital. Tiene una ingeniería en diseño gráfico digital y maestría en administración de negocios con concentración en mercadotecnia. Tiene más de 10 años de experiencia de trabajo en diseño y producción multimedia para televisión y redes sociales. Es co-fundadora de una agencia productora multimedia y de efectos visuales.
  • Gabriela Reyes, camarógrafa y asesora. Tiene una licenciatura en comunicación, tiene más de 10 años de experiencia en televisión, como camarógrafa, floor manager y conductora, y directora de marketing y ventas.
  • Jorge Ávila, analista de redes sociales. Es asesor en redes sociales y posicionamiento web. Fundador de una empresa dedicada a redes sociales, desarrollo, asesoría y posicionamiento web y es consultor de marketing de contenido digital en un canal de televisión y de turismo médico.
  • Hava Villaverde, asesora. Tiene gran experiencia en investigación en las áreas de planeación estratégica, marketing y desarrollo de negocios sustentables, y planificación. Tiene maestría en administración de empresas con enfoque en sustentabilidad y doctorado en leyes.
  • Ronald E. Steffens, asesor. Maestro de comunicación en Prescott College, tiene licenciatura en Inglés y maestría en escritura narrativa creativa, con gran experiencia en periodismo y comunicación ambiental.
  • Alejandro Sevilla, asesor. Fue conductor de un programa matutino de televisión, y ha sido conductor y productor de un programa televisivo de cultura pop y cine por más de 10 años. Es YouTuber creador de contenido, y editor en un estudio de animación 3D que crea contenido para Cartoon Network, Nickelodeon, HBO y Netflix.

 

Hacer este proyecto conlleva muchos gastos:

  • Videos – investigación, creación del guión, grabación, edición, y publicación. Cada video toma entre 60-70 horas para hacerse. Haremos 12 videos en 9 meses.
  • Equipo [cámara 4K, tripie, memoria, micrófonos, lámparas, y teleprompter]
  • Renta de espacio de grabación
  • Diseño de la imagen
  • Página web (diseño, hosting y mantenimiento)
  • Promoción del canal de YouTube para poder llegar al mayor número de personas
     

     

     

     

    Conforme mayor sea la contribución, más exclusivos y mayor la cantidad de beneficios y mejor el regalo. Cada nivel incluye los beneficios (excepción del regalo) del nivel anterior y un premio único. Esta es nuestra manera de agradecerte y reconocer que sin ti, no pudiéramos haber lanzado esta iniciativa de educación y conservación ambiental.

    1-Email de agradecimiento: Te mandaremos un correo electrónico agradeciéndote tu contribución en nuestro proyecto

    2-Agradecimiento en redes sociales: Haremos una publicación en Facebook e Instagram, donde te etiquetaremos, agradeciéndote por el apoyo

    3-Membresía en grupo de Facebook: Serás invitado a integrarte a un grupo privado que haremos, donde podrás compartir tus comentarios, dudas y conocimiento con personas con los mismos intereses y valores que tú, y con el equipo de Neurona Ecológica. En este grupo estaremos haciendo encuestas y pidiendo opiniones sobre los diferentes videos y contenido que publiquemos

    4-Acceso a detrás de cámara: Tendrás acceso a contenido (fotos y videos) exclusivo de las grabaciones y del proceso de producción de los videos. Podrás ser de los pocos que ven todo lo que pasa detrás de cámaras y que no aparece en los videos que publicamos.

    5-Tu nombre en la página web: Publicaremos tu nombre en nuestra página web, NeuronaEcologica.com (que habilitaremos en noviembre), como una de las personas que permitió que este proyecto se haga realidad. Si gustas, le pondremos una liga a tu red social o página de tu empresa.

    6-Selecciona el tema del próximo video: De manera privada, te compartiremos una lista de temas y pequeña descripción,  para que votes por los que más te interesan. Contaremos los votos y así seleccionaremos los temas de los próximos videos que haremos. De esta manera tú influirás directamente en el contenido de Neurona Ecológica.

    7-Tu nombre en los créditos de videos: Al final de cada video aparecerá tu nombre, donde permanecerá mientras exista YouTube para que miles de personas vean que fuiste uno de los principales facilitadores del proyecto. Podemos poner tu nombre o el nombre de tu marca o empresa.

    8-Asiste (en persona o transmisión en vivo) a una grabación: Podrás vivir lo que son las grabaciones de los videos. Podrás conocer el estudio donde grabamos y todo el proceso de preparación (ajuste de luces, cámara, micrófono y teleprompter) y grabación; ya sea en persona un sofá en el estudio, o en la comodidad de tu casa mediante transmisión en vivo privada contigo

    9-Mención durante el video (10-15 segundos): Te agradeceremos al inicio de cada video. Mencionaremos que el video fue patrocinado por ti (tu nombre o tu empresa) y una breve descripción de tu empresa, productos o servicios. El agradecimiento permanecerá mientras exista YouTube para que miles de personas vean que fuiste uno de los principales facilitadores del proyecto.

    Los beneficios se brindarán durante toda la primera temporada de 9 meses en los cuales se publicarán 12 videos.
     

     

    Por favor contáctanos para cualquier pregunta que tengas, con mucho gusto te la responderemos y daremos cualquier información adicional que desees. Te agradecemos mucho tu ayuda. Cualquier cantidad que puedas donar será muy agradecida.

    ¡Muchas gracias!

     

     

    [English]

    The videos are filmed with a green screen at a video production studio using professional grade equipment. We are doing this because there is minimal scientific research based information about these topics in Spanish.

    We will share this knowledge with all the people living in the United States who only speak Spanish, with all Mexico and with all Latin America. We will be your practical go to guide that will help you change your habits so you can have a more environmentally friendly lifestyle, and together help conserve thousands of species that are at risk of extinction, and have a cleaner and healthier community. The more people this knowledge reaches, the more people will make the necessary lifestyle changes and stop being part of the problem and become part of the solution. This is why this project is extremely important and urgent. This is also why it is so important that you participate and helps us do this. We have to do this together.

     

    OUR OBJECTIVES

    • Create and publish 12 videos, 7 to 10 minutes long each, filmed with a green screen, with animated text and graphics, video clips, animations and supportive imagery, within a 9 month period (1 every 3 weeks)
    • Create and manage a project website, a YouTube cannel and Instagram and Facebook pages, where we will share the videos and content that will inspire and help you make a change
    • Create an international community of people interested in protecting the environment and in having a better future for this and coming generations

     

    OUR TEAM

    We are a team of experts in different áreas in multimedia production, social media and environmental conservation…

    • Arturo Angeles, Producer, Scriptwriter and Host. Has a B.S. Degree in biology and an M.S. Degree in resilient and sustainable communities. Is the Executive Director of an organization specialized in multimedia environmental education, with a base of more than 93,000 social media followers, and was the person who started the movement against plastic bags, which helped lead to the prohibition of plastic bags in Tijuana, Mexico. 
    • Monica Hernandez, Editor and Digital Graphic Designer. Has an Engineering Degree in digital graphic design and an M.A. Degree in business administration with a focus on marketing. Has more than 10 years of experience in design and multimedia production at a TV station and is the co-founder of a multimedia and visual effects production firm.
    • Gabriela Reyes, Cameraperson and Adviser. Has a B.A. degree in communications and more than 10 years of experience working in televisión as Cameraperson, Floor Manager, TV Show Host and Marketing and Sales Director
    • Jorge Avila, Website and Community Manager. He is an adviser on social media and web branding; is the Founder of a web branding and social media branding and consulting firm, and is a digital content consultant in the medical tourism sector and at a TV station.
    • Hava Villaverde, Project Adviser, has research expertise in the areas of strategic planning, marketing and sustainable business development and planning; a M.B.A. degree in sustainable business administration, with concentration in sustainability and a Juris Doctor degree in Law.
    • Ronald E. Steffens, project adviser, Prescott College Associate Professor of Communications, has a M.F.A. Degree in creative writing and B.A. Degree in English, extensive experience in journalism education, environmental communication and creative writing.
    • Alejandro Sevilla, project adviser, was a TV morning show host and has produced a pop culture TV show for more than 10 years, is currently a Spanish language YouTube content creator and Editor for a 3D animation studio that creates content for the Cartoon Network, Nickelodeon and Netflix.

     

    OUR EXPENSES

    Executing this project has a lot of expenses:

    • Videos – research, script writing, shooting, editing, and publishing. Each video takes 60-70 hours to create. We will do 12 videos over 9 months.
    • Equipment (4K camera, tripod, memory card, microphones, lamps, and teleprompter)
    • Shooting space rental
    • Brand design
    • Website (design, hosting and maintenance)
    • Promotion of the YouYube channel to reach the greatest amount of people possible

     

    EXPLANATION OF THE BENEFITS

    As the contribution is greater, so too are the benefits and get exclusive, and better the gift is. Each level includes the benefits (excludes gift) of the previous level and a unique gift. This is our way of thanking you and recognizing that you are the one who makes the launch of this environmental education and conservation initiative possible.

    1-Thank you email: We will email you thanking you for contributing to our project

    2-Social media thank you: We will make a post on Facebook and Instagram, tagging you and thanking you for your support

    3-Facebook group membership: You will be invited to join our private group, where you will be able to share comments, questions and knowledge with people with the same interests and moral values as you, and with the Neurona Ecologica team. In the group, we will be doing surveys and taking your opinions and feedback about the videos and content that we publish.

    4-Behind the camera access: You will have access to exclusive content (photos and video) of the videos filming and production process. You will be one of the few that get to see what happens behind the cameras and that it is not shown in the published videos.

    5-Your name at the website: We will add your name at our website NeuronaEcologica.com (which we will launch in November), as one of the persons that made this project possible. If you would like, we can link your name to one of your social media sites or your business website.

    6-Select next video’s topic: Privately, we will share with you a list of topics along with a brief description of each, so that cast your vote for the topics that most interest you. We will tally the votes and that way select the topics for the next videos. Allowing you to directly influence Neurona Ecologica’s content.

    7-Your name in videos credits: Your name will appear at the end of each video, where it will stay for as long as YouTube exists, so that thousands of people see that you were one of the main supporters of the project. We can add your name or your brand or business name.

    8-Attend a filming (in person or via live transmission): You will be able to experience the video filming.  You will get to know the studio where we shoot the videos, see the whole preparation process (adjust lights, camera, microphone and teleprompter) and the actual shooting; either in person at a sofa at the studio, or from the comfort of your house through a private live transmission.

    9-(10-15 second) video plug: We will thank you at the start of each video. We will mention that the video is sponsored by you (your name or your business) and give a brief overview of the business, products or services. The plug will remain there for as long as YouTube exists so that thousands of people see that you were one of the main supporters of the project.

    The benefits will be offered during the whole first 9 month season in which we will publish 12 videos.

     

     

    Please contact us with any question that you have, we will happily respond and provide you any additional information that you seek. We appreciate your support very much. Any donation you give will be greatly appreciated.

    Thank you!

Hacemos este proyecto porque es mínima la información basada en investigación científica sobre estos temas, disponible en español.  Compartiremos este conocimiento con todas las personas que solo hablan español en toda América. Y seremos tu guía práctica que te facilitará el hacer cambios en tus hábitos para que lleves un estilo de vida más amigable al medio ambiente. Juntos ayudaremos a conservar miles de especies que están en peligro de extinción y a tener una comunidad más limpia y más sana. Mientras a más personas llegue este conocimiento, más gente hará el cambio necesario en su estilo de vida, dejará de ser parte del problema y será parte de la solución. Es por esto que es sumamente importante y urgente este proyecto. Y también, es por esto que es tan importante que participes y nos ayudes a llevarlo a cabo.¡Esto lo tenemos que hacer juntos! 
Producir y publicar 12 videos de 7 a 10 minutos cada uno, grabados en pantalla verde, con  textos y gráficos animados, clips de videos, animaciones e imágenes de apoyo, en un periodo de 9 meses (1 cada 3 semanas)
Crear y manejar una página web del proyecto, canal de YouTube y páginas de Instagram y Facebook, donde compartiremos los videos y contenido que te inspirará y ayudará a hacer el cambio
Adquirir 100,000 suscriptores de YouTube, 50,000 de Facebook y 20,000 de Instagram
Crear una comunidad internacional de personas interesadas en cuidar el medio ambiente y en tener un mejor futuro para esta y para las próximas generaciones.
Somos un equipo de expertos de diferentes áreas de producción multimedia, redes sociales y conservación ambiental…

Arturo Ángeles, productor, guionista y conductor. Tiene licenciatura en biología y maestría en desarrollo comunitario sustentable. Es director de una organización especializada en la educación ambiental multimedia, con una base de más de 93,000 seguidores en redes sociales, y fue la persona que inició el movimiento contra las bolsas de plástico, que ayudó a llevar a la prohibición de bolsas en Tijuana, México.

Mónica Hernández, editora y diseñadora gráfica digital. Tiene una ingeniería en diseño gráfico digital y maestría en administración de negocios con concentración en mercadotecnia. Tiene más de 10 años de experiencia de trabajo en diseño y producción multimedia para televisión y redes sociales. Es co-fundadora de una agencia productora multimedia y de efectos visuales.

Gabriela Reyes, camarógrafa y asesora. Tiene una licenciatura en comunicación, tiene más de 10 años de experiencia en televisión, como camarógrafa, floor manager y conductora, y directora de marketing y ventas.

Jorge Ávila, analista de redes sociales. Es asesor en redes sociales y posicionamiento web. Fundador de una empresa dedicada a redes sociales, desarrollo, asesoría y posicionamiento web y es consultor de marketing de contenido digital en un canal de televisión y de turismo médico.

Hava Villaverde, asesora. Tiene gran experiencia en investigación en las áreas de planeación estratégica, marketing y desarrollo de negocios sustentables, y planificación. Tiene maestría en administración de empresas con enfoque en sustentabilidad y doctorado en leyes.

Ronald E. Steffens, asesor. Maestro de comunicación en Prescott College, tiene licenciatura en Inglés y maestría en escritura narrativa creativa, con gran experiencia en periodismo y comunicación ambiental.

Alejandro Sevilla, asesor. Fue conductor de un programa matutino de televisión, y ha sido conductor y productor de un programa televisivo de cultura pop y cine por más de 10 años. Es YouTuber creador de contenido, y editor en un estudio de animación 3D que crea contenido para Cartoon Network, Nickelodeon, HBO y Netflix.
 Hacer este proyecto conlleva muchos gastos:
Videos – investigación, creación del guión, grabación, edición, y publicación. Cada video toma entre 60-70 horas para hacerse. Haremos 12 videos en 9 meses.
Equipo [cámara 4K, tripie, memoria, micrófonos, lámparas, y teleprompter]
Renta de espacio de grabación
Diseño de la imagen
Página web (diseño, hosting y mantenimiento)
Promoción del canal de YouTube para poder llegar al mayor número de personas 
   Conforme mayor sea la contribución, más exclusivos y mayor la cantidad de beneficios y mejor el regalo. Cada nivel incluye los beneficios (excepción del regalo) del nivel anterior y un premio único. Esta es nuestra manera de agradecerte y reconocer que sin ti, no pudiéramos haber lanzado esta iniciativa de educación y conservación ambiental.1-Email de agradecimiento: Te mandaremos un correo electrónico agradeciéndote tu contribución en nuestro proyecto2-Agradecimiento en redes sociales: Haremos una publicación en Facebook e Instagram, donde te etiquetaremos, agradeciéndote por el apoyo3-Membresía en grupo de Facebook: Serás invitado a integrarte a un grupo privado que haremos, donde podrás compartir tus comentarios, dudas y conocimiento con personas con los mismos intereses y valores que tú, y con el equipo de Neurona Ecológica. En este grupo estaremos haciendo encuestas y pidiendo opiniones sobre los diferentes videos y contenido que publiquemos4-Acceso a detrás de cámara: Tendrás acceso a contenido (fotos y videos) exclusivo de las grabaciones y del proceso de producción de los videos. Podrás ser de los pocos que ven todo lo que pasa detrás de cámaras y que no aparece en los videos que publicamos.5-Tu nombre en la página web: Publicaremos tu nombre en nuestra página web, NeuronaEcologica.com (que habilitaremos en noviembre), como una de las personas que permitió que este proyecto se haga realidad. Si gustas, le pondremos una liga a tu red social o página de tu empresa.6-Selecciona el tema del próximo video: De manera privada, te compartiremos una lista de temas y pequeña descripción,  para que votes por los que más te interesan. Contaremos los votos y así seleccionaremos los temas de los próximos videos que haremos. De esta manera tú influirás directamente en el contenido de Neurona Ecológica.7-Tu nombre en los créditos de videos: Al final de cada video aparecerá tu nombre, donde permanecerá mientras exista YouTube para que miles de personas vean que fuiste uno de los principales facilitadores del proyecto. Podemos poner tu nombre o el nombre de tu marca o empresa.8-Asiste (en persona o transmisión en vivo) a una grabación: Podrás vivir lo que son las grabaciones de los videos. Podrás conocer el estudio donde grabamos y todo el proceso de preparación (ajuste de luces, cámara, micrófono y teleprompter) y grabación; ya sea en persona un sofá en el estudio, o en la comodidad de tu casa mediante transmisión en vivo privada contigo9-Mención durante el video (10-15 segundos): Te agradeceremos al inicio de cada video. Mencionaremos que el video fue patrocinado por ti (tu nombre o tu empresa) y una breve descripción de tu empresa, productos o servicios. El agradecimiento permanecerá mientras exista YouTube para que miles de personas vean que fuiste uno de los principales facilitadores del proyecto.Los beneficios se brindarán durante toda la primera temporada de 9 meses en los cuales se publicarán 12 videos.  Por favor contáctanos para cualquier pregunta que tengas, con mucho gusto te la responderemos y daremos cualquier información adicional que desees. Te agradecemos mucho tu ayuda. Cualquier cantidad que puedas donar será muy agradecida.¡Muchas gracias!  [English]The videos are filmed with a green screen at a video production studio using professional grade equipment. We are doing this because there is minimal scientific research based information about these topics in Spanish.We will share this knowledge with all the people living in the United States who only speak Spanish, with all Mexico and with all Latin America. We will be your practical go to guide that will help you change your habits so you can have a more environmentally friendly lifestyle, and together help conserve thousands of species that are at risk of extinction, and have a cleaner and healthier community. The more people this knowledge reaches, the more people will make the necessary lifestyle changes and stop being part of the problem and become part of the solution. This is why this project is extremely important and urgent. This is also why it is so important that you participate and helps us do this. We have to do this together. OUR OBJECTIVES
Create and publish 12 videos, 7 to 10 minutes long each, filmed with a green screen, with animated text and graphics, video clips, animations and supportive imagery, within a 9 month period (1 every 3 weeks)
Create and manage a project website, a YouTube cannel and Instagram and Facebook pages, where we will share the videos and content that will inspire and help you make a change
Create an international community of people interested in protecting the environment and in having a better future for this and coming generations
 OUR TEAMWe are a team of experts in different áreas in multimedia production, social media and environmental conservation…
Arturo Angeles, Producer, Scriptwriter and Host. Has a B.S. Degree in biology and an M.S. Degree in resilient and sustainable communities. Is the Executive Director of an organization specialized in multimedia environmental education, with a base of more than 93,000 social media followers, and was the person who started the movement against plastic bags, which helped lead to the prohibition of plastic bags in Tijuana, Mexico. 
Monica Hernandez, Editor and Digital Graphic Designer. Has an Engineering Degree in digital graphic design and an M.A. Degree in business administration with a focus on marketing. Has more than 10 years of experience in design and multimedia production at a TV station and is the co-founder of a multimedia and visual effects production firm.
Gabriela Reyes, Cameraperson and Adviser. Has a B.A. degree in communications and more than 10 years of experience working in televisión as Cameraperson, Floor Manager, TV Show Host and Marketing and Sales Director
Jorge Avila, Website and Community Manager. He is an adviser on social media and web branding; is the Founder of a web branding and social media branding and consulting firm, and is a digital content consultant in the medical tourism sector and at a TV station.
Hava Villaverde, Project Adviser, has research expertise in the areas of strategic planning, marketing and sustainable business development and planning; a M.B.A. degree in sustainable business administration, with concentration in sustainability and a Juris Doctor degree in Law.
Ronald E. Steffens, project adviser, Prescott College Associate Professor of Communications, has a M.F.A. Degree in creative writing and B.A. Degree in English, extensive experience in journalism education, environmental communication and creative writing.
Alejandro Sevilla, project adviser, was a TV morning show host and has produced a pop culture TV show for more than 10 years, is currently a Spanish language YouTube content creator and Editor for a 3D animation studio that creates content for the Cartoon Network, Nickelodeon and Netflix.
 OUR EXPENSESExecuting this project has a lot of expenses:
Videos – research, script writing, shooting, editing, and publishing. Each video takes 60-70 hours to create. We will do 12 videos over 9 months.
Equipment (4K camera, tripod, memory card, microphones, lamps, and teleprompter)
Shooting space rental
Brand design
Website (design, hosting and maintenance)
Promotion of the YouYube channel to reach the greatest amount of people possible
 EXPLANATION OF THE BENEFITSAs the contribution is greater, so too are the benefits and get exclusive, and better the gift is. Each level includes the benefits (excludes gift) of the previous level and a unique gift. This is our way of thanking you and recognizing that you are the one who makes the launch of this environmental education and conservation initiative possible.1-Thank you email: We will email you thanking you for contributing to our project2-Social media thank you: We will make a post on Facebook and Instagram, tagging you and thanking you for your support3-Facebook group membership: You will be invited to join our private group, where you will be able to share comments, questions and knowledge with people with the same interests and moral values as you, and with the Neurona Ecologica team. In the group, we will be doing surveys and taking your opinions and feedback about the videos and content that we publish.4-Behind the camera access: You will have access to exclusive content (photos and video) of the videos filming and production process. You will be one of the few that get to see what happens behind the cameras and that it is not shown in the published videos.5-Your name at the website: We will add your name at our website NeuronaEcologica.com (which we will launch in November), as one of the persons that made this project possible. If you would like, we can link your name to one of your social media sites or your business website.6-Select next video’s topic: Privately, we will share with you a list of topics along with a brief description of each, so that cast your vote for the topics that most interest you. We will tally the votes and that way select the topics for the next videos. Allowing you to directly influence Neurona Ecologica’s content.7-Your name in videos credits: Your name will appear at the end of each video, where it will stay for as long as YouTube exists, so that thousands of people see that you were one of the main supporters of the project. We can add your name or your brand or business name.8-Attend a filming (in person or via live transmission): You will be able to experience the video filming.  You will get to know the studio where we shoot the videos, see the whole preparation process (adjust lights, camera, microphone and teleprompter) and the actual shooting; either in person at a sofa at the studio, or from the comfort of your house through a private live transmission.9-(10-15 second) video plug: We will thank you at the start of each video. We will mention that the video is sponsored by you (your name or your business) and give a brief overview of the business, products or services. The plug will remain there for as long as YouTube exists so that thousands of people see that you were one of the main supporters of the project.The benefits will be offered during the whole first 9 month season in which we will publish 12 videos.  Please contact us with any question that you have, we will happily respond and provide you any additional information that you seek. We appreciate your support very much. Any donation you give will be greatly appreciated.Thank you!

story:
English version below.

Un bambino viene lasciato a casa da solo. Cosa prova? Quale silenzio lo avvolge? Dove sono i suoi genitori?

Se sei arrivato qui, devi sapere che il nostro intento è di raccontare una storia che ti faccia provare esattamente la sensazione che prova un bambino lasciato da solo, a sé stesso. Non lo facciamo per sadismo, ma per sensibilizzare chiunque ad un aspetto della nostra società molto importante. Sono minimo 35 milioni i bambini che vengono lasciati da soli nel mondo, sia che essi siano alcuni tra i 150 milioni di orfani, sia che siano figli di famiglie benestanti occidentali. Immaginate la metà della popolazione italiana. Immaginate che metà della vostra nazione sia composta solo, esclusivamente da bambini soli. Immagina che uno di loro sei tu, o tuo figlio.

Se deciderai di volerci aiutare, noi daremo il massimo per rappresentare questa condizione e sensibilizzare il pubblico, ma lo faremo senza toni melodrammatici e lo racconteremo come una fiaba contemporanea. Aiutaci, con un piccolo contributo sensibilizzerai tutti i grandi a prendere consapevolezza di un aspetto poco noto della società in cui viviamo.

Chi siamo?

Siamo Amarena Pictures, una casa di produzione italiana fondata da due registi.

Il nostro core business è principalmente la creazione di pubblicità tv/web.

Siamo entusiasti di annunciare il crowdfunding della short series Doorlight. Racconta di Thea, una bambina di dieci anni, che vive da sola in una grande casa. Il tema che andremo a toccare è proprio l'abbandono e la solitudine infantile. Alcuni di voi, forse in particolare quelli che sono figli unici, probabilmente sanno a cosa ci riferiamo. Altri ricorderanno dei momenti personali, perché è capitato a tutti almeno una volta di trovarsi soli in casa da piccoli.

La serie Doorlight sarà diretta dai due registi Giovanni Caloro e Alessandro Merletti De Palo:

Nei diversi episodi vedremo la piccola protagonista compiere azioni di tutti i giorni: prepara il pranzo, lava i piatti, disegna su un grande tavolo in silenzio oppure, si spazzola i capelli prima di andare a dormire. Azioni semplici che, nell'assenza dei suoi genitori o di altre persone, portano lo spettatore a pensare: perché questa bambina vive in quella grande casa da sola? Il mistero cresce quando Thea sente una voce, una voce che le fa domande e la spaventa. Questa voce proviene da una delle porte della casa ma, questa sembra essere bloccata e inaccessibile. In più, dalla stessa porta, un forte spiraglio di luce illumina la stanza. Chi è quella voce? Chi c'è dietro la porta? L'idea dietro la storia è quella che la resistenza di tutti i piccoli esseri umani che si ritrovano da soli può essere una forza vincente che supera ogni sfida ma, allo stesso tempo questi piccoli eroi non dovrebbero essere lasciati soli.

Lo scopo del progetto è quindi rappresentare questa condizione dei bambini e partendo da qui diffondere questo tema attraverso un network di comunicazione internazionale.

Abbiamo bisogno di 50.000€ per produrre l'intera serie Doorlight. Ma come potete vedere al momento vi stiamo chiedendo solamente 15.000€ così da riuscire a produrre i primi due episodi e iniziare a diffondere il messaggio. Raggiungere il nostro obiettivo di Indiegogo sarebbe solo il primo passo del nostro viaggio. Ed è per questo che superarlo sarebbe ancora meglio: con 30.000€ saremo in grado di produrre quattro episodi e con 50.000€ riusciremo a dare vita all'intera storia di Thea.

Crediamo che un'iniziativa del genere possa essere anche un'opportunità per tutti gli amanti del cinema che vogliono prendere parte ad un progetto reale e ambizioso. Nello specifico, poiché le campagne crowdfunding offrono ricompense per chi supporta il progetto, abbiamo pensato di dedicare alcune di queste a chi vorrà supportarci con il cuore e chi invece, come gli studenti e amanti di cinema, con la propria passione professionale:

1) Il tuo Nome nei titoli: 1€

2) Un Ringraziamento Speciale nei titoli: 5€

3) Ricevi immagini del Dietro le Quinte in Alta Qualità: 10€

4) Live! e una Preview degli Episodi: 20€

5) Download in Alta Qualità + Dietro le Quinte + Contenuti Speciali: 30€

6) Segui e aiuta il Montaggio: 100€

7) Preview dell'intera Sceneggiatura: 150€

8) Festa in Piscina + Maglietta Crew: 200€

9) Raggiungici sul Set per un giorno + Cena: 400€

10) Diventa una Comparsa + Corso di recitazione di 1 giorno: 750€

11) Associate Producer + Corso di produzione di 1 giorno: 1000€

12) Associate Producer + Corso intensivo di filmmaking: 1.500€

13) Producer - Segui il corso, inviaci un tuo soggetto e vieni a tutti gli eventi Doorlight: 2000€

Nota: tutte le ricompense contengono le precedenti. 

Come potete vedere, le ultime implicano la reale possibilità di partecipare attivamente alle riprese sul set di Doorlight! Quindi, potreste avere l'opportunità, sia che siate studenti, sia che siate padri o madri e vorrete partecipare con i vostri figli, di far parte del mondo di Doorlight. Il nostro scopo è quello di condividere questa iniziativa con voi, cosicché possiate sia aiutarci a sviluppare questo progetto sia essere coinvolti in un'esperienza unica!

Nello specifico, per gli studenti abbiamo:

CORSO DI RECITAZIONE DI 1 GIORNO:

Avrai l'opportunità di imparare cosa significa RECITARE su un vero set. Sceglierai una scena e sarai diretto nel rappresentarla parte. Imparerai a controllare i tuoi movimenti, a migliorare le tue tecniche di respirazione e la tua dizione, tutto questo nel contesto del set.

CORSO DI PRODUZIONE DI 1 GIORNO:

Avrai l'opportunità di imparare tutto ciò che c'è da sapere nel campo della PRODUZIONE e cosa si nasconde dietro ad un set perfettamente funzionante. Dal punto di vista finanziario e organizzativo, potrai scoprire i ruoli e i compiti non solo di chi prende parte al set, ma anche di chi si occupa delle fasi di pre e post produzione.

CORSO INTENSIVO DI FILMMAKING:

Avrai la possibilità di imparare tutto su PRODUZIONE e REGIA! Questa è la tua migliore occasione per poter finalmente apprendere mentre vivi l'esperienza del set e pratichi la tua passione. Avrai modo di relazionarti e capire ruoli e compiti di tutte le persone sul set, l'utilizzo corretto dell'attrezzatura, la grammatica delle inquadrature e infine vedere come tutto questo confluisce nel montaggio.

Vogliamo inoltre assicurarvi che qualora non raggiungessimo neanche in minima parte l'obbiettivo fissato, necessario per produrre Doorlight, considereremo l'eventualità di donare i soldi raccolti ad un'associazione che supporta i diritti dei bambini.

Se volete darci una mano in altri modi, scriveteci, aiutateci contattando i vostri amici: mandategli una mail con il link a questa pagina anche se non avete finanziato il progetto!

Speriamo vi piaccia il nostro trailer e che vogliate unirvi a noi nel diffondere questa storia unica e ricca di significato.

Non perdete questa occasione, unisciti a noi nel mondo di Doorlight!

ENGLISH

Some children are left home alone. How do they feel? What silence surrounds them? Where are their parents? 

If you’re here, please know that our goal is to tell a story that will make you feel just like as a child left home alone.

We don’t do it for sadistic purposes, but to make people conscious about a very important aspect of our society. There are at least 35 million children who are left alone in the world, whether they are some of the 150 million orphans, or they are children of western wealthy families. 

Imagine half the population of Italy. Imagine, now, that half of Italy is made up of lonely children. 

Imagine one of them. it could be you, it could be your son.

If you’ll decide to support us, we will do our best to represent this aspect of our children and raise public awareness. We’ll do it without melodramatic tones but telling a story that is like a contemporary fairy tale. Help us now: with a small amount of money you will make many adults aware of this less-known aspect of our society.

Who we are? 

We are amarena Pictures, an Italian production company founded by two directors. Our core business is mainly the creation of TV/ web advertising.

We are thrilled to tell you about the story of a short series named Doorlight. It talks about Thea, a ten years old girl, who lives alone in a big house. The theme that we will discover at the end of the story is about children loneliness.

The name of our project is Doorlight, a short series directed by the two directors Giovanni Caloro and Alessandro merletti De Palo: “we have the intent of telling a story, the story of a little girl, Thea, who lives alone in her house. Some of you, especially those who are only children, probably know what we mean. Others will probably remember some personal occasions in which they were left home alone: it has happened to everyone at least once when we were children.”

In the several episodes we’ll watch the little protagonist make everyday actions like preparing lunch, washing dishes, drawing or brushing her hair before going to sleep. Simple actions that, in the absence of her parents or other people, make the viewer wonder: why is this child living in that big house all alone?  The mystery gets bigger when Thea starts to hear a voice, asking her questions and scaring her. The voice comes from one of the doors of the house but it seems to be locked and inaccessible. From the same door, we see a strong blade of light that illuminates the room. Who’s that voice? Who’s behind that door? The idea behind the story is that the endurance of all little human beings who face loneliness can be a winning force that overcomes every challenge, but at the same time they shouldn’t be left alone.

The aim of the project is therefore to depict the condition of lone children, and out of it to create a joint communication about this theme through an international network.

We need about 50.000€ to produce the entire Doorlight series. But as you can see at the moment we are asking you only 15.000€, so we are able to produce the first two episodes and starting to spread awareness on  our children loneliness message. Reaching our Indiegogo goal would be only the first step of our journey. And that's why overcoming it would be even better. With 30.000€ we'll be able to produce four episodes and with 50.000€ we'll be able to show the complete story of Thea.

We believe that an initiative like this could be also an opportunity for cinephiles to take part in a real and ambitious project. In particular, crowdfunding campaigns require rewards for those who support the project, so we thought about perks even for cinema students and lovers:

1) Name in titles: 1€

2) Special thanks in titles: 5€

3) Receive High Quality BTS images: 10€

4) Live! and Episodes Previews: 20€

5) HQ Download + BTS + Special Content: 30€

6) Exclusive: Follow and help the Editing: 100€

7) Full Script Preview: 150€

8) Pool Party + Crew T-shirt: 200€

9) Come with us 1 day on set + dinner: 400€

10) Be an Extra + 1 day actor course: 750€

11) Associate producer + 1-day course: 1.000€

12) Associate producer + Full course: 1.500€

13) Producer: Your Script, Invitations, Course: 2.000€

Note: all the rewards contain the previous ones.

Our aim is to share this initiative with you, both to help us carry out this project and to make you involved in an experience which could certainly be interesting to a film lover and that's why the last entries imply the real possibility to actively participate in the shooting and on the Doorlight set!

1 DAY ACTOR COURSE:

You will have the chance to learn what ACTING on a real set means. You will choose a scene and you'll be directed on how to be in it. You'll practice how to control your movement, to improve your breathing techniques and your diction, all of this in the context of the set.

1 DAY COURSE:

You will have the chance to learn everything about the PRODUCTION flow that is behind a perfectly working set. From the financial and organizational point of view, you will be able to discover each role and their duties not only on the set but also before and after the shooting.

FULL COURSE:

You will have the chance to learn everything about PRODUCTION AND DIRECTION! This is your best option to finally learn while actually living the experience and practicing what you love. You'll be able to understand roles and duties of all the people on set, discover the use of technical equipment, learn about shooting geometry and grammar and also see how all of this merges in the editing.

We want to clarify that if we could not reach the amount needed to produce Doorlight, we could evaluate to donate the money to an association supporting child rights.

If you want to support us in other ways, write us, help us or contact your friends: send them an email even if you didn't largely fund the project!

We hope you will like our trailer and join us in spreading this meaningful, unique story.

Don't miss this opportunity, learn and come join us into the Doorlight world!

Racconta di Thea, una bambina di dieci anni, che vive da sola in una grande casa. Il tema che andremo a toccare è proprio l'abbandono e la solitudine infantile. Alcuni di voi, forse in particolare quelli che sono figli unici, probabilmente sanno a cosa ci riferiamo. Altri ricorderanno dei momenti personali, perché è capitato a tutti almeno una volta di trovarsi soli in casa da piccoli.La serie Doorlight sarà diretta dai due registi Giovanni Caloro e Alessandro Merletti De Palo:Nei diversi episodi vedremo la piccola protagonista compiere azioni di tutti i giorni: prepara il pranzo, lava i piatti, disegna su un grande tavolo in silenzio oppure, si spazzola i capelli prima di andare a dormire. Azioni semplici che, nell'assenza dei suoi genitori o di altre persone, portano lo spettatore a pensare: perché questa bambina vive in quella grande casa da sola? Il mistero cresce quando Thea sente una voce, una voce che le fa domande e la spaventa. Questa voce proviene da una delle porte della casa ma, questa sembra essere bloccata e inaccessibile. In più, dalla stessa porta, un forte spiraglio di luce illumina la stanza. Chi è quella voce? Chi c'è dietro la porta? L'idea dietro la storia è quella che la resistenza di tutti i piccoli esseri umani che si ritrovano da soli può essere una forza vincente che supera ogni sfida ma, allo stesso tempo questi piccoli eroi non dovrebbero essere lasciati soli.Lo scopo del progetto è quindi rappresentare questa condizione dei bambini e partendo da qui diffondere questo tema attraverso un network di comunicazione internazionale.Abbiamo bisogno di 50.000€ per produrre l'intera serie Doorlight. Ma come potete vedere al momento vi stiamo chiedendo solamente 15.000€ così da riuscire a produrre i primi due episodi e iniziare a diffondere il messaggio. Raggiungere il nostro obiettivo di Indiegogo sarebbe solo il primo passo del nostro viaggio. Ed è per questo che superarlo sarebbe ancora meglio: con 30.000€ saremo in grado di produrre quattro episodi e con 50.000€ riusciremo a dare vita all'intera storia di Thea.Crediamo che un'iniziativa del genere possa essere anche un'opportunità per tutti gli amanti del cinema che vogliono prendere parte ad un progetto reale e ambizioso. Nello specifico, poiché le campagne crowdfunding offrono ricompense per chi supporta il progetto, abbiamo pensato di dedicare alcune di queste a chi vorrà supportarci con il cuore e chi invece, come gli studenti e amanti di cinema, con la propria passione professionale:1) Il tuo Nome nei titoli: 1€2) Un Ringraziamento Speciale nei titoli: 5€3) Ricevi immagini del Dietro le Quinte in Alta Qualità: 10€4) Live! e una Preview degli Episodi: 20€5) Download in Alta Qualità + Dietro le Quinte + Contenuti Speciali: 30€6) Segui e aiuta il Montaggio: 100€7) Preview dell'intera Sceneggiatura: 150€8) Festa in Piscina + Maglietta Crew: 200€9) Raggiungici sul Set per un giorno + Cena: 400€10) Diventa una Comparsa + Corso di recitazione di 1 giorno: 750€11) Associate Producer + Corso di produzione di 1 giorno: 1000€12) Associate Producer + Corso intensivo di filmmaking: 1.500€13) Producer - Segui il corso, inviaci un tuo soggetto e vieni a tutti gli eventi Doorlight: 2000€Nota: tutte le ricompense contengono le precedenti. Come potete vedere, le ultime implicano la reale possibilità di partecipare attivamente alle riprese sul set di Doorlight! Quindi, potreste avere l'opportunità, sia che siate studenti, sia che siate padri o madri e vorrete partecipare con i vostri figli, di far parte del mondo di Doorlight. Il nostro scopo è quello di condividere questa iniziativa con voi, cosicché possiate sia aiutarci a sviluppare questo progetto sia essere coinvolti in un'esperienza unica!Nello specifico, per gli studenti abbiamo:CORSO DI RECITAZIONE DI 1 GIORNO:Avrai l'opportunità di imparare cosa significa RECITARE su un vero set. Sceglierai una scena e sarai diretto nel rappresentarla parte. Imparerai a controllare i tuoi movimenti, a migliorare le tue tecniche di respirazione e la tua dizione, tutto questo nel contesto del set.CORSO DI PRODUZIONE DI 1 GIORNO:Avrai l'opportunità di imparare tutto ciò che c'è da sapere nel campo della PRODUZIONE e cosa si nasconde dietro ad un set perfettamente funzionante. Dal punto di vista finanziario e organizzativo, potrai scoprire i ruoli e i compiti non solo di chi prende parte al set, ma anche di chi si occupa delle fasi di pre e post produzione.CORSO INTENSIVO DI FILMMAKING:Avrai la possibilità di imparare tutto su PRODUZIONE e REGIA! Questa è la tua migliore occasione per poter finalmente apprendere mentre vivi l'esperienza del set e pratichi la tua passione. Avrai modo di relazionarti e capire ruoli e compiti di tutte le persone sul set, l'utilizzo corretto dell'attrezzatura, la grammatica delle inquadrature e infine vedere come tutto questo confluisce nel montaggio.Vogliamo inoltre assicurarvi che qualora non raggiungessimo neanche in minima parte l'obbiettivo fissato, necessario per produrre Doorlight, considereremo l'eventualità di donare i soldi raccolti ad un'associazione che supporta i diritti dei bambini.Se volete darci una mano in altri modi, scriveteci, aiutateci contattando i vostri amici: mandategli una mail con il link a questa pagina anche se non avete finanziato il progetto!Speriamo vi piaccia il nostro trailer e che vogliate unirvi a noi nel diffondere questa storia unica e ricca di significato.Non perdete questa occasione, unisciti a noi nel mondo di Doorlight!ENGLISHSome children are left home alone. How do they feel? What silence surrounds them? Where are their parents? If you’re here, please know that our goal is to tell a story that will make you feel just like as a child left home alone.We don’t do it for sadistic purposes, but to make people conscious about a very important aspect of our society. There are at least 35 million children who are left alone in the world, whether they are some of the 150 million orphans, or they are children of western wealthy families. Imagine half the population of Italy. Imagine, now, that half of Italy is made up of lonely children. Imagine one of them. it could be you, it could be your son.If you’ll decide to support us, we will do our best to represent this aspect of our children and raise public awareness. We’ll do it without melodramatic tones but telling a story that is like a contemporary fairy tale. Help us now: with a small amount of money you will make many adults aware of this less-known aspect of our society.Who we are? We are amarena Pictures, an Italian production company founded by two directors. Our core business is mainly the creation of TV/ web advertising.We are thrilled to tell you about the story of a short series named Doorlight. It talks about Thea, a ten years old girl, who lives alone in a big house. The theme that we will discover at the end of the story is about children loneliness.The name of our project is Doorlight, a short series directed by the two directors Giovanni Caloro and Alessandro merletti De Palo: “we have the intent of telling a story, the story of a little girl, Thea, who lives alone in her house. Some of you, especially those who are only children, probably know what we mean. Others will probably remember some personal occasions in which they were left home alone: it has happened to everyone at least once when we were children.”In the several episodes we’ll watch the little protagonist make everyday actions like preparing lunch, washing dishes, drawing or brushing her hair before going to sleep. Simple actions that, in the absence of her parents or other people, make the viewer wonder: why is this child living in that big house all alone?  The mystery gets bigger when Thea starts to hear a voice, asking her questions and scaring her. The voice comes from one of the doors of the house but it seems to be locked and inaccessible. From the same door, we see a strong blade of light that illuminates the room. Who’s that voice? Who’s behind that door? The idea behind the story is that the endurance of all little human beings who face loneliness can be a winning force that overcomes every challenge, but at the same time they shouldn’t be left alone.The aim of the project is therefore to depict the condition of lone children, and out of it to create a joint communication about this theme through an international network.We need about 50.000€ to produce the entire Doorlight series. But as you can see at the moment we are asking you only 15.000€, so we are able to produce the first two episodes and starting to spread awareness on  our children loneliness message. Reaching our Indiegogo goal would be only the first step of our journey. And that's why overcoming it would be even better. With 30.000€ we'll be able to produce four episodes and with 50.000€ we'll be able to show the complete story of Thea.We believe that an initiative like this could be also an opportunity for cinephiles to take part in a real and ambitious project. In particular, crowdfunding campaigns require rewards for those who support the project, so we thought about perks even for cinema students and lovers:1) Name in titles: 1€2) Special thanks in titles: 5€3) Receive High Quality BTS images: 10€4) Live! and Episodes Previews: 20€5) HQ Download + BTS + Special Content: 30€6) Exclusive: Follow and help the Editing: 100€7) Full Script Preview: 150€8) Pool Party + Crew T-shirt: 200€9) Come with us 1 day on set + dinner: 400€10) Be an Extra + 1 day actor course: 750€11) Associate producer + 1-day course: 1.000€12) Associate producer + Full course: 1.500€13) Producer: Your Script, Invitations, Course: 2.000€Note: all the rewards contain the previous ones.Our aim is to share this initiative with you, both to help us carry out this project and to make you involved in an experience which could certainly be interesting to a film lover and that's why the last entries imply the real possibility to actively participate in the shooting and on the Doorlight set!1 DAY ACTOR COURSE:You will have the chance to learn what ACTING on a real set means. You will choose a scene and you'll be directed on how to be in it. You'll practice how to control your movement, to improve your breathing techniques and your diction, all of this in the context of the set.1 DAY COURSE:You will have the chance to learn everything about the PRODUCTION flow that is behind a perfectly working set. From the financial and organizational point of view, you will be able to discover each role and their duties not only on the set but also before and after the shooting.FULL COURSE:You will have the chance to learn everything about PRODUCTION AND DIRECTION! This is your best option to finally learn while actually living the experience and practicing what you love. You'll be able to understand roles and duties of all the people on set, discover the use of technical equipment, learn about shooting geometry and grammar and also see how all of this merges in the editing.We want to clarify that if we could not reach the amount needed to produce Doorlight, we could evaluate to donate the money to an association supporting child rights.If you want to support us in other ways, write us, help us or contact your friends: send them an email even if you didn't largely fund the project!We hope you will like our trailer and join us in spreading this meaningful, unique story.Don't miss this opportunity, learn and come join us into the Doorlight world!

story:
What is City Boyz?

City Boyz  is a five episode original comedy series that follows two adults brothers (Trystan and Teddy Jenkins) who still live at home with their mother, Tamela, in a small town in Florida. The boys win a radio sweepstakes with a video submission (including an interpretive dance directed, choreographed and stage managed by Trystan) that awards them an all expense paid trip to NYC. Trystan, the ultimate theatre queen of Southern Florida, is psyched. He's always dreamed of flashing his jazz hands on the Great White Way and this may be his chance. Teddy, the resident hypochondriac of the family, can only focus on crime statistics and everything that could possibly go wrong.

Their mother encourages them to go on the trip to allow her some quality time with her husband, Mr. Richard, who she recently met on NeedaDaddy.com. With the help of a New York City guidebook, they map out the adventures that they will embark on. The problem is, they are pretty out of touch with what the big city has in store and run into a myriad of situations that they are ill equipped to handle.

About Us

Chad Burris (Creator/ Writer/ Trystan Jenkins) Chad is a New York based actor and writer. Chad recently moved to the city after touring across the United States and Canada with The Book of Mormon tour as the standby for Elder Cunningham. He has also worked regionally as an actor at acclaimed theaters including Arkansas Repertory Theater, Cape Playhouse, and Cleveland Playhouse. Chad can also be seen on the new Blackpills series, Bonding, debuting later this year.

Cory Stonebrook (Director/Writer/ Teddy Jenkins) Cory is an actor, director, writer, improvisor who currently lives in Brooklyn, NY with his wife, Tiffany and yorkie, Poptart. Cory is the creator of Sensitive, a web series that played several festivals such as Hudson Valley Comedy Festival, Katra Film Series, NYC Web Fest, IOWF and Brooklyn Web Fest where it took home the Audience Award. You can watch Sensitive on SeekaTV and on the upcoming ENV channel on Amazon Prime. Cory has also made recent appearances in Netflix's Orange is the New Black & Comedy Central's New Timers. You may have also seen him on one of the random commercials he has appeared in or performing with indie improv team Desert Rabbit. 

Jordan Battiste (Cinematographer/Editor) Jordan is a music producer and filmmaker residing in Harlem, NYC. He has procured placements on various film and TV projects, and has appeared on various MTV shows. He’s served as cinematographer and editor for NikoFrank Productions, for which they’ve amassed film festival nominations and successes. Jordan currently teaches film at Bronx Law and is the founder of The Panda Bandit, LLC., a video production company currently developing various web series and film projects.

What We Need & What You Get

Our base budget is $8,000 for the 5 episode series shoot. This includes paying our crew, led by cinematographer Jordan Batiste, lighting and equipment rental, catering for cast and crew on shoot dates, post production and color correction, costumes and props & festival fees and submissions. If we can get $10,000, our schedule would allow us an extra day of shooting and more flexibility and a more extensive post production process.  See pie chart below  for a fun, more colorful version of what i just stated. :) 

 

Why We Want To Make This Series

In the entertainment industry, it is important for actors to produce their own original content. With City Boyz, we are hoping to create visibility for ourselves and our collaborators. This is a story and script that showcases our strengths, in a way that only a script we wrote could. The process of creating the series is going to present us with many educational opportunities as well. This experience will be invaluable to us as we expand our knowledge of writing, directing, producing, casting, and acting.

Not only do we want this experience, to stretch our skills as writers/ producers/ actors, but we want to bring you a show that makes you want to come back each week for a new episode. We love to make people laugh. There is too much craziness in the world sometimes and we want to provide an escape for you to run to that feels like a warm blanket or a nice hot beverage. Who doesn't like a hot bev?! This series is an offbeat, stylized story that could only be told by us. Our sensibilities combined have created a pretty unique show that we really want to share with all of you! 

Other Ways You Can Help

Please, please please donate to help get the Jenkins boys to New York City (make our show!!)  After you donate, make sure to share our campaign with all of your friends and family.

-If you frequent the Upper East Side and run into old rich people often...please give them our info. 

-If you have recently come into some money because you play scratchers religiously or you took your ex-husband for all he's worth, you should really consider helping us out because...I mean you got lucky. Share the wealth! 

- If you are extremely good at making oatmeal chocolate chip cookies or you have super secret access to girl scout cookies...hook a brother up! This has nothing to do with the campaign, we just like cookies. 

Stay updated on all things City Boyz, by following us on Facebook, Instagram, and Twitter.

Instagram and Twitter (@cityboyzwebseries),

Facebook

If you have any questions or want to work on City Boyz, shoot us an email at cityboyzwebseries@gmail.com. 

Thanks for all your help! SHARE! FOLLOW! DONATE!!
