story:
Click "Back It" to Donate Now.
Follow for updates and share this campaign with your friends.

Hellgate Academy is an urban fantasy web-series about a slacker New York post-grad who discovers he is actually a Demon. We hope to raise $10,000 to make the first 2 episodes of this dark and funny "fish-out-of-water" urban fantasy webseries- and pay for our cast, crew, special effects & makeup artists, and all the other financial responsibilities. The series will be released for free on YouTube, with plans for the first episode to debut during VidCon 2018. 

If you're ready to donate now, scroll back to the top of this page and click "Back It." We have a lot of great perks in exchange for your donation at a variety of levels. And after you've donated, don't forget to follow for updates and share the campaign with your friends using the share icons next to the "Back It" button! If you need more information about this project, read on.

                   

 

Please Read This Important Campaign Update

Due to some personal events during the first week of our campaign, we made the difficuly decision to diminish our public activity on this fundraiser.  Without the constant plugging of the campaign, we know we probably won't reach our goal, and that's okay. We have already come up with some really great ideas to bring this project to life within our own means, starting with a LIVE multimedia staged reading. Please contribute if you can to help bring the best possible version of this to life. 

And thanks for your words of support. They actually mean more to us than any donation you could have provided.

What is Hellgate Academy?

We were initially inspired by the fantasy stories of writers like C.S. Lewis (The Screwtape Letters), Dante (The Divine Comedy), Milton (Paradise Lost), the Book of Revelations, and the "seven deadly sins." At its core, the production will be a showcase for the kind of work we would like to do, and the kind of show we want to watch: snappy dialogue set to a compelling story examining universal themes.

The script has quite a few special effects & makeup elements, so we need to raise money to actually make the project look good and ensure everyone involved is paid fairly. The entire first season has already been written, about 10 episodes, each episode lasting about 7 to 10 minutes, so if we tried to raise enough to shoot the entire series, it would  essentially be like making  a feature film. Since that kind of money is a lot to ask for in one go, we're hoping to secure the funds to make the first two episodes now, and release those episodes in advance as a proof of concept to generate interest in creating the rest of the series in the future. Special effects and makeup and such increase the production costs; and the series is demanding. This isn’t a living room sitcom; this is a  battle between good and evil. It’s a big cast and our friends from the New York acting community will be joining us. We believe that our cast and crew deserve to be paid for their work, and that their work will be better if we show them our appreciation with financial support. That means at LEAST paying SAG minimums or they wouldn’t be allowed to show. So we may be asking for a lot, but in terms of budgets for feature films, it's been very conservatively budgeted.

We'd like to create this series as a showcase for the type of work we want to do on film, as well as showcase the many wonderful actors we have met on my journey. We've created something that will be fun to watch, be easy to relate to, and pushes a few buttons along the way, purposely designed for the short episodic format that web-video excels at. With your help, we can put together a team to make this project even better.

What We Need & What You Get

We'd like to assemble a team of experienced professionals to help bring this series to life. In order for a professional cast and crew to spend a week shooting in New York City, we need a lot of money. We'd love to raise over $10,000 to pay our actors and all of the rest of the production crew and staff.

$25 gives us a roll of gaff tape.  $100 could allow us to rent a 15-passenger van for a day. $500 covers the cost of our entire crew, on set, for a full day of shooting. Your help makes a big difference.

Now, let’s be honest: $10,000 may not actually cover the cost of this whole venture, especially since crowdfunding fees eat up a percentage of the contributions.  We'd be overjoyed to go beyond that goal, because then we could afford to make each episode even better, and get started on making the rest of the series as well. The better the quality, the more likely people will watch it, and the more likely the story can have an impact on other people, future seasons, merchandise, and more.

The ultimate plan is to release a new episode once a week for 10 weeks on YouTube. To build a community and increase YouTube channel activity, we plan to post special behind-the-scene features a few days after each episode, and possibly some special background episodes, livestream interviews, or Viewer Comment Response videos a few days before each episode release. We'd also like to supplement the webseries with a social media campaign from the perspective of one of the characters, like Warren Wood's Tumblr page and Instagram account.

The more you contribute, the closer we can be to making all of these goals come true. If we miss our goal, that's okay. Your contribution will be used to wisely take the next steps in creating as much of series as possible in a reasonable manner. Maybe we have to scale down some of the production values. Maybe we can't afford to get permission to film on-location, so we have to make some warehouse in New Jersey look like a park along the East River in New York. Maybe we only have enough to make a really good trailer. Maybe we have to publish a comic book instead of a webseries at first. Whatever we get could be used as a proof of concept to get the project to the next level. 

Tell me more about this...

Hellgate Academy is about a young man from Astoria, New York who learns after years of living as a human, that he is actually a Demon. We follow his story as he struggles through his Tempter training at Hellgate Academy. It's made for people who want to see a magical world like Harry Potter grown up and inverted, with the snarky dialogue of Joss Whedon, and some of the armchair philosiphizing of Dogma.

Accessed through a secret door under Hellgate Bridge, which is an actual bridge in Astoria Park in an outer borough of New York City, Hellgate Academy is like the ivy leagues of demon schools. Our hero, Warren is only there because his uncle is a high ranking official in the demon government. After Warren gets in a few mishaps in his first few days at school, the students are assigned a Human to tempt to the Darkness. But it turns out that Warren is not good at this at all. 

Intended as a New Media series for broadcast on YouTube, the story is told in 10 episodes, of about 7 to 10 minutes each. Each episode follows Warren as he attempts to practice a different skill, commonly known as the Seven Deadly Sins. Episodes start with short cold-opens that mimic "found footage," showing Warren succeeding or failing at new assignments, before continuing the episode in a standard episodic shooting format. 

The real struggle for Warren is not being able to achieve success despite all the evidence that this is his calling.  But there is a deeper truth. He fails so much at being evil because he may not truly be entirely evil, and he is at the center of a battle larger than all of humanity, angels, and demons. Although the main character is a demon, he's fundamentally flawed. Those flaws are what viewers will relate to as he tries to make sense of the world around him. His struggles mirror the struggles so many people have had when wrestling with their own beliefs and morals. His failures mirror the failures so many people have had when ... Sometimes its funny, sometimes its heart-wrenching. But with your help it can be done right, and hopefully have a lasting impact on the viewers.

The pursuit of a creative life is a struggle. We wanted to find a way to put that struggle into the work, and entertain an audience with a fun and socially relevant story. Yes, this story concerns religion. It also features some speculative mysteries about  real-life landmarks in the outer-boroughs of New York, the underground NY theatre scene, and an eclectic community of artists battling for their way-of-life. Oh- also a Frappuccino-obsessed guardian angel.

The writer/producer/star is Kane Prestenback. Kane has been acting professionally for over 15 years. Since graduating Circle in the Square Theatre School on Broadway, he's focused on new theatrical works, regional theatres, short films, and guest star television roles. His appearance in premiere of The Tallest Building in the World (at Luna Stage) garnered rave reviews including one from the New York Times. He has appeared on Travel Channel, Lifetime, Discovery ID, American Heroes Channel, and lead roles in many short films and webseries, and he has worked in New York with NYMF, Old Vic New Voices, Public Theatre, John Gould Rubin, and Theodore Mann. He was a participant in the inaugural TS Eliot US/UK Exchange, in association with London’s Old Vic and Kevin Spacey.

Risks & Challenges

We've already touched upon some alternative plans if we don't reach our goal. We think that this story carries a message that is important for society today, so we plan to do everything we can to surmount those challenges. The goal is to assemble an experienced production team that will be able to take a look at our production means realistically. We also plan to reach out to local New York businesses for potential branding and product placement opportunities, since the events of the series take place in a specific place and time. This could help preserve costs and bring in additional funds for production.

We've also got some really great people who have already expressed interest in being involved. We think having these people on board will help generate publicity and anchor the production in a high regard for quality. The closer we get to our goal, the more likely we will be able to make sure these wonderful friends of ours will be able to be involved.

Some of the possible co-stars for the first episode include:

Kristin Parker- TV/ Film: “Maturity” (pilot), “Orange is the New Black”, “Blue Bloods” “Law & Order: SVU”, “College Humor”, I’m Here For You, Kingdom Coming, Matryoshka. Theater: Kristin has performed off-Broadway at the Soho Playhouse, The DR2, and The Theatre at St. Clements; Regionally at Arkansas Rep, The Kaufman Center, Speakeasy Stage, Old Castle, Fiddlehead, and NSMT; and developed work at Playwrights Horizons, Primary Stages, Rattlestick, The Cherry Lane, The Lucille Lortel, Urban Stages and The York. www.KristinParker.com

 

Alex Moreno-  Working out of New York, Alex has collaborated with New York Theater Workshop, New Dramatists, Theater for the New City, Dixon Place, IATI Theater, The PIT, NYU Writers lab, Columbia's MFA Directors & Writers program, the Robert Moss Theater, and The New York International Fringe Festival. He is known for his work on "Jessica Jones", "Kevin Can Wait", "Full Frontal with Samantha Bee", and "Sneaky Pete". He has been part of several projects overseen by the guidance of directors such as Anne Bogart (SITI), Gregory Mosher (Lincoln Center), and Brian Kulick (CSC). 

And future episodes  have roles written for the following:

Jason Michael Miller- international exposure as a featured member of the Award Winning sketch & parody series: The Key of Awesome.

 

Rachel McPhee Benson- classically trained off-Broadway and in film & television. (Pearl Theatre, "Unbreakable Kimmy Schmidt," "Boardwalk Empire." Rachel has an internet following via the high profile sketch comedy series Barely Productions/ Key of Awesome, whom she performs with regularly.

 

Lulu Picart- Lucille Lortel Award nominee for the Off-Broadway production of "Disenchanted." Tours: R & H Cinderella (First National, Charlotte); Listen To My Heart with David Friedman. Regional: 1776 (Edward Rutledge); Mame (Tampa Bay Theatre Award); Man of La Mancha (Aldonza); Rent, Hair, Wit, The Rocky Horror Show, How to Succeed…(with the Orlando Philharmonic). Co-host of the new podcast This Message Has No Content.

 

Nick Kohn- Nick Kohn is currently starring in the Tony Award–winning Broadway musical Avenue Q. He has appeared in the new Marvel hit series “Jessica Jones” on Netflix, as well as on Broadway and in Las Vegas in productions of Avenue Q. Nick’s television credits include "Elementary", "Person of Interest", "Nurse Jackie," and "Late Night with Jimmy Fallon".

 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

We understand if you can't contribute, but we hope this story excites you enough to want to help in another way.

  • Share this campaign with your friends. It's easy to use the Indiegogo share tools to get the word out.
  • Subscribe to the YouTube channel NOW so we can start strong.
  • Visit and share the social media pages for Hellgate on twitter, facebook, and tumblr. Like, share, and comment on the posts so more people know about the project!
  • Get in touch with us if you think you can contribute to the production process or the fundraising campaign! We'd love to be able to mention that your talents would be attached to the production. We are looking for producing partners, a director, film company, designers, and actors who may share my passion for the project and help make it a reality. Or if you think you can benefit the fundraising campaign in some way (produce teaser videos, campaign support, graphic design, promotion, organize live events, etc) please reach out to us!
story_txt:
Click "Back It" to Donate Now.Follow for updates and share this campaign with your friends.
Hellgate Academy is an urban fantasy web-series about a slacker New York post-grad who discovers he is actually a Demon. We hope to raise $10,000 to make the first 2 episodes of this dark and funny "fish-out-of-water" urban fantasy webseries- and pay for our cast, crew, special effects & makeup artists, and all the other financial responsibilities. The series will be released for free on YouTube, with plans for the first episode to debut during VidCon 2018. 
If you're ready to donate now, scroll back to the top of this page and click "Back It." We have a lot of great perks in exchange for your donation at a variety of levels. And after you've donated, don't forget to follow for updates and share the campaign with your friends using the share icons next to the "Back It" button! If you need more information about this project, read on.

                   

 
Please Read This Important Campaign Update
Due to some personal events during the first week of our campaign, we made the difficuly decision to diminish our public activity on this fundraiser.  Without the constant plugging of the campaign, we know we probably won't reach our goal, and that's okay. We have already come up with some really great ideas to bring this project to life within our own means, starting with a LIVE multimedia staged reading. Please contribute if you can to help bring the best possible version of this to life. 
And thanks for your words of support. They actually mean more to us than any donation you could have provided.
What is Hellgate Academy?
We were initially inspired by the fantasy stories of writers like C.S. Lewis (The Screwtape Letters), Dante (The Divine Comedy), Milton (Paradise Lost), the Book of Revelations, and the "seven deadly sins." At its core, the production will be a showcase for the kind of work we would like to do, and the kind of show we want to watch: snappy dialogue set to a compelling story examining universal themes.
The script has quite a few special effects & makeup elements, so we need to raise money to actually make the project look good and ensure everyone involved is paid fairly. The entire first season has already been written, about 10 episodes, each episode lasting about 7 to 10 minutes, so if we tried to raise enough to shoot the entire series, it would  essentially be like making  a feature film. Since that kind of money is a lot to ask for in one go, we're hoping to secure the funds to make the first two episodes now, and release those episodes in advance as a proof of concept to generate interest in creating the rest of the series in the future. Special effects and makeup and such increase the production costs; and the series is demanding. This isn’t a living room sitcom; this is a  battle between good and evil. It’s a big cast and our friends from the New York acting community will be joining us. We believe that our cast and crew deserve to be paid for their work, and that their work will be better if we show them our appreciation with financial support. That means at LEAST paying SAG minimums or they wouldn’t be allowed to show. So we may be asking for a lot, but in terms of budgets for feature films, it's been very conservatively budgeted.
We'd like to create this series as a showcase for the type of work we want to do on film, as well as showcase the many wonderful actors we have met on my journey. We've created something that will be fun to watch, be easy to relate to, and pushes a few buttons along the way, purposely designed for the short episodic format that web-video excels at. With your help, we can put together a team to make this project even better.


What We Need & What You Get
We'd like to assemble a team of experienced professionals to help bring this series to life. In order for a professional cast and crew to spend a week shooting in New York City, we need a lot of money. We'd love to raise over $10,000 to pay our actors and all of the rest of the production crew and staff.
$25 gives us a roll of gaff tape.  $100 could allow us to rent a 15-passenger van for a day. $500 covers the cost of our entire crew, on set, for a full day of shooting. Your help makes a big difference.

Now, let’s be honest: $10,000 may not actually cover the cost of this whole venture, especially since crowdfunding fees eat up a percentage of the contributions.  We'd be overjoyed to go beyond that goal, because then we could afford to make each episode even better, and get started on making the rest of the series as well. The better the quality, the more likely people will watch it, and the more likely the story can have an impact on other people, future seasons, merchandise, and more.
The ultimate plan is to release a new episode once a week for 10 weeks on YouTube. To build a community and increase YouTube channel activity, we plan to post special behind-the-scene features a few days after each episode, and possibly some special background episodes, livestream interviews, or Viewer Comment Response videos a few days before each episode release. We'd also like to supplement the webseries with a social media campaign from the perspective of one of the characters, like Warren Wood's Tumblr page and Instagram account.
The more you contribute, the closer we can be to making all of these goals come true. If we miss our goal, that's okay. Your contribution will be used to wisely take the next steps in creating as much of series as possible in a reasonable manner. Maybe we have to scale down some of the production values. Maybe we can't afford to get permission to film on-location, so we have to make some warehouse in New Jersey look like a park along the East River in New York. Maybe we only have enough to make a really good trailer. Maybe we have to publish a comic book instead of a webseries at first. Whatever we get could be used as a proof of concept to get the project to the next level. 


Tell me more about this...
Hellgate Academy is about a young man from Astoria, New York who learns after years of living as a human, that he is actually a Demon. We follow his story as he struggles through his Tempter training at Hellgate Academy. It's made for people who want to see a magical world like Harry Potter grown up and inverted, with the snarky dialogue of Joss Whedon, and some of the armchair philosiphizing of Dogma.
Accessed through a secret door under Hellgate Bridge, which is an actual bridge in Astoria Park in an outer borough of New York City, Hellgate Academy is like the ivy leagues of demon schools. Our hero, Warren is only there because his uncle is a high ranking official in the demon government. After Warren gets in a few mishaps in his first few days at school, the students are assigned a Human to tempt to the Darkness. But it turns out that Warren is not good at this at all. 
Intended as a New Media series for broadcast on YouTube, the story is told in 10 episodes, of about 7 to 10 minutes each. Each episode follows Warren as he attempts to practice a different skill, commonly known as the Seven Deadly Sins. Episodes start with short cold-opens that mimic "found footage," showing Warren succeeding or failing at new assignments, before continuing the episode in a standard episodic shooting format. 
The real struggle for Warren is not being able to achieve success despite all the evidence that this is his calling.  But there is a deeper truth. He fails so much at being evil because he may not truly be entirely evil, and he is at the center of a battle larger than all of humanity, angels, and demons. Although the main character is a demon, he's fundamentally flawed. Those flaws are what viewers will relate to as he tries to make sense of the world around him. His struggles mirror the struggles so many people have had when wrestling with their own beliefs and morals. His failures mirror the failures so many people have had when ... Sometimes its funny, sometimes its heart-wrenching. But with your help it can be done right, and hopefully have a lasting impact on the viewers.
The pursuit of a creative life is a struggle. We wanted to find a way to put that struggle into the work, and entertain an audience with a fun and socially relevant story. Yes, this story concerns religion. It also features some speculative mysteries about  real-life landmarks in the outer-boroughs of New York, the underground NY theatre scene, and an eclectic community of artists battling for their way-of-life. Oh- also a Frappuccino-obsessed guardian angel.
The writer/producer/star is Kane Prestenback. Kane has been acting professionally for over 15 years. Since graduating Circle in the Square Theatre School on Broadway, he's focused on new theatrical works, regional theatres, short films, and guest star television roles. His appearance in premiere of The Tallest Building in the World (at Luna Stage) garnered rave reviews including one from the New York Times. He has appeared on Travel Channel, Lifetime, Discovery ID, American Heroes Channel, and lead roles in many short films and webseries, and he has worked in New York with NYMF, Old Vic New Voices, Public Theatre, John Gould Rubin, and Theodore Mann. He was a participant in the inaugural TS Eliot US/UK Exchange, in association with London’s Old Vic and Kevin Spacey.


Risks & Challenges
We've already touched upon some alternative plans if we don't reach our goal. We think that this story carries a message that is important for society today, so we plan to do everything we can to surmount those challenges. The goal is to assemble an experienced production team that will be able to take a look at our production means realistically. We also plan to reach out to local New York businesses for potential branding and product placement opportunities, since the events of the series take place in a specific place and time. This could help preserve costs and bring in additional funds for production.
We've also got some really great people who have already expressed interest in being involved. We think having these people on board will help generate publicity and anchor the production in a high regard for quality. The closer we get to our goal, the more likely we will be able to make sure these wonderful friends of ours will be able to be involved.

Kristin Parker- TV/ Film: “Maturity” (pilot), “Orange is the New Black”, “Blue Bloods” “Law & Order: SVU”, “College Humor”, I’m Here For You, Kingdom Coming, Matryoshka. Theater: Kristin has performed off-Broadway at the Soho Playhouse, The DR2, and The Theatre at St. Clements; Regionally at Arkansas Rep, The Kaufman Center, Speakeasy Stage, Old Castle, Fiddlehead, and NSMT; and developed work at Playwrights Horizons, Primary Stages, Rattlestick, The Cherry Lane, The Lucille Lortel, Urban Stages and The York. www.KristinParker.com
 
Alex Moreno-  Working out of New York, Alex has collaborated with New York Theater Workshop, New Dramatists, Theater for the New City, Dixon Place, IATI Theater, The PIT, NYU Writers lab, Columbia's MFA Directors & Writers program, the Robert Moss Theater, and The New York International Fringe Festival. He is known for his work on "Jessica Jones", "Kevin Can Wait", "Full Frontal with Samantha Bee", and "Sneaky Pete". He has been part of several projects overseen by the guidance of directors such as Anne Bogart (SITI), Gregory Mosher (Lincoln Center), and Brian Kulick (CSC). 
And future episodes  have roles written for the following:
Jason Michael Miller- international exposure as a featured member of the Award Winning sketch & parody series: The Key of Awesome.
 
Rachel McPhee Benson- classically trained off-Broadway and in film & television. (Pearl Theatre, "Unbreakable Kimmy Schmidt," "Boardwalk Empire." Rachel has an internet following via the high profile sketch comedy series Barely Productions/ Key of Awesome, whom she performs with regularly.
 
Lulu Picart- Lucille Lortel Award nominee for the Off-Broadway production of "Disenchanted." Tours: R & H Cinderella (First National, Charlotte); Listen To My Heart with David Friedman. Regional: 1776 (Edward Rutledge); Mame (Tampa Bay Theatre Award); Man of La Mancha (Aldonza); Rent, Hair, Wit, The Rocky Horror Show, How to Succeed…(with the Orlando Philharmonic). Co-host of the new podcast This Message Has No Content.
 
Nick Kohn- Nick Kohn is currently starring in the Tony Award–winning Broadway musical Avenue Q. He has appeared in the new Marvel hit series “Jessica Jones” on Netflix, as well as on Broadway and in Las Vegas in productions of Avenue Q. Nick’s television credits include "Elementary", "Person of Interest", "Nurse Jackie," and "Late Night with Jimmy Fallon".
 
 


Other Ways You Can Help
We understand if you can't contribute, but we hope this story excites you enough to want to help in another way.

Share this campaign with your friends. It's easy to use the Indiegogo share tools to get the word out.
Subscribe to the YouTube channel NOW so we can start strong.
Visit and share the social media pages for Hellgate on twitter, facebook, and tumblr. Like, share, and comment on the posts so more people know about the project!

Get in touch with us if you think you can contribute to the production process or the fundraising campaign! We'd love to be able to mention that your talents would be attached to the production. We are looking for producing partners, a director, film company, designers, and actors who may share my passion for the project and help make it a reality. Or if you think you can benefit the fundraising campaign in some way (produce teaser videos, campaign support, graphic design, promotion, organize live events, etc) please reach out to us!

story:
What's about?

When Lily is finally asked out by the guy of her dreams, she panics at her lack of romantic experience and enlists her best friend, Aster, to help her practice as much as she can before the date. 

Set in her New York apartment, Lily (successful publisher but hopeless romantic) and Aster (pro bono lawyer who doesn't feel like he is worthy of happiness) practice kissing in preparation for her date with the office hottie, David. It’s her first kiss, and she’s nervous, but he calms her down. They kiss, and it seems like Aster might be harboring feelings for her. Before she can find out, they’re interrupted by a phone call from David. 

 

Meet the crew!

We are Jo and Juliana, a team of (soon to be) producers but also post-graduate students from the UK (though one of us is Brazilian!). Created by the bright&new amazing writer, Zoë Hodge, a recent screenwriter graduate from New York, who "aims to amplify the voices of those often forgotten, so they know that they and their stories are seen, heard, and valid".

We all fell in love with this script, not only because it is a fresh rom-com which portraits the lack of self confidence present in teenagers when it comes to their romantic lives but because we feel a show like this is important now because black women are not usually awarded such roles and we want to remove the focus from white-leading rom-coms and shift it to a diverse cast for a diverse audience. 

 

What can I do to help?!

We have put much effort into developing this story and producing our very first web series. This is part of our academic assessment but we're taking this opportunity, with the help of Royal Holloway media arts centre and teachers with years of industry experiences, to get a taste of real life and deliver top notch content! We have been working hard over the past several months and we are just a few pounds away from our budget for this pilot (we are aiming for 200£)! You are going to be supporting, not only this project but also other in-training producers, who are eager to achieve their dream careers!

 

The real deal:

Our shooting day is just a week away, so help us with any donation, of any kind  and it would be highly appreciated! We promise to use the money we achieve to cover our production costs and hopefully pay our lovely cast & crew! We would also love to be able to provide our caring team with all the good they deserve (who doesn't love a tasty snack after a hard day of work?!) 

You can also help us by sharing it amongst your social media group chats, sending it to friends & family, even to your high skilled pet! Literally, anyone! 

 

COVID SAFE SET 

In case you are wondering how we are going to bring it to life on a covid safe environment, we can assure you that we got our cast&crew covered! We've been taught how we should proceed and have a covid risk assessment in place. We are also aware of the social distancing shooting procedures as well as gov guidelines to certify that everyone gets to get and leave the set safe & sound! We are kindly taking care of everything!

story:
Thanks to you we got funded in 28 hours!

We are completely humbled and thankful. You made our campaign a success. Now we have a little problem… We have lots of time left on our campaign but we’re not content sitting on a Cuban beach drinking mojitos. We have a film to make and we have lots more to share!  So, we have some stretch goals we want to hit:

If we can raise a total of $10,000 we’ll be able to upgrade our post-production motion-graphics. May not sound like a big deal but this means that the Startup Cuba project will have an even more professional (broadcast quality) look.  

As a little thank you, when we hit this goal we're giving every one of our backers a cool sticker featuring one of our branded motion graphics.

If we can hit $13,000 we’ll be able to produce one entirely new episode for all of our backers. This means one more inside scoop of Cuban entrepreneurs…more personalities, more stories, more footage.  It’s a lot more.

This. Is. The. Big. Whopper. If we hit $20,000 this project goals global baby. The additional funds will enhance our distribution efforts. More $ typically means more eyeballs.

To thank you all, if we hit this goal, we'll produce an entirely new travel guide video for all of our backers. It'll feature our favorite secret places in Cuba - our go to spots to hit, off the beaten path, after our many trips to the island country. 

Now to your regularly scheduled program...

_________________________________________________

Wait. What?

These aren't startups like you know startups.  

Cuban entrepreneurs have no venture capitalists, no angel investors and no accelerator programs. There is no Cuban startup ecosystem. They’re on their own…figuring it out in ways that look different than anywhere else on the planet. We're telling this story and the story of how, in the midst of a Communist government, Cuban entrepreneurs are popping up and relying on their grit and ingenuity to survive. They're risking BIG to get their first taste of capitalism. And their story has the power to inspire us.

 

What has intrigued us as storytellers and filmmakers is the Cuban Spirit. You first see it as you get into a 1957 Chevrolet Bel Air taxi at the airport and hear how the driver has used parts for 20 other cars to keep it going. But that’s only the beginning. Cuban innovation goes far beyond the clichés and cool factor of classic cars. It’s the very way they move through the world.

We wanted to find out what was behind that. So began our quest. 

What we’ve discovered is this: a story that entails a love affair with the Soviet Union that goes awry, a time in recent history when the average Cuban lost 20lbs from economic collapse, a tele novella that inspires a spread of micro businesses, a handful of people who weekly curate the Internet for the whole island…and so much more.

 

Cubans are some of the most innovative people on earth…and they’ve got the street cred to prove it. 

They were schooled by a (in)famous revolutionary, lived in a communist government (even when communism went out of fashion), grew up with an embargo (spared of McDonalds but deprived of Starbucks) and survived an economic collapse (losing 80% of imports and exports when their Russian sugar daddy went away). Yet in the highs - and especially in the lows - they haven’t stopped creating.

When they couldn't buy car parts or shampoo or steak they mastered the work around.

And now, they have a chance to start businesses... and begin to own their destiny. In recent years over a half million Cubans have left their government controlled jobs to start small businesses.  

We’ve decided to focus on entrepreneurs because it’s where we see this Cuban spirit - full of zest, grit and innovation - most profoundly.  We’ve been uber inspired by their stories… and we suspect you will.

Meet just a few of the folks that we've gotten to know already...

Nestor - An aspiring Cuban filmmaker (media mogal) with clients such as National Geographic and the Rolling Stones.  He continues to be up on the trends despite limited access to the internet. 

 

Maryori - A self-trained artist building a business dependent on ever changing, and often-times non-existent, access to supplies and materials.

 

Sasha - A pioneering restauranteur defying Cuban cliches by creating a new approach to cuisine in Havana.

 

Gallo - A 90 something former barber and diplomat who is now getting a taste of capitalism.

 

We're two friends; Ken and Tamara. We met in 2009 in Mozambique. Ken (an entrepreneur) was a traveler in the bush and Tamara (a documentary filmmaker) was there filming a project.  We've stayed friends over the years and are excited to have found ourselves working together to explore mutual passions; film, startups, Cuba and telling the stories of extraordinary people.

 

Tamara - Story chaser, filmmaker, adventurer, curiosity-seeker, producer on five continents, high jump queen, & Cuba aficionado.

 

Ken - Serial entrepreneur, travel addict, Cuban lover (as in, "has a love of Cuban culture"),  bad joke teller, born with a video camera glued to hand.

 

Our gang has been to Cuba three times.  We've interviewed over twenty entrepreneurs in their homes, place of work, and of course... their taxis.  BUT, we're not done.  We need your help to go back to Havana to shoot our remaining interviews and complete the project.  And frankly, so much is changing in Cuba we suspect there are a few twists to the story still to discover.

 

We are grateful for your financial support.  Here's a breakdown of what we'll be using these campaign funds for...

CREW - In addition to our own team, we're thrilled to use Cuban filmmakers to help us tell the story.  We'll use some proceeds to hire these people.

TRAVEL & ACCOMODATION - Your support will fly us to Cuba and cover lodging. We promise to pay for our own Cuba Libres. For sure.

PRODUCTION - All film productions have costs. Here are some of ours; equipment rental, translators, craft services (food for crew).

POST PRODUCTION - We are compelled and committed to getting these stories out. So your help will support things when we're back like editing, motion graphics and sound design. Help us package it up and get it out to the world. And know...we'll love you for this. 

We've invested chunks of our lives in the last two years to chase down and learn from these Cuban entrepreneurs. We've been mesmerized and embolden by their innovative spirit. We're so excited to introduce them to you and share their stories. Thanks so much for helping us make this happen. Gracias x 1k! 

 

You're going to be inspired and educated. You'll have a behind-the-scenes window into our experience on the ground in Cuba and some pretty zesty stories to tell at your next cocktail party. Not to mention, our biggest supporters will get some one-on-one time, thank yous and kisses from the bald guy (optional).  

And, more amazing stuff...

Cuban Coffee

 

Is this legal?

Yes. It is legal. While technically still under an embargo, travel to Cuba is now permitted on a limited basis by US Citizens. There are twelve categories of approved US travel to Cuba. If you meet one of the 12 criteria, you can apply for a visa to visit Cuba. We meet one of these categories so we are legally permitted to visit Cuba.

Can you bring me back a Cuban cigar?

Yes. And. No. As of October, 2016, US citizens traveling to Cuba are permitted to bring back goodies like cigars and rum for personal use. We can't bring them back and sell them and we can't include them in our Indiegogo campaign. So, we can either carry them home to (a) smoke them all ourselves (cough, cough) or (b) give 'em away to friends as gifts. We're giving them away as gifts to some select friends. If you're interested, reach out.  

Who is actually producing this?

We are. We're a team of producers, storytellers, videographers, editors, creatives, and entrepreneurs. We set up our own little production company called VERV EXP to make it happen. In fact,  we're always looking for fun new video projects to work on so if you have a project, reach out.

Is there much of a startup infrastructure in Cuba?

No. There is nothing. There is no "startup ecosystem" like you know it.  That's one of what makes this so fascinating. Cubans don't start businesses because it's cool.  They do it because it's an opportunity for them to have impact and to increase their living wage (which is on average $20-$30 a month) and have a stake in their own destiny.  

What types of entrepreneurs are you talking to?

We're talking to entrepreneurs from all walks of life. But, to set expectations, the government only permits 201 legal business types for Cuban entrepreneurs to start. They range from "Cafe Owner" to "Car Painter" to "Broom Crafter" to "Maker of Yokes, Harnesses and Rope for Oxen" and other businesses that support Cuban  society. There is the opportunity for an entrepreneur to become a "Computer Programmer" but that's the limited nod to modern technology. Nonetheless there’s a new generation of Cubans who are creating apps (when you can’t buy apps online), designing video games (pioneering this for the first time) and they’re even making their own version of Amazon (all black market). These innovators are moving much faster than government categories…and many of the most techno-savvy endeavors are considered black market. This really intrigues us!

How are you getting access to the people, especially underground?

We've got an amazing group of friends who spend their time traveling to far away destinations in the name of doing good stuff. They do this by building genuine friendships on the ground and working within the local communities. As a result, we have friends in Cuba who know the people, who know the people, who know the people.    

How long are you going to Havana for?

It depends. Our goal is to get enough footage to tell an amazing story so we'll spend as much time there as we need. Due to obligations and responsibilities at home we can't really do it all at once but we plan to go back and forth as needed. Tamara's already been three times. We're now going back for a week. If we don't get everything shot on this trip, we'd go back again for another week or two in the future but since we've got most of it shot already, we feel good.

If I contribute $500, do I get to go with you?

Yes. Not on the trip that we're shooting on though. We'll soon be taking a small group on another trip to Havana. If you contribute $500 we'll invite you on that trip. You'll join us on a customized People To People trip where we'll stay in a Casa Particular and experience the real Cuba, as our Cuban friends on the island experience it. Oh, and you'll have to pay for it. ;-) It's not very expensive but we don't cover expenses (we will give you a discount though).

Has the current US administration impacted your plans?

Not so far. If anything, it's encouraged us to step on the gas a bit to finish up before any changes possibly take place. We're watching the situation closely because from what we hear, the current US administration is reviewing the US's position on Cuba. We don't know what that means at this point.  Changes in US travel rules or other laws could impact our ability to complete the project or deliver on promises made to you. It's a risk. As of now though, we appear to be in good shape and are moving forward with our plans. We'll certainly keep our supporters updated on any news we come across.
story_txt: Thanks to you we got funded in 28 hours!We are completely humbled and thankful. You made our campaign a success. Now we have a little problem… We have lots of time left on our campaign but we’re not content sitting on a Cuban beach drinking mojitos. We have a film to make and we have lots more to share!  So, we have some stretch goals we want to hit:If we can raise a total of $10,000 we’ll be able to upgrade our post-production motion-graphics. May not sound like a big deal but this means that the Startup Cuba project will have an even more professional (broadcast quality) look.  As a little thank you, when we hit this goal we're giving every one of our backers a cool sticker featuring one of our branded motion graphics.If we can hit $13,000 we’ll be able to produce one entirely new episode for all of our backers. This means one more inside scoop of Cuban entrepreneurs…more personalities, more stories, more footage.  It’s a lot more.This. Is. The. Big. Whopper. If we hit $20,000 this project goals global baby. The additional funds will enhance our distribution efforts. More $ typically means more eyeballs.To thank you all, if we hit this goal, we'll produce an entirely new travel guide video for all of our backers. It'll feature our favorite secret places in Cuba - our go to spots to hit, off the beaten path, after our many trips to the island country. Now to your regularly scheduled program..._________________________________________________Wait. What?These aren't startups like you know startups.  Cuban entrepreneurs have no venture capitalists, no angel investors and no accelerator programs. There is no Cuban startup ecosystem. They’re on their own…figuring it out in ways that look different than anywhere else on the planet. We're telling this story and the story of how, in the midst of a Communist government, Cuban entrepreneurs are popping up and relying on their grit and ingenuity to survive. They're risking BIG to get their first taste of capitalism. And their story has the power to inspire us. What has intrigued us as storytellers and filmmakers is the Cuban Spirit. You first see it as you get into a 1957 Chevrolet Bel Air taxi at the airport and hear how the driver has used parts for 20 other cars to keep it going. But that’s only the beginning. Cuban innovation goes far beyond the clichés and cool factor of classic cars. It’s the very way they move through the world.We wanted to find out what was behind that. So began our quest. What we’ve discovered is this: a story that entails a love affair with the Soviet Union that goes awry, a time in recent history when the average Cuban lost 20lbs from economic collapse, a tele novella that inspires a spread of micro businesses, a handful of people who weekly curate the Internet for the whole island…and so much more. Cubans are some of the most innovative people on earth…and they’ve got the street cred to prove it. They were schooled by a (in)famous revolutionary, lived in a communist government (even when communism went out of fashion), grew up with an embargo (spared of McDonalds but deprived of Starbucks) and survived an economic collapse (losing 80% of imports and exports when their Russian sugar daddy went away). Yet in the highs - and especially in the lows - they haven’t stopped creating.When they couldn't buy car parts or shampoo or steak they mastered the work around.And now, they have a chance to start businesses... and begin to own their destiny. In recent years over a half million Cubans have left their government controlled jobs to start small businesses.  We’ve decided to focus on entrepreneurs because it’s where we see this Cuban spirit - full of zest, grit and innovation - most profoundly.  We’ve been uber inspired by their stories… and we suspect you will.Meet just a few of the folks that we've gotten to know already...Nestor - An aspiring Cuban filmmaker (media mogal) with clients such as National Geographic and the Rolling Stones.  He continues to be up on the trends despite limited access to the internet.  Maryori - A self-trained artist building a business dependent on ever changing, and often-times non-existent, access to supplies and materials. Sasha - A pioneering restauranteur defying Cuban cliches by creating a new approach to cuisine in Havana. Gallo - A 90 something former barber and diplomat who is now getting a taste of capitalism. We're two friends; Ken and Tamara. We met in 2009 in Mozambique. Ken (an entrepreneur) was a traveler in the bush and Tamara (a documentary filmmaker) was there filming a project.  We've stayed friends over the years and are excited to have found ourselves working together to explore mutual passions; film, startups, Cuba and telling the stories of extraordinary people. Tamara - Story chaser, filmmaker, adventurer, curiosity-seeker, producer on five continents, high jump queen, & Cuba aficionado. Ken - Serial entrepreneur, travel addict, Cuban lover (as in, "has a love of Cuban culture"),  bad joke teller, born with a video camera glued to hand. Our gang has been to Cuba three times.  We've interviewed over twenty entrepreneurs in their homes, place of work, and of course... their taxis.  BUT, we're not done.  We need your help to go back to Havana to shoot our remaining interviews and complete the project.  And frankly, so much is changing in Cuba we suspect there are a few twists to the story still to discover. We are grateful for your financial support.  Here's a breakdown of what we'll be using these campaign funds for...CREW - In addition to our own team, we're thrilled to use Cuban filmmakers to help us tell the story.  We'll use some proceeds to hire these people.TRAVEL & ACCOMODATION - Your support will fly us to Cuba and cover lodging. We promise to pay for our own Cuba Libres. For sure.PRODUCTION - All film productions have costs. Here are some of ours; equipment rental, translators, craft services (food for crew).POST PRODUCTION - We are compelled and committed to getting these stories out. So your help will support things when we're back like editing, motion graphics and sound design. Help us package it up and get it out to the world. And know...we'll love you for this. We've invested chunks of our lives in the last two years to chase down and learn from these Cuban entrepreneurs. We've been mesmerized and embolden by their innovative spirit. We're so excited to introduce them to you and share their stories. Thanks so much for helping us make this happen. Gracias x 1k!  You're going to be inspired and educated. You'll have a behind-the-scenes window into our experience on the ground in Cuba and some pretty zesty stories to tell at your next cocktail party. Not to mention, our biggest supporters will get some one-on-one time, thank yous and kisses from the bald guy (optional).  And, more amazing stuff...Cuban Coffee Is this legal?Yes. It is legal. While technically still under an embargo, travel to Cuba is now permitted on a limited basis by US Citizens. There are twelve categories of approved US travel to Cuba. If you meet one of the 12 criteria, you can apply for a visa to visit Cuba. We meet one of these categories so we are legally permitted to visit Cuba.Can you bring me back a Cuban cigar?Yes. And. No. As of October, 2016, US citizens traveling to Cuba are permitted to bring back goodies like cigars and rum for personal use. We can't bring them back and sell them and we can't include them in our Indiegogo campaign. So, we can either carry them home to (a) smoke them all ourselves (cough, cough) or (b) give 'em away to friends as gifts. We're giving them away as gifts to some select friends. If you're interested, reach out.  Who is actually producing this?We are. We're a team of producers, storytellers, videographers, editors, creatives, and entrepreneurs. We set up our own little production company called VERV EXP to make it happen. In fact,  we're always looking for fun new video projects to work on so if you have a project, reach out.Is there much of a startup infrastructure in Cuba?No. There is nothing. There is no "startup ecosystem" like you know it.  That's one of what makes this so fascinating. Cubans don't start businesses because it's cool.  They do it because it's an opportunity for them to have impact and to increase their living wage (which is on average $20-$30 a month) and have a stake in their own destiny.  What types of entrepreneurs are you talking to?We're talking to entrepreneurs from all walks of life. But, to set expectations, the government only permits 201 legal business types for Cuban entrepreneurs to start. There is the opportunity for an entrepreneur to become a "Computer Programmer" but that's the limited nod to modern technology. Nonetheless there’s a new generation of Cubans who are creating apps (when you can’t buy apps online), designing video games (pioneering this for the first time) and they’re even making their own version of Amazon (all black market). These innovators are moving much faster than government categories…and many of the most techno-savvy endeavors are considered black market. This really intrigues us!How are you getting access to the people, especially underground?We've got an amazing group of friends who spend their time traveling to far away destinations in the name of doing good stuff. They do this by building genuine friendships on the ground and working within the local communities. As a result, we have friends in Cuba who know the people, who know the people, who know the people.    How long are you going to Havana for?It depends. Our goal is to get enough footage to tell an amazing story so we'll spend as much time there as we need. Due to obligations and responsibilities at home we can't really do it all at once but we plan to go back and forth as needed. Tamara's already been three times. We're now going back for a week. If we don't get everything shot on this trip, we'd go back again for another week or two in the future but since we've got most of it shot already, we feel good.If I contribute $500, do I get to go with you?Yes. Not on the trip that we're shooting on though. We'll soon be taking a small group on another trip to Havana. If you contribute $500 we'll invite you on that trip. You'll join us on a customized People To People trip where we'll stay in a Casa Particular and experience the real Cuba, as our Cuban friends on the island experience it. Oh, and you'll have to pay for it. ;-) It's not very expensive but we don't cover expenses (we will give you a discount though).Has the current US administration impacted your plans?Not so far. If anything, it's encouraged us to step on the gas a bit to finish up before any changes possibly take place. We don't know what that means at this point.  Changes in US travel rules or other laws could impact our ability to complete the project or deliver on promises made to you. It's a risk. As of now though, we appear to be in good shape and are moving forward with our plans. We'll certainly keep our supporters updated on any news we come across.

story:
Our Story

Over the past 24 years, actor/producer Rafael Zubizarreta has been constantly adding onto his realm of "Windward Spirits" which began as a simple fantasy roleplaying game among friends as a kid in 1994. Only in recent years (2015-2017) has he at last turned his ideas and visions into reality with the help and collaboration of Branching Out Productions along many others behind the scenes.

 

Production officially began on "Windward Spirits: A New Ruler" in December of 2015 and was filmed in May of 2016. Its follow up film, "Windward Spirits: Blood Ties" began production in September 2016 and filmed in January 2017 all through self and family funding . After a year long filming hiatus, the time has once again come to prep for the next film under Zubi Productions to round out the trilogy with "Windward Spirits: On Deadly Grounds" in collaboration with Nu Eyes Media and Rage Monkey Media. In this film we want to continue our story of these rich and mysterious characters and further capture the realm of Vanderia as these characters travel on through this harsh and unforgiving world.

For this to happen we need some help from you. Each and every contribution helps tremendously and we sincerely appreciate anything that you are able to assist with in helping this passion project once again come to life. We are currently setting our sights for the Fall of 2018.

Your Help

We are looking for a budget of approximately $20,000 for this next campaign to efficiently fulfill the production needs. This funding will cover:

Talent

Crew

Production Staff

Equipment

Set design

Location Expenses

Post Production

Music

Certainly, reaching this type of amount is challenging. As mentioned before however, any contribution is sincerely appreciated and will be used specifically for the vision of "Windward Spirits: On Deadly Grounds" even if our desired goal is not met. As proven before with our previous two award winning films of the series, we have the proper team in place to not only put this type of production together, but to execute it at its fullest potential with the resources we will have in place. 

Giving Back

We most definitely would love to give back some perks for those of you who choose to help us in our venture. Some of the perks include:

Shout out on social media outlets via Twitter, Instagram, and Facebook

Windward Spirits T-shirts

Windward Spirits posters

Becoming an executive producer complete with IMDb credit

Living in the realm with us in a featured role in "Windward Spirits: On Deadly Grounds" complete with IMDb credit

Other Ways You Can Help

We are aware that some of you simply cannot contribute at this time. That certainly doesn't mean it has to end there. Another way you can help us out is by sharing and spreading the word. The more people who come in contact with our page, the better it is for the over all production. We still want you to be involved. You can also help us out by following us on social media on Twitter, instagram, and Facebook. The links for each are listed below along with our website where you can purchase WS T-shirts as well as character posters. ALL proceeds go directly into the funding process of WSODG. Site and social media outlets listed below:

www.windwardspirits.net - Official website.

https://twitter.com/WindwardSpirits - Official Twitter page.

https://www.instagram.com/windward_spirits/ - Official Instagram page.

https://www.facebook.com/WindwardUniverse/ - Official Facebook page.

If you would also like to see a little more about our projects, you can visit our YouTube channel here:

https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCgNi238QIf-J-6...

We can't thank you enough for your contribution and support.

story:
Summary

In the far future an independent Scotland has begun conquering the stars.

Well it was all bound to go wrong sooner or later.

Scottish Space Federation: Chronicles of Yer Maw is an animated series that follows the exploits of Captain Danny McAndrew and his crew of hard-working layabouts aboard the eponymous federation battle-cruiser Yer Maw.

Perpetually drunk, easily distracted and with a brain capacity of a not-too-bright ten-year-old, Captain Danny is a continual thorn in the Scottish Space Federation's side. 

Yet their patience is wearing thin and assassination is beginning to appeal. 

Can the Yer Maw crew stay employed? Can they survive? And how much engine fuel is too much to drink?

The galaxy is turning Scottish and you're invited along for the ride.

What We Need 

The plan is to make six short episodes. One a month for six months. Released online via Youtube and Vimeo.

Animation is a painstaking process and takes time, effort and computer wizardry.

I need to raise £14,500 to do these cartoons justice. That may sound like a lot but it's mere buttons when it comes to animation.

The money will go to covering my time for the six months, covering some hardware and software costs, and paying for the contributions of other voice actors and background artists

Sketching, illustrating, scripting, storyboards, voice work, animating, editing and sound design. It's no mean feat and it's going to require working more than full-time hours each month to pull this off.

There is no corporate funding, I don't have hundreds of staff to put this together, I'm out here on my own making weird and wacky Scottish stuff and I need your help to make it happen.

The Impact

Times are unsettled and the avenues for working-class Scottish artists are narrow (if they exist at all).

With Chronicles of Yer Maw I hope to deliver something new, exciting, funny and entertaining. If successful then there could be no telling where this could go. 

 

Risks & Challenges

Crowdfunding is always a risk and there's always the chance I don't reach target. If that happens then I'll take stock of where I'm at and do the best I can with what has been raised (if I reach half of the target we'll do three episodes etc).

If, on the other hand, I'm lucky enough to go above target then I'll be able to use those extra funds to make more episodes and bring on some other artists and animators to help out. 

Shout about it, loudly

If you like what you see then please share this crowdfunder and video with as many people as you can, on as many social media sites as you can (I've lost track of what the kool kids are using these days - MSN messenger? Is Bebo still a thing?). 

If you want to keep Yer Maw  flying then help us in any way you can.

Cheers.

story:
Ashlar is the finest stone in masonry. It is strong and dependable, just like Ashlar Studios. Ashlar Studios is a production team formed by fourth-year Media Production students in Ryerson University’s RTA School of Media. In January 2021, our diverse skillset brought us together to take on our first production, Yesterday Will Hurt. Our team was formed out of passion, determination, and drive to tell important stories. Each member brings their own unique skillset and ideas to the table, and together, we create an innovative and positive work environment. Ashlar Studios is overjoyed to take the vision of Yesterday Will Hurt, and display our passion and creativity on the screens. 

 

Yesterday Will Hurt follows Joey Walker, a pessimistic, hot-headed, 17-year-old who suffers from frightening flashbacks from her childhood. She has no recollection of these memories and questions if they’re really her own. Joey wants nothing more than to leave town and start a new life with her inheritance once she turns 18. However, Joey’s legal guardians, her uncle Doug and aunt Heather, haven't stayed true to their promise. Joey’s fragmented memories begin to form a full picture when an unwanted visitor arrives with an ulterior motive. 

 

Emily and Serafina started creating Yesterday Will Hurt when they were inspired by scenes in Breaking Bad, Ozark, and Sons of Anarchy. These scenes included traumatic fighting between adults, in the presence of an infant who was crying from being so frightened. These scenes made us think, “Would the infants present during filming of those scary scenes have any problems later in life?” This inspired us to create a unique story revolving around a character who was exposed to frightening horror scenes as an infant. Through Yesterday Will Hurt, we want to explore the human psyche and show the experience of someone struggling with Post-Traumatic Stress Disorder (PTSD). It has become more common to see television characters that struggle with anxiety and depression, but PTSD is still under-represented in the media. Another character in Yesterday Will Hurt will exhibit signs of Antisocial Personality Disorder (ASPD) in the more severe form as a psychopath. Hollywood frequently depicts psychopaths as serial killers but, though they lack empathy, the vast majority of them are not murderers. There are a lot of assumptions and misinformation about PTSD and ASPD that we want to break down in Yesterday Will Hurt. Through the series, we also want to create an awareness of the fear people have of addressing mental health issues. It is common for people of all ages, particularly teenagers, to push their problems aside and not get help. Our series will show a realistic portrayal of people dealing with these mental health issues and the paths they travel as they work through their personal barriers.

 

The greatest risk and challenge is the Covid-19 Pandemic. Ashlar Studios is determined to keep our entire cast and crew safe in the process of creating the pilot for Yesterday Will Hurt. We have come up with a detailed safety plan to ensure we follow Covid-19 guidelines. Some of our policies and protocols include but are not limited to: wearing masks. temperature checks, physically distancing, symptom questionnaires, vaccine requirements, and contact tracing.

Financing is another challenge we face. Ashlar Studios is a group of students who are self-funding this pilot episode, and we appreciate all the help we can get from supporters such as yourself! Our executive team has invested a significant amount in the project and we have come up with a thorough financing plan to make our vision come to life through fundraising.

 

We are all extremely passionate about bringing our story to life, but we need your help. To make our production possible, we aim to raise approximately $6500. This will cover all costs throughout our production, including: 

  • Set Operations
  • Accommodations
  • Equipment
  • Transportation
  • Editing

We are a group of students and storytellers with a dream of bringing this important story to life. We've created a variety of perks to show our appreciation for all our backers, which include a social media shoutout, an official show poster, or even an executive producer title in our credits! 

Share our campaign, donate if you can, and keep up with our social media! We appreciate all the support we can get for Yesterday Will Hurt. Any donation, no matter how small, will get us closer to our funding goal.

Keep an eye out for our upcoming virtual concert fundraiser premiering on YouTube on August 18th, 2021! To stay up to date with our project, check us out on Instagram, Tik Tok, and Facebook.

These scenes included traumatic fighting between adults, in the presence of an infant who was crying from being so frightened. These scenes made us think, “Would the infants present during filming of those scary scenes have any problems later in life?” This inspired us to create a unique story revolving around a character who was exposed to frightening horror scenes as an infant. Through Yesterday Will Hurt, we want to explore the human psyche and show the experience of someone struggling with Post-Traumatic Stress Disorder (PTSD). It has become more common to see television characters that struggle with anxiety and depression, but PTSD is still under-represented in the media. Another character in Yesterday Will Hurt will exhibit signs of Antisocial Personality Disorder (ASPD) in the more severe form as a psychopath. Hollywood frequently depicts psychopaths as serial killers but, though they lack empathy, the vast majority of them are not murderers. There are a lot of assumptions and misinformation about PTSD and ASPD that we want to break down in Yesterday Will Hurt. Through the series, we also want to create an awareness of the fear people have of addressing mental health issues. It is common for people of all ages, particularly teenagers, to push their problems aside and not get help. Our series will show a realistic portrayal of people dealing with these mental health issues and the paths they travel as they work through their personal barriers.
 


The greatest risk and challenge is the Covid-19 Pandemic. Ashlar Studios is determined to keep our entire cast and crew safe in the process of creating the pilot for Yesterday Will Hurt. We have come up with a detailed safety plan to ensure we follow Covid-19 guidelines. Some of our policies and protocols include but are not limited to: wearing masks. temperature checks, physically distancing, symptom questionnaires, vaccine requirements, and contact tracing.
Financing is another challenge we face. Ashlar Studios is a group of students who are self-funding this pilot episode, and we appreciate all the help we can get from supporters such as yourself! Our executive team has invested a significant amount in the project and we have come up with a thorough financing plan to make our vision come to life through fundraising.
 


We are all extremely passionate about bringing our story to life, but we need your help. To make our production possible, we aim to raise approximately $6500. This will cover all costs throughout our production, including: 

Set Operations
Accommodations
Equipment
Transportation
Editing



We are a group of students and storytellers with a dream of bringing this important story to life. We've created a variety of perks to show our appreciation for all our backers, which include a social media shoutout, an official show poster, or even an executive producer title in our credits! Share our campaign, donate if you can, and keep up with our social media! We appreciate all the support we can get for Yesterday Will Hurt. Any donation, no matter how small, will get us closer to our funding goal.Keep an eye out for our upcoming virtual concert fundraiser premiering on YouTube on August 18th, 2021! To stay up to date with our project, check us out on Instagram, Tik Tok, and Facebook.

story:
WHAT Is MISS WALKER?

 

From the multi-award-winning production company behind short films Liberating Love  and The Better World...

MISS WALKER is a TV Concept about three Glasgow-based female actors experiencing the highs and lows of trying to “make it” in the Film/TV industry.

It will bring audiences a visually striking, socially relevant drama that is strongly based on the experiences of many of our female colleagues and friends in the Film/TV industry. It follows their slow progression from outsiders to established actors over the course of three seasons.

The show is sort of a cross between Call My Agent! and Not Another Happy Ending. We aim to pitch the finished concept to international distributors, such as Channel 4, Netflix & Amazon Prime.

 

WHY Are We Making MISS WALKER?

When you think of Scotland’s image in mainstream media…what do you think of?

Let me guess: probably something to do with bagpipes, drugs and William Wallace slicing up Englishmen, right?

While there’s nothing necessarily wrong with these things, as a Scottish person, it gets a bit tiresome when that’s ALL people think of.

There is so much more to our country than that. We have incredible artistic heritage, from the stunning designs of Charles Rennie Mackintosh to the transcendent words of Robert Burns.

That is why we want to make MISS WALKER.

A show about Scottish artists, with a burning desire to make something of themselves in spite of the struggles they face, the barriers that block their path.

While we may be taking on a highly ambitious task, we feel compelled to make MISS WALKER because our country has so much more to offer than just "FREEDOM!".

WITH YOUR BACKING and our team's talent, we believe that this goal is firmly within our grasp.

 

WHO Are We?

We are a team of highly-driven Scottish creatives, united and determined to bring this project to life in the most resonant way possible.

While our producer and director have been nominated for a combined SEVENTEEN awards in 2021 alone and our cast have acted in over a hundred feature films, adverts and short films between them, we all feel it's time to make the next step and create a serious project together that has the power to change how Scotland is perceived internationally.

CAST:

Annabel McCusker as LAUREN WALKER

Vivien Taylor as JESSICA MILLER

Lauren Wade as EMILY ALEXANDER

John McQuiston as JOHN MacKENZIE

Freya Anderson as SOPHIE MORRISON

Alice Gold as AMY SHAW

with  Robert Carr as JAMES DAY

and  Tony MacDonald as TERRY DOYLE

CREW:

Robin De Vernon Ryding - Creator & Director

Euan Brown - Producer

Allan Taylor - 1st Assistant Director

Bryan McIntyre - Sound

James Raeburn - Drone Operator

Jack McNeil - Lighting

Amy-Louise Ferguson - Make-Up Artist

Kirsty Joanne Kelly - First-Aid & Hairstylist

Sanne Gault - Photographer

Sonja Blietschau - Photographer

Hâle Denholm - Photographer

HOW Will The Funds Be Used?

The immediate allocations will be:

  • LOCATION FEES
  • SOUND
  • DRONE FOOTAGE
  • COVID PROOFING
  • TRAVEL & CATERING

The remaining will go towards covering the £1850 needed for VFX and – beyond that – towards securing A-List talent for the concept (more on that in the future)!

 

WHAT Will You Get For Donating To Our Campaign?

We are aware that the financial circumstances of many would-be donors are likely impacted in some way by the spread of COVID-19.

After a lot of consultation from our mentors, bouncing options off of our cast & crew members and doing a lot of reading, we decided to not to offer ANYTHING that isn’t giving some form of value back to our financiers.

We don’t want to just give you some overpriced t-shirt - it’s about providing value back to our community.

For £10, we give you an OFFICIAL MISS WALKER POSTCARD!

For £25, we THANK YOU IN THE CREDITS!

For £100, we will give you a SPEAKING ROLE IN THE CONCEPT (only 4 slots available)!

For £250, we will PROMOTE YOUR BUSINESS, PRODUCT OR SERVICE!

For £750, you will receive an ASSOCIATE PRODUCER CREDIT (only 5 slots available)!

For £3750, you will receive an EXECUTIVE PRODUCER CREDIT (only 3 slots available)!

The reason behind the producer fees is:

If we fill every Executive & Associate Producer slot, we raise:

(£3750x3) + (750x5) = £15000

This is our BEST-CASE SCENARIO. It would be enough capital to get significant A-List talent attached to the project, as well as fully cover the VFX we need and allow us to pay every single member of our cast & crew.

Any surplus funds beyond the £15k we secure would go towards getting the MISS WALKER concept in-front of producers, marketplaces, distributors and networks - whether that's through submitting it to markets or through other means.

 

Are There OTHER WAYS I Can Help?

If you can't contribute to our campaign for whatever reason, sharing our campaign with others who can contribute would be greatly appreciated!

story:
Overview

Miss Tutti And The Fruity Band is a children's musical web series promoting body positivity. Think Mr. Rogers meets The Monkees but it's a band of gorgeous, diverse musicians talking about loving yourself & your individuality.

Diet Culture Is Not For Kids (Or Anyone!)

Here at Miss Tutti we want to crush the diet industry & pave a better future for the next generation. We want to encourage intuitive eating, joyful movement, and an overall sense of self-love. Kids should be focusing on fun, school, and friends...not their BMI. 

Recently diet companies have created apps for kids as young as 8 years old, and we think that kids deserve WAY BETTER! 

Hi, I'm Gracie! I am a singer/songwriter and music educator living & working in NYC. I'm currently a teaching artist with The Metropolitan Opera Guild & The WillYouLearn music school. After receiving my master's degree in songwriting from NYU, I wrote a medley of body-positive children's songs & wanted to share them with the world.  

 

I decided that the best way to bring self-love to the younger generation is through a live musical series! This is how I came up with Miss Tutti And The Fruity Band.

With the help of director/producer Nathan Chang, and head writer Kalli Siringas, I brought together some of the best musicians NYC has to offer: Regina Strayhorn, Emma Jayne, Dan Corica, Laura Dadap & Scott Still. Together, they make the Fruity Band come to life!

We also have an all female writing team with personal experience working in entertainment, childhood education, food studies, and comedy, here in NYC.

 

What You'll See In An Episode:

Miss Tutti plays with her rockin' fruity band at their favorite hangout. In each episode the band chats about topics such as: intuitive eating, self-affirmations, what is "normal?", the beauty of diversity, and all the ways we can show our unique bodies a lot of love. Each episode will have an original song and end with a self-love mission. 

We Need Your Help! 

We're making 5 episodes of Miss Tutti with the highest quality possible and need to pay our talented cast & crew what they deserve. With your support we'll be able to fund:

  • Camera
  • Lighting
  • Grip
  • Sound Equipment
  • Costumes
  • Props
  • Set Building
  • Craft Services
  • Transportation
  • Insurance
  • Editing
  • Graphics
  • Sound Mixing
  • And of course...coffee!

All of this is possible because we have a professional production company, Halleloo Creative on our side!

Support The Next Generation of Self-Love

Donate anything you can to bring Miss Tutti And The Fruity Band to life! If you can't donate, then please share our mission! Think of the people in your life who could benefit from a show like this.

story:
De Sin Rumbo y te voy a contar todo sobre el proyecto...

Sin Rumbo surgió estando aún en el colegio, cuando mis amigas llegaban con sus cuentos de todo estilo; unos que nos hacían morir de risa y otros que llorábamos juntas.  Al final, sus historias dejaban al descubierto lo difícil que resulta ser tan joven. Pues ser adolescente tiende a volverse un viaje confuso, en el que queremos comernos el mundo pero a su vez lo sentimos muy grande para nosotros. 

Inspirada en sus historias , creé los tres personajes principales de Sin Rumbo: Grecia, Mariana y Juan pablo.

 

 

Gress es una chica espontánea, quien con su alegría ilumina todo a su alrededor. Cansada de vivir dentro de la burbuja de sus padres conservadores, decide empezar a tomar riesgos y cruzar límites por su propia cuenta. Adentrándose en una vida donde la diferencia entre libertad y libertinaje no es clara. 

Sin embargo, poco a poco entenderá que no siempre es necesario estar en los extremos, no todo es blanco o negro y que la vida también es de matices.

Mariana  define su vida como una montaña rusa, llena continuamente de subidas y bajadas, las cuales son en su mayoría, ocasionadas por su carácter melancólico. Lo que la va llevando a un abismo de soledad. Pues se hará dependiente de una pareja que solo la hace sentir más vacía. 

Su refugio será el arte, a través del cuál encontrará la forma de volcar su emociones y ser ella misma su mejor compañía. 

Juan Pablo es un chico muy sociable que sabe muy bien cómo adaptarse a cada situación. A pesar de eso, su nuevo reto será aprender a conocerse y aceptarse. Ya que un nuevo interés -especial- por su mejor amigo, ha empezado a surgir. 

Debido a que creció en un entorno donde no es correcto sentirse enamorado de otro chico, se enfrentará con el dilema de reconocer sus sentimientos o "ignorarlos" para seguir con la vida que llevaba. 

 

Estamos preparando la producción del capítulo piloto, con el cual queremos empezar este proyecto.  Y aunque la cosa no es fácil, pues aún no contamos con todo el presupuesto para el rodaje. Hemos decidido aprovechar la oportunidad que nos ofrece Indiegogo para recaudar lo restante a través de crowdfunding. 

 

Y de acuerdo al aporte que realices al proyecto, tenemos ciertas recompensas para ti, que son nuestra forma de agradecerte por creer en nosotros. Aquí al ladito (derecha) puedes ver en qué consisten. 

 

Sin Rumbo es una invitación para mirar hacia dentro, cuestionarse y decirse ¿Sé a dónde quiero ir o a dónde estoy yendo? Es una excusa para expresar que cada uno puede forjar su propio rumbo, el que de verdad le pertenece y no el que todos los demás  dicen que recorras.

Es por ello que nuestro equipo está conformado por un grupo de amigos que comprendemos el "drama" que se vive siendo adolescente (y hay quienes estamos aún superando las secuelas). Así que compartimos una meta en común: expresar a cada joven el hecho de que no es el único que anda por acá perdido, averiguando cómo es que se juega la vida.

Algunos de los jóvenes que estamos detrás de Sin Rumbo somos...

A uno estas cosas le dan miedo ¿sabes? porque en cualquier sentido uno no quiere fallar, no con algo a lo que le guarda tanta ilusión y le apasiona tanto. Por eso decidí que este miedo no sea una razón para renunciar, sino una motivación. Y con disciplina, dedicación y  el gran equipo que respalda este proyecto, confío en que no habrá obstáculo imposible para nosotros.

 

Si estás pelado como nosotros, pero igual te gustaría apoyarnos sería una gran ayuda que lo hicieras compartiendo lo que estamos haciendo. Ve y le cuentas a todo el que puedas de nosotros: tu fanaticada,  el amig@ que se aguanta todos tus cuentos,  tu familia que siempre te saca de apuros, o incluso tu arrocito en bajo. 

Andale ve c:
