story:
¿Cómo usaremos los fondos?

 

Estamos seguros de que para lograr mejor contenido debemos usar mejor equipo. Por eso destinaremos los fondos obtenidos a nuevo equipo de video, sonido y edición que nos permita crear contenido de primera calidad. De igual forma, esto nos permitirá contratar personas, y cubrir gastos de transporte, aumentando nuestro alcance a nivel nacional, y quizás, en un futuro, más allá de nuestras fronteras.

En el tema de equipo de video adquiriremos nueva cámara, set de micrófonos inalámbricos, así como piezas para mejorar los equipos que usamos en loa actualidad para editar, de esta manera los trabajos realizados por claraMENTE tendrán mejor calidad, la que merecen todos nuestros espectadores.

Por eso destinaremos los fondos obtenidos a nuevo equipo de video, sonido y edición que nos permita crear contenido de primera calidad. story:
***Double Your Impact***

Give now, and a generous donor will match all contributions, up to $10,000!

 

Help Bring A Vegan Comedy Series To Life!

Hi, I'm Charles Horn, an Emmy-nominated writer, and the creator of Zoe and Charles, a comedy webseries about two best friends who want to enjoy life and find love -- and want the world to go vegan!

I made a teaser to get things off the ground, but I need your help to create the series so that it can grow and grow with each episode, and eventually be developed into a mainstream TV show with a funny and positive animal rights message!  (The series will comedically explore dating and everyday life through the eyes of vegans.)  I have an entire first season that’s already written, amazing, and ready to go.  Let’s make it happen!

Why?

I believe that comedy and entertainment is powerful, and can have a large positive impact on society.  Many TV shows have helped society evolve on important issues -- for example, The Mary Tyler Moore Show, The Cosby Show, Ellen, Will & Grace, and Modern Family, to name a quick few.  I want Hollywood to create shows with positive animal rights messages.  I want Hollywood to be part of the solution, and I want to be professionally entertained all along the way.  So please spread the word and pledge what you can, but even if it’s just a dollar, you’re already helping Hollywood know that there’s an untapped market for this important issue.

Is This Show Only For Vegans?

No!  We’re making a general comedy show for a broad audience with anyone and everyone in mind, no matter where they’re currently at.  Our characters have the same human quirks and foibles as anyone else, but they just happen to also want a world where animals aren’t bred and killed for human pleasures. 

We will always aim for material that can make anyone laugh, even if they’re currently disagreeing with it.  Sure, we have a definite point of view, just as any other show does, but we will always keep comedy as our focus.  You'll be vegan before you know it, anyway.

Where Will The Money Go?

After paying out crowdfunding fees and fulfilling donor awards, your pledges will be used to pay talent and crew, complete production of webisodes, hire professional marketing and PR, and do everything else needed to make and distribute a kick-ass show suitable for the mainstream public.

The initial goal will help pay for the production of a mini season (4 webisodes, 2-5 minutes each), our first stretch goal of $50,000 will help pay for the production of 10 webisodes, and our stretch goal of $100,000 will help us up the production value, approach famous actors for guest appearances, and complete an entire first season (20 webisodes) that’s already written, amazing, and ready to go.  Anything extra after that will be used for gender-neutral vegan hookers and blow!

Who's Involved?

I'm Charles Horn, the writer and creator of this series.  I’m an Emmy-nominated writer and producer with credits including Fugget About It, Robot Chicken, and Robot Chicken: Star Wars.  I’m also the author of the acclaimed book Meat Logic: Why Do We Eat Animals?

The main characters of Zoe and Charles are being played by Tanya Zoeller and Andy Greene, two SAG actors with numerous credits.  Tanya studied acting in the US and London, and Andy is a graduate Upright Citizens Brigade (UCB) improvisor.

When Will It Come Out?

Once funding is in place, we'll move into pre-production and aim to shoot in late 2017 or early 2018, and then finish post-production and have episodes ready beginning in May 2018.

Risks:

Scripts are already written and ready to go, but given some of the subject matter involved, there is an acute risk of one or more of the following:

  • Getting stranded on a desert island
  • Animals might go extinct and take over the world
  • We might discover we’re a lion
  • We might become the prime suspect in a plant murder investigation
  • Our bodies might tell us to take the money and run, and we always have to listen to our bodies
  • Kwashiorkor

THANK YOU FOR YOUR SUPPORT!  PLEASE SHARE WIDELY!  LET’S DO THIS!
story_txt:
***Double Your Impact***
Give now, and a generous donor will match all contributions, up to $10,000!
 
Help Bring A Vegan Comedy Series To Life!
Hi, I'm Charles Horn, an Emmy-nominated writer, and the creator of Zoe and Charles, a comedy webseries about two best friends who want to enjoy life and find love -- and want the world to go vegan!
I made a teaser to get things off the ground, but I need your help to create the series so that it can grow and grow with each episode, and eventually be developed into a mainstream TV show with a funny and positive animal rights message!  (The series will comedically explore dating and everyday life through the eyes of vegans.)  I have an entire first season that’s already written, amazing, and ready to go.  Let’s make it happen!

Why?
I believe that comedy and entertainment is powerful, and can have a large positive impact on society.  Many TV shows have helped society evolve on important issues -- for example, The Mary Tyler Moore Show, The Cosby Show, Ellen, Will & Grace, and Modern Family, to name a quick few.  I want Hollywood to create shows with positive animal rights messages.  I want Hollywood to be part of the solution, and I want to be professionally entertained all along the way.  So please spread the word and pledge what you can, but even if it’s just a dollar, you’re already helping Hollywood know that there’s an untapped market for this important issue.
Is This Show Only For Vegans?
No!  We’re making a general comedy show for a broad audience with anyone and everyone in mind, no matter where they’re currently at.  Our characters have the same human quirks and foibles as anyone else, but they just happen to also want a world where animals aren’t bred and killed for human pleasures. 
We will always aim for material that can make anyone laugh, even if they’re currently disagreeing with it.  Sure, we have a definite point of view, just as any other show does, but we will always keep comedy as our focus.  You'll be vegan before you know it, anyway.

story:
Yvette and Kyla have been friends and colleagues since theatre school. They are incredibly hard working artists and know how to get it done!

Shooting a trailer/teaser for THE FREE TABLE web series is an important step in the journey of our project. We have dedicated our time to creating this series because we absolutely love it and we know it has a lot to say about what we know to be true and important.

Check out our website! https://kylawise.wixsite.com/freetableseries

THE FREE TABLE is a funny and poignant look at how we relate to each other and our stuff.

When Kate starts a free table in the laundry room in her apartment building the objects that are left there and taken from there end up taking us into the lives of the diverse tenants who live there. The table becomes a place of connection, community, expression and meaning. The building manager hates it.

The first season is 10 episodes. We have assembled a core cast, a cartoonist, a graphic artist, and an award winning director who are already committed to the project.

Please take a moment to share our campaign with your friends, family and colleagues. Thanks!

story:
Overview

A STORY OF THE AGES

In the present age of heightened conspiracy, two men walk a fine line between grace and iniquity. With orders from high, Russ and Charlie, brothers of the cloth, take on their daily Commandments as operatives of The Watchtower, an organization as adept as it is unknown. Drawing from historical and socio-political moments, this series addresses the seriousness of the abysmal modern world, how it directly relates to the events of history, and how to traverse its changing landscape. With just the right amount of cheeky sarcastic banter, we watch two men grow from partners to brothers as they put their lives on the line to save humanity from its oldest and largest threat, itself. Help us bring Russ and Charlie off the page!

LOGLINE: Missionaries or Mercenaries? Annoyingly polite or deceptively buff? Both? Definitely both.  Not the typical Witnesses, these two open wounds as much as they open doors.

SYNOPSIS: Two trained operatives masquerade as door-to-door Jehovah’s Witnesses, sharing The Good Book by day, and cleansing the world of Sin by night. As part of the world’s most ancient and unknown order, The Watchtower, Russ must train the very first outside recruit, Charlie, in their mission protocols, as their daily Commandments give way to a higher calling.

https://fortheloveofgodtheseries.com/

THE PERFECT PITCH

The passion behind this project has grown immensely. Beginning as just a short, 12 page script, the now 55 page Pilot has garnered industry professionals, solidifying pitch meetings with large distributors in early August. The Pilot is accompanied by a full Bible presentation, equipped with  Budget and Top Sheets, Logline, Synopsis, Episode List, Summary (Season 2 & 3), Script, Shot List, Schedules, Potential Distributors, as well as all the concepts footage, art, and story.

  • This is a large piece to bring together. Creating a pilot that has enough potential and promise typically costs hundreds of thousands of dollars, professionally millions. By combining a hands on practical sense to its fight scenes, this pilot has successfully created iterations with baseline variables and examples to showcase potential. In tandem with highly structured and scheduled professional choreography, a humble and extensive crew has banded together to see this piece through. From large executives and coordinators such as Jimmy Sharp Jr. and Oliver Young, as well as the many professionals like Erich Mingenbach and Duffy Taylor who set time and work aside on their series THIS IS US to see this through, we thank you.
  • Having been educated in Art and Business, creating a Series Pitch Bible was serendipitously fitting for O'Neil. Stocked full of the Box Office statistics, from Distributor Metrics through extensive cross analysis of previously successful series, For the Love of God shows exemplary promise. 
  • Being raised in a religious mid western environment, O'Neil took each rule or commandment as an inquiry into reason. In this series, we dive into the ideas of creation and existence, and how Christianity and religion shaped the world just as much in Biblical times as it does in modern day, as well as some tribulations that may have been happening behind the holy curtain. This, all while addressing the very organized tactics of the worlds largest business, the Church.

What We Need

Here's the grit.

For this piece, we need $45,000 to showcase a potent concept!

HELP US REACH OUR GOAL OF $45,000!

This is where that budget goes:

Pre-Production: This includes development, location scouting, casting, contracts, insurance & permits. This is the gritty work that has to be strategically planned to encompass the entirety of everything that will happen on the shoot. All of these are essential to a professional piece, ensuring the production has followed through proper legal guidelines. Remember the 5P's: Proper Preparation Prevents Poor Performance. This portion typically takes up about 15% of the total budget.

Production: Any an all confines of shooting days! This is where the bulk of the budget goes. All equipment (camera rentals and sound packages, electrical equipment/lighting, etc.), set design, character wardrobe, crew labor, craft services and food, hair and make-up, the works. We have a great and humble crew, all working for drastically less than their rates because of the promise and vision they have in the concept, in hopes of working together to further the careers of everyone involved. Taking the majority of the budget, this will account for approximately 75% of the total.

Post-Production: Editing, sound mixing, ADR, color correction, visual effects, sound effects and music are some of the great many things that must come together to create the final piece. These seemingly overlooked pieces can be the defining value of what makes or brakes a good piece. 

INVESTMENTS and DONATIONS:

If we don't reach our goal we still have meetings! Simply following a breakdown of the schedule, a reallocation of resources and a restructuring allows to shoot less than the full pilot, but far more than just a few scenes. Scheduled for the beginning of August, Pitch meetings with large networks and distributors have been scheduled to showcase, so regardless of whether we have a full 55 minutes pilot, we will have a lot to present! 

As an investor you would help bring this piece to life.

We do have original Investors and Producers, but in order to make our goal, we just need a bit more help! A contribution could be in the form of: 

  • A THANK YOU
  • RECEIVING DIGITAL ARTWORK
  • RECEIVING A COPY OF THE SCRIPT
  • CONNECT WITH THE CREW
  • RECEIVING A COPY OF THE PITCH BIBLE
  • BECOMING A SUBSTANTIAL INVESTOR
  • BECOMING A PRODUCER

 

We have worked very hard for the past year and a half to put together an industry standard equivalent, even with such a low budget. The potential and possibilities for this piece are endless. There is no promise or guarantee, but there is sometimes luck. Luck is what happens when hard work meets opportunity, and opportunity came knocking. We thank you for taking the time and we appreciate any help you have to give!

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you can't contribute, that doesn't mean you can't help:

  • Get the word out and make some noise about our campaign. Share out Instagram and Website to anyone that you think would be interested!
  • Remind them to use the Indiegogo share tools!

We do have original Investors and Producers, but in order to make our goal, we just need a bit more help! A contribution could be in the form of: 

A THANK YOU
RECEIVING DIGITAL ARTWORK
RECEIVING A COPY OF THE SCRIPT
CONNECT WITH THE CREW
RECEIVING A COPY OF THE PITCH BIBLE
BECOMING A SUBSTANTIAL INVESTOR
BECOMING A PRODUCER

There is no promise or guarantee, but there is sometimes luck. Other Ways You Can Help

Get the word out and make some noise about our campaign. Share out Instagram and Website to anyone that you think would be interested!
Remind them to use the Indiegogo share tools!

story:
Our Story

Hi there, 

Gabriel Carrubba and Victoria Thompson here from the team at Viceroy Pictures. 

'White Teeth' is a Psychological, Original Web Series Drama about coming of age as a teenager in modern-day suburban Australia. It's a story about guilt, identity, confusion, responsibility, and feeling as if you had the weight of the entire world stacked on your shoulders. That feeling of never ending anxiety and regret while battling with the secret that lays deep within the pit of your stomach, constantly itching at your conscience - all while having to deal with the consequences of your actions.

Through our exploration of television and cinema, we've often found ourselves taking a liking to stories about youth and coming of age. Many of our previous conversations have revolved around our High School experiences and how different they were for the both of us. However, regardless of our differences, we both came to the same conclusion of wishing that there was a television show about Australian teenagers, with relatable characters that we could have watched growing up. It would have saved us both a world of confusion knowing that we weren't the only ones facing the awkward issues and situations that teenagers often find themselves in.

Two television shows in particular that inspired us to write 'White Teeth' are; 'Puberty Blues' (2012-2013), '13 Reasons Why' (2017). The reason for this is purely because of how accurate they are in telling the stories of teenagers truthfully. 

Synopsis

Six teenagers attempt to navigate their way through high school after a fatal car accident that has turned their world upside-down. The truth begins to unravel as they attempt to battle with internal guilt, confusion, responsibility, anxiety and regret – all while having to deal with the consequences of their actions - their conscience remains tainted.

Impact

As the series will deal with the themes of mental health, drug use and sexual situations, we plan on reaching out to organisations such as; Beyond Blue, Headspace and The Line as we want to spread the word of the series so more and more teenagers can get around to seeing it.

In regards to this project, diversity is a key for us. Many of our characters come from different cultural backgrounds and beliefs, providing a realistic Australian, Public High School experience. 

Our Plan

'White Teeth' will run as an original web series for 6 episodes, running at the duration of 12 minutes per episode. Each episode will be told through the perspective of one of the six teenagers as they experience the before, during and after of the accident. It will feature on the 'Viceroy Pictures' YouTube channel. The first episode will be filmed in October and will be uploaded in December. The other five episodes will be filmed from February-May and will be released in August-September.

As this is Viceroy's first production, this is required to prove ourselves in the industry and build an audience. 

In the future, we plan on extending the series to 6 x 1 hour episodes. This will only happen if it is picked up and distributed by a larger streaming company. In order to do this, we need your help to make the web series possible! 

Main Crew

Producer - Jazmin Padarath

Jazmin Padarath has recently graduated from JMC Academy and has a passion for producing films and documentaries that spark conversations about social issues. She hopes to inspire change with her creative works.

Writer/Director - Victoria Thompson

Victoria Thompson is a Writer and Director. She has written and produced web series in the past such as; "Kan't Keep Up", a parody of the Kardashians. She also specialises in sound recording, and is passionate about working with actors, providing a comfortable environment in allowing creativity to flourish.

Writer/Cinematographer - Gabriel Carrubba

Gabriel Carrubba is an Australian based Actor/Filmmaker from Melbourne, Victoria. He has previously studied a Full Time Acting Course at the Film & Television Studio International in Melbourne, and is now working towards a Bachelor in FIlm & Television Production at JMC Academy, also in Melbourne. Gabriel is currently represented as an Actor by Ignite Elite Artists, a Melbourne and Sydney based talent agency. Some of Gabriel's screen credits include 'Glitch' (Matchbox Pictures, ABC: Australian Broadcasting Corporation, Netflix) playing the guest role of George. Gabriel is also the Founder of Coney Island Productions and a Co-Founder at Viceroy Pictures.

1st Assistant Director - James Rigoni

James Rigoni is a ‘jack-of-all-trades’ with ample experience and high attention to detail in Directing, Editing, Visual Effects and Colour Grading. James has worked as a Production Assistant on the ABC television series ‘The Ex-PM’, assisting the Production Office, Grips, Electrics, and Art Department, learning from many seasoned professionals including 1st Assistant Director; Guy Campbell (Lord of the rings, The Hobbit, Tomorrow When the War Began, Charlotte’s Web). Ambitious and determined, James is always willing to push the boundaries in order to produce the best quality possible.

Production Designer - Laura Davies

Laura Davies made her start to the creative arts in the world of Theatre and Make-up. She has recently begun her journey in the Film & Television Industry, studying a Bachelor of Film and Television Production at JMC Academy in Melbourne, Australia. Laura is also a Co-Founder at Viceroy Pictures as she continues to bring stories to life from script to screen. 

Sound Recordist - Noah Bretnall 

Noah Bretnall is a Victorian based Filmmaker (Director/Screenwriter/D.O.P/Producer), currently studying his final year of a Bachelor Degree in Film and Television Production at JMC Academy, based in Melbourne, Australia. He is additionally the founder of Master’s Productions, and an active member of Viceroy Pictures.

Editor - Dael Limaco 

Dael Limaco is a Filmmaker that specialises in the Post-Production process. He is also a Journalist who develops online and offline media content for a range of ends and clients.

You can view his reel here: http://dael.space/

Cast

The cast will be announced within the next 15 days. So stay tuned! 

Social Media 

Facebook - https://www.facebook.com/WhiteTeethOriginalSeries

Instagram - @whiteteeththetvseries

Twitter - https://twitter.com/WhiteTeeth_TV

Budget

If we were to surpass our goal of $3,000, the remainder of the money will be used to pay actor's, submitting to web series festivals, and obtaining rights to music. 

Perks

There are plenty of great perks available to thank you for your contribution. 

All awards and perks will be distributed at the end of December once we have finished and finalised the filming and production of the first episode.

If you're unable to contribute, that's okay! You can still help us out by spreading the word and sharing the campaign around. Something as simple as liking our Facebook page or following our Instagram account would also be greatly appreciated. 

The team at Viceroy Pictures thank you in advance for your time and generosity!

Dael Limaco is a Filmmaker that specialises in the Post-Production process. He is also a Journalist who develops online and offline media content for a range of ends and clients.
You can view his reel here: http://dael.space/
Cast
The cast will be announced within the next 15 days. So stay tuned! 
Social Media 
Facebook - https://www.facebook.com/WhiteTeethOriginalSeries
Instagram - @whiteteeththetvseries
Twitter - https://twitter.com/WhiteTeeth_TV
Budget


If we were to surpass our goal of $3,000, the remainder of the money will be used to pay actor's, submitting to web series festivals, and obtaining rights to music. 

Perks
There are plenty of great perks available to thank you for your contribution. 
All awards and perks will be distributed at the end of December once we have finished and finalised the filming and production of the first episode.
If you're unable to contribute, that's okay! You can still help us out by spreading the word and sharing the campaign around. Something as simple as liking our Facebook page or following our Instagram account would also be greatly appreciated. 

The team at Viceroy Pictures thank you in advance for your time and generosity!

story:
Executive Summary

DIY Community Changers, LLC, will create awareness about self-community care by filming and highlighting community agents who represent the idea that it is not necessary to wait for someone else to make a difference in your own community, you can do it yourself.

DIY Community Changers will accomplish this mission by introducing a new dynamic and cool factor to the community development field by using social media platforms such as Facebook, YouTube, LinkedIn, and Instagram to disseminate short films that focus on community projects and the stories of those people working on them.

Join me to contribute to the socioeconomic development of communities by directly inspiring community members to be proactive in developing and implementing the changes they want to see. Encouraging this idea can lead to the correction and improvement of those things which may be factors of a low socioeconomic area.

Community members may be aware changes are needed but it may take seeing the actions and hearing the stories of others that provides them the inspiration and motivation to contribute positively to their community.  

DIY Community Changers believes, A few can change a community of many! How about you?

What We Need

The starting capital needed is $14,974.00. Below is a detailed breakdown of funding for the initial 6 months:

*If using cell phone please turn device side ways ( horizontal) to view funding breakdown*

Travel Airfare - $5,946.00 (2 people)

Puerto Jimenez, Costa Rica:                                    $991.00 (International avg.)

Royal Bafokeng Nation, South Africa:                   $991.00

Coronel Ovideo, Paraguay:                                        $991.00

Team Member Compensation –$2,125.00

Videographer:                                                     $2,125.00

Digital Marketing & Brand Awareness - $3,000

Facebook ads:                                                      $1,500.00

Instagram ads:                                                     $1,500.00

Merchandise-    $1,587.00

Hats:                                                                          $325.00

T-Shirts:                                                                    $470.50

Stickers:                                                                    $100.00

Sweat pants:                                                            $591.50

Water bottles:                                                          $100.00             

Website & Merchandise Maintenance- $1,016.00

Miscellaneous- $1,300.00

The Impact & Methodology 

DIY Community Changers, LLC, will identify change agents who call community members to action. We will portray their projects and stories to help, inspire and influences viewers to take action in their communities. These change agents will focus on community projects such as:

  • Education- includes projects that aim to fill a void of recreation, educational, community health, or economic development.
  • Conservation- includes projects that attempts to protect the biodiversity of the earth, for wildlife and humans.
  • Poverty-includes projects that aim to assist those that are in poverty or suffer from underlying causes such as homelessness.

To identify these change agents, we will use 3 methods. These methods are;

  1. Recruit & Identify: Through social media platforms such as Facebook, Instagram, and LinkedIn I will publish a recruiting video that will introduce the purpose and mission of the organization.

This recruiting video will call qualified participants to action and general viewers to share to reach potential participants.

  1. Coordinate & Plan: As each participant is identified, the participant and I will discuss the storyline script and the filming schedule timetable. The storyline script will have two primary focuses;
  • The participant- The viewer will be informed of the participant background, inspiration behind their actions, and day to day balance of being a community member and community changer.
  • The community project- The viewer will be informed about the project and who it serves. The viewer will witness the operations of the project and experience the hands-on duties required for the project through the interactions of the participant and I.         
  1. Start Project: Once steps one through two are complete the filming of the project will begin. To keep our fundraiser campaign contributors and other supporters informed of the progress, vlogs will be made and shared via social media.

As I can not travel everywhere at once and highlight great projects, a “How to Video” will be created on how community agents can help me highlight their project without me being there.  The "How to Video" link is available below. 

"How to Video" link: https://youtu.be/wjsRwXKvMAE

Risks & Challenges

Your support will help minimize the risk and challenges new organizations may face. For this business model, these primary risks are:

  1. Financial
  2. Brand Awareness  

Below are the actions that will take place during the initial 6 months to overcome these challenges and minimize risk going forward.

Initial 6 months:

Financial:

  • For a fee, marketing packages will be available for individuals to create more awareness about their specific community project, using the DIY Community Changers platform.
  • Through our Squarespace e-commerce platform, supporters will be able to purchase advertised DIY Community Changers merchandise.
  • Always inviting supporters to donate to support our mission.

Brand Awareness

  • Understanding that it takes time and consistency to establish a brand, strategic advertising campaigns will be developed to expand awareness through paid social media ads.   

Thank You

Working to make the world a better place is a journey I started as a frequent volunteer in Nashville, TN.  Since my start I have partnered on educational and community projects in Paraguay, Costa Rica, and China.

Through these experiences, I found my purpose to impact the world through DIY Community Changers, LLC.

Thank you for your support in helping me accomplish this purpose and please share this link via social media if possible.  

To see my latest projects please see the links below.

https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PLPpc6xsm...

https://www.patreon.com/jeromelmoore

story:
I'm Kyle Mackesey. I'm a jack of many trades and a proud Massachusetts Townie. For the past seven plus years I have been learning the craft of building hand- puppets along with writing comedy, building sets, drawing, lighting, video and audio work. Now that I have assembled a quorum for performance production I am ready to bring my puppet, Townie, comedy webseries: Sonkhonkett, to the wider world. This fictional town lies where the Rumney Marsh takes up Boston's North Shore towns of Revere and Saugus. The webseries aims to capture the local persona of the region, the Townie. Being one myself, we are a unique people that I feel is either overlooked or misrepresented in popular culture. For me there is no better way to parlay information than humor. I meticulous sculpt and gather jokes and comedic structures I feel capture the Massachusetts style of comedy. The show is ADULT (Not for children), ball-busting and fearless but done out of great love for the land that has shaped my ways and spirit.

Many hours, days, weeks, months and years has been invested into this town I call Sonkhonkett. Laying out every street of the town which you can check out at http://www.sonkhonkett.com/  and https://www.facebook.com/sonkhonkett/ , researching North Shore history and creating the town's own lineage, building sets and figuring out how to film has pushed this project to it's next evolution. There are shorts on Youtube, https://www.youtube.com/user/skaskaskadank/videos , called "Sonkhonkett Samplers" that introduce the viewer to the world of this town.  They start out with limited production value but as time progressed over these past 3 years we have a DSLR camera, a variety of sets and props, better audio and better lighting.

We hosted two fundraisers in the last  two years where we reached on average 180% of our target goal. The first fundraiser funded the people and equipment to make the Sonking Pilot Episode and the second just went towards paying the performers, artists, craftsmen and laborers. This year we are continuing to have 90% of the funds allocated to all the people that make Sonkhonkett possible.

Sonkhonkett is about fun anthropology in a Squidbillies / Trailer Park Boys sort of manner but Sonkhonkett is more than that. I can't do Sonkhonkett without collaboration. My collaborators come from a variety of backgrounds and they kill at what they do. I want Sonkhonkett to become a production company that pays people for what they are worth. I, like many others who "Sonk The Honk" are artists and more often than not our work is rarely paid appropriately or even at all. Artists are skilled, passionate folk that deserve better. But this also applies to all workers. As the cost of living goes up and wages either stagnate or decrease many people struggle to survive and live a happy life. This production will not just need puppeteers, videographers, painters, sculptors but accountants, janitors, marketing folk, software engineers and you name it. We would like this $550 to act as an investment to forward us in the direction of creating a company that is fair to its workers. A company that will stay local to portray what is local because we got what no other state has got. GO MASSACHUSETTS!

story:
Short Summary

Hello there !

My name's Magpie, I will be your Captain during this intergalactic mission !

 I've previously worked on projects such as MAYHEM, the latest Mystery Skulls animated video, Hazbin Hotel and Helluva Boss.

I'm creating this campaign to help with the costs of a comic dub for my personal project Kina's Adventure !

The first issue has already been dubbed a couple of years ago, but with time and experience, I want to up the quality of this one a bit, and I want to make sure that all the musicians and voice actors will be paid fairly ! Because even tho we've got pirates and mafia in space, we still take artists's wages very seriously.

If you want to read the Kina's Adventure comics, you can do so on my website here :
https://www.magpiemayhemproductions.com/our-comics

 

 

Welcome on board space cadet ! For the mission to be accomplished, I require £800. 

 

Here's how you can help me to reach this goal !

(Note ; Indiegogo also takes a portion of fees so there's this to keep in mind too !)

I offer some different tiers and rewards - whatever specie you belong to, I have something for you !
 

The Impact

Your contribution will help me get the video out much quicker ! Saving up to gather this amount of money can take some time, and I really can't wait to bring the second issue of Kina's Adventure to all of you on Youtube - I could get to release the video soon and you would get some cool goodies out of it, it's a win win !


 

Risks & Challenges

I plan on getting the video done no matter what, so there aren't really any risks, just that the video would take a lot longer to do.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you want to purchase some merchandise, you can also visit our website which has its own merch store !
https://www.magpiemayhemproductions.com/

We also have a Teespring store where you can get some cool Kina shirts :
https://teespring.com/stores/kina-adventure

You can also help by watching more of my videos on my Youtube channel and clicking the subscribe button !
https://www.youtube.com/kinaaxian

You can also follow me on Twitter here :
https://twitter.com/Magpie_Feather

story:
illustration by Jérémy Pailler (Facebook, Instagram)

Apartment Sessions is... 

a Brooklyn-based multimedia artist collective. Our family is growing everyday, with over 200 artists joining us to date. Through our videos and performances, we aim to bring back the natural communal element that music holds in everyone's hearts. Check out our Season 2 Finale video to get inside the Apartment Sessions spirit. 

As our community has grown, we have moved outside of The Apartment to push the boundaries of collaborative art, culturally and geographically. We have filmed outdoor and unconventional sessions here in the US; on the subway, on a lake, on rooves and in backyards. Now we are headed north, over the Atlantic Ocean and into the surreal landscapes of Iceland. 

Why Iceland?

When Apartment Sessions looked to expand our community around the globe, Iceland was the obvious choice. From black sand beaches to jagged cliffs to cascading waterfalls, the country's geographic features are one of a kind on our planet. This intersection of place and artistic inspiration provides the ideal space to create something magical.  

Additionally, a member of the Apartment Sessions team, Drew Krasner, has had a love affair with Iceland for many years. One fateful summer, while living at an artist residency in a small town in the northwest of the country, he created an interdisciplinary work of art called the Iceland Soundscape Trio. Drawing deep inspiration from geography, history, and culture, this trip promises to be a continuation of that narrative on a grand scale. 

Skagaströnd, Iceland, home of Nes Artist Residency

Where will your money go? What will you get!? 

We are lucky enough to have 40+ lovely people coming with us for this trip. Your contributions will ensure that we are able to live and work to the best of our abilities over the course of a demanding 10-day recording schedule. The three main categories we are fundraising for are transportation, housing, and food: 3-4 vans for people and gear, one large guesthouse for lodging, and basic groceries for everyone.

In return for your generosity, we have plenty of rewards available for you. From postcards to behind-the-scenes footage to barbershop tags to your own personalized Apartment Session, your kindness will be returned in creative kind. 

What will we be doing? 

We will be recording at least one session per day at various indoor and outdoor locations, backdropped against glaciers, waterfalls, and endless horizons. We'll be arranging existing songs, featuring Apartment Sessions musicians' original songs, and collaborating with Icelandic musicians (and dancers and visual artists!). Sessions will range from just a few people to the entire crew of nearly 40 musicians. We will also be performing as various groups around the country. Stay tuned for updates as specific sessions and performances get planned! 

All of these videos will be publicly released on our Youtube channel over the course of 2019.

Risks & challenges

This trip comes with plenty of intrinsic challenges that we feel Apartment Sessions is uniquely qualified to overcome.

Navigating a foreign country with a large amount of people is a logistical hardship no matter what you're doing, but doing so with a group of musicians on a tight working schedule is even more of a challenge. However, Apartment Sessions has been practicing pulling off near-impossible schedules and organizational feats since our inception. We are well-versed in adapting on the fly and making sure that our end goals are met.   

Recording outside is a challenge in itself, and the ever-changing weather of Iceland presents its own obstacles. We will be working with a solar-powered energy rig to power outdoor sessions. If this all sounds farfetched to you, that's entirely fair; the entire history of Apartment Sessions is one of slowly moving ideas from the realm of the absurd to the realm of the real. We are confident that we have the improvisational skills to overcome any and all challenges that will inevitably arise on this adventure. 

Other ways you can help

As we move to grow our community globally, sharing is the name of the game. We understand if you are unable to donate financially to our campaign, but you can donate to the cause simply by sharing it with others. We hope to get as many people involved in this project as we can, so spread the word as far as it will fly!

story:
The Mission

Can you have an adventure travelling to the Isle of Man without travelling all the way to a far off country like Mexico? I suggested you can - and Lady Felicity was sceptical! So for our second travel adventure documentary, we will be packing our bags and heading to the Isle of Man. Starting with a performance of one of my shows at the Studio Theatre in Douglas, we will then travel around the Island for a week as I prove to Lady Felicity that there is so much adventure on offer there!

What We Need & What You Get

Having just started in travel documentary film making with our Mexico video, we have learned a lot of lessons, and there is a lot that we can improve on with every video. My main concern going forward is sound, and so some of the money we raise on our main target will go towards a few improvements in sound recording equipment. We have already invested in a new on-camera microphone, but to really take our documentaries to the level we want - and to allow a lot more freedom when shooting to allow us a wider choice of shots, we also want to get some quality wireless lapel microphones. Obviously, these will not just be used for this project, but will also be used for all of our future videos (and for fans of our Steampunk web series 'The Last Airship', they will cross over into that as well). So for the sake of both this video and future videos, we want to make sure that we get the best quality microphones that we can afford. This will account for approximately £300 of our main budget - although if we exceed our stretch goals, this will be a lot more!

Most of the money we receive from our main target, however, will be seen on the screen! The actual basics of the trip itself - the flights, accommodation and car hire - will be paid for either with ticket sales from my show and/or by deals and direct sponsorship we can arrange with the suppliers of those - we are not crowdfunding for you to just pay for us to have a holiday. 

I have big plans for things I would like to do while we are on the Isle of Man. Although I don't want to go into too much detail on here (as Lady Felicity will, of course, see this page, and part of the point of the venture is that she should go into it with as little foreknowledge as possible),  suffice to say that we will be wanting to get into the water - this is a major part of adventuring for Felicity. We will (hopefully) both have finished our scuba diving certifications before this trip, so that is likely to form part of what we do. I will also be talking to various places and people on the Island to try to arrange some experiences that take us beyond the general tourist views of certain attractions, and will also be talking to local experts in certain fields about appearing in the video.

All of these things cost money, and our aim is to show the Isle of Man in the best possible light - and our initial target of £1500 for this project is a low-level target which we will have to use wisely to get the best possible results we can.

Of course, it would be great to go over our initial target and reach our stretch goals - these ones are also aimed at improving not only this particular adventure documentary but also all of our future ones (and all of our other videos) - so if you enjoyed our Mexico video and want lots more adventures to watch, or just want our video showing the Isle of Man to be even more incredible, help us reach a little further if you can!

 

Stretch Goal 1: £2500 (total) - One of the biggest problems we had with the Mexico video was with the edit. The computer we use for editing really wasn't designed for the task, and so it took a lot longer than it should have and made it very difficult to edit in real-time. If we reach this stretch goal it will allow us to buy a laptop specially designed for the task of editing. The reason we want to go with a laptop rather than a desktop for this purpose is to allow us to put together rough cuts of each day's events each evening. This will not only speed up the time between filming and release, but it will also allow us on occasion to go back and pick up extra shots if necessary where timing allows.

 

Stretch Goal 2: £3000 (total) - If we reach this level, the additional £500 will have a very simple purpose - to allow us to promote the documentary, and to enter it into film festivals and competitions around the world to spread both this film and the Isle of Man as far as possible!

 

Stretch Goal 3 - To infinity and beyond! - If we get beyond this level, everything will go towards the project. There are 'dream' ideas we'd like to include in the project if we have the funds, and 'dream' equipment we would like to purchase if we could. We're not daring to expect to go this big on this first funding attempt for one of our travel documentaries, however - but if we look like we're getting close to Stretch Goal 2, we'll be a bit more specific about where we can go from here!

 

The Impact

As our second travel documentary, this one means a lot to us, and so, of course, we want to get it right! Our aim with these videos is to show a genuine adventure - so we are honest - but at the same time to show the places we visit in the best possible light. We want our videos to inspire people to travel to the places we visit!

In its first two weeks, our Mexico video was seen by over 2500 people on YouTube (we'll try to keep an idea of the current figure on this page), and this is just a start as we are learning the art of promoting it to as large an audience as possible. More to the point, here are some of the comments left on the video from some of the people who have seen it so far:

"The Mayan ruins look awesome - they look fascinating. I hope you get the chance to share more adventures like this with us."

"What an amazing adventure - a true spectacle and wonderfully presented."

"What a fantastic video. Supremely jealous, as I would love to go there."

"What a fantastic summary of your adventure in Mexico. If I ever get out there I would love to see the whales and do the swimming with the sharks and sea lions."

We think that this shows that people clearly have a taste for what we do - but also that the film clearly makes the country the star!

I know that from what I have seen of the Isle of Man, and from what I am currently researching, that between us all we can create an adventure that not only makes Lady Felicity concede that you can have a perfectly good adventure without going all around the world, but will also encourage other people to come and have their own adventures!

So, to enjoy another adventure from us, and to help us share the Isle of Man with many more people, please consider helping us out!

 

Risks & Challenges

There are always risks, but in this project, they are very few. What would happen if we didn't reach our full goal? Well, I still have a show on the Isle of Man, we'll still be flying over and staying there, so the bottom line is that we will still be filming a video. However, we want this film to be incredible - so the closer we get to our goal, or the more goals we exceed, the better the final result will be!

Other Ways You Can Help

I know that not everyone will be in a position to help us out with funding - and thank you for coming over to this page!

There is still a lot you can do to help. Please let other people know about this campaign - share the link around anywhere you can! Also, be sure to watch, comment, and subscribe to the Mexico film on YouTube - the more success we have with that, the easier it will be to get our Isle of Man film out to a larger number of people!
story_txt:

So for our second travel adventure documentary, we will be packing our bags and heading to the Isle of Man. story:
Last night Diane Egan died. Now she's a ghost. It sucks.

Diane...wasn't the best friend. She liked to bend the truth and look out for number one. After embarrassing herself at a party, she's killed in a ride-share accident when climbing into the front seat to charge her phone. Then, because of a mistake in the afterlife, she's sent back to earth and forced to haunt those she could've treated a little better, and might owe her an apology themselves. 

GUESS I'M A GHOST is a comedy web series in eight episodes that explores coming to terms with your past mistakes, making amends, and how we both perform ourselves and find out about death through social media. Tonally, the series is a mix between High Maintenance and The Good Place. Using both naturalistic and absurd comedy, the show looks to see how we grieve over imperfect people we think we knew, but maybe didn't at all.

What We Need & What You Get

We've already shot about half of the series, but we need your help to finish. Funds will go directly to paying cast and crew, production costs like equipment, locations, and food, post production costs like editing and sound mixing, and finally marketing and festival submission fees. You can know your money is going to a project that's committed to diversity both in front of and behind the camera.

In exchange for your help, we're offering rewards ranging from special early screeners, posters, thank you's in the credits, and personalized on-set thank you videos. 

The Team

Chris Sullivan
Writer/Director/Producer/Creator

Chris Sullivan is a playwright, screenwriter, director, and producer. His work has been seen Off-Broadway at the Ensemble Studio Theatre, where he is a former member of the Obie-Award winning Youngblood group, as well as The Flea Theatre, Theatre Row, NYU, Death by Audio, Cake Shop, Silent Barn, and elsewhere. He is a recipient of the Hudson Memorial Award and holds an MFA from USC’s John Wells Writing for Screen and Television Division. His play BEST FRIEND recently won an Encore Producers Award at the Hollywood Fringe Festival. His career peaked after starring as Wilbur in his high school's production of "Charlotte's Web."

Kelsey Siepser
"Diane"/Producer

 Kelsey Siepser is a LA-based actress originally from the east coast who holds an MFA in acting from USC’s School of Dramatic Arts. She has acted in numerous films and TV projects notably, SEAL TEAM, WEST OF HER, THE AMERICAN SIDE and THE WHITE ORCHID.  Her most extensive experience is in acting in theater where she has performed at Dixon Place, The NYC and LA Fringe Festivals, The Vineyard Theater and The Williamstown Theatre Festival.  She won the Tryon Prize for art and technology with her site specific video installation, ELUESIS, while at Smith College.  She recently directed a pilot episode for her webseries, ONE BEDROOM. She performed her expanded solo piece, REVELATION, at the 2016 Solo Performance Festival at Son of Semele. She has written two feature films and recently finished her first full length play, Theia Mania, which she developed in a writing workshop at The Echo theater company with Charlotte Miller.  Most recently she played Lady Capulet in Romeo and Juliet for the 2018 LA Fringe.

Sarah Alammuri 
Producer

Sarah Alammuri was born in Washington D.C. and raised in Alexandria, Virginia. She constantly references the movie "Remember The Titans" when talking about her hometown. She majored in journalism at St. John's University in New York and subsequently attended American University completing the post-baccalaureate pre-medical program. She’s been based in Los Angeles for five years. She started her career in production and later transitioned to Paradigm Talent Agency. She currently works at the production and finance company Cristal Pictures. Her hobbies include talking about her cat Brownie, going to the movies and eating. She is passionate and focused on producing. Her inspirations are Michael De Luca, Judd Apatow, Emma Tillinger Koskoff, Jordan Peele, and Megan Ellison.

Nicole Danser
Co-writer/Director, Episodes 1-3, 7

Nicole Danser graduated this past May from USC's School of Cinematic Arts with a Masters Degree in Film and Television Production. She specialized in writing and directing comedies, and now specializes in watching a lot of television, which she defensively calls "research". Nicole currently works at an all-female boutique PR firm in San Francisco, which she defensively calls "storytelling."

Sarah Winters
Director of Photography

Sarah Winters was born and raised in Chicago, where her parents supported her work as a poet and photographer. Now based in Los Angeles, Sarah is a cinematographer who focuses on light, color, and lenses to convey a story while bringing a director's vision to life. Sarah is a recent MFA graduate of USC's School of Cinematic Arts, and has 5+ years of experience in production. In that time she has shot narrative, documentary, music video, and corporate work, and has lensed over 30 short films (many of which have played in festivals internationally and domestically). Sarah's inspirations include Roger Deakins and Kate Arizmendi, and hobbies are hanging out with her dog and defending the art of Kanye West. You can view more of her work at www.sarahwintersfilm.com, or www.instagram.com/s_winters.

Liquid Feet
"The Dancing Ghosts"

Liquid Feet is LA's premiere comedy dance troupe as seen on ABC and TBS. They've choreographed over 50 original dances - ranging from TV and movie theme songs to pop hits to some sick royalty-free jams. TV appearances include The Gong Show, the Angie Tribeca Binge-A-Thon, and #DanceBattleAmerica. They're regulars on all the top stages in Los Angeles including the Hollywood Improv Mainstage, Super Serious Show, Hot Tub, Meltdown, Scot Nery's Boobie Trap, and their own recurring show at UCBLA. As a highly sought after festival act, they've delighted audiences at LA Riot Fest, Big Fire Fest, and Hell Yes Fest.  Their YouTube videos have racked up over 200,000 views. Liquid Feet's unique brand of shameless and joyful dance has brought surprised smiles and laughter to thousands. Their style is silly and quirky though they take their dance moves quite seriously. The magic of Liquid Feet needs to be experienced in person. Let them dance into your heart!

Eugene Young
"Marc"


Eugene can be seen onstage next in Poor Yella Rednecks (the sequel to VIETGONE) by Qui Nguyen at South Coast Repertory. TV credits include JANE THE VIRGIN, VEEP, CRIMINAL MINDS, REVENGE, UNFORGETTABLE.He is also appears regularly in sketch series like GOOD COP GREAT COP, and MO FUNNY MO LAUGHS (executive produced by KEVIN HART)

Caroline Bloom
"Courtney"

Caroline is an American-French graduate of NYU’s Tisch School of the Arts, where she studied at the Atlantic Theater School and Stonestreet School for Film and Television. She wrote and starred in the short film Da Capo,  directed by '18 WGA Winner Barbara Stepansky which has screened at 10 festivals in 2017-2018, including Cleveland International Film Festival, Napa Valley Film Festival, Sidewalk Film Festival, LA Shorts, among others. She recently appeared in the first season of Here and Now on HBO opposite Tim Robbins, directed by Alan Ball. She'll next be seen in Shatara Ford's upcoming feature American Woman, starring Brittany S. Hall, and the short film Made Public, starring Jeanine Mason. Currently she is working on a few writing projects.

Susan Shearer
"Dusty"

Susan Shearer wrote & starred in “Casting All Corpses” which just won Best Comedic Short Film in the 2018 Hollywood Reel Film Festival and was awarded Special Mention in the London World-Wide Comedy Short Film Festival. Susan graduated from U.C. Berkeley with a B.A. in Theater, and went on to attend the prestigious L.A. Civic Light Opera Workshop. She then studied with David Bennett - Shakespeare Intensive, Jose Quintero, Sal Dano, Ken McMillan and has appeared  in television shows, commercials and soap operas. Susan went on to become a  documentary producer for History Channel. However she recently returned to her first love; acting. She is currently studying improv with Shira Piven and acting with the director and acting coach, Cameron Watson. She is starring in a forthcoming sci-fi movie short film now in post-production

Jonathon Graham 
Editor

Jon has been working as a freelance filmmaker in Los Angeles, California while getting his Masters Degree at University of Southern California School of Cinematic Arts for T.V. and Film Production. Jon is very excited for what the future holds, and is always looking for new opportunities to create.

Other Ways You Can Help

Thanks so much for taking the time to check us out!

Even if you can't contribute, simply spreading the word about the series is an enormous help! We'd be tremendously grateful for anything you can do to help get the word out about the series.

story:
Clicca per vedere i primi 3 episodi (click link down below for first 3 episodes!)

https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PLdClCGfzLYnEANtvEh6ZzRyL8yZh_MSKx

Il Setting

In un sistema chiuso privo di informazioni le circostanze ambientali condizionano considerevolmente la capacità di giudizio. Una ragazza con indosso un abito da sera scadente trema e sbava convulsa sul ciglio d'una strada statale.

Sono le 04:00 di mattina e ad impedirle di trasformarsi in un irrilevante trafiletto di cronaca locale ci sono solo due balordi; ma le probabilità di salvare qualcuno dalla morte per abuso di stupefacenti si assottigliano ulteriormente se quelle sostanze le hai assunte anche tu. Più nello specifico: le probabilità tendono a zero se di quelle sostanze sei strafatto come un balordo cavallo dopato.

La ragazza abita in periferia. Trascinarcela incosciente ha comportato un dispiegamento coordinato di sforzo fisico e arguzie intellettive francamente sorprendente, specie se si considera l’infima caratura dei due individui in questione. Scoprono tuttavia che l’alloggio non le appartiene; pare che la ragazza lavori come badante di un’anziana signora che scorrazza incauta tra le eleganti e impolverate stanze della sua dimora signorile, animata da quella sincera allegria che solo la demenza senile può regalare.

In un sistema chiuso privo di informazioni, la presenza di una montagna di soldi nel cesso della vecchia in questione può condizionare considerevolmente la capacità di giudizio.

Hooked è una black-comedy.

In a closed system with no information, environmental circumstances can have an impact on the ability of judgement.

A girl wearing a poor quality dress shivers and drools at the edge of a highway. It is 4am and two morons are trying to prevent this to become part of the news, but the chances to rescue someone’s from overdose become smaller and smaller if you take the same substances. To be more precise: chances get close to zero if you are as high as a doped horse.

The girl lives in the suburbs. Dragging her there while she in unconscious requires a surprising combination of physical effort and wit, especially if we think about the caliber of the two characters. They finally find out that the house does not belong to the girl: she is the nurse for a senile lady that incautiously romps about the elegant and dusty rooms of her refined abode.

In a closed system with no information, the presence of a huge amount of money in the loo of this old lady can considerably influence the ability of judgement.

Hooked is a black comedy.

 

I Personaggi

Hooked è una black comedy a narrazione seriale. Atmosfere umide, relazioni umane claustrofobiche e dialoghi politicamente scorretti fanno da sfondo ad una vicenda grottesca ed intricata dalle ampie possibilità di sviluppo. 

I protagonisti rappresentano per iperboli la marginalità della condizione umana degli attuali 30enni, delineandone quindi emblematicamente i confini: tossicodipendenti disinteressati al proprio futuro, lavoratori frustrati in cerca di gratificazione, extracomunitari in fuga dagli stereotipi. 

La scrittura alterna ritmi e stili variegati che – lungi dallo stridere l’uno con l’altro – si completano sinergicamente nella creazione di un immaginario narrativo complesso e realistico, in cui il ruvido slang della strada si fonde efficacemente con un nozionismo farmacologico asettico e di valenza informativa, attenta però a non veicolare una compiaciuta esaltazione della tematica della droga. Hooked sfrutta invece il background dissoluto dei protagonisti per restituirlo allo spettatore in uno storytelling caleidoscopico, impreziosito da trovate estetiche tanto suggestive quanto visionarie. 

Hooked is a black comedy series. Wet atmospheres, claustrophobic human relationships and politically incorrect dialogues serve as background to an absurd and complex sequence of events that have many different ways to develop.

The protagonists are an exaggerated representation of the marginality in which nowadays 30-year-old people live and thanks to their characteristics they manage to trace the borders of this group: drug addicts with no interest in their future, unsatisfied workers looking for their own fulfillment, illegal immigrants trying to escape stereotypes.

The writing alternates varied styles that complete each other in synergy creating a realistic and complex collective imagination, in which a rough street slang mixes efficaciously with an aseptic pharmacological knowledge. Nonetheless, it is always carefully tries not to convey a pleased exaltation of the theme of drugs. Hooked exploits the lascivious background of the protagonists to give it back to the audience with a kaleidoscopic storytelling, enriched by suggestive and visionary aesthetic expedients.

 

La Campagna

HOOKED è la prima serie d'impostazione democratica e andrà avanti solo se ci sarà la possibilità tangibile di poter migliorare nei differenti aspetti della realizzazione, curando minuziosamente ogni singolo step. Partendo dalla pianificazione e dalla scrittura per poi passare alla realizzazione e alla produzione effettiva costituita dal periodo di riprese, ed infine approdare al confezionamento e alla distribuzione.

HOOKED is the first series with a democratic planning and it will go on only if there will be tangible basis to improve different aspect of its realization, taking extra care of any single step. This will include its planning and writing, production and shooting and finally packaging and distribution.

 

I Perks

I perks (i gadget destinati a chi parteciperà alla campagna) sono oggetti curiosi che aggiungono informazioni alla storia e ne ampliano l'immaginario. Scopriremo così il passato dei personaggi e degli eventi che precedono queste prime tre puntate.

The perks are extravagant objects that add information to the story and widen its collective imagination. You will have the chance to discover the characters’ past and the events that happened before these three episodes.

 

- Il poster locandina di HOOKED. Esiste inoltre il pezzo unico originale dipinto da Fabrizio De Tommaso.

-Hooked poster: there is also an unique original drawing painted by Fabrizio De Tommaso.

- La chiave USB (al posto del DVD che spesso si distrugge nell'invio) con tutte le puntate, l'episodio esteso, i contenuti extra, le foto di scena e gli artworks) da formattare e da usare come periferica/portachiavi.

-USB pendrive containing all the episodes, the extended episode, special features, set pictures and artworks. Once it is set up it can be used as pendrive or keyring.

- Il cappello peruviano del FDM  (chullu). 

-Shithead’s peruvian hat (chullu).

- Il dossier con i fascicoli sui personaggi principali (contengono la perizia psichiatrica della vecchia, i precedenti penali di Valerio, il passaporto della badante romena, i turni e le cartelle cliniche dei pazienti di Anna, il libretto universitario di Luca e gli opuscoli sulle cliniche di disintossicazione dalle quali è fuggito, e molto altro materiale informativo)

A dossier with booklets on the main characters: they contain the old lady’s psychiatric report, Valerio’s criminal precedents, the Romanian nurse’s passport, Anna’s rota and her patients’ medical records, Luca’s university records and the brochures of the rehab clinics he ran away from and much more information.

- Il peluche del FDM direttamente dalla serie anni '80 realizzata dall'animatore Marco Pavone da abbracciare nelle tue notti di tossicodipendenza.

-Shithead’s stuffed puppet: directly from the 80s series created by Marco Pavone. You can hug it during your druggy nights.

- L'action figure di Romano, il paramedico.

-Paramedic’s action figure.

- L'adesivo trasparente in PVC a grandezza naturale della badante romena realizzato dalla disegnatrice Chiara Colasanti da attaccare dove vuoi.

-A Life-sized transparent sticker in PVC of the Romanian nurse created by the designer Chiara Colasanti that you can stick wherever you wish.

I creatori della campagna

 

La Crew 

 

I Partner

story:
Our Show

14 Days of Action is a documentary series that will follow veteran stuntman Scottio Arnold for two weeks as he prepares himself mentally, physically and emotionally for life in the world of film and television stunts. 

8 episodes will include:

  • Training with stunt coordinator Kofi Elam
  • Daily living, habits and workout routines 
  • Stunt and Fight choreography
  • Interviews from trainers & industry buddies
  • Scottio’s personal stories, inspiration, struggles and triumphs on screen

Meet Scottio

What doesn’t kill you makes you stronger

And Scottio Arnold knows this better than most

Before he made his living falling down stairs, being hit by cars and lighting himself on fire (as a stunt man, of course), he grew up a very active and energetic child in a drug infested neighborhood of New Haven, Connecticut. Discovering hip hop, dance and martial arts at a local rec center was his escape.

At 19, he made the difficult decision to leave his family temporarily behind while he ventured to Los Angeles, California to build a new life for them and was introduced to a world he never even thought to dream of: that of a professional stunt man.

Scottio was determined to prove he was tough enough for the stunt world and with hard work and training, he ascended into stunt roles in various television programs, including HBO’s series TNT and CBS’ The District, and films, including The Salton Sea starring Val Kilmer and BD Wong.

Through devastating loss, marital strife and personal struggles, stunt work is what has driven and sustained Scottio.

Now at 52 years old, Scottio is more determined than ever to make his mark in the stunt world and continue doing what he loves, at any cost.

Our Team

Scottio is joined by an experienced and enthusiastic team, with expertise in stunts, production and distribution.

Our Production

Your support will go directly towards the post production of 14 Days of Action​

While initial investments have secured our cast and crew and have ensured that our production will proceed, we need your help to fund the post production costs of our show. 

As a thank you for your support, we have a range of incentives from handwritten post cards and access to our filmmaker blog to opportunities to see our production and even participate in our show. We want to bring you into the action!

Why This Story?

Scottio's story will inspire anyone who's ever felt like an underdog in a highly competitive world. 14 Days of Action also offers a look into the struggles and risks of a facet of film and television that is rarely seen and often under appreciated.

It is both a testament of tenacity and spirit, and a love letter to the stunt people of the world.

Get Involved

If you are unable to contribute financially (or want to go the extra mile), we would still appreciate your support in the following ways:

  • Let everyone know about our campaign
  • Let everyone know about our show, by following us on Twitter, Instagram and Facebook

story:
WHAT IS “LEA THE LATE BLOOMER”?

“Lea The Late Bloomer” is a dramedy web series written and created by myself, Kadia Blagrove.Here’s a quick synopsis: She’s almost 30. She’s broke. She lives with her parents. She’s “Lea The Late Bloomer.” In this new original web series, we follow 28-year-old Lea Watson, an underachieving filmmaker whose dream is to make it big (or at least get verified on the ‘gram). After a failed attempt at “making it”  in Los Angeles, Lea returns home to The Bronx to live with her parents, and is forced to face her old demons and self-sabotaging behavior.

Also, fun fact: Leo the Late Bloomer was one of my favorite books as a kid, so the title is somewhat of an homage. 

We released our first episode, just to give a taste, you can watch it below. (With your help we can improve audio and color quality!)

 

COOL. SO WHY DID YOU WRITE IT?

I wrote “Lea The Late Bloomer” for a few reasons:

  • Because maybe you relate: Sometimes it can feel like everyone else has got it all figured out but you. Living in a world where we’re constantly exposed to the successes, joys, and achievements of friends and strangers, it’s easy to find yourself comparing your insides to everyone’s outsides. I wanted to speak to that.
  • Because we don’t need to “have it all before 30”: There’s so much pressure put on young people to become rich and successful (whatever that means to you) by a certain age. It can be so damaging on one’s self-esteem and mental health. It’s not just a “millennial thing” either. Whether you are 25 or 45, society can really make you feel inadequate based on external factors.
  • Because we need a variety of Black women characters: I love me some diversity! And while we are seeing more people of color and identities on screen, their narratives are still so very limited. Black women characters are either super overachiever boss queens or tragic tortured souls  — what about the regular-degular-shmegular girls from The Bronx? (Shout out to Cardi B!)
 

I DIG IT!  SO HOW CAN I HELP?

So glad you asked! “Lea The Late Bloomer” is really a labor of love. Equipment costs, locations rentals, food costs, transportation costs, and every cent put into production came from my own pockets.  I am so very grateful for the generosity of my crew and cast who shared time and talents with me for free, as well as the few local locations who allowed us to film in their space at no cost at all!  Now that we are in the post-production stage, we are raising funds to help us pay for top-notch editing, fees for film festival competitions to get more eyes on the show, and the means to kickstart our Season 2. We released our trailer in January and received an outpour of excitement and support. Folks really connected to the story and want to see “Lea The Late Bloomer” come to life. With your donation, we can make that happen!

 

LOVE IT! SO WHERE WILL IT AIR?

You can find “Lea The Late Bloomer” on YouTube and IGTv. Be sure to follow us on Instagram (@LeaTheLateBloomerSeries) too for snippets, sketches, and sneak-peeks.

 

I’M SO INTO THIS AND I WANT TO LEARN MORE. GO AHEAD AND TELL ME MORE.

Thank you so much for making it this far! Keep reading to learn more about my creative mission and the hardworking cast and crew behind the show!

 

THE CREW

 

Kadia Blagrove, Writer/Creator/Executive Producer

Kadia Blagrove is a Jamaican-American writer and author for all things life and culture. For nearly a decade, the Bronx native has used her gift of storytelling to help diversify the imagery of people of color — particularly Black women. Her thoughtful and conversational pieces have been published and discussed in several publications including HuffPost, Jezebel, Cosmopolitan, Bustle, Thought Catalog, Complex, and more. For her screenwriting debut, Blagrove presents “Lea The Late Bloomer.”

 

Remy Fink, Director

Remy Fink is a Brooklyn based writer, director, and editor. He is the creator of "$5.00 Shorts" (a bi-weekly series of short films each made for under $5.00), and has also directed music videos and branded content. "Lea the Late Bloomer" is the first episodic web series he has directed.

 

Raven Irabor, Producer

 

Raven Irabor is her environment, generation, race, gender, education level, culture, city, family, and consumptions. All of these things are pieces of her holistic experience that has influenced the way she views the world. Using visual art as her primary form of expression, Raven is an award-winning Multidisciplinary Producer and Creative Director creating work that explores the relationships between identity and space through film, fashion, and business ventures that serve POC. 

 

And so many other amazing folks including Devon Howard (audio), Kofi Newton (audio), Julian Hackney, Kashana Blagrove (audio and so much more!), Rokya Samake (audio and so much more!), Mohammed Ndiaye (audio), Maggie Wong, Allen Kendunga, and Tyree Rush.

 

THE MAIN CAST/CHARACTER

 

Kadia Blagrove, “Lea Watson”

I play Lea, the show’s doubtful, anxious, insecure, melodramatic titular character. She is an exaggerated version of myself. (I think.)

 

Anika Rashaun, “Bethenny Lawrence”

Anika Rashaun is an actress, content creator, and talk show host, and has appeared in shows like MTV’s Real World and The Challenge. She plays Bethenny Lawrence, Lea’s ambitious social media influencer friend from college. When Anika isn’t on screen she is traveling the world and making us all jealous on Instagram!

 

Maurita Salkey, “DeeDee Michaels”

DeeDee, Lea’s bubbly and optimistic childhood BFF, is played by Maurita Salkey, an actress, writer, and entertainment reporter. While she has acted in a number of productions, Maurita is also a queen behind the scenes, working on the development of shows at VH1, BET, AND MTV.

 

Tasneem Nathari, “Sharika Watson”

Tasneem Nathari aka Hoodrat Feminist is an actress and a social media icon for all things body positive, sex positive, and feminist. She plays the role of “Sharika,” Lea’s witty younger sister.

 

Special thanks to all of the other talented actors who appeared in our first season.

 

MY CREATIVE MISSION

My mission as a writer is to help others own and embrace their vulnerability. Especially for black women, it can be difficult for us to accept our own weaknesses. There is this expectation for us to always be strong and magical, but we're only human. Through my work, I bare my own soul and insecurities as a form of expression and as a way to let people know they aren't alone in their darkness. As an artist of color, I want to create content that shows the very human and very flawed versions of ourselves. I want to create a world where all of the things we feel too ashamed about take up space — enough to make us reckon with who we are and grant ourselves patience and forgiveness. My web series, "Lea The Late Bloomer" is a show about a black woman who is the very antithesis of what society deems "Black Girl Magic." She isn't successful, popular, confident, or extraordinary. She doesn't always love her hair.  She doesn't always love herself. She feels behind in life. She's just a person trying to figure out who she is and what that even means.

This project has been self-funded so far. At lot of hard work, discipline, and heart went into this. I do not have any background in the film world — neither did I in journalism, yet I still worked my way into that space and had the privilege to interview and write about some of the most influential people in the world. I believe my ambitions are boundless and that every dream realized is fueled by passion and perseverance. I am looking to tell a fresh story about overcoming and what it feels like before the climb.

 

THANK YOU SO MUCH FOR YOUR SUPPORT!
