So glad you asked! “Lea The Late Bloomer” is really a labor of love. Equipment costs, locations rentals, food costs, transportation costs, and every cent put into production came from my own pockets.  I am so very grateful for the generosity of my crew and cast who shared time and talents with me for free, as well as the few local locations who allowed us to film in their space at no cost at all!  Now that we are in the post-production stage, we are raising funds to help us pay for top-notch editing, fees for film festival competitions to get more eyes on the show, and the means to kickstart our Season 2. We released our trailer in January and received an outpour of excitement and support. Folks really connected to the story and want to see “Lea The Late Bloomer” come to life. With your donation, we can make that happen! LOVE IT! SO WHERE WILL IT AIR?
You can find “Lea The Late Bloomer” on YouTube and IGTv. Be sure to follow us on Instagram (@LeaTheLateBloomerSeries) too for snippets, sketches, and sneak-peeks. I’M SO INTO THIS AND I WANT TO LEARN MORE. GO AHEAD AND TELL ME MORE.
Thank you so much for making it this far! Keep reading to learn more about my creative mission and the hardworking cast and crew behind the show! THE CREW Kadia Blagrove, Writer/Creator/Executive Producer

Kadia Blagrove is a Jamaican-American writer and author for all things life and culture. For nearly a decade, the Bronx native has used her gift of storytelling to help diversify the imagery of people of color — particularly Black women. Her thoughtful and conversational pieces have been published and discussed in several publications including HuffPost, Jezebel, Cosmopolitan, Bustle, Thought Catalog, Complex, and more. For her screenwriting debut, Blagrove presents “Lea The Late Bloomer.” Remy Fink, Director

Remy Fink is a Brooklyn based writer, director, and editor. He is the creator of "$5.00 Shorts" (a bi-weekly series of short films each made for under $5.00), and has also directed music videos and branded content. "Lea the Late Bloomer" is the first episodic web series he has directed. Raven Irabor, Producer

 
Raven Irabor is her environment, generation, race, gender, education level, culture, city, family, and consumptions. All of these things are pieces of her holistic experience that has influenced the way she views the world. Using visual art as her primary form of expression, Raven is an award-winning Multidisciplinary Producer and Creative Director creating work that explores the relationships between identity and space through film, fashion, and business ventures that serve POC.  And so many other amazing folks including Devon Howard (audio), Kofi Newton (audio), Julian Hackney, Kashana Blagrove (audio and so much more!), Rokya Samake (audio and so much more!), Mohammed Ndiaye (audio), Maggie Wong, Allen Kendunga, and Tyree Rush. THE MAIN CAST/CHARACTER Kadia Blagrove, “Lea Watson”

I play Lea, the show’s doubtful, anxious, insecure, melodramatic titular character. She is an exaggerated version of myself. (I think.) Anika Rashaun, “Bethenny Lawrence”

Anika Rashaun is an actress, content creator, and talk show host, and has appeared in shows like MTV’s Real World and The Challenge. She plays Bethenny Lawrence, Lea’s ambitious social media influencer friend from college. When Anika isn’t on screen she is traveling the world and making us all jealous on Instagram! Maurita Salkey, “DeeDee Michaels”

DeeDee, Lea’s bubbly and optimistic childhood BFF, is played by Maurita Salkey, an actress, writer, and entertainment reporter. While she has acted in a number of productions, Maurita is also a queen behind the scenes, working on the development of shows at VH1, BET, AND MTV. Tasneem Nathari, “Sharika Watson”

Tasneem Nathari aka Hoodrat Feminist is an actress and a social media icon for all things body positive, sex positive, and feminist. She plays the role of “Sharika,” Lea’s witty younger sister. Special thanks to all of the other talented actors who appeared in our first season. MY CREATIVE MISSION
My mission as a writer is to help others own and embrace their vulnerability. Especially for black women, it can be difficult for us to accept our own weaknesses. There is this expectation for us to always be strong and magical, but we're only human. Through my work, I bare my own soul and insecurities as a form of expression and as a way to let people know they aren't alone in their darkness. As an artist of color, I want to create content that shows the very human and very flawed versions of ourselves. I want to create a world where all of the things we feel too ashamed about take up space — enough to make us reckon with who we are and grant ourselves patience and forgiveness. My web series, "Lea The Late Bloomer" is a show about a black woman who is the very antithesis of what society deems "Black Girl Magic." She isn't successful, popular, confident, or extraordinary. She doesn't always love her hair.  She doesn't always love herself. She feels behind in life. She's just a person trying to figure out who she is and what that even means.
This project has been self-funded so far. At lot of hard work, discipline, and heart went into this. I do not have any background in the film world — neither did I in journalism, yet I still worked my way into that space and had the privilege to interview and write about some of the most influential people in the world. I believe my ambitions are boundless and that every dream realized is fueled by passion and perseverance. I am looking to tell a fresh story about overcoming and what it feels like before the climb.
 
THANK YOU SO MUCH FOR YOUR SUPPORT!

story:
A note from creator, Michael Witkes

After "the closet"

I thought that I would immediately accept myself after I came out, but boy was I wrong! I still had so much shame about my sexual identity. As a theater kid, I turned to plays for guidance. But all of the narratives about young gay men at the time ended with the main character coming out or committing suicide. Why did gay characters have to die? And what happened to the ones that lived through their shame? 

It started as a play

I wrote the first draft of "Interested In" as a play in 2013, beginning directly after "the closet." I sat on the piece for a few years, while continuing to rework it, because I didn't think I had the right to tell this story. But I realized that nobody was going to give me the "ok." So in the summer of 2016, I presented the play at two festivals: Dixon Place's HOT! Festival in NYC, and Quince Production's GayFest! in Philly. We received great interest and feedback, and decided that the story would serve much better as a web series. After four years, the script is in great shape, we have an amazing team on board, but apparently, art isn't free. That's where you come in...

Budget Breakdown:

  • We need YOUR help to tell the underrepresented stories of these fierce kweens, dudes, and everyone in between
  • We take your donations seriously! We see every donation as a contract to make this series top notch

What's in it for you?

  • We've teamed up with New York Yoga, 305 Fitness, and BrINK Editing to get you some AMAZING PERKS for donating:

​

  • Our #1 goal is to make our backers feel like they are truly part of the process. The most rewarding part of this is not only reaching our goal, but making a personal connection with our community. Thank you!

The Team

The Impact

  • With your help, we will film the first five episodes, and then pitch it to streaming sites. We want this to be HUGE. Wouldn't it be amazing to say that you helped put it on it's feet?! #QueerRepresentation
  • We have a skilled team! Our producer, cinematographer, and director all worked on the successful queer web series, Tough Love. Their third season was featured on Huffington Post, among other sites.

Risks & Challenges

  • Producing high quality web content is difficult. We have an experienced team on board, so the most challenging part is raising the funds to accomplish what we need to do!
  • We are pulling our resources and filming the entire 5 episodes over a span of one weekend
  • We will film some interior scenes in NYC, and then travel to Philly to film two episodes and establishing shots. Travel is expensive, but crucial to creating a realistic product. This show is ABOUT Philly's Gayborhood. And we need to showcase it. 

Other Ways You Can Help

We get it gurl, slaying ain't cheap, but you can still help:

  • Share this page! Your sugar daddies will love new gay content!
  • Sign up for the mailing list
  • You can also share right from this page using the social media share tools at the top (lol... top)
  • Like us on social media and invite your friends too!
    • Twitter: @InterestedIn__
    • Instagram: @InterestedInWebSeries
    • Facebook: www.facebook.com/InterestedInWebSeries

story:
Overview

Pipo is a crime-drama following a Cuban gangster who lives in Knoxville, Tn; the pipeline to the country via I-40. Things are "business as usual" until some heavy hitters move into town, forcing Pipo to face his own morality time and time again. 

To continue on from the overview, Pipo has been running his crime family smoothly in East Tennessee. Good relationship with the community and the police in general won't mess with Pipo or his family because of the benefits to having them around. However, that doesn't stop Federal agencies from poking their noses around, especially after a few governing members of a notorious Mexican drug cartel move into the area. The coming of a new entity of power pushes Pipo into new business ventures that he doesn't agree with but, he realizes that he has no choice. He will play the game for now until he can find his window but, how much of himself does he have to sacrifice before he can escape? Will things go back to, "business as usual"?

Where did you get the idea for "PIPO"

PIPO (Pe-poh) was my grandfather's nickname to everyone who knew him, including family. He and my grandmother left Cuba with my mother and her two siblings right before Castro came to power. They relocated to New York City in the late 50's where they found themselves in Little Italy. It was there that he made some connections and ended up working for some pretty interesting people to say the least. Around the time the gangs were starting their blood wars (I believe the 60's or 70's), they picked up and relocated to Miami, Fl where my grandfather picked up his work that he left behind in New York. I have heard so many interesting stories about my grandfather, some not so good and others that blew my mind. I never knew any of the things that he was a part of until recently when my mom started telling me more in detail what life was like with him back then. With all of that, the idea to bring his name, Pipo, back to life and play off of his life but dressed for modern times. This series is not your typical gang affiliated show. Pipo touches on serious issues that are not often addressed as they should be.

 

The Grandson, The Director, The Creator

This is where most people would talk about themselves in the 3rd person but, I am choosing to level with you and just be myself like two friends catching up. Well old friend, it's been a while since we last talked and I would love to catch you up on what I have been up to. I know that one of the, if not the most important, questions you may have is, 'why should I trust someone I don't know with my money to produce a show? Who are you?' I can admit, my time in the industry is short to say the least with just now entering my 3rd year. However, in that short amount of time, I haven't just been laying around or not putting my full effort into what I believe. I started off simply making car videos for friends from a local car club and that was when I knew I had a deep love and passion for film. I didn't have a lot of direction in what I wanted to do at the beginning of all of this. I thought that car videos was the top of the top. (I was new, don't judge me to hard!) I made a move to music videos and at first, they were a nightmare. Again, I had no idea or direction of what I was doing but, it gave me a taste for wanting to pursue a narrative instead of just filming random scenes to cut together with flashy transitions. My music videos and the skills I had started to shape and led me to literally falling in love with directing and creating stories. Here is a music video I wrote, Directed, Filmed and edited, please excuse the language!

So now you have a little idea of where I am. I fell in love with story telling and music videos were a perfect medium to feed my need to create. I enrolled myself into The Los Angeles Film School in July of 2019 for my Bachelor's Degree in Digital Filmmaking because I knew it was the only way to take myself to a more professional, formal level. I wanted to understand the how's and why's behind a movie, tv show, or even a commercial advertisement and this was my moment. (Can I brag a little and say as of this Campaign creation, I am holding a GPA of 3.92 strong and steady).
A few months in, I tackled my very first short film from start to finish called, Social. Social is currently available via Amazon Prime and Youtube and for my first film, it has been selected already in its first film Festival!  Social is still gaining momentum as it was considered by Crypt TV. However, the genre did not fit the viewer content. Receiving an invite to submit future work was offered and I look forward to doing so. Social had me motivated  to pursue another project from the ground up. Rideshare was the next endeavor, and a humbling experience going from four people to a sizeable cast in my second film attempt. I learned what it meant to organize and prepare for the shoot day and was able to improve even more as a Director as a whole. Rideshare has also won awards with The New York City International Screenplay Awards as a Semi-Finalist, Semi-Finalist in the Lift-Off First Time Filmmaker Sessions, and selected for The Horror Movie Awards!
Oh, and I have made sure to keep busy in between as well, taking initiative to improve my skillsets, even outside of school.
I invite you to check out everything I've done at my Youtube channel, www.youtube.com/DanielShootsVideosS
 

Enough About That Guy! Who Else is Working??

Alright, Alright! So now you got to know me a little but, I want to quickly introduce who is behind the scenes so far bringing everything together.

Our Producer

Michael Mathis is an Actor as well as an aspiring Producer. With work and credit in Jumanji: The Next Level to leading roles on Oxygen Channel to working crime scenes on ID Channel, Mike brings a solid amount of experience to PIPO. His ability to break a script down and plan out each scene is incredible and the reason I know that this will be a success. 

 

Our Writer, Our Dream Weaver

Julie De La Fuente is an amazing writer, and I am not just saying that because she is working on this world. I can guarantee you, the way she can tell stories and mold such intricate tails in a way that won't lose you but keep you hooked, she will be a major name one day and we are so incredibly lucky to have her right here with us building such an intense world!

Director of Photography

 

David Cunningham is nearing the end of the very same Degree Program I am in at LA Film School. David holds his Honor Society Status and comes with a ton of experience from outside of school as well. A former US Marine, sorry David......correction, a US Marine, (Once a Marine, always a Marine, am I right?) David has worked in live production as well as event filming. His most recent projects include running a live streaming campaign for a local Non-Profit Organization called The Little Ponderosa Zoo and Rescue as well as part of the film crew on a local wrestling production that is on our local CBS Affiliate as well as Amazon Prime. 

Our Music. Our Composer. Our Beethoven.

Dan Holtz is The Man, to put it simply. He has so many awards and credits that it would take up way to much of your time to read through them all but, he is a heavy hitter. I'll post his reel for you to enjoy and see for yourself. Dan joined us for Rideshare and I knew we had to get him to come back. After seeing the PIPO teaser, Dan quickly went to work and within hours, he had the score figured out and sent back to us. His excitement told us what we already knew; that we are onto something big and big projects need big hitters like Dan. 

 
 
This section of course will be updated as we find our missing pieces to our puzzle but, hopefully that gives you a little more faith in who is working on bringing this to life. 

 

 

Woah, Buddy....What About the Cast??

Casting as you would imagine is the most difficult part of all of this. Some would argue other areas but, we know our story is solid so we want to make sure that we find the right people to properly portray it to our audience. With that said, we have already found our Pipo! Let me introduce him to you all:

PIPO

Salvador Alexander Soriano is new to the acting world. Is it gutsy casting someone with virtually no experience to play the lead role of a potentially huge tv show? Well, did you know that other's have been casted with zero experience who played major roles in films that are iconic to this day? Harrison Ford is an excellent example of someone who was brought to the silver screen from ordinary life. Oh, and let's not forget Johnny Depp who's first film ever was A Nightmare on Elm Street. A quick google search will show you plenty of actors and actresses who have similar starts to what we are proposing with Salvador Soriano. With the direction he has been receiving as well as his speech coach to make sure he is as Cuban as he can be, we know that Sal will bring this home and sell the role of Pipo and quickly become a franchise in himself. 

 

Elena

Stephanie Rachal has worked with Director Daniel Perez and Producer Michael Mathis in our previous project, Rideshare. Stephanie is an incredibly gifted actress and fits the part of Elena perfectly. With credits from commercials to having a few network appearances, she is definitely someone to watch out for and we are incredibly grateful to have her on board.

As mentioned before, we are still building our cast and we won't rush casting. It just won't happen! 

 

Okay, I'll back your show! What will my contribution be going towards?

We knew when we started getting things ready to bring Pipo to life that we can't do it justice with the usual out of pocket budget that I had been working with in my previous films. The story has real potential to make it to major platforms and networks and because we know what this could bring to audiences as well as investors, we need to tackle this with our best foot forward. 100% of the contributions will be put towards absolutely everything related to the production of PIPO. Securing award winning cast and crew members isn't cheap! Making sure we have the right equipment on set, all permits and taxes are paid for, insurance, I mean literally everything you can think of when you ask yourself what goes into a tv production, it's a lot and we can only cover so much out of pocket. Unfortunately, what we can/have contribute isn't enough to get us where we need to be to ensure we can hire professional Visual Effects Artists, Editors, Hair & Makeup, Special Effects, etc. Your contribution is a sign that you believe in this project just as much as we do and I promise you, it won't go unnoticed. How can we when people like you are helping and being a part of this from the beginning?? We can't. We need you and can only hope that you believe in it enough to need us too.

Unfortunately, what we can/have contribute isn't enough to get us where we need to be to ensure we can hire professional Visual Effects Artists, Editors, Hair & Makeup, Special Effects, etc. Your contribution is a sign that you believe in this project just as much as we do and I promise you, it won't go unnoticed. How can we when people like you are helping and being a part of this from the beginning?? We can't. We need you and can only hope that you believe in it enough to need us too.

story:
Good Cop Bae Cop

Detective Simeri and Detective Leary are fighting crime and each other, in Good Cop Bae Cop. GCBC is a comedy web series that follows two young LAPD officers who just so happen to be a couple. They say it's a bad idea to date your coworkers, so help us show you how it can also be hilarious. 

Who We Are 

We are Anna Simeri and Sean Leary. Stand-up comedians, writers, producers, and together as a couple for five years. Good Cop Bae Cop is a long time coming for us.  Pretty early on in our relationship, we realized we had something particular in common…we want to be TV cops. This is a dream that lives deep down in both of us. Neither one of us are the type to give up and the favorite quality of our relationship is that we're continually pushing each other to be better. Because of those two things, Good Cop Bae Cop was born. A product of hard work and years of discussing how cool it would be to wear a fake badge. 

Season 1

The first season of Good Cop Bae Cop will be six episodes. You can watch the pilot episode here.
Watch us attempt to catch Tinsel Town's biggest asshole, The Mooner, while also trying to avoid fighting about who's turn it is to get groceries. There will be car chases, stakeouts, the captain telling us we're too close to the case & pretty much everything you love about cop content. We couldn't be more excited about what's to come!

We’re currently working with the wickedly talented (I’m hoping we all read that in John Travolta’s Oscar presenting voice) Cole Garrett and Keegan Duncan of Happy Pants Productions to make this the best possible show it can be. If you watch the pilot, hopefully, you'll be able to tell that production value is not something we are willing to compromise. That being said, that's what's stopping us from making more. We're all very proud of the pilot, but we're also confident we can make this upcoming season EVEN BETTER. More characters, nicer uniforms, movie quality sets, etc. Out of sheer shock to the both of us, not a single television network has offered us thousands of dollars to make our show…..., crazy, right? Sadly, that means we're funding this 100% on our own, and great content is not cheap.

We Need Your Help!

COVID-19 has greatly affected everyone on the planet, but for us, it's mostly financially. Sure, staying quarantined with no toilet paper isn't great for our mental health, but sadly we are unable to make any money right now, and that's worse. Our business and 100% of our income is producing and performing live events. Every show has been canceled for the foreseeable future, including a few road gigs that were going to be extremely lucrative.  We wanted to be able to put all we had into GCBC, but unfortunately, all we have is going towards surviving this crazy time right now. That’s why we're asking for a little help from you. We talk regularly about how lucky we are to be able to do what we love while also having a tremendous support system. So many of you have come to our shows (a lot of you to multiple shows) commented on our silly Instagram videos, and reached out with kind words and gifts when we were going through a significant loss in our family. If you're not able to help us monetarily today, just know that we still see and appreciate you. If you ARE able to help, you're so much better than those other people, and we thank you for it.

Check us out on Instagram: @GoodCopBaeCop

Check us out on Facebook: facebook.com/goodcopbaecop

Please SHARE, SHARE, SHARE! 

DISCLAIMER: PERK TIMELINES WILL BE FLUID WITH EVER CHANGING REGULATIONS WITH COVID-19

story:
Turns Out Making a Web Series is ALSO expensive. 

We want to be able to make this show with a professional, experienced crew and equipment, so we need some help! 

  • Babbs and Maria Lopez are twins who have recently been making a splash in indie projects and the documentary film, "The Pistol Shrimps". They are improvisers who also play a little basketball on the side, in between nannying and running the world. The twins have an incredible sense of humor and everyone relates to their struggles as sisters, women, friends, lovers and humans. 
  • We want to raise money for this webseries in order to create the best product that we can, while valuing the time and talents of the crew and actors. (Psssst. This is Elizabeth, producer extraordinaire, filling this out because Babbs and Maria have a hard time asking for help). It's fine, if you don't want to donate, they get it, would they donate to your campaign? It's a strong maybe. They'd definitely volunteer their services as extras or craft services if they have time. Which, if you have time to donate instead of money, we will gladly accept that as well. 
  • If you donate a few dollars to our campaign we will be able rent a camera, some lighting equipment, pay the crew, pay the cast, hire an editor that knows what they are doing, promote the videos online and all that other stuff that comes with creating a project sans studio. Oh and snacks, we will use the money for snacks. 

 

What We Need & What You Get

We are raising $5000 for the first season of Babbs and Maria Go To Therapy.

  • All of the funds raised will go to support this web series. We are functioning with a skeleton crew and very little money for equipment, but we think that's all this series is going to need. Why ask for more than what you need?
  • By donating to BAMGTT you can get exclusive perks like a "One Minute Catch Up" video dedicated solely to YOU! A social media shoutout from the twins. A Skype session with our director, producer or cast. Check them out and see what kind of swag you're missing in your life. 
  • If we don't reach our full goal we will forge ahead and make the series with what money we can raise, supported by favors from our lovely and talented filmmaker friends. The LA City Women's Municipal Basketball league has about 24 teams in it, so we're confident we can get at least 2 members from a team or two to come help us. We may sell it as a scrimmage, but they'll probably be on board once they get there. 

 

WHY ARE WE DOING THIS?

Frankly, we just want to make people laugh. 

  • The world has been a little rough lately. What do we love more than laughing at other people's pain? Not much. Chips and Salsa. Margaritas. 1/2 off Wine nights. We would love to brighten your day, make you laugh and attempt to heal their relationship. 
  • As women in an industry dominated by men we want to create our own opportunities as well as hire women for our projects. We are committed to hiring at least a 50% female crew, with 4 women at the helm already we are well on our way! 

The Team 

DIRECTOR- Mapuana Makia

Mapuana is used to taking direction from Babbs and Maria on the basketball court when she's in foul trouble during a game, so switching roles is going to be a fun experiment! Mapuana has been a shadow director and finalist in the ABC Discovers Talent showcase, has directed numerous short plays, and is also an actor and singer. http://www.imdb.com/name/nm2435995/

PRODUCER - Elizabeth Mihelich 

Elizabeth was born in Pueblo, Colorado, brought up on movies like Airplane!, Naked Gun and Clue! She quickly developed a razor sharp wit and repartee that sometimes only her siblings and cousins can truly get (They were raised on the same movies, which makes it easier). She loves to laugh and cause others to dissolve into laughter. Elizabeth met Babbs and Maria at iO West while they were on Harold teams and are currently members of the Ba Dunka Dunks basketball team. Elizabeth is an actress and writer who has been doing a whole lot of producing lately. She has produced 4 short films in the last year and a half, organizing all aspects of production, as well as doing everything she has too. . . sometimes she's crafty, sometimes she's the wardrobe person but she's always ready to put on any hat she has to in order for a project to be successful (Once I built a fake walk out of blanket and C- stands). "It Happened Again Last Night", a short film she produced has been in 14 film festivals, garnered 22 nominations and racked up 14 wins. "What Metal Girls Are Into", a horror comedy short made its debut on the festival scene a few short months ago and has already been in 16 festivals, winning 3 awards! "Weather Talk" and "Always Remember Me" are currently in post production and should be hitting the festival circuit soon. She can't wait for you to meet Babbs and Maria so they can brighten your life like they have hers!  http://www.imdb.com/name/nm2235318/​

WRITER - Maria Evelyn Lopez

  

Maria Lopez was born in LA and raised on the Dodgers, Lakers, beans and rice. She ran around the mean streets of LA chasing ice cream trucks with her twin sister Babbs. Once they were teenagers, the ice cream trucks changed to punk rock gigs and in college punk rock gigs changed to comedy. She has performed at countless theatres in and out of California. This is the second piece she has written based on true stories from her life. Maria is currently living in Hollywood, reading, writing, performing and admittedly still chasing ice cream trucks, punk rock gigs and comedy.

STARRING-

Babbs Lopez as BABBS

 

 (Barbara Ivette Lopez Morales... yes, the whole thing), is a Mexican American actress, comedian, and improviser, who was born and raised all over the hoods of Los Angeles, California. She was an introvert and relied on her twin sister to be her one and only friend. 

In her teenage years she was a punk rock kid, who liked to listen to music and skateboard with her friends. By sheer luck, she discovered theatre. She realized her dark, dead pan demeanor made people laugh, and that fed her soul like nothing ever had before! It became an addiction! She pursued improv comedy and acting in college, and followed it to Hollywood. She threw thousands of dollars at improv schools and did numerous shows all over LA clubs, but mostly spent too much money at their bars. 

To this day, there’s nothing that makes her  feel happier and more alive, than  making people laugh,  and to help them forget life’s troubles, if even only for a brief moment. It’s the best gift in the world.   http://www.imdb.com/name/nm7658493

Maria Evelyn Lopez as MARIA 

See BIO above. http://www.imdb.com/name/nm5009343

Nick Bush as The THERAPIST

Nick Bush is the kind of actor that everyone can relate to. He's probably in one of your favorite commercials that's running right now. You've probably seen him on Jimmy Kimmel Live, Grey's Anatomy and Superstore, or Fox's newest comedy, LA to Vegas. His dry, sardonic sense of humor and subtle facial reactions are a perfect match for the Lopez twins. Nick Bush, Actor. Dad. Dork.   http://www.imdb.com/name/nm1870402

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Not in a place to contribute?  That doesn't mean you can't help:

  • Help us by spreading the word about our campaign! Share it with your friends on Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, Snapchat, Tumblr, Google Plus!, My Space, Flip-a-Gram, Phone a Friend (not a thing, but you thought it was for one second)
  • Use the Indie Go Go Share tools for an easy way to post to your pages!

story:
The show is the successor of ‘Dateline Scotland’, which we made during the 2014 referendum on Scottish independence. Fans will probably notice a change in tone in the intervening years, and they’d be right! The world is a very different place: we’re slap bang in the middle of a Brexit process no one wants, led by a Prime Minister who aspires to incompetence, whilst appeasing a US President who makes George W. Bush seems statesmanlike…

Dateline 2018 is all set for a second series, which we hope to launch in the autumn - there’s just one tiny hurdle we need to get past first, and that’s the funding!

This Crowdfunder needs to raise £12,000 in order to fund the next series of six episodes of Dateline 2018 - and if we don’t hit our target, we don’t see a penny!

Obviously, the figure of £12,000 might sound like a lot of money, but in television terms it’s pennies. We obviously need to pay the team who make the show, and the time they devote to it far exceeds the six weeks they’re actually releasing content. There’s also equipment costs, running repairs, costumes, props and other expenses (and petrol, lots and lots of petrol).

The world is very much on fire, and it’s times like these that satire is most important. In many respects, broadcast media has become more and more complicit, and journalism has been compromised by the ability of all sides to shut down their opponents with accusations of “bias” or “fake news”.

So here we are, perhaps the last island of beauty in the world… Or at the very least, giving you something to laugh about whilst the ship goes down!

story:
We are a group of old high school friends who have been writing, performing, and directing comedy sketches, plays and routines for years. Now, after years of planning and prepping, we are ready to begin shooting the first season of our digital series GREEN CROSS!

GREEN CROSS is a workplace comedy that takes place in a marijuana dispensary. Our protagonist, Nick, has found out that his old partner, Dean, is in jail for a crime he committed on the premises of his dispensary...which he just so happened to include Nick's name on the deed. So now Nick, a grumpy, drop out of a man who hates drugs and drug people, must run this shop legally and legitimately or else he'll end up in jail himself.

Nick quickly finds himself working with the most oddball group of employees, such as a "bud-tender" who knows nothing about weed, an accountant who thinks he's a gangster, a fight crazy security guard, and a take-no-guff right hand woman, while being constantly hounded by the bumbling local sheriff's deputy who is dead set on taking everyone down. 

We have been wanting to create a show for as long as we can remember. Now we've finally stopped letting life and work and adulting get in our way and are going all out for this. It has made us all laugh like crazy, and we know it'll make you laugh too. 

What We Need & What You Get

Everybody in our team has made and performed in countless short films, plays, and sketches, working with volunteer crews, borrowed apartments, subpar equipment, and cheap pizza. To paraphrase Danny Glover in the Lethal Weapon movies, we're too old for this. 

We are aiming to raise $6,000 to cover four days of filming. Our plan is to film the first three episodes. These three will work not only on their own, but are also crafted to come together as a full half hour episode, allowing us to shop our project in both formats. 

The funds will allow us to properly pay our cast and crew. They are a fantastic team of people and we want to make sure that we compensate them with more than snacks and something for their reel. The funds will also be used to rent and secure a proper location that looks the part and works for our filming needs. We also plan on purchasing and creating props, getting a dedicated sound operator, paying our post production professionals, and hopefully buying quality pizza. We have  a lot of fun and unique rewards for our donations, so check out the perks package and give what you can!

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute to the funds, no worries. We really want as many people to see this and have a laugh with it. So forward this to someone who might be interested as well. Do the old like and share move. And keep following us so you can catch it when it premieres! 

The Cast and Crew

Nick - Nick Clark

Dean - Sam Sibilsky

Molly - Lyndsey Doolan

Billy - Evan Carver

Sheila - Cheryl Bonilla

Lanny - Ryan Churchill

Melvin - Matias Ponce

1st AD - Angelique Rojo

Director of Photography - John Heppe

AC, Makeup and Hair - Faith Clapp

Audio Sweetening and Mix - Pascual Romero

Color and Online - Alex Rothauser

Original Artwork by Ted Lange IV and Bambinomonkey

Directed by Daniel Sukara

Created, Written, Produced by Ted Lange IV, Sam Sibilsky, and Daniel Sukara

story:
Short Summary

  • As a filmmaker, actor, and youtuber, I have been making short films and videos often revolving around culture and language. I grew up in the city of Montreal, studying many languages and being immersed in a variety of cultures.
  • As such, I have always appreciated and valued the many rich cultures of the world, and want to represent them in a series that brings people together from different backgrounds.
  • By funding this episode, you contribute to a series dedicated to building bridges by pushing forward cultural and ethnic diversity through television, film, and the web. As we move forward, we will begin introducing more nationalities into the series.

What We Need

The money we raise will be spent on  location, equipment, and food. 

  • Location: 1000$
  • Food: 250$
  • Equipment, props 650$
  • Music, post-production: 100$
  • Estimated Indiegogo percentage: 250$

Impact

  • This series truly has been bringing people together. Fans from all over the world are now following the series, which has so far generated hundreds of thousands of views on Youtube and Facebook in a short period of time.

Other Ways You Can Help

You like laughter? You like culture and language? Spread the word.!Share this campaign! Tell your family and friends about the series!

If you haven't seen the series, go check it out on my Youtube channel: Mark Hachem - FRAJALICAN.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=V8bjg__9qSg&amp...

The channel also includes more cultural and language videos, along with wisdom/inspiration, and health/fitness.

Check out BigBong's Youtube channel for French and Japanese related videos, and fun facts. : Youtube: BigBong: https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCWZQPXNSb0hjvP...

story:
Life as a teenager isn’t easy, especially if you’re made of latex. Balloonburbs is an animated adult comedy about family, life, and coming of age in the suburbs. The show takes place in a world in which every character is a balloon!

We’re making a 22-minute episode entitled “Parents.” The story revolves around loving father and husband, Carmen telling his son, Andy, about his life before Andy was born. We see what Carmen went through to achieve his dreams and, most importantly, what he gave up so that Andy could do the same. This is a story about a father and a son and the sacrifices that parents make. It’s a heartfelt story that’s honest and weird and at times even raunchy and stupid. 

Any donation to our production, Balloonburbs, is greatly appreciated and will help us create an animated piece filled with laughter, family, and growing pains. If you're wondering how your donation will help the project, check out our graph below.

 

To produce Balloonburbs, we will need $2500. Your donation will help cover costs such as composing an exciting score, hiring editors to help us in post-production, and transporting our crew. It will even help feed our amazing illustrators, animators, and team as we produce this project.

We greatly appreciate any donation big or small as it helps us reach our goal!

story:
Who am I?


My name is Elsabet Ademe and I was born in Bahir Dar Ethiopia. I left  my beloved country 16 years ago, to follow my dream of working in the Hollywood industry.  The road to the U.S. for me was long and difficult...I faced death on several occasions being smuggled through several African and European countries before legally immigrating to the United States from Central America.  I actually wrote a book about that journey, called Sunrise, and hopefully someday the fullness of that story will be told on screen.  But for now, I'm setting my sights on this smaller project that explores one important snippet of my experience.

As a bartender in real life, I've been fascinated to informally "study" the role alcohol plays in the lives of the people I serve. I've watched relationships start and end because of alcohol. I've watched people drink to celebrate their happiness, numb their pain, cover their loneliness, and find new friends...or new victims.  

 

The Story


So it wasn't hard to envision a character who becomes a bartender to do exactly that-study peoples' relationship with alcohol-because of her own pressing circumstances.  Amy Solomon is an Ethiopian immigrant to the U.S. who's relationship with her fiancé is turned upside down by his drinking problem. The morays of Ethiopian culture, coupled with Amy's own good nature and love for Nate, lead her to go to amazing lengths to understand and help him. But over the course of the 6-episode season, her journey to understand Nate evolves into a journey to better understand herself and her own values. 

 

The Ask 


We are attempting to raise $30,000 towards the production budget of the six remaining episodes.  It's a big ask, but faith can move mountains right?  This money will go towards equipment rentals, post production (editing, color correction, etc.), insurance, cast and crew salaries, meals, locations, set design/wardrobe/make-up, props and set decoration.  In the (unlikely!) event we only reach a fraction of our goal, the priority for funds raised on Indiegogo will be equipment rental and post production costs.  

The biggest challenge facing me is the temptation to cut corners for the sake of expedience. I'm committed to seeking the most cost-effective ways to accomplish high production values. We will beg, we will borrow, we will use due diligence to shop around. But ultimately this project WILL get done, and it WILL be a polished and beautiful web series, however long it takes. We have a great team of professionals coming together already (see the link below) and your donation is crucially important to our artistic imperative.   

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Maybe you don't have a lot of money kicking around (lol who does?)  But you can still help!  Would you share this campaign on facebook and instagram?  You can use the sharing tools right here on Indiegogo. 

We also need a social media coordinator, and would welcome people who are interested in helping us get the word out!  Just contact me at haymielsa@gamil.com

 

For More Information...


Here's a link to our website: http://www.thebartenderseries.com   You can see bios for all the professionals who've already joined our cast and crew, and even watch the pilot episode!

Thanks again for reading this, and for supporting The Bartender!

story:
A Gay Victorian Affair is a webseries produced in Toronto by comedian/actor/writer/me, Robert Watson! It’s Downton Abbey Meets Queer as Folk, a non-traditional, Homosexual Romance brought to life, and provides a subversive look at what it takes to survive as a Queer person in Victorian England.

Within a week of our episode 1 launch, we had over 20,000 views on YouTube. As a first-time producer, I was so thrilled by the positive impact the show made in the LGBTQ community, and I knew I needed to make more! Season 1 was  100% self funded, so I hoped for the second time around I could use some YouTube ad revenue to make more episodes, unfortunately, that wasn’t possible which is...

In the first episode of A Gay Victorian Affair, two men kiss.

Despite it being 2018 and not 1818, one user evidently took issue with Lord Favershum and Master Waverly’s brief snog, and reported the video to YouTube. We were subsequently slapped with an age restriction. We immediately submitted an appeal, and although Youtube conceded that we didn’t violate any content rules, they kept the age restriction on. This means we can’t monetize our videos by running ads, which is why we need your help to make S02 a reality. 

ICYMI, YouTube has a bit of a reputation for restricting LGBTQ content.

Like this...

And this...

Although YouTube has stated they’ve made changes to their policies to be more inclusive of LGBTQ content, the reality is that discrimination is still happening. With your support, not only can we make a superb season 2, we can spread the word that YouTube’s policies still need work.

 

*will look something like this ;)

This campaign is powered by:

story:
Earpers, You demanded it, Now You'll get it....

This is an exclusive offer to you, the fans, of Wynonna Earp. 

  • All 13 episodes of Season One
  • Incredible behind-the-scenes content
  • Interviews with the cast

NOTES:

  1. Blu-ray is coded region 0 (meaning they play worldwide).
  2. Not available to ship to Australia.
  3. No DVD version, Blu-ray format only.

New to Wynonna Earp...?

Wynonna Earp follows Wyatt Earp's great granddaughter as she battles demons and other creatures. With her unique abilities, a demon-killing gun named Peacemaker, and a posse of dysfunctional allies, she's the only thing that can bring the paranormal to justice.

There's Something for Every Earper!

 

 Who's Who.

story:
Hello,

My name is Chuck Rayner and I am the producer, writer, and director of my TV show "The Paramedic Angel" that I am very excited about. I have actually worked as a paramedic for many years before I became a filmmaker and this is the reason why I am very passionate about this project as it is something near and dear to my heart. Also, being that my production company is an official partner-in-hope with St. Jude Children's Research Hospital, I will be giving 3% back to them from all pledges that we receive during our campaign.

This campaign is extremely important because for the main reason that I know the real struggles that paramedics deal with everyday trying to save the lives of others as well as doing their best to not let their emotions interfere with their family life. Also, the importance of this campaign is even greater as we honor all the first responders and healthcare workers during this pandemic that our world is experiencing.

Every contribution that we receive from our supporters are going to have a huge impact with helping us achieve our funding goal for the project. Being able to reach our goal will help us achieve the necessary equipment, compensation for our extremely hardworking and talented cast and crew, as well as food on the set and more importantly help with distribution for the show.

What We Need & What You Get

For our production, ideally we would need $5,000 that will help with the costs of obtaining the best up to date equipment, wardrobe, food on set for the cast and crew, and all of the post-production costs of editing and distribution.

In addition, for all of our supporters who donate to the production, we have some really amazing perks to offer. Such as, shadow the director on the set, meet and greet with cast, signed cast poster, and an actual ride along on the paramedic unit with the cast member of your choice, and many more!

The Impact

This project is very valuable to all of our contributors as they will be helping me and my cast achieve our goal of showing an amazing story that the entire world will love. Another valuable impact to our contributor's will be that of for every contribution made, our production will be personally giving 3% to St. Jude Children's Research Hospital as a partner-in-hope.
